name: Monopoly: Ströer Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Ströer, a company in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Goo Goo Pon
description:
You are a bear, and the goal of every bear to eat a balanced diet. You've collected some food, but now you need to protect it from the other hungry bears.

The game is played in as many rounds as there are players. Each player is the "parent" bear for one round, during which the other players try to steal food tokens from the parent's table using one of four food cards. The parent can defend one type of food each round, and if the other bears get too greedy, none of them will steal anything.

name: Misión Imposible
description:
Misión Imposible features up to four competing Intelligence Agencies (players) in a frantic battle of wits and resources for the ultimate espionage feat.

The Agencies' goal is to be the first to acquire classified reports on six different Government areas (Military, Space, Air Force, State, Naval and Nuclear secrets). On each turn, Agencies roll their dice and move their tokens around the board, acquiring the reports "naturally" by landing on the proper spaces. Reports can also be stolen from rival Agencies who have already acquired that particular piece of the puzzle. This is achieved by sending spies to their facilities. Players must balance spy missions with the need to conduct counter-espionage against the other agencies' spies.

But beware -- not all of the reports collected are authentic, so it'll require the powers of observation and skills of a true agent to smoke out the false data and avoid spending precious resources on mere decoys!

As they race against the clock, Agencies will recruit the help of Super-Agents and Super-Spies, get mission-disrupting directives from Headquarters, and receive situation updates via state-of-the-art Telex communications!

The first agency to get their hands on six authentic classified reports (one for each Government area) will be the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Hit It! Tactical Card Game of Tennis
description:
Hit It! is a quick print & play card game of tennis for two players.

Each player has a deck of 25 cards, of three types to represent different tennis shots, plus two types of cards that modify shots. Each player sets out four cards face down to form the playing surface. (Choosing these cards adds an element of deck building to the game.) Each player takes six of the remaining cards from their deck. The first player "serves" by placing a card on one of the opponent's hitting zones and draws a replacement card from his deck. The opponent then moves his player marker to the ball and selects what card he will use to hit the ball back. This continues until one player manages to place a fourth card in a particular hitting zone, or a player is unable to return the ball.

Play continues until one player has won the set, i.e. six games.

Hit It! has abstracted tennis into a quick tactical card game, but retains the feel of the sport.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Trick-taking

name: Kings of War: The Basilean Legacy
description:
The Basilean Legacy is a supplement for Mantic's Kings of War (KoW). KoW is a miniatures wargame set in a fantasy world and Basilean Legacy expands both setting's background and wargame by providing three new army lists. The new army lists are the Basilean Army (good aligned humans backed by angelic beings); Forces of Nature (neutral aligned fey and elementals) and Forces of the Abyss (evil aligned monsters and demons).

In addition to the background information and new army lists, the supplement also expands magic artefacts and one of the original spells (Zap!) in the original KoW rules. These changes to magic provide additional variety in gameplay and approaches to magic strategy in the game.

The supplement is available as a hard copy version and in electronic PDF format.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: When Empires Clash!
description:
These wargame rules have been designed so that players can fight typical small battles between European Colonial armies and their opponents during the period between 1875 and 1910. They use a square gridded battlefield, which removes the need to measure both move distances and weapon ranges, thus speeding up the whole process of fighting a wargame. It also removes any doubts or possible disputes as to whether or not a unit has moved too far or if it is in range or not. They also incorporate simple combat resolution systems that likewise speed up game play. The armies needed to fight battles with these rules are small by most wargames standards. This means that players can ‘raise’ lots of small armies rather than a couple of big ones.

- Description from Publisher

name: Egipte
description:
This book has 4 board games and a crossword with some easy games used to explain Ancient Egypt to kids. The book also has punchable hard stock counters and even a die.

The four board games are:

Before the river floods. 2 players. Two farmers compete to bring all of their harvest to the granary before the river Nile floods. They must follow a circuit and can have encounters with gods disguised as animals that can help them or harm them.

Chariot race in Thebes. 2 players. Two teams of two chariots race for victory in a circuit full of bifurcations, barriers and even a herd of goats that moves really slow.

Finding Ra's crown. 1 player. Choose your adventure game in which you read the description for each chamber inside a pyramid and must choose your next action. Many lead to death, only one leads to victory.

Senet. 2 players. The original ancient Egypt Senet game.

There's also a crossword made with Egyptian hieroglyphic instead of latin letters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Coopopoly
description: Coopopoly is a board game with a baseball/Cooperstown theme. Choose a player piece and start playing...as you buy, sell, and trade The National Baseball Hall of Fame, Farmers' Museum, Otesaga Hotel and all of your favorite businesses and museums in Cooperstown, NY! It's a new addition to complete every baseball collection and the perfect gift for any baseball fan, Cooperstown entusiast, and board game lover. Designed by elementary teacher this game can also encourage math skills for young children!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Mature / Adult, Sports

name: BattleGroup: Modern Wargaming Rules – For Battalion Level Miniature Based Games
description:
Battlegroup has been written because of modern wargamers, dissatisfaction with the commercial rules available.

Battlegroup has been play-tested over the last few years and were used successfully between 1997 and 2008 in the Ultramodern World Wargaming Championships, the 1997 Royal Air Force Wargames Association Championships and the modern competition at Roll Call 2001-2007.

The feedback from all those experienced players helped the rules evolve into this edition.

Although these rules offer nothing revolutionary in the field of wargames rules you will find Battlegroup faster and easier to follow than previous modern rules, rules that due to the complexities of modern warfare ended up either too complicated or far too simplistic.

Battlegroup is designed to give the feel of modern combat, taking into account all the latest technologies being fielded, yet still remain an enjoyable game.

These rules are ideal for quick battles, competitions, and campaign games or even for new players to learn about modern warfare.

—description from game introduction by Ian Clarke - 2009

name: Billy Yank
description:
AMERICAN CIVIL WAR IN 10MM SCALE MINIATURES RULES

The Civil War lasted from 1861 to 1865 and cost the lives of 600,000 Americans; more than in all Americas' other wars combined. Its immediate cause was the decision of several southern states to leave the Union of States. This 'secession' was the result of years of rivalry between north and south and friction between the federal Government and State governments, particularly over the issue of slavery. Some 50,000 books and articles have been written about this epic conflict that re-forged the American nation.
This is a rules system that enables players to re-fight some of the 2,500 battles and skirmishes that made up of this dramatic episode of history. They are based on modern historical research, which dispels

name: Blue Skies, Wood and Canvas
description: These rules are intended for use with 1/144 scale aircraft miniatures. Each aircraft model should be mounted on an hexagon shaped flying stand which has one side designated with an arrow to indicate the direction of forward movement (see Figure 14a) and a collar assembly which allows the insertion and removal of the multi-length altitude dowels.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Brandy Station 1863
description:
The Battle of Brandy Station, also called the Battle of Fleetwood Hill, was the largest predominantly cavalry engagement of the American Civil War. It was fought at the beginning of the Gettysburg Campaign by the Union cavalry under Maj. Gen. Alfred Pleasonton against Maj. Gen. J.E.B. Stuart's Confederate cavalry on June 9, 1863.

Game was published in the 33 issue of the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine. It contains board and 65 counters. Game usees "Taktyka i Strategia Napoleon system rules". Game has two scenarios:
- Buford nadchodzi (early stage of the battle)
- Brandy Station (whole battle)
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Pungo
description:
Pungo is a simple abstract game of perfect information involving pyramid movement determined by a 6-sided die, but not in the way you might think.

There are two ways to win:

First, you get a symmetric arrangement of pyramids, according to size, in your home row, where each cell has at least one pyramid occupying it. Or, your opponent’s row contains all of the pyramids, in any legal arrangement and in any or all cells. In either case, the arrangement of pieces must arise as the result of using all of your allocated movement points.

On each turn a player takes two actions:

1. Make a *controlled roll* of the die

2. Move some number of pieces some number of squares orthogonally
connected squares in the game arena
On each turn the player to move is allocated a certain number of movement points as shown on the top of the die.

A *controlled roll* is a method of choosing the value of the movement die by twisting, or manually tumbling it along the cells in a 3x4 grid. This action allows players to plan for certain numbers occurring in the future or to prevent certain numbers from occurring that might benefit their opponent. By using a *controlled roll* mechanism, Pungo eliminates chance entirely, but still maintains the feel of a dice-driven game.

name: Twelve Twelves
description:
From the designer website:

Twelve Twelves is a simple card game of prediction and bluff for two players. It is also a game that will fairly quickly and painlessly teach people their times-tables. The game consists of four hands and takes about 5 or 10 minutes.

Each hand works as follows:

1. deal six cards to each player
2. the dealer then chooses a card from her hand and plays it face up on the table
3. the other player (the scorer) then plays a card on top of this
4. the scorer gains points equal to the value of the two cards multiplied together
5. repeat steps 2 to 4 for the other five cards

Now play the next three hands, alternating who is the dealer and who is the scorer. There will be 4 cards left over: these are simply discarded.

The value of each card is as follows:

- Aces are worth 1
- Number cards are worth their face value
- Jacks are worth 11
- Queens are worth 12
- Kings are worth zero

name: Tactics
description:
This is a symmetric two player abstract which is played with (initially) 8 pieces per side on an 8x8 board. There are initially 3 types of piece: CROIX, which can move any distance orthogonally, IXI which can move any distance diagonally and ETOILE which can move any distance orthogonally or diagonally. All these pieces have a STOP piece of the opposing colour on their reverse side.
Pieces capture by either:
1). Moving such that enemy pieces are immediately (no gaps) orthogonally between them and friendly piece(s) or
2). Moving into a space immediately between two or more orthoganally seperated ememy pieces.
The captured piece(s) are turned over and become immobile STOP pieces for the capturer that in turn may be used in future captures. If recaptured the STOP pieces revert to their original piece.
The winner is the player who captures all the opponent's pieces or immobilizes all opponent's remaining pieces.

name: Brimstone
description:
Welcome to Brimstone, the minis game for people going to Hell. Using this system, you shall wage war for control of the Nine Circles of Hell, commanding all the forces of nefariousness and villainy that you can possibly imagine.

The Prince of Darkness has been slain, and all of Hell has been thrown into chaos. The chief lieutenants of Satan, the Aspirants, have put aside all pretenses of unity and now engage in open warfare upon each other, sending forth hordes of demons and damned souls to slaughter the forces of other Aspirants, paving the way to Hell’s throne with blood, bone, and those fiddly little pink bits that
always hang off the entrails.

The ultimate prize is, of course, the throne of Hell, and the license to continue Hell’s insidious cold war against Mankind and the forces of Heaven. But only if there’s anything left after the fighting’s done…

A 15mm/28mm skirmish game.

name: Over The Hills and Far Away
description:
A campaign game of Regimental management in the 18th century.

This is game that was originally designed to be played in a club or group context over a series of sessions, the aim being to build up a ‘campaign’ of experiences and a context for a number of small 18th century skirmishes involving just a handful of battalions a side.
In the game the players represent colonel proprietors of British Infantry regiments in the mid-eighteenth century. The premise is that in this period, Colonels were, in effect private military contractors to the state – contracted to provide a battalion for the King.
The game is a development of an original idea developed by Brian Cameron and Jim Wallman in June 1996 and subsequently played by the enthusiastic members of the Chestnut Lodge Wargames Group.

Background

The British Army in this period (the date is deliberately not specified, it is “Seventeen forty-something”) consists of a variable number of regiments (usually 50 - 60) each of which is normally a single battalion.

For administrative purposes each battalion consists of 10 companies, 9 centre and 1 grenadier. In effect the colonel owns the regiment and is paid by the government to recruit and maintain it.
Each player makes up a character name for their Colonel. This is, in many respects, a roleplaying game, so players are encouraged to define such things as age, marital social status, background and previous military experience (which is not required to hold a colonelcy). If in doubt about what the period was like watch the film Barry Lyndon.

The colonel should be regarded as being the player in person – so risk to the colonel in battle is risk to the player.

name: Air War Vietnam: Miniature Rules for Jet Combat Over Vietnam 1965-1972
description:
Miniature Rules for Jet Combat Over Vietnam 1965-1972.

Air War-Vietnam is designed for 1/600th or 1/300th miniatures, although 1/144th can be used by doubling all measurements.

The second in a series of introductory level rules for air to air combat with this set focusing on Vietnam.

Air War-Vietnam is highly suitable for group play and can be learned quickly, with only a few pages of rules.

The rules include all markers and templates needed to play the game.

Air War-Vietnam Sequence of Play:


Place altitude, maneuver and airspeed markers beside the aircraft model stand, face down.
Reveal markers.
Check Initiative – The fastest aircraft moving first, whether following or not, and then following aircraft moving last if their movement rate does not exceed the aircraft they are attempting to follow.
Move all aircraft in order of initiative.
Check target acquisition.
Engage in air-to-air firing.
Engage in anti-aircraft fire against ground attack aircraft
Aircraft attacking ground targets conduct their attack(s). If the game has not ended, start a new turn with Step #1
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Vietnam War

name: ESSEN: The Press Room
description:
ESSEN: The Press Room is one of the ESSEN bonus tiles

When playing with the bonus tiles, players have one additional action during the Action phase. By placing their player token next to the bonus tiles, a player is allowed to either place a bonus disc on to a tile, or move one disc from one tile to another. If a disc is moved away away from a track, all progress made on that track is lost.

The bonus tiles are all intended for games with at least 3 players.

When the players are using one or two bonus tiles, use 1 bonus disc per player.
When the players are using three or four bonus tiles, use 2 bonus discs per player.

ESSEN: The press room
In ESSEN, the local and international board game press comes to check out all the new games that publishers have. The publishers must visit the press room, and spend time to promote their games. However, the more crowded it is, the less attention they each get.

At the end of the game, the bonus points of the press room will be divided among the players with discs on the tile. Only 1 disc per player is allowed. If points can not be divided equally, any surplus points are lost.

For 3-4 players there are 4 spots available, and the total bonus is 12.

If 1 spot is taken at the end of the game, then that player will receive 12 bonus points.
If 2 spots are taken at the end of the game, then those two players each get 6 bonus points.
If 3 spots are taken at the end of the game, then those three players each get 4 bonus points.

If all 4 spots are taken at any point during the game, all discs are immediately removed.

With 5 players, one more spot is added, and the total bonus is 15.
With 6 players, one more spot is added, and the total bonus is 18.
With 7 players, one more spot is added, and the total bonus is 21.
With 8 players, one more spot is added, and the total bonus is 24.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Worker Placement

name: Memotrio: Tiere auf dem Bauernhof
description:
Memory game supporting learning.

Each turn, player reveals three hidden tiles and if they belong to each other, gets to keep them. If they don't, they flip the tiles back and next it is next players turn.

The winner is player who gets the most triplets.

name: Walec Parowy 1914
description:
Walec Parowy 1914 (Steam Roller 1914) is a war board game, which was released in May 2014 by the Forum of Polish Malopolska Branch Historical Society project The Great War in Malopolska - memory and identity.

The game provides two modes - for two or four players. In both cases, each player takes command of two armies or associations operating. It receives the relevant boards of the army and pools chips and card deck of cards generals of staff. For the game on the board influenced these cards staff, especially the generals who lead our armies into battle. At the beginning of the game we have such a scenario which determines - that is suitable for autumn 1914, during the game we can not change them. Generals have characteristics that affect the gameplay. The most important is an initiative of deciding on the order of execution of commands the army and orders, informing us how many orders we can spread the chips on the board. Cards and indicate how many cards of Staff tighten at the beginning of each turn. These factors can be modified by other cards of Staff, which assign the army (up to 3 cards), putting them on these boards army generals next card. In addition, staff can use the card in a different way - by playing them as an action during your turn or turn another player. The applied procedure allows us to influence the strength and mobility of the army, and thus develop their own, each time another strategy. Cards staff played as stocks allow us to accelerate the arrival of reinforcements such as on the board, or on the contrary force the opponent deploy the neighboring front of any of several units.

The game consists of six or eight turns, and each of the four phases. The first three are played simultaneously by all players. In the preparation phase we select the appropriate number of cards, we draw card of weather, check supplies, we join the army staff card or change the generals at their stations. In the phase of aviation spread the chips on the board planes that make us the third phase. This is the instruction phase, in which we place our units orders - march, spread, defend, retreat, reorganization, support, or crossing. If the field with our units appeared aircraft orders, we must spread face up - in a transparent manner. It was not until the fourth and final phase of motion play as an initiative of the cards generals - from highest to lowest. We then move orders or spread. If you meet the armies opposing players battle occurs. This is to be decided on the basis of the points of strength and modifiers. The final outcome of the battle can affect tightens card battle. Emotions provide the card with the arrow symbol - they require tightening next card, the count of all modifiers. Thanks to the great happiness we can overcome the enemy an advantage of more mesh than allowed by the cube d6. After all, is not familiar with such episodes of military history. In contrast to the loss of power affects individuals involved in the battle - of course, bears attacking them proportionally more. All the time, we can also use the cards of Staff.

The game is won by the player (or the site in the case of 4-seater variant), which scores more points wins. Most gain for controlling individual identified in the scenario, cities. The Russian side can further plunder the fields of the German Empire and the Kingdom of Hungary - action is causing the loss of points by Austria. Extra points goes to sometimes get as a result of the great victories or destruction of the enemy army staff.

name: Alphabet Soup
description:
Players serve themselves letter tiles from a bowl with a spoon. The object of this phase is to get as many tiles as possible but players risk being accused of not being genteel and forfeiting tiles if they have more than 35.

Each player then tries to make as many words as possible from their letters within three minutes. Points are scored for the number of syllables created. There is then a three-minute partnership round in which pairs of partners make as many words as they can from their shared existing words and their pooled unused tiles. The winners are the partners with the highest combined scores from both rounds.

Simpler variants are offered for children and for solitaire play.

name: All The Kings Men
description:
A game for battles in the horse and musket era, a period covering the 18th and 19th centuries. You can play fictional battles or try and refight famous battles from the period covered.
These rules can be used with any scale of miniature

name: Der Brennstoff Boss
description:
Der Brennstoff Boss is a economic game about the trading of fuel oil, coal and browncoal. Every player has the role of an merchant of fluid fuel or fossil burning. After several rounds the player wins who had earns the most money during the trading.
The player has to look for a good price at the distributer and must get the best price from his customers.

It's a promotional game from Rheinbraun Company, a german trading company for coal, browncoal and fuel oil.

name: Monopoly: Fulda
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Fulda, in Germany.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hamelner Ratzentanz
description:
The harvest in the year of 1284 was really abundant: The granaries and storerooms of the city of Hamelin are bursting with food, thus the four great rat tribes of the city race to be the first to gather all kinds of provisions for the winter to come...but they did not expect the arrival of the Pied Piper whose job as a rat-cathcer is to exterminate the vermin by the song of his magical flute...

Players take turns by rolling two dice in order to reach a food token: one dice is for movement, the other triggers a good or bad event (i.e. procreation of new rats, teleport home or Pied Piper's song (kills all rats in streets) or summon the Pied Piper's cat (blocks a door). Afterwards the food token must be returned to your home base. The aim is to block other players' paths and be quicker than the others to deliver food to the own base or just steal from other players. The first to collect four different tokens wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Schroders
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another version of the classic Monopoly. This time the cases represent the investment company Schroders.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

description:

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. Another version of the classic Monopoly. This time the cases represent the company Fairmont.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Queens
description:
Note: This game is a very basic variation of Mille

Deck: 2 52 Standard Decks, Also include the Jokers.
Point Values:




Cards

Point Value



Queen of Spades

100



Jokers

50



Ace & 2

25



10 - Kings

10



3 - 9

5




A and 2 are wild cards
First to reach 2,000 points wins.
13 cards to be dealt out to each player.
dealer must cut the right amount of cards for all players and the the one in the middle to get 100 bonus points.
ex: 3 players, 3x13=39+1=40, for 3 players the dealer must cut exactly 40 cards.
The first player to lay down all their cards ends the hands, whatever points the other players has left in their hands will be deducted from their score.
ex. player caught with 175pts, and had 60pts laid down, and overall score is 345, 175-60=115pts - 345 = 230 pts for an overall score from that hand.
Players must have 3 of a kind first to lay down, a.k.a 3 5's or 3 10's, or 3 jokers or 3 wilds.
After a player may lay down a combination of a A or 2 with any one or two cards the same.
eg. A-10-10, or A-2-5 or A-A-10, anything like that.
Jokers can be laid down on one at a time but not before you lays your first 3 of a kind.
You may only lay when its your turn.
When your turn comes you have to choose to take a card what's laid on the pile or take one from the deck, and must lay another card on the pile unless you can go out without laying.
It is legal to go out on the first turn.
A player cannot take the card on the discard pile on their first turn of the hand, and must draw a card before laying a 3 of a kind.
Note: When you get caught with more points then you have as a overall score, you will be in the minus's.
example: overall score is 50, you got caught with 110 pts.
110-50 is 60 in the hole or -60. when you gain pts. next time, you have to use them to get out of the hole.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Vicious Circle
description:
The Vicious Circle is a fast-paced strategy game that pits players against each other in a “hawk-eats-rabbit” frenzy based on the food chain. Use the cards in your hand to “eat” the cards laid down by your friends and claim total victory. It’s an eat-or-be-eaten world.
In this unique card game, players attempt to collect the most cards by trumping their fellows each turn and claiming stacks of cards. Learn to balance risk, greed, and timing as you read your opponents and calculate when to strike.

name: Aerial Assault
description:
Design, build, and test a robot. Compete to win in this new card game based on a real life robotics competition!

Aerial Assault is based on the real-life robotics competition presented by FIRST. Every year, FIRST (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) develops an exciting new game. Teams only have six weeks to design, build, and test a robot to play the game. Aerial Assault is inspired by the 2014 competition. With Aerial Assault, you can now work through a four-month season in 30 minutes by building a robot, training your drivers, and competing against other teams in matches.

In the build phase, players select robot parts (cards) and build their robot. For driver training, players build their action deck and draft cards that represent special capabilities. Finally, the robots compete two on two (or three on three in the deluxe game) to drive, shoot, and block their way to victory.
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Travelers of Storia: Clan Blackcore
description: Travelers of Storia is a 1 - 4 player cooperative fantasy board game. Players each choose a combat deck full of allied unit cards that are used to defeat various enemy unit cards. The object of the game is to complete each mission in the campaign, defeat all boss units, and to try and get the highest achievement rating from exploring as much of the world map as possible. There are two zones of play in the game: the world map consisting of world map cards, and the encounter board where players encounter enemy cards.

name: Goblin Toboggan
description:
A ‘take-that’ fantasy themed, tile-laying, route-building, downhill avalanche racing game, featuring a deck of mischief cards that allow 2-6 players to manipulate the board for their benefit and their opponents’ demise.

Each round, players add a new row to the track, rotating each tile they play to their own advantage. Once the tiles are placed the movement phase begins. Players utilize the effects of their mischief cards to give themselves an edge and humiliate their opponents to stay in the lead and outrun the avalanche, which rushes down the mountain destroying tiles and goblin toboggans in its wake.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Wettfahrt um das Blau-Rote-Bahlsen-Band
description: The players have to get their two ships from the harbor at the bottom of the game board to the harbor at the top. Movement is determined bay a die.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jezioro Pejpus 1242
description:
Game covers battle of Lake Peipus (also known as "Battle on ice"). This was a battle between the Republic of Novgorod and the Livonian branch of the Teutonic Knights (whose army consisted mostly of Estonians) on April 5, 1242, at Lake Peipus. The battle is notable for having been fought largely on the frozen lake.

Game contains board and 128 counters, along with one scenario. It was published in 34 issue of "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine. Game uses "Średniowiecze" system rules.

name: Daimyos' Sekigahara
description:
Another Sekigahara game from Game Journal. But, this one is really unique and innovative.

Each player is secretly assigned a role as a secondary daimyo: Kobayakawa, Kikkawa, Chosokabe, or Shimazu. Neither player knows the identity of their opponent. Since identities are hidden, control of the Eastern and Western forces alternates each turn until players reveal their identity.

Victory is decided by victory points for eliminating the other side's (Eastern or Western) units. More points are earned by the side who wins the battle. It is possible that both players belong to the same side at the end of the game.

Time scale: ?
Game period: September 15, 1600
Counters: 108
Map: half standard



Published in Game Journal #51.(from BGG user)

name: Combat Tank Attack
description:
This is a three-dimensional dexterity game with a military theme published in the late 1950s or early 1960s. Terrain is represented with a cardboard base and plastic landscape features. A colorful background depicts a WWII battle scene. A plastic tank is guided along a road network using a magnetic control device. The tank commander scores points for removing obstacles but receives a penalty for entering a minefield or running off the road. Players take turns driving the armored vehicle and compare scores.

Includes the landscape board, a tank, and several plastic terrain features. The rules are printed inside the box lid.

name: Project Football
description:
Project Football is a game that tries to deliver the full feeling of football. The game starts with a draft to fill the 18 man squad with every player having their abilities. Players alternate performing actions by activating one of their footballers. The game simulates almost all possible real life situations from fouls, throw ins and corners to penalties, injuries, hand balls or yellow and red cards.

Attribute test are made in one of two ways (agreed before kick off):
1. By rolling a 20-sided die
2. By flipping the top card of Your "fate" deck.

The first thought of this game was in April 2013, but not until February 2014 that I found the mechanics that I want to use to fuel my ideas. After that a working prototype has been made, and during several test the game had gotten a good reception. Now it's in a very advance test shape.

Recently a 4th prototype version was printed with minor changes in game mechanics, and with prototype card layouts, and new game board preparing the title for release.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Sisset
description: A word game, in Catalan, with 110 cards, each one with a letter (distributed according to their relative abundance in Catalan). Each player is dealt six cards and six more cards are placed face up on the table. In his turn, a player places a card from his hand below one of the six face up cards, forming a column, or expanding an already created column, with just one condition: all the letters in a column must always form a correct word (not taking into account the order of the cards); then receives a new card from the draw pile. When a column reaches five cards, the cards are retired and placed horizontally in the correct order; then all players can attempt to form a longer word with their hand cards, and whoever makes the longest word gains the cards. When the draw pile is empty the game ends and the winner is the player who has formed most words.

name: Kings of War: Kings and Legends
description:
Kings and Legends is an expansion supplement for Kings of War which contains rules for a host of Living Legends, mighty heroes and villains who bring even more character to the world of Mantica.

Most of the Living Legends from the Kings of War book make an appearance, with expanded backgrounds and additional rules which let you customize units in their army to reflect the forces they fought alongside. There are also several new Living Legends, including several who were created with the direct input of the Kings of War community.

Finally, the book contains the brand-new Ogre force list. No longer confined to the Kingdoms of Men force list as mercenaries, the Ogres can now take to the field as an entire army in their own right!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: SnapGammon
description:
SnapGammon is a unique new board game inspired by Backgammon where two cowpokes race to move their cows to their home stations and onto the train, hitting other cows along the way and sending them into the cow pen.
Special power cards let players bend the rules of the game for their strategic advantage.
There are different variations included which include power cards, crazy dice that replace the regular dice that have different values on their faces including an 8, 3+3 and a even -1.
And even another variant for players to hit spaces even though there are 2 or more cows on the spaces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Gin Mummy
description:
In the dark, damp confines of an ancient pyramid lies an artifact of priceless value: the lost idol of Jin-Ruh-Mee! Become the adventurer your father said you’d never be: find the idol and escape the pyramid. But beware the Mummy King – he’s a hugger.
Gin Mummy plays a lot like Gin Rummy except there are mummies and you can die.

The game itself is a free rules download. You'll need a standard 52-card deck.

In the game you'll make sets of 3 or more cards in order to dig through the deck and search for the lost idol. When the deck runs out, if you have the idol you win.

But be careful: Jack the Adventurer can steal the idol, the Mummy Queen will bury it back in the deck, and if the Mummy King finds you with the idol you're dead!

name: Nuclear Poker
description:
From the manual

You are a country trying to achieve the status of Nuclear Superpower. Once you have Superpower status you can shape the world you want to live in. Do you want to nuke or disarm your neighbors? Will you create global peace or Mutually Assured Destruction?

User addition
Nuclear Poker is a fast playing (10 minutes) card game where users use threats, bluff, trade and psychology to gain nuclear supremacy over the other players.

The game is meant a fast paced, light hearted, cutthroat game which teaches the participants something about global nuclear warfare and policies like Mutually Assured Destruction.

Players gather components cards (Uranium, Refinement, Warhead and Test) to get functional nukes. After that they can gather Short Range capability, Second Strike, Long Range and ultimately Superpower. Firing at another player instantly eliminates the other player from the game (unless he owns Second Strike, which allows for one last attack)

The game is sold with an inbuilt expansion about biochemical weapons, which work likewise: when you own Superpower and gather Lab and Plague, every other player is instantly dead unless he owns Lab too. This makes for even shorter games.

name: Custodial Trap: The Game
description:
Custodial Trap: The Game is a game created to show off the Custodial Trap move type seen in a number of games designed by Rich Hutnik. The move type is akin to Custodial Capture seen in Tafl family of games, or Custodial Conversion seen in Othello/Reversi. The custodial trap move involves two pieces bookending a line of enemy pieces, and freezing them so they can't move. In a future turn, one of the two pieces freezing enemy pieces, which isn't also trapped, can then move one space and occupy an enemy piece that it is freezing, and capture it.

Custodial Trap: The Game, is played on an 8x8 chessboard with 18 pieces each in two different colors that are identical. Chess pawns or checkers work. In the basic game, the pieces are set up in a 6x6 alternating pattern of of opposing pieces, that form a checkerboard pattern. Pieces on the corners are the only ones free. Object of the basic game is to either prevent one's opponent from having no legal moves or capturing at least 12 of their opponent's pieces.

The advanced version of the game, introduces a new win condition of a player connecting all their not capture pieces into oone orthogonally connected group of piece. In addition, players also can start with pieces off the board, and one player sets up the pieces for both players, and the other player picks what side to play, utilizing a Limited Dutch Offer (this is an extended version of the pie rule).

name: Polpastrelli
description:
Otto the Octopus really needs a snack. Using their fingers like the tentacles of Otto, children try to catch a lot of colored fishes — just one for each finger! — before they swim away, due to the arrival of the clumsy scuba diver.

In Polpastrelli, players must have quick reflexes, finger speed, and a bit of luck as they try to catch the most rare and valuable fishes.

name: Bestium!
description:
Card game for children.
6 cards are dealt to each player.
The first player draws a card, and discards another one face up on the discard pile. The next player can draw a card from the draw pile or the discard pile and then discard a card from their hand. And so on until a player has the 5 cards of a kind (5 cards of different background colour but with the same "beast") and shouts "Bestium!".
There are 6 suits (6 different "beasts"). For each "beast" there are 5 different coloured cards, numbered 1-5, per duplicate (so 10 cards with the same beast, 2 for each of the 5 colours).

There's a "Memory"-like variant of the game.

name: The Big Ten Football Game
description: Comes with 5 blocks (dice) which are rolled to get the result of the play call. The player playing offense chooses whether to call a running, passing or punt play. The result of that roll determines what happens on the play. The result of the die roll can be either NO COMBINATION, SINGLE PAIR, DOUBLE PAIR, THREE OF A KIND, SEQUENCE , PAIR AND 3 OF A KIND , FOUR OF A KIND, or FIVE OF A KIND and then depending on what play you choose to run a chart shows the result in yards of that play. The results chart also shows results with either a black or white dot which accounts for fumbles or interceptions and break away touchdown runs or passes. Some black dot results increase the length of the play, or give the unusual results that a game might have including penalties. 30 plays make up a quarter.

name: Sword Girls
description:
Sword Girls (Korean: 소드 걸스) is a Korean collectible card game developed by Zeonix (제오닉스), released in 2012, available in an online and physical (printed) versions. The online version was available in Korean, Japanese and English; the physical cards are available only in Korean.

The four factions in the game are Vita, Academy, Crux and Darklore, all in the background of a war against the empire of Lazion.

The game art was influenced by manga art style.

name: Burger Dice
description:
Burger Dice is a casual press-your-luck dice game for 2 or more players ages 8 and up. A game lasts between 15 and 20 minutes. Players take turns rolling dice and making burgers with their ingredients based on a set of simple rules. Score points for dice you play but be careful: waste too many ingredients and you’ll get kicked out of the kitchen! Be the player with the most points at the end of the game to be declared the Chef de Burger!

Whoever ate a burger most recently goes first. Players take turn rolling 3 dice at a time and placing them in burgers based on a set of simple rules (must have buns, no duplicate ingredients, etc.). You get to score points for completed burgers when you end your turn. Any die you cannot play is considered waste and moved to your waste pile. If at any time you have 4 or more waste dice your turn is immediately over and you score no points.

The game is driven by the custom dice, each one featuring 2 buns and 4 ingredients (burger, pickles, ketchup, and cheese). Using these with the burger building rules the players make their rolls and place the resulting ingredients to create burgers. Players can stop any time they want (before rolling) and score points for their completed burgers (1 point per die) or they can keep rolling and risk losing it all!

name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: 2258 Starter Kit – Narn
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Focus: Sarà vero?
description:
Focus: Sarà vero? is a trivia and dexterity game.
A player reads a sentence and pushes the button to spin the wheel. After the wheel stops, all the players make an action and take simoultaneosly a disc with their suction. The action and the disc colour are indicated by the wheel.
For example:
1) the players have to stand up and turn around, or clap their hands.
2) then, if they think the sentence is true, they try to take the discs indicated by the True arrow (for example Red). Otherwise, if they think the sentence is false, they try to take the discs indicated by the False arrow (for example Blue). Because the discs of one colour aren't enough, they have to take them fast.
Who guessed the right disc, can keep it.
The player who first has 5 discs win.

Extended version: the players have to make all the actions written on the discs they won during the previous rounds.

name: Pile Up
description:
2-player

8x8 board

20 stackable pieces, 10 black and 10 white each set numbered from 1-10

Play
Board starts out empty

One player is black the other white.

Black starts, turns alternate.

On a turn, a friendly piece may move or jump in a straight line orthogonally or diagonally across any number of empty spaces and over any number of friendly or enemy pieces so long as the face value of the moving/jumping piece is greater than the pieces being jumped. The jumping piece at the end of a jump must either land on an empty space just after the jumped piece(s) or end a jump by landing on top of an enemy piece already on the board.


If a player can capture on a turn he must.



Once a stack of three or more pieces is created, it is off limits, no further pieces may be stacked on them.



A stack cannot be split or moved.



The top piece on a stack designates who has control of that stack.


The game ends when a player manages to stack all of his pieces or is reduced to a single piece.

Object
A winner is determined by adding the face values of all the pieces within all the stacks controlled by each of the players. The player with the highest score wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Fish'n'Stones: Goldfish
description:
Fish'n'Stones: Goldfish is a promotional card for Fish'n'Stones that is available at the Logis booth 3-F101 during Spiel 2014.

This fantastic golden fish, who is shuffled into the deck instead of an empty water card, transforms 1 negative stones card into positive points at the end of the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: BIDittle
description:
"BIDittle [bi-DIT-tle] players are dealt 7 cards per hand. Using a simple bidding language based on high card points, partners work together to bid on the number of tricks the team intends to win and identify which suit or notrump the game will be played. The game board corners include bidding prompts to help the new player bid more easily. Once the final bid has been defined, the dummy hand is introduced, and the play of the hand is just like Bridge. The seven-card hands are easy to hold and help make the game move quickly." [description from website]

BIDittle is actually 3 games in one box, each of which may be played entirely on its own:

"little BIDittle" is a very simple game to introduce trick-taking and trump suits to youngsters and newcomers to card playing. It is recommended for ages 7 and up.

"BIDittle" is the main game, as summarized above.

"The bridge to Bridge" is a more advanced game that deals full hands of 13 cards to each player and uses bidding that is much closer to Bridge itself, though still being a simplified version of Bridge.

The game contains a 2-sided board that has bidding guidelines and a track to show the bidding progress with colored markers. One side of the board is used for "little BIDittle" and BIDittle itself, while the other side of the board is used for "The bridge to Bridge".

name: UPGRADE! Licensing expansion
description: This expansion extends the scope of UPGRADE! to include the tricky area of licensing. You must choose which licensing models work best for your mix of users, hardware and game variant.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Monster Cube
description:
Monsters in town! Can you stop them before they mess up the Mons-Cube Town? Try to re-arrange your Monster Cubes to match the designated Code Number and defeat the monsters! With the help of some mathematics, saving the town is more than fun!

In Monster Code mode, players try to solve the puzzle by finding the legal combination of three Monster Cubes that matches the Code number shown on the Monster Card. The player who is the first to announce the correct combination beats the monster and scores the victory points on the Monster Card. Whoever scores the most points in the end wins the game and becomes the hero of Mons-Cube Town!

name: Zombie ApocalyOOPS
description:
Zombie ApocalyOOPS takes place in a not-so-distant future, where scientists who have been researching immortality have accidentally created zombies instead. Fortunately, the condition can be reversed, though there may be some residual side-effects. In the meantime though... players must battle each other to survive!

Zombie ApocalyOOPS is a fast paced card game in which players switch between human and zombie in a free-for-all battle. Each card is split in half and color coded. Blue halves are playable by humans, green by zombies, and white by any race. If a player chooses (or is forced) to change race, they must flip their hand to the corresponding color.

The game also includes 22 Event cards, of which a random 10 are used each game. This provides high replay value, and also a chaotic element similar to what one might expect in a real zombie apocalypse.

name: Samurai Conquest: A Solitaire Game of Japan's Wars of Unification.
description:
BACKGROUND: Samurai Conquest is a semi-historical simulation of Japan’s Wars of Unification. The Player assumes the role of the head of the Tokugawa Clan during the later decades of Japan’s Wars of Unification (1540-1600). As the Leader of the Tokugawa Clan, you have the powerful ambition of conquering your Clan Rivals and unifying all of Japan’s Provinces under one ruler, you. Will you be able to fulfil your destiny to become the Shogun of Japan?

GAME OBJECTIVE: The Player takes the role of the Daimyo of the Tokugawa Clan and must muster his forces and manage his assets to defeat the rival Clans. The Player must control a number of Settlements whose Fortification Values (FV) total 60 or more by the time the last Campaign Card is played. If the Player controls a number of Settlements whose FV total is 20 or less during the Victory Check Phase, the Player loses.

GAME FEATURES: Samurai Conquest features a 4-Sheet Map, lots of colorful game counters, Campaign Cards, a Battle Mat for resolving Battles and much more. Units include Ashigaru Spearmen, Teppo (Arquebusiers) Infantry, Samurai Foot, Samurai Cavalry and individual Samurai Champions.

If you love movies like Ran, Kagemushi, The Hidden Throne, and Heaven and Earth, you will enjoy this game.

Samurai Conquest can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Relic Knights: Black Diamond Battle Box
description:
Black Diamond is the largest mercenary force in the universe. Originally created to manage the disparate private Security Charters, Black Diamond has become increasingly centralized and cohesive. It now maintains a force to rival any of the most powerful organizations in the Last Galaxy. Leopold Magnus spearheads Black Diamond's research and development. Naturally the best place to test his fiendish creations is on the field of battle.

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: My Life as a Card Game
description: Collectible card game depicting players' lives! Build your deck around your life's greatest accomplishments, your goals, dreams and failures. Be the most successful as you tell your life's story in duel and multi-player formats! The game "ends" when one players life (deck) runs out! Count up your accomplishments and the winner is the one who's lived the "best" life. Variable scoring options entice ccg hobbists to build different deck types and play themselves...or as the person they'd like to be!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Adjugé vendu
description:
The objective of Adjugé vendu is to become the richest art collector before the close of the auction!

Players seek out the most unusual and rare paintings, buy, sell and collect them, participating on auctions but must be careful because some items are copies!

The game also has electronic detector for detecting the false paintings!

If there are not paintings left the player with the most money is the winner.

name: Eier im Anflug
description: Players take turns catapulting egg tiles onto a grid of rabbit tiles. If an egg misses the rabbits, it stays on the table where it landed. If it lands on a rabbit tile, then the player gets to keep the egg along with all eggs of the same color still on the table. The game ends when all 30 eggs have been catapulted, and the player with the most eggs wins.

name: Black Stories: Jubiläumsedition Best of 1-10
description: A limited best-of-edition celebrating Game: Black Stories' 10 year anniversary with 100 cards (twice the size of a normal edition) taken from Black Stories 1 through 10.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: H2OMG
description:
H2OMG is a fast-paced, simple card game about sneak attacks, soaking your friends, and revenge in last-man-standing a water battle.
Player have a four-card hand they use to deploy various attacks, such as balloons, buckets, and squirt guns. Each type of attack requires a different number of water cards. The most devastating attacks are also the most work to pull off.
The last player to sustain 15 points of soak damage the round. The first player to win three rounds wins the game. Rounds last about 5-10 minutes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Betcha Can't Win
description:
Step right up and roll the dice! This colorful “boardwalk” theme creates a fun carnival like game experience. Roll as many times as you like to try to match the sum on the Number Cards but be careful there is a price to pay!

Roll dice and combine their sums to match target sums displayed on number cards. Collect the number cards you match and secure their points if no other player can match their target sum that round. Secure the most points by the end of the game to win!

name: Letter Slide
description:
Take a fast paced ride down the Letter Slide!

Don't "slide" by the letter tiles that you need. Spell as many words as you can based on the card that has been turned over. Hurry before the timer runs out!

Grab Letter Tiles to complete as many four-letter words as you can before the time runs out. Place one Letter Tile from each correctly spelled word onto a corresponding letter space. Cover all the Letter Spaces on your Slide Board first to win the game!

name: Dreams of Dystopia
description:
Dreams of Dystopia - The Postapocalyptic Deckbuilding Game with a TWIST

In Dreams of Dystopia, set in a distant, postapocalyptic and dystopian future, players assume the roles of mighty "Masters" commanding various "Minions" to compete against each other - choosing between the Divine or Demonic aspect or even trying to tread the perilous path of Twilight - as they do so.

Dreams of Dystopia (DoD for short) is a "Dominion-Style" Deckbuilding Game, in which each player picks their "Master" at the beginning of the game, choosing their (inital) side - Divine or Demonic - and each will begin the game with an (almost) identical starting deck. Over the course of this combat-centered and highly interactive Deckbuilding Game players will build, enhance and expand their decks by recruiting new Minions and buying supporting Weapons, with the ultimate goal of reducing the opponents' Masters Life Points to zero, before your opponents do so to you!

What makes DoD unique and special is that each card has two sides, one representing the Divine and the other the Demonic aspect or incarnation of any Master, Minion or Weapon you can choose, recruit or purchase. The initial choice of Divine or Demonic will heavily influence the various winning strategies you will be able to pursue, but fear not: There are plenty of ways to switch your cards from Divine to Demonic or vice versa, and building decks using cards from both "Factions" is an option as well... DoD can hence safely be called a game "With a TWIST".

The game will come with custom card sleeves which are mandatory to use in order to keep your hand etc concealed from your opponents.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Cadets: Dice Duel – Drive Thru Promo
description:
The Drive Thru token for Space Cadets: Dice Duel will allow players to heal their Capital Ship once per game.

To start the game, drop the token from 1 foot above the board. If it lands equally in between a grid space, players agree which grid will hold the token. During the game, players may stop on the token with their Capital Ship. Fighters have no interaction with the token. Players must stop exactly on the token, and shout "Pit Stop!". The Capital Ship will heal the last damage received. Players will remove the last energy crystal or retrieve the last energy die. Discard the token from game.

name: Moral Dilemma: Famous Moral Dilemmas of History
description:
An expansion or booster pack for Moral Dilemma which includes 25 additional moral dilemma cards that can be mixed into the full game or played separately. So you and your friends can debate such historical factoids, like:

"Did you know that the Nazis were the first to realize that smoking led to lung cancer and started the first anti-smoking campaign? True story.
Do you:
a) feel like a bit of a Nazi if you are against smoking?
b) feel cool for copying the Nazis?"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Jack B. Timber
description:
A dexterity game from Milton Bradley's "T.H.I.N.G.S." line of games. Knock all of the wood slices from the rotating tree before the timer runs out.

From the box:

Can you chop down the stump before time runs out?

Fit stump into base, then stack stump pieces onto buzzard post, facing target pegs in any direction.

Fit post into stump hole and you're ready for action!

Move switch on to start the stump turning.

Pull back on axe trigger and then let go! Aim Jack's axe at the peg to whack a piece off the stump.

Chop down all five pieces before time runs out or the stump will jump and the buzzard will buzz off.

name: Dead Things: The Zombie Boardgame (Third Edition)
description:
The zombies are everywhere, they catch you by surprise and attach when you least expect it. By yourself you might be able to get through the crowd, but it's either all of you or none of you...that was the deal.

In Dead Things, the players need to work together to play against the game. Turn order and movement is controlled by a movement deck and the board is set up so that zombies appear in a programmed order, moving ahead of you if your characters move too slow.

The goal is to find gas, and car keys and leave the board before the zombies overwhelm the party.

Dead Things 3rd Edition is a board game that expands on the original Dead Things game. New maps, new challenges for 1-4 players.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Joepspel
description:
This is a smart pack of cards that includes multiple games in one. Each card shows a number, with different symbols and colours to denote how that number can be achieved. For example, the card for 18 shows a red heart (the game's symbol for 2) and a yellow cat (the symbol for 9), a red and yellow pattern, and eighteen dots arranged in a 2x9 grid.

New games playable with the pack appear regularly on the website. The base game is a game that helps to learn multiplication tables while playing the game.

name: Stalingrad: Gorod Smerti
description:
Stalingrad: Gorod Smerti (City of Death) is a regiment to brigade/division level boardgame.

.5mi/.67km per hex scale. 11 weekly turns, 4Sep-19Nov42. Odds CRT with Disruption. Mass or pinpoint Luftwaffe bombing. East bank Russian artillery. Snipers: Zaitsev, Fritz, Kulikov, Thorwald, and Tanya Chernova. Engineer battalions vs. bloody exchanges.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Space Slugs
description:
In route back to your home planet, following a very successful planetary invasion, your spaceship crashes, leaving seventy slugs stranded on a desolate moon.

There is one option for survival - the only functioning escape pod!

In SPACE SLUGS each player takes on the role of a Slug Officer, and are tasked with recruiting a crew of 5 different slugs to activate the escape pod and flee the desolate moon.

Problem is, there is only one escape pod, so the officer that is able to form his crew first, will be able to activate the escape pod and flee, leaving everyone else to an uncertain future.

The game is played clockwise around a table with players either playing slugs cards from their hands, into play, as their needed crew members. Or playing action cards, which allow them to swap slugs around from player to player, make players lose their turns, or even remove slugs completely from the table.

Play continues until a player has, in play, each of the 5 different slug cards. At which time that player promptly wins!

"Quick, silly, and with just enough challenge ... Space Slugs delivers and won’t disappoint." - FATHER GEEK
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Rodeo
description: In Rodeo, 1 player play as bull and the others play as cowboy/cowgirl. During the course of the game, cowboy/cowgirl try to follow the bull's movement and manage to get points by make special move. But, be carefull, if you lose while make your special move, you will lose points. Risk or ride!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: HOF Fire Team
description:
HOF Fire Team is an original dynamic tactical game with a setting from ultra modern to the far future. Fire Team pits squads of soldiers, guerrillas, police, and thieves or just about anyone else with a grudge against one another. Use miniatures from your existing collection, on single bases, or add any new ones of your choice. Players command a number of Teams. These being Fire Teams, Support Teams, Command Teams and trusting to sound small unit tactics and the luck of the dice they attempt to carry out their mission objectives.

HOF Fire Team is played on purpose designed 'Battle Boards' de-marked into a 20mm squared grid. These set squares allow for easy and instant measurement of game distances for movement and weapons fire along with the relation between every miniature in play and possible cover. Play is easy and lethal. Using a unique D6 mechanic based on the Firefight 2.0 engine combined with an innovative 'tech level' for all troops and the 'waypoint' mission driver this game promises fast and intense action in a compact playing area. Play in a place of your choosing even if it is too small for other 'open terrain' wargames.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Jeu de la Libération
description:
French game called "Game for freedom" made at the end of WWII. The center of game board represents a defeated Germany (Nazi). The 4 board corners show allies: Great Britain, the Soviet Union, the United States of America and France. The track represents various battles and cities of Europe.
The printed paper is glued to a wooden board. It is a simple game, made with the resources available in 1944.
It is marked "Model No. 43667 filed -1944- -EMG. SGDG patented. Composition and Writing Clichés Union."
Components: wooden figures "little horses," which represents soldiers of allies.
It is simple roll and move game. The first player, who cross all 52 cities, wins the game.

name: Moral Dilemma: Moral Compass Expansion
description: Each round, one person is nominated by the group to be the Moral Compass. This person gets a second set of voting cards, essentially doubling this person's voting power, helping to break ties in a game with an even number of society members. The Moral Compass can also choose to vote two different ways, which is especially strategic when playing with the "Modes Expansion"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Moral Dilemma: Modes Expansion
description:
There are now different ways to play each turn! The person asking the question selects which 'mode' they want before pulling a card:


Strategic mode (also known as classic) - the person asking the question gets a point if they vote the same as society
Honesty mode - the person asking the question gets a point if they vote the same as society and each member of society that voted the same as the person asking the question gets a point
Majority mode - every person in the majority gets one point, regardless of who is asking the question.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Cowboys & Gunslingers
description: A miniatures skirmish system for Reaper Miniature's wild west line of figures using modified Warlord rules which employ initiative cards and randomly drawn skills to make each encounter different.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ark of Animals: Alternative Board Promo
description:
Ark of Animals is the first release by Historical Games Factory targeted mainly at younger players.

In this game, the players help Noah fill the Ark with animals and save them from Flood. They do it by simultaneously drawing animal tiles from the pool and placing them face down on their boards. Players score points for being the first to fill the Ark, collecting the most mammals, collecting sets of three different birds, reptiles or amphibians, etc. They should also remember not to place herbivores next to predators, as carnivores will simply try to eat other animals. The game has various difficulty levels, introducing the possibility to balance the Ark's sides and managing grain supplies.

The Alternative Board is a promo sheet available at SPIEL 2014 at the publisher's booth.

The new board with a bigger number of spaces is given to the player with the fewest points after each of three rounds. In this way they have a bigger chance to score more points in the next round to keep up with the rest of the players. The promo also offers an alternative scoring method.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Real-time

name: Zero: Battles of the Navy Air Service
description:
Aerial combat wargame for World War 2 Pacific Theater in 1941 to 1943.
Including 16 fighters and 6 bombers. However, the game only focus to air-to-air combat.

Players operate a aircraft squadron. At the start of each turn, they determine the initiative, and move the aircraft alternately. The initiative side can select the aircraft to move more flexibly. All aircraft's ability are printed on the counter, it is possible to operate many aircraft with a simple compared to other aerial combat game.

Victor is determined by scenario condition, mostly shooting down opponent aircraft.
The game include nine battle scenarios and a campaign scenario.

Components:
◇ One rule book (16 pages)
◇ 3 maps (A3 size)
◇ 240 counters
◇ 1 game chart (double side)


Published as Command Magazine Japan Tactical Combat Series #4 in 2014.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Pittile
description:
Pittle is a card drafting and tile placement game where each player tries to complete color patterns on their secret cards for points.

Each player receives an equal number of color tiles. They are then dealt 4 cards from the secret card deck. Each player selects one card and passes the others, continuing like this until everyone has a hand of 4 cards.

The first player then plays a colored tile in the center of the board. Going clockwise, each player plays one colored tile anywhere on the board until all tiles have been played.

Once the final tile has been played, players reveal their secret cards which depict color patterns which have been completed on the board. Points for completed cards are totaled for each player and the player with the highest point total wins.

name: And Away
description:
And Away is a Tabletop Novel, a solitaire card game.

It is the story of The Wanderer, who is stuck on a desert planet learning Kung-Fu from various teachers, some of which are not human, some of which are very much just a skull, or maybe even a cactus. Above the desert is a green verdant moon called Paradise. The Wanderer is learning Kung-Fu in hopes to somehow defy the impossible and reach this moon.

In the desert player’s will find familiarities to the world of Spell Saga. As if the same world had two reflections.


From the Introduction:

Welcome to the world of And Away: ~ Tabletop Novel~

This is a card game for anyone to play alone. It contains magical items, mysterious places, and dangerous battles. Your hero will have to grow in order to reach the goal of the game, but don’t worry, the hero will grow as the world around them is explored.

This game is also a story. The major plot of And Away is always the same, but what you do during the game and if you survive is up to you.

It can be played an endless amount of times, without ever experiencing the same game twice.

And Away consists of one 41 card deck, which represents the first act of the story. Players will start with all the cards FaceDown in a pile, and two marked “starting cards” flipped FaceUp in a second pile.

Progression through the game occurs by Flipping FaceDown cards and either Acknowledging (bringing them to the FaceUp pile) or Ignoring (Cycling them back under the FaceDown pile) based on the game state until each card in the Deck is FaceUp.

name: Extraordinary!
description:
Extraordinary is a superhero-themed strategy card game by designer Roger Alan Cotton for 2 players, ages 12 and up.

PREMISE

Players each control a team of seven super-powered characters who battle through an episode from an original comic book issue story line.

Each Episode is comprised of seven Hero Objectives and seven competing Villain Objectives.

In order to complete an objective, a hero or villain must use a requisite super power (listed on the Objective Card) to perform a specific Feat (listed next to the super power on the Objective Card).

To complete the Feat, a character must roll a result that equals or exceeds the Objective's target Completion Point Value (CPV).

Should the character successfully perform the Objective Feat, an opponent's character may still attempt to thwart it. This is accomplished in the manner explained above.

If the Thwart Feat roll result equals or exceeds its target CPV, it is successful, and the opponent's Objective Feat fails. In addition, the thwarting team gains a two-point advantage on its next turn, when attempting to complete its own objective.

Either team may attempt to complete their unfinished objectives on their subsequent turns.

However, as soon as either side completes an objective that isn't thwarted, that part of the Episode story line is "locked down," and the Objective Card is "won" by the team that completed it.

______________________________________________________________________________________

OBJECTIVE

Win four or more of the Episode's seven objectives.

______________________________________________________________________________________


GAME SET UP

1. Decide who will play the Heroes League and who will play the Villains League. Place the appropriate Player Mat on the playing area in front of you.

2. Decide which Comic Book Issue you will be playing. Bring out this issue’s corresponding Issue Cover Card and place it off to the side of the play area, between the players for reference. Next to this card, place that Issue’s Episode Card, and the corresponding Episode Objective Cards (stacked face-down and in sequence).

3. Each Player selects (7) super heroes or super villains and places them face-down on the playing area before them. These characters should have power icons and keywords on them that match as many power icons and keywords listed on the Episode Objective Cards.

Shuffle each of these characters’ (5) Action Cards in with the (25) core cards in your League Deck.

4. Take all of the Resource Cards and separate them into four face-down card stacks: NPCs, Powers, Tech, and Upgrades. Shuffle each card stack and flip face-up the top card of each stack.

5. Determine First Player

Each player rolls (1) die. The player who rolls the highest result is the Active Player during Turn 1. Reroll any tied roll results.

From Turn 2 onward, players alternate being the Active Player.

6. Both players flip their characters face-up.

7. Draw (7) cards each to form your starting Hands.

______________________________________________________________________________________

GAME TURN PHASES

Each game turn in XO! is divided into five phases:

1. Status Check Phase
2. Card Discard/Draw Phase
3. Attack Phase
4. Feat/Thwart Phase
5. Turn Resolution Phase

______

1. STATUS CHECK Phase

(This phase is skipped during the first turn)

Remove Status cards tagged to any Characters or Objects in play who were <Blinded>, <Short-Circuited>, <Staggered>, <Stunned>, or <Winded>.

Characters or Objects in play who are tagged with the <Damaged>, <Injured>, <Incapacitated>, <Prone>, <Sabotaged>, or <Trapped> Status Cards retain their Status cards until other cards are played that instruct players to remove them.

2. CARD DISCARD / DRAW Phase

On the First Turn, both players draw (7) cards to form their Hands.

At the start of every turn thereafter, players may each discard up to (2) cards from their Hands, and then draw back up to (7) cards.

3. ATTACK Phase

During this phase, the Active Player may attack with as many characters as he wishes (as long as those characters are able to do so, and have the requisite Energy Cards to use cards from the Active Player’s Hand).

NOTE: Card play may change the order of some attacks, regardless of who the Active Player is at the time.

- Combat Rounds

Each Combat Round is divided into three segments: Hit Determination segment, Damage Effect Determination segment, and Counterattack segment.

Each attack is resolved in whatever order the Active Player desires. The Responding Player may play applicable defenses and modifier cards to counter the attacks.

The Active Player indicates which character in play is attacking, and who the defending enemy character or target will be.

Hit Determination Segment

During this phase segment, you determine if an attack hits or misses.

The Attacking Character (Attacker) rolls the number of dice indicated by the value on his or her card’s Attack Icon. The Defending Character (Defender) rolls the number of dice indicated by the value on his or her card’s Defense Icon.
The Attacker’s attack roll result (plus any applicable modifiers) becomes his/her Attack Combat Value (ACV). The Defender’s attack roll result (plus any applicable modifiers) becomes his/her Defense Combat Value (DCV).
Compare the DCV to the ACV:
If the DCV equals or exceeds the ACV, the attack fails, and the Defender takes no damage, and suffers no attack effects. The Attack Phase immediately ends.

If the ACV exceeds the DCV, the attack hits, and the Defender takes damage. Proceed to the Damage Effect Determination segment.

Damage Effect Determination Segment

During this phase segment, you determine how much damage the Defender sustains, and what effect, if any, the attack has on the Defender’s Readiness Status.
