The difference between the Attacker’s ACV and the Defender’s DCV is the amount of damage the Defender sustains. This Damage Value (plus any Attack Effect Damage) is compared to the Defender’s Health Value which is listed within his/her card’s Health Icon:

If the amount of damage sustained is less than the Defender’s Health Value, the character remains in play. If the attack has a listed effect, that attack effect is now applied (see Attack Effects).
If the amount of damage sustained is equal to the Defender’s Health Value, the character remains in play but is tagged with the <Stunned> Status card.
If the amount of damage sustained by the Defender is greater than his/her Health Value, the Defender is <KOd> and placed on top of the League Deck discard pile.

- Attack Effects

Different attacks have different effects. For <Blinded>, <Burned>, <Frozen>, <Horrified>, <Knocked Back>, <Staggered>, or <Stunned> attack effects, tag the Defender’s card with the appropriate Status card.

Tagging a card means to attach a Status Card to it.

Follow the instructions on attached Status Cards to determine their impact on characters and objects for the rest of the turn.

- Moffed Attacks and Defenses

If a Defender or Attacker rolls (1) or more dice, and all of the roll results equal (0), that defense or attack is considered to have “monumentally failed” (moffed).

When the Defender’s DCV is moffed, s/he sustains (+1) Die of Damage during the Damage Effect Determination segment.

When the Attacker’s ACV is moffed, the Defender has the opportunity to immediately counterattack.

Counterattack Segment

A Defender may only counterattack if s/he has the Counterattack ability, or if the Attacker moffed his/her ACV.

To resolve the Counterattack, follow the standard combat resolution steps listed above. The Counterattack’s Damage Type is determined by the Defender’s Superpower Icon (listed on the Character card’s upper-left corner).

Once all of the Active Player’s attacks have been resolved, his Attacks Phase ends.

- AOE Damage Effects

Some attacks indicate they are AOE Attacks. This means they are Area of Affect attacks which affect both the defending target of the attack and any characters adjacent to the Defender.

5. FEATS COMPLETION Phase

During this phase, the Active Player assigns a ready character in play with the requisite Power icon (or Keyword) to attempt a feat that will complete his league’s current Episode Objective.

- Resolving Feat Attempt

The Active Player rolls as many dice as s/he can to attempt the feat (based on the numbers indicated on the acting character’s card, as well as on any applicable cards from the Active Player’s Hand):

If the Feat Attempt roll result (plus any modifiers) equals or exceeds the Feat Completion Value (FCV) indicated within the Completion diamond, the feat is successfully completed.
Otherwise, the feat attempt fails, and the phase ends.
Should the Active Player’s feat attempt succeed, the Responding Player may assign a ready character in play to attempt to thwart the feat.

To do this, the Responding Player’s character must have the requisite Power icon or Keyword to attempt the thwart:

If the Thwart Attempt roll result (plus any modifiers) equals or exceeds the Thwart Completion Value (TCV) indicated within the Completion diamond, the feat is successfully completed.
In this case, the Responding Player gains a 2-point bonus on his or her next turn, when attempting to complete his or her League’s Episode Objective.
If the thwart attempt fails, the Active Player “wins” the Episode Objective Card. The card is removed from the Story Line, and placed in the Active Player’s Victory Area.
SCORING

Once all seven Episode Objective Cards have been completed, the player with four or more of them wins the game.

6. TURN RESOLUTION Phase

Once the Active Player has finished attacking and attempting a feat, his turn is over. If all seven Objective Cards are completed, the game ends, and you proceed to Scoring.

Otherwise, the next player becomes the Active Player, and the game proceeds.
______________________________________________________________________________________

COMBAT DICE

Each player gets (7) six-sided dice to use during the game. The Heroes Player uses the White Mask dice and the Villains Player uses the Black Mask dice.

Each combat die has six sides with different values listed on them. One side has the (0) value, two sides have the (1) value, two sides have the (2) value, and the last side has the (3) value.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Bycatch
description:
A card game about flawed surveillance, impossible decisions, and the people caught in between, for 3–5 players.


Simple to learn and quick to play, Bycatch invites players from across a wide range of game-playing backgrounds to contemplate the dilemmas of remote warfare.
An inventive surveillance mechanism employs your phone's camera to let you experience firsthand the shortcomings of aerial spying.
Appealing artwork helps you empathize with your citizens and the horrors of drone strikes and collateral damage.


In Bycatch, each player controls a nation on the hunt for suspected terrorists. The players try to locate suspects hiding abroad using drone surveillance, and eliminate them using drone strikes. Meanwhile, they must shelter their citizens from the attacks of their opponents. Who will gather the most accurate intelligence and strike with the least collateral damage?

name: Deep 5
description:
In the distant future, a crew of oddballs in a ship that can barely stay powered must save themselves from themselves and from, the universe. To lead a starship one must possess a keen eye, a sharp mind, and the courage to stare down insurmountable odds – or at the very least one must own a ship with enough crew to keep it from exploding.

Deep 5H.1T is a competitive, resource management, strategy game for 2-4 players. You decide how your character will spend their actions, collect their resources and ultimately build their commendations to score enough points to be considered the true 'captain' of the very first 5H class ship in the space fleet. The running time is approximately 60-90 minutes for a full four player game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: ARRRH!
description:
Two monkey pirates engage in a tough dialectic struggle to get the last box of bananas that survived the shipwreck. But this time they will need to have his tongue sharper than his sword...

ARRRH! Is a fast, tense and addictive memory game for 2 players upon 7 years old.

Players must distribute the shipwreck cards around the board and place the pirate marker in the middle of it.
In turns, one player must raise a wooden grog card, where he will meet with the offense that has to perform to the other player, who must find between the wreckage the answer to that offense. In case of luck, the procedure is to repeated and advance the track approaching it to the player lifting the offense. Otherwise the roles are exchanged.
The game ends when one of them leaves the board overboard!

name: Space Mines
description:
Space Mines is a game playable with Looney Pyramids -- one stash per player plus a few extras in a new color to be asteroids.

The pieces are placed, lying on their sides, into the play space anywhere they fit -- there is no board or grid. Then the ships fire and mine in a prescribed fashion, targeting whatever is directly in front of them. Mining asteroids earns points, and those points can be doubled if you take the fewest losses.

name: Story War: Sentinel Conflict
description:
Sentinel Conflict is a super-powered party game for 3-8 players in which you control the greatest “what if?” fights in the Multiverse!

Story War is all about using creativity and humor in impromptu storytelling to defeat your opponents! In Sentinel Conflict, each player will have a hand of Character cards and Item cards, and will use those heroes, villains, devices, and equipment to assemble the best team to take on the other players!

name: Devour
description: Players simultaneously select an undead role. Each role affects the village population in some way and score points according to the aggregate effect of all roles selected. When the village is wiped out, the game ends, and the player with the highest score wins.

name: Dudek
description: Fun and educational game. Look for the symbol that appears repeated as many times as display in the deck.The first player that finds it, takes the card. The first player that ends up with more cards is the winner.

name: Bubbling Brew
description:
This game is about a competition between witches and or warlocks in the quest to find the greatest potion maker amongst them.

Players take turns drawing ingredients from the bag to use with ingredients already in the cauldron to fulfill recipes of all kinds. The board changes a lot during the turn instead of discarding unwanted ingredients back to the bag they are discarded to the cauldron. This burys ingredients that your opponent may need or burys ingredient(s) you are trying to make sure is safe for you to dig up later with a special Metamorph. Maybe you want to try and set up ingredients for a more complex potion hoping that it will still be there when it comes back around to you. Some of the potions allow it's maker to affect actions during the game.

The first witch or warlock to complete the required number of potions ends the game. Each person tallies up the points of the completed potions and subtracts the points of the uncompleted recipes in their hand and whomever has the highest score can claim victory as the world's greatest potion maker.

name: F.P.1 antwortet nicht
description:
Up to six players try to find the swimming airport F.P.1 in the middle of the Atlantic, while one player moves the F.P.1 in secret on a second game board out of sight from the other players. The player who gets his plane on the same space as the F.P.1 wins the game. The player who moves the F.P.1 wins the game when he reaches one of two safe spaces (marked with an arrow).

This game is based on the 1932 UFA Motion Picture "F.P.1 antwortet nicht" with Hans Albers, Peter Lorre, Eric Ode, Sybille Schmitz, Paul Hartmann and Rudolf Platte and the song "Flieger, grüß' mir die Sonne"
categories: Aviation / Flight, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Iconoclasm
description:
In Iconoclasm, you strive to form and control units by playing your element tokens to it. Once a unit is formed, an icon of the strongest element is placed in it. Once a unit is connected to unit of a different element, the two units clash.

When all elements have been played, the player with the most units wins.

The players take turns to play element tokens to a hexagonal board. Although the players represent one element each, they start with tokens of all elements at hand. Units are formed when 7 tokens are grouped and units are connected when there is a path of tokens between them.
 
Each element has a supporting relation to another element; one that it supports and one that it is supported by. This relation is used to break ties between the elements. The tokens of the weaker element are removed from the board. However, the tokens of the stronger element are weakened and this may result in the supporting element taking over the unit.
 
The challenge of Iconoclasm is to play elements, own and supporting, to obtain a majority at the right time and at the right place.

The unique mechanism of Iconoclasm is the so called circular relation between the players where A supports B, B supports C etc. This mechanism, in combination with the players playing each others' colors, opens up innumerous strategical paths. Should you build a strong unit of your own element? Should you support another element only to take over its unit? Or should you form other units, see them deformed and among the ruins form your own unit? You must find the answer yourself!

name: Forts & Treasures: Lucky Shot
description:
A pencil and paper dice rolling game where each player is collecting treasures and protecting those treasures with forts. Players try to destroy each others forts and steal their opponents' treasures. You get three dice to roll and assign to your actions. You get to do one action per die, so you can't do every action every turn, you have choose which three to do.

Actions

Hunt for new treasure
Build bricks to improve your forts
Attack to destroy opposing forts
Raid forts to steal the treasure
Fortify forts to improve brick strength and raid resistance


The first player to get four treasures, or the last player left with any treasure wins!

name: Widget Mechs
description:
Widget Mechs is a strategic dice game. Players are working to build their mechs while destroying their opponent's mechs. You roll dice that you then must combine in different ways to determine where you want to build or attack.

You have to evaluate where you can best improve your position, defend yourself from attack, and where to strike a victorious blow on your opponents.

After dice are rolled, you choose how to pair them up to get different pair totals. To build or attack a part, you need a pair matching the part's value. For each unique completed part you have, you get to add one die to your attack roll, giving you more attack options.

The easier it is for you to complete a portion of your mech, the easier it is for your opponent to destroy. Each part you destroy is a victory point and the most victory points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Pass the Popcorn!: TV Edition
description:
This is a follow up trivia game to the original Pass the Popcorn!. This version is focused on television shows and includes alternate game play making it possible to play with just two players.

From the Game Box:
All the fun of the popular movie game is now in a game featuring 300 old and new TV favorites.
Pass the Popcorn TV brings the small screen to life! It's packed with reality shows, sitcoms, dramas, cartoons, late night talk shows and more. Try to guess the name of a TV show from the People, Quotes and Story clues. There's also a new category--Anything Goes!
Speed counts! be the first to shout out the name of the TV show based on the clues. Can you complete your set of tiles first?
Add some Pass the Popcorn to your next party!

name: Stein schleift Schere
description:
A tactical board game of Rock-Paper-Scissors

The players in turn place their counters on the gameboard until each space contains one counter.

Then in turn a player selects a counter and captures all weaker counters belonging to the opponent, orthogonally or diagonally next to the selected counter. If no more options available, the round ends. The winner scores the difference of counters remaining. A new round is played, unless one player has reached eight points.

Ranking of the counters:

paper - beats well and stone
well - beats scissors and stone
scissors - beats paper
stone - beats scissors

name: Trailer Park Boys: Supply & Command
description:
From the publisher's website:

Straight out of the Trailer Park! High Roller Games brings you the Ultimate Party Game - Supply and Command! Like the classic Asshole or President game, Supply and Command lets you take charge as the new park Supervisor. But watch out, it's Survival of the Fitness, where new rules and new dicks can lead to some awkwardly situations. With original pics of the TPB characters, its the perfect game for those smokey cheeseburger liquor parties. Guaranteed to make your night extra greasy! *This game is supported by the People’s Freedom of Choices and Voices Act.

The deck contains cards ranked from 12 to 1, along with two Jokers, Cory and Trevor. Each card bears a number, which is not only its rank, but also tells you how many of that card exist in the deck. The lower the number, the better the rank.

The deck is dealt out to all players and the object is to get rid of your cards as fast as possible. The hand begins with one person playing one or more card to the center of the table. The cards played must all be of the same rank (although Jokers are wild, and may be played with any other cards). Each player in turn must now either play the same number of cards of a better rank, or pass. Play continues around the table until everyone has passed; at that point, the cards are cleared and whoever played the last set of cards leads the next round. After everyone has gone out, the players are ranked. The person who first got rid of all his cards becomes the Trailer Park Supervisor. The last becomes the Shit Puppet. Players change seat position to represent the new hierarchy and begin another round.

TPB: Supply and Command also includes two optional decks, Supervisor and Trailer Park. These cards are used to provide additional advantages to the Supervisor or to make the Shit Puppets' life more miserable.

name: Turro
description:
Turro is an abstract strategy game for 2 players. Your goal is to reach the opponent's end of the board with your Turro stone or capture the opponent's one.

Turro is a game of careful planning, area control and and flexibility on the board. With the two winning conditions you always have to keep your mind open for either way while keeping an eye on the plans of your opponent.

Capturing opponent's stones is key to make way to victory. But captured stones stay on the board remaining a threat if freed in the wrong moment. And capturing in the wrong moment can offer your opponent a free move to turn around the whole match.

Will you be able to break through? Or will you get captured on your way there?

name: Comrade
description:
In Comrade, you alternate between the roles of a dissident and an informer in a totalitarian regime, the former trying to influence the people with the word of freedom and the latter trying to "protect" the same.

As an informer, you win by identifying the dissident player and play him or her your card. As a dissident, you win by playing your card to as many comrades as possible so that they may learn the secret word of freedom and vote for it.

The game starts with one of the two words of freedom in play, "glasnost" or "perestroika". Your hand consists of one card only that tells you your current role. The card is played through three distinct phases:

1. Vote: Selected players vote secretly for or against freedom.

2. Committee: If the vote says freedom, the selected players vote again but this time openly. If they succeed in identifying the word of freedom all except the informer win. If they fail, the dissident player is revealed and an easier target for the informer in the third phase.

3. Interrogation: The players take turn to give or receive 1 card until all have 1 card again. The dissident tries to play his or her card to players who have not yet seen the card while the informer tries to play his or her card to the dissident.

The players may never reveal their cards.

The continuous change of roles makes the game unpredictable and keeps the players in uncertainty. A strong advocate of freedom one turn may suddenly be an informer the next.

You must trust each other to successfully vote for freedom but you cannot trust anyone!

name: Bingo: Salish Sea, Land & Sky
description: This Salish (Northwest Coast of North America) themed bingo game features art from Doug LaFortune. There are 36 different hexagonal bingo tiles and 6 hexagonal boards with 6 unique tile spots. When the dealer calls out an animal, each of the 2-6 players searches his or her board. The one who has that animal claims it. This continues until one player fills all six spaces on his or her board.

name: Vinegar Hill
description:
Vinegar Hill is a low complexity wargame covering the Australian Castle Hill Convict Rebellion of 1804. The game includes an 11x17 map, countersheet, and 3 pages of rules. The game is based on Peter Schutze's Eureka Stockade.

Each player has an objective that he or she must meet in order to win - either number of units destroyed or occupying certain hexes. Each counter can move one hex per turn. The combat is a simple system in which the players must roll greater than or equal to the number printed on the counter to achieve a hit.

name: Armada Beginner's Box
description:
Armada is a multiple-deck deckbuilding game of fast-paced space combat. Each player controls two to five decks, each of which represents one ship in the fleet.

Each card in a deck represents one system coming online. As the AI alerts the control crew to which systems are ready, power can be diverted, weapons reloaded, hardware destroyed, AI disrupted — all using a rules light system that is easy to understand but difficult to master.

Each player attempts to use his ships to destroy his opponent's ships and be the last player remaining.

In the distant future, mankind has spread across the stars of our galaxy. Matter configuration technology requires vast quantities of Osmium. Interstellar corporations are locked in a battle for control of Osmium reserves and, thus, control of the galaxy. Cryogenically preserved crew sleep for centuries, awaiting their awakening to the sound of klaxons as an enemy armada enters sensor range.

Battle will be joined. Ships will be destroyed. Men may die. When the cryopod opens only one thing is certain: only one armada can survive.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tour du Jour
description:
With Tour du Jour you can organize one-day classics or your own multi-stage tour! Use a single racer or a team consisting of a maximum of four members. Whether you enjoy hills or mountains, cobblestones or coastal roads, Tour du Jour has it all. Find out how your team holds up under the onslaught of the gruesome secteurs pavés of Mons-en-Pévèle or Trouee d'Arenberg and brutal côtes such as the Kapelmuur and Oude-Kwaremont. Prefer long or short or false flat stages? It's all up to you. Mountain top finishes? Check out the tiles for 3 infamous climbs: L'Alpe d'Huez (France), Alto de l'Angliru (Spain), and Plan di Montecampione (Italy). Rain? Snow? Got it covered. Labyrinthine, narrow city streets, complete with 90 degree turns, nasty road furniture that pops up unexpectedly? Tour du Jour has that as well. There's no end to the possible configurations: this versatile game contains enough tiles to lay out any type of race and blast off.

The gamebox itself—containing 6 teams of 4 racers, game token holders, a set of 40 cards, 45 terrain tiles, and a 20-sided die—has been reduced in size and weight in order to save on shipping charges. Less box, more game!

The course is laid out from the terrain tiles each of which has a number indicating its degree of difficulty. On a player's turn, they roll a die and if the die roll is higher than the difficulty, the player may advance. If there are still unused pips to cover the degree of difficulty of the next time, the player may advance another tile until all the pips are used up (or insufficient pips remain to advance a tile.) Unused pips are tracked and carried over to the next turn.

The cards are event cards which are drawn at the end of a turn. Most are blank (no effect), the rest contain an event (usually bad, but not always) that impacts the race.

For a single race, the winner is the first to cross the finish line while for multi-stage races, the lowest aggregate score (aka time) is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Roverseiland
description:
Three robbers took a treasure and hid it in their castle. This castle is on the island in the middle of the deep lake in robbers forest. Each player tries to conquer the treasure, the fastest player wins the game.

First, each player has the get hold of the necessary attributes to make the crossing to the castle: a hat as a disguise, a boat as transport and a key to get in. These attributes are available on special fields in the robbers forest. A simple dice game helps the players with that.

When someone has collected the necessary cards, he may try his luck in the castle. In his turn, this player may choose one of the seven cards face down (three robbers, three neutral cards and the treasure). Either he won immediately (treasure map), he may try again in his next turn (neutral card), or he must begin again (robber card).

With beautifully illustrated game board.

name: Miaou Matou
description:
Match colours, quick reaction: A blue father cat, a red mother cat... Quick! You must be the first to find their 3 kittens!

All players have two big cats, each face down. Kittens are also face down, but at the center of the table.

The players must find three kittens in the same color as their big cats , like a memo. The first player who has collected all her kittens must shout "MIAOU", the turn is over and he wins a "mouse" pawn.

Is repeated until a player gets five mice pawns. He will be the winner of the game!

name: Lost Legacy: Undying Heart
description:
User summary:

This is a Lost Legacy set that was handed out as a promo sheet (2 A4 sheets) on Game Market spring 2013. It runs on the same system as the other Lost Legacy sets, and contains no special rules.

Please refer to the family entry for details on the various Lost Legacy sets.

name: Sentinel Tactics: For Profit
description:
Sentinel Tactics: For Profit contains additional characters and scenarios involving content from both the Flame of Freedom and Battle for Broken City core games for Sentinel Tactics.

Cancelled in 2020.
publishers: Greater Than Games, LLC, Living Worlds Games

name: Världsmästare eller stolpskott?
description:
Do you follow all sports on TV or are just turned into a sportsnerd at the olympics? Are you an athlete or a couch potato? This is the quiz game that reveals if you are a champion or belong at the substitutes' bench. Contains 265 fun and tricky questions about sports divided into these categories:

"Snow & Ice", "The ball is round", "Olympic", "The Pro question" and "Misc".

The game gives some ideas on how to play the game but there are no strict rules.

name: Multiple Tic Tac Toe
description:
OBJECT:
To win the majority of 9 games played simultaneously.

INCLUDES:
54 pegs
9 up gameboard
Instructions with box

(source: Text on box)

name: Wettpuzzeln auf dem Bauernhof
description: On the farm in Wettpuzzeln auf dem Bauernhof things have been moved around: The cow hides behind the goat shed, the dog is running around the scarecrow, and where is the tractor? Everything is messed up and not even Farmer Paul can be found. Now it's time to quickly find the right parts and clean up the farm once again!

name: Ratzeputz
description:
A lot is going on the vegetable garden, and in Ratzeputz the small gardeners need to work with Till the dwarf to plant and harvest the colorful carrots. But watch out as underneath the garden bed Ratzeputz lives with his insatiable family of rabbits — and carrots, as is well known, are their favorite food.

As soon as the young gardeners plant a new turnip, hungry Ratzeputz immediately comes out to see what's present, and as the players rotate the garden turntable the cheeky rabbit will move with it. If they have bad luck, then "plop!" — the carrot falls down a rabbit hole. Gardeners can be unlucky at harvest, too, with the rabbits also being happy to take home a turnip.

In the end, whoever has the most carrots wins! Ratzeputz includes two levels of difficulty and bonus game rules for children ages five and up.

name: Bau den Turm
description:
Bau den Turm is a dexterity game. You roll a die to determine which of six wood element you have to put on a hemisphere.
When you roll the colour of an element already placed, game also passes to the next player.
The game ends when the structure collapses. The perpetrator loses the game.

name: Wrummy 3-4-5
description:
Wrummy 3-4-5 is a fun new twist on the classic card game rummy that you play by spelling out words! This new 108-card deck allows you to play rummy, but also can be used to play games like poker, solitaire, and bull$#@! (aka Cheat).

What sets this apart from past combinations of rummy and word games is the scoring system. Very much similar to classic rummy, letter cards are colored according to their rarity, and thus their points. The most rare are 15 points, like aces. The less common are 10 points, like face cards, and the common cards are 5 points. There are also 4 wilds, which score 0 points.

name: Gauntlet of Heroes
description:
Welcome to Gauntlet of Heroes. Are you ready to take up the gauntlet against other Heroes and face the many challenges that await your party?

Your heroes delve into a long forgotten crypt, rumored to be filled with treasure and danger! Equip your team of brave Heroes as they defeat monsters and maneuver past obstacles to find the treasure and gold that is hidden there. Your Heroes will also face opposition from other parties searching the dungeon. Your Heroes will journey until they find and defeat the elite monster in the final room. The party of Heroes with the most gold wins. So gear up and get out there and show your opponents who the REAL Hero is!

The goal of the Gauntlet of Heroes is to be the player with the most Gold Pieces when the game ends. The player gains Gold Pieces by completing Challenges (defeating monsters, overcoming obstacles, and collecting treasures).

name: Carnival
description:
This game has a very interesting "back story" in the convoluted early history of the Monopoly game. It is based on the expired 1904 Elizabeth Magie patent for The Landlord's Game.

In 1934, Charles Darrow tried to sell his version of Monopoly to Milton Bradley, but they passed on it, knowing the real history of the game. He took Monopoly to Parker Brothers and the rest is history.

As Monopoly began to become very popular in 1935, Milton Bradley came out with their own "property trading" game, Easy Money. This was based in part on Monopoly and also Finance, which was another very similar game that had been on the market since 1932.

A race ensued to see who could patent this type of game first. The patent office decided that these games were derived from The Landlord's Game. Parker Brothers purchased the second Landlord's patent from Elizabeth Magie Phillips in November 1935, and Charles Darrow was granted a patent on Monopoly (as an "improved version") the following month.

Parker Brothers then pressured Milton Bradley to change Easy Money, and remove what they considered aspects of the game that infringed on Monopoly. This included the use of property cards.

Milton Bradley went along with this, but in 1937, perhaps as a bit of "payback," they briefly marketed this game Carnival, based on the earlier (expired) Landlord's Game patent. This game has what amounts to property cards (the "Concessions").

So, it may very well be that this game was put on the market by Milton Bradley largely to thumb their noses at Parker Brothers. There was nothing Parker could do to prevent it.

The iconography on the game board also ties it in directly to Easy Money, since the exact same Bank illustration is used. There are also references to "concessions" and it's very possible this is all in the nature of "subtext" as part of a dialogue between the two major game makers.

It was only available for sale for a brief period of time, perhaps just long enough for Milton Bradley to make their point about patents. Parker Brothers had been attempting to get a third trading game patent (and actually did so in Canada), but they gave up on the effort in the United States, and this game may have played a part in it.

If Milton Bradley had challenged the Monopoly patent in court, it likely would have been invalidated, and Parker Brothers knew this.
Some of the other early Monopoly-related variants are quite valuable (the Knapp/Electronic Laboratories "Finance," "Boondoggling," Rudy Copeland's "Inflation," Cadaco's "Movie Mart," the 1935 version of "Easy Money," etc.) and this game is just about as rare as these are.

name: Grecia
description:
User summary:

Grecia is a Party Game designed for 4 to 8 players above 18, which involves some drinking and moderate physical contact - like hugs and kisses (but this is not a rule, is just something that often happens). Grecia it is not necessary an adult game, although by experience I have noted that when is the case of having only adults playing it, mostly end becoming one.

Every player must choose one among the eight characters available for playing; they impersonate a Hero or Heroine who wants to become a God. In order to do that, the player must advance his pawn through the game board to the finish place, Mount Olympus. The player simply throw the dice and moves across the game board, adding or subtracting modifiers as he can, using his Drachma coins to gather advantage over the other players.

There are several things that a player can do in order to win some extra points for boosting his pawn and get first to the finish line. He can win extra Drachma coins by winning some challenge, for example. Besides that, that are some events that can punish the player who lost a challenge, or simply got unlucky on the dice toss. The punishment often involves some drinking or some nudity but, as always, that all can be avoided spending some Drachma coins. In the end, the "temperature" of the game tends to increase, but it will depends on the group of players because the limits are decided before by the players.

Description from the back of the box:
Welcome to ancient Greece! A fascinating place where gods vie followers as heroes struggle to get a seat on Mount Olympus. In this game, you will play a hero with a great ambition: Becoming a god. For this you should go through a tortuous path, full of intrigue, riddles and many wine-fueled orgies.

The objective of the game is to be the first to reach Mount Olympus. Players will have to go a long way to go facing obstacles, challenging mythological creatures and doing rituals and offerings to the gods to get to your destination.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Mythology, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: De Fabeltjeskrant: Dierentroef
description:
English description:
The 'Fabeltjeskrant' animal trump game is a colourful cordage for children aged 3 and above. Each round players play a card. The highest card takes all played cards. Player with the most cards wins the game.
The 'Fabeltjeskrant' theme is known by any Dutch person which makes it very recognisable for everyone.

Dutch description:
Met 'De Fabeltjeskrant Dieren Troef' proberen de spelers elkaar af
te troeven met hun Fabeltjeskrantdieren! Het programma is in 2005
uitgeroepen tot 'Beste Nederlandse Kinderprogramma Aller Tijden'.

De Fabeltjeskrant Dieren Troef is een kleurig kaartspel voor kinderen vanaf 3 jaar. De spelers leggen om de beurt een kaartje op tafel: wie het hoogste kaartje legt, krijgt alle gelegde
kaartjes. De speler die uiteindelijk alle kaartjes bezit, wint DierenTroef!

name: Mawaru Noroi To Yuusha Tachi
description:
User summary:
廻る呪いと勇者たち (Mawaru Noroi To Yuusha Tachi) is a game from the doujin circle 'emag Image' in Japan. The English name would be Circulating Curses And Heroes because 廻る呪い refers to the Curse cards circulating between the players. In this co-op deck-building card game, the players share their cards to improve their status and decks in order to fight a dragon.
Publisher summary:
「廻る呪いと勇者たち」は、プレイヤー間でカードを分け合い、自身のステータスやデッキを強化し、竜を討伐する協力型のカードゲームです。
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Fey Ball
description:
Fairies playing dodgeball with wild magic.

A dice game for 2-6 players. Each player takes on the role of a fairy. They gather magic and throw it at members on the opposite team. Fairy's have individual stats and powers.

Each turn players take mana tokens from the mana pool, pass their tokens to a teammate, or throw magic at an opponent. Throwing at an opponent entails rolling a number of dice equal to how many mana tokens they have. The game has custom dice with hit icons on 2 of the 6 sides. The attacker compares the number of hits they rolled to the defender's catch value. The defender loses health on a hit, or gathers some of the mana that the attacker spent.

Players need to be careful, as the magic is a bit unstable. At the end of each turn the overload die is rolled. Any player whose number comes up on the overload die has to check how much mana they have. If they have too much, their mana explodes causing them to lose health.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Quest for Arete
description:
You are an apprentice sorcerer in this new CCG. But can you master the elements when put to the test? So begins your Quest for Arete!

Quest for Arete (Are-a-Tay) is an Elemental card game of sorcery and duels. This beautifully illustrated game is suitable for players age 12 and up. The game is designed to be simple to learn, but with multiple layers of complexity that may be added based on player experience and ability. In the game, each player is a sorcerer’s apprentice charged by their master to make their way in the world seeking to increase their Arete – or excellence.

The back story of the game sets it in the pre-history of modern chemistry when magicians and sorcerers were actually trained in the undiscovered properties of the natural elements.

As an apprentice, you must duel any other sorcerer you meet using magical elements (represented by the cards) that combine make potions and spells. Each duel, won or lost, increases your experience and understanding of the elements and therefore, increases your Arete.

With additional rules applied, the challenge increases as players contemplate element stacking, spell interactions, time constraints, character cards and special character abilities. Decks are custom built by the player to suite their style of play and the strengths of their chosen character.

The game is available in a Starter Set that contains everything needed for two players. The kit includes 2 play mats, a full-color 24-page rule book, a timer, 4 character cards, two starter decks (identical) and two expansion decks (unique).

Once they learn the basics using their starter decks, the players can duel for first draw from Expansion Deck A. Each player chooses 5 new elements and customizes their deck. They may then duel again for first pick until Expansion A is depleted. As they repeat this process with Expansion B, their decks become more and more different - focusing on their unique preferences and character strengths.

Did they choose wisely? Have they mastered the elements and gained Arete?

Can you do better?

Quest for Arete can range from a simple game to high levels of complexity that will satisfy even the most avid gamer!

To locate a Quest for Arete distributor or retailer near you, visit www.QuestForArete.com

name: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #2: Savage Beasts
description:
In CQ:Heroes, up to 4 players take turns collecting heroes and sending them out to gain victory points for your tavern. From the mighty Paladins and Wardens of the King's Guard from Game Pack #1 to the powerful Great Wolves and Berserkers from Game Pack #2, Savage Beasts, each player will try to create a powerful combo of heroes to defeat even the toughest locations.

The heroes from Game Pack #2 - Savage Beasts feature Pet heroes that can be controlled by the Beastmaster skill.

Game Pack #2 - Savage Beasts includes the Adventure Deck: Desert Temple which features all new cards including a new card type: Raid Boss. These encounters are much tougher than normal encounters and are placed in the location area when revealed.
The new objective in Desert Temple is to defeat 3 of these Raid Bosses to open up the Throne Room. This triggers the final battle where all players make last party of heroes to battle each other for the room's treasures.

GAME FEATURES:

Simple and engaging: Although it's simple to learn and play, turns can become quite involved with all of the hero abilities and how you combo them during your turn.

Everyone plays to the end: No one is eliminated during the game and all players count their victory points at the end.

Quick flow of play: Because you draw up your hand at the end of your turn, you are then able to plan your next turn while others are taking theirs.

Accessible: Only 1 deck is needed for up to 4 players. Extra decks can be used separately by each player or shuffled together for everyone to share.

Easy to collect: No mystery packs. Each deck has all the cards you need to play.

Fast: The game sets up in less than a minute and plays in about 10-20 minutes.

HOW TO PLAY:

Starting with the first player, each player performs the following 4 actions in order:

ATTACK: Attack 1 encounter OR skip your attack to add one additional Hero to your Tavern on the next step
TAVERN: Place 1 hero in your Tavern (2 if you skipped your attack)
DRAW: Draw your hand back up to 5 cards
REFRESH: Draw and add 1 new Adventure card to the dungeon hall
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: If I'm Going Down...: Penelope Character Card
description:
Van Ryder Games gave this very special character card for If I'm Going Down to those who backed the "Tessen" Kickstarter campaign at the $12 level or above.

Penelope:
Recently reunited with her ex-lover Agent Zero in Livingston, Penelope was forced to explain her relations with Rigo. Now that he's dead, Penelope finds herself forced to examine if the feelings she once had for Agent Zero can be reignited...
Special Ability:
When making a Fate Check, Penelope may Trash a resource from her inventory to use the Fate Icon from that card.
Special Modifiers:
All weapons +1, but only if already bitten/scratched

Zombie side of card has a 3.

name: Moefuda
description:
User summary:
萌札 (Moefuda) is a card game from Japan. In Moefuda, the players use cards (fuda) with 'Moe' elements, such as 'Tsuinte' (bunches or pigtails), 'Tsundere' (coldness turning to love) and 'Osana-najimi' (childhood friend). Gameplay resembles Apples To Apples as, while one player acts as a judge, the other players use their cards to form combinations from their hands. The players try to make the combo with the most 'Moe' (adorable cuteness) in the view of the judge. The winning combo gets the player a chip, most chips by the end wins.

A second version of the game 萌札女学院 (Moefuda Jogakuin) has a High School Girl theme and some changes in the voting method.

Publisher summary:
「ツインテ」「ツンデレ」「幼馴染」といった萌え要素が書かれた札を使い、子に選ばれた二人が配られた手札の中でできるだけ萌える組み合わせを考えます。審判役の親に選ばれた方がチップを獲得します。ゲームを繰り返し獲得したチップが最も多いプレイヤーの勝利となります。
publishers: 哀愁旅館きたぐに (Aisyu Ryokan Kitaguni)

name: The Mimic King
description:
User summary:
マネキング (Manekingu) is a Japanese game first published in 2014 in time for the Osaka Game Market. It was quickly re-issued in time for the Tokyo Game Market in Autumn 2014, with English included on the cards and rules, and named in English as The Mimic King.

Be quick to strike a pose and shout a sentence determined by a die-roll. The slowest person is out of the game. The last survivor will be honoured as The Mimic King!

A set of word cards and pose cards are formed in a circle, with each combo numbered from 1 to 6. After the dice are rolled, players race to identify any numbers that were not rolled, and must strike the correct poses, and shout the correct phrases. The slowest player is eliminated each round, until one player remains to be crowned Mimic King.

There is also a download pack for 'Period Drama' poses.

Publisher summary:
サイコロを振って、出目によって決まる「ポーズ」と「セリフ」を、いち早く決めよう。一番遅かった人が脱落。最後の一人「マネキング」まで生き残れるか？
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Party Game

name: Twisted Skies
description:
A Steampunk Card Game of Adventure Across the Multiverse.

Imagine, beyond the bounds of your world that there are in fact several worlds, several Alternate Realities. Each more fantastic than the last all given life and connected by the pure power of thought, creativity, and terror harnessed in a mystical energy source called "Aether". These Realities exist tethered together in a tumultuous ever growing and ever changing Multiverse. While most worlds are blissfully ignorant many know of it's existence and even travel between the Realities seeking knowledge, riches or power.

Twisted Skies is a Steampunk card game of Adventure and Intrigue set in the fabulous adventures of the AIRSHIP ISABELLA. Players cooperate to complete daring missions at the start of the game but will double cross and challenge each other as they near victory. Can you master the Steampunk Multiverse?

Players take control of an elite airship. By manning and equipping the ship and crew, players take turns attempting to complete mission cards in an attempt to earn enough Victory Points to win. Other players can try to Interrupt the current player from succeeding at a mission, or can form alliances to help each other.

Twisted Skies is played in a sequence of Phases that make up each player’s turn. Players take their turns one at a time proceeding clockwise around a table. The active player taking
their turn is known as the Mission Attempter The Sequence of play for the phases of a turn are as follows:

1. Ready all Exhausted Cards
2. Draw one Manifest Card
3. First Drop. Place one Crew card into play or Equip a Tech card
4. Open Trading. Players openly trade cards with the Mission Attempter
5. Draw one Catalyst Card. If it is a Mission Card place it on the Table.
6. Mission Attempt. The Mission Attempter tries to gain points by completing Missions.
7. Pirate Trading. Players blindly trade cards from their hands with the Mission Attempter
8. Second Drop. Place one Crew card into play or Equip a Tech card

Once a player has made the Second Drop (and resolved any effect of that Drop) then their turn is over.

name: The Prisoner's Dilemma
description:
This card game is based on the game theory of the Prisoner's Dilemma. The theory explores why two purely "rational" individuals might not cooperate, even if it is in their best interest to do so.

In the prisoner's dilemma story, two prisoners are separated and have the option to confess to the crime or deny any involvement. If both prisoners confess, they will get 2 years. If one confesses and other denies involvement, the one who confesses will get 10 years. If they both deny involvement they both get 3 years.

When the story plays out, the prisoner's choose their self interest over the risk of possibly getting less jail time if they both confess.

Our card game uses that same idea but expands on it to allow for up to 5 prisoners and includes some added incentives to keep things interesting.

PLAYING

Each player draws an Incentive Card, looks at it and places it face down in front of them. Dice are rolled and placed on the Jail Card and Reward Card. Each player selects a Color Card from their hand and plays it face down in front of them. The Witness Color Card is turned over so that everyone can see the color. All players reveal their Color Card and Incentive Card at the same time.

Starting with the player color card who matches the Witness, any player who can play a Incentive Card decides how to use it: Alibi, Bribe, Double-Cross, Bully, Outsmart, Threaten.

Colors Cards are counted up by color. The player whose color has the most cards gets negative points matching the die on the jail card. The player whose color has the least cards gets positive points matching the die on the reward card. If there is a tie, all of the tying players each receive the negative points.

Points are recorded for each player and the round is over and everything starts over again.

First player to 21 points wins.

name: Kruisslag
description:
The goal is to be the first player to get all his ten stones to the opposite side of the board. One player moves his stones from to left to right, the other from bottom to top.

Two dice are thrown and the sum of both may be used for one dice or the separate numbers for two. When you end your move on top of your opponent's stone, that stone is moved back to its starting position.

name: Stiga Bowling
description: A bowling game where you spin a gyro on a sloping field against the pins

name: Don't Explode
description:
It is a glorious, shining moment for the National Space Program: launch day is finally here. The crew is suited up and looking dashing, journalists are lined up for miles, and the sky is clear and inviting. There's just one problem: due to a bureaucratic mishap, the rockets aren't scheduled to be assembled until next Tuesday.

You and the other players are high-ranking scientists at the National Space Program, competing to put together the best rocket you possibly can in the final ten minutes before launch. Whoever builds the rocket that gets closest to space, without exploding or suffering a similar fatal catastrophe, wins the game and keeps their job. If every rocket is destroyed, the winner is whoever got the closest.

Don't Explode takes place over two phases, Construction and Launch. During Construction, players will draft cards from the construction deck and add components to their control module, in order to build the best rocket they possibly can in the limited time available. During Launch, players will see how well they did, by using the components which make up their rocket to advance their pawn from the Earth to space (or as close to space as they can get).
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: The Cat Box
description: The Cat Box is both a card expansion for Box O'Cats or game of its own. The Cat Box game play is cat situations and cat-related items taken to the extreme. Can you placate your new catlike alien masters? Can you get a cat out of a tree using some cattails or a catapult? What if WE were shrunk to the size of cats? What if dogs and cats started a war? Can you solve these dilemmas with the items on the cards you hold in your hands?

name: Hats On: The Jet Set Name Game
description:
Geographical guessing game.
Take turns to pull ticket from the hat and guess correctly who, what or where in the world you are to get the ticket as a point.
Collect the most tickets to win

The set contains 8 card hats and 120 tickets.

name: Menagerie
description:
Collect the most impressive animals!

Menagerie is a quick and fun card game for 2-4 players. Build the most impressive collection of animals while trying to not let your opponents take advantage of your moves.

In Menagerie you collect cards to build animals and collect animals to build collections. But when you pick cards that you can't use, you may have to give them to another player. Menagerie is quick to learn, quick to play and more fun than a barrel of monkeys!

name: Professor Pugnacious: Armies of the Undead
description: This vampire and zombie themed promo mini-expansion for Professor Pugnacious adds 13 new cards - 12 zombie cards, and a new finale, Vampyr.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Professor Pugnacious: Age of Industry
description: This industrial revolution themed promo mini-expansion for Professor Pugnacious adds 5 cards - 1 new event, and 1 new class (4 cards), Captain of Industry.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Professor Pugnacious: Great Detectives
description: This detective themed promo mini-expansion for Professor Pugnacious adds 5 new cards - 1 new finale, Criminal Mastermind, and 1 new class (4 cards), Great Detective.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Aldabra: The Wildlife Game
description:
The wildlife game of Aldabra is an educational game for all the family.
The object of the game is to be the first to move a turtle into the lagoon by answering questions and accumulating points until one has 50 points.

name: Pointy Hats
description:
Pointy Hats is a trick-taking micro-game (18 cards) in which players try to outperform their rivals with great feats of wizardry. Try to perform your most powerful spell to impress your foes - winning the round and maybe the game. But be careful, playing too cautious or too reckless can cost you.

Gameplay Summary:
Cards are sorted into the Trick Card stack and Trump Card stack - and then shuffled. Each player is dealt 3 Trick Cards. Reveal the top card from the Trump Card stack. The player who dealt plays first. Turns then move to the right. The player with the highest numbered card takes the trick. The next Trump Card is turned over and the round continues until all three cards have been played.

name: Division War
description: Division War is a version of the classic card game War with a twist, designed to teach division facts. Players are dealt an equal number of the 86 cards showing division problems. Like in war, each player then turns over a card. They must then solve the division problem displayed on the card. The player with the highest answer wins and takes all the cards. If a player's answer is wrong, he or she gives her card to the player to the right. A wild card automatically gains all the cards in that round for the player who plays it. Like in wars, equal answers result in a "war" where players play two face-down cards and the an face-up card, and the winner wins all the cards. Players play a predetermined number of times through the deck or until one player has all the cards.

name: Vuitdeu
description: Word game, in Catalan, that freely reimplements the hangman game. Each player begins with a certain amount of points and one of the players thinks a word, placing on the table as many "?" counters as letters in the word. Then players take turns to guess a letter in the word; if the guess is incorrect, the player must pay one point. At any time, a player can guess the hidden word: if correct she wins as many points as "?" counters still on the table plus 2; if not, she must pay two points.

name: Het Spreekwoorden spel
description:
This is a cardgame where the cards have a drawing on one side, that depicts a Dutch proverb. On the other side the proverb is listed, along with an explanation, example phrases, and a point value. Each turn a player takes one card (with picture visible) and tries to guess the proverb. If possible the explanation can be given. If a player is right, they get the card/points. Whoever has the most points wins.

In 2014 a second part appeared.

name: Espionage
description:
A fast and fun game of deception and Espionage.
You take on the roles of spies in this simple card game. You are doing all that you can to find out the roles of your opponents and force them out of the game.

You and your friends (or perhaps enemies...) will each receive a single card. On your turn, draw a single card and then you are faced with a simple decision, Keep the old card or keep the new card. The catch is, whatever card you decide to discard will have an effect on the other players and maybe even on yourself. So choose wisely who you trust to discard and even more carefully who you decide to keep around.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: King's Tournament
description:
Each player commands a lord or lady from an established noble house who has traveled to the king's annual tournament to expand their influence with the crown and to earn favors and patrons for the coming year. You must balance your efforts between sponsoring knights (who may yield you honor and glory) and managing the subtle manipulations of the king’s court after each day’s battles.

Lavish the powerful with gifts, ply the gullible with a tapestry of empty promises, publicly humiliate your rivals, or back the people’s champion in the arena -- nothing matters except royal favor, and if your enemies are dragged down in the process, well… they knew the risks.

King's Tournament is a card-driven game that sets a random assortment of unique knights onto a play mat styled after a single-elimination tournament. Gameplay centers around the ebb and flow of two recurring phases: the action- and auction-based Festival Round and the card dueling-oriented Tournament Round.

Festival Rounds are play-or-pass affairs wherein players use actions, cards, tokens, and written abilities to sponsor knights, sabotage their foes, or benefit from the tournament in more subtle ways. The Tournament Round follows, during which the knights battle one another using their printed attributes and special maneuver cards played by their patrons. Victorious knights advance further down the bracket, and a new Festival Round begins afterward.

Play continues until a single knight has been crowned the tournament's champion, at which point players compare the favor tokens earned over the course of the game. Bonuses are doled out for reaching certain conditions, and the player with the most favor tokens is then declared the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Ex-Machina
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Gold Dwarf Cleric Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Gold Dwarf Cleric Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Boarding: Like a Pirate!
description:
Boarding! is team microgame where players have to board the enemy ship, and defend their own.

Each player have 4 different cards/actions to choose from each round, they can choose to Fire!, Charge!, Defend! or just hide behind a Barrel, the game has a mechanism like Rock Paper Scissors, but all the cards have a different reward/risk relation, is safer to hide behind a barrel, but if the enemy charge, you are gonna walk the plank for sure!

This game is family oriented, or for a small party of 4, 6 even 8 players on each team

name: Battle of The Electric Vikings: None More Black
description: In the new expansion you will get 11 new cards based on the two Spinal Tap albums, "This is Spinal Tap" and "Break like the Wind" to play along with the original Battle of the Electric Vikings.

name: Elemental Wars
description:
Elemental Wars is a strategy card game for 2-4 players in which they take on the role of Lords of Elemental Plane.

The Elemental Plane is a fantasy world full of elemental energy. Lord of Air, Fire, Water and Earth fight with each other for the supreme throne to rule the whole plane. These great Elemental Lords can summon mystical creatures to fight for them and cast powerful magic spells. Their wars shatter the earth and shake the sky.

As one of these mighty Lords, a player should fight with clever tactics to defeat enemy creatures and control key points and area.

name: Call My Bluff
description:
Call My Bluff is designed for up to six individual players or two teams. Insert a cassette into the game console. Stand by your button as the emcee announces each question. The first player to hit the button gets to answer. But listen carefully - is it a bluff? Should you challenge? It's up to you. You'll get points if you're right, lose points if you're wrong. The digital display automatically registers each player's points.

Call My Bluff is a trivia game that involves a large console with a cassette tape player. Special cassettes indicate to the console how many points a player gets for answering the question correctly (as some of the questions are worth more points than others.)

While the game was published by Charan Toys, the cassette technology was licensed from Words of Wonder, the company responsible for the hugely successful Teddy Ruxpin series of toys.

name: In the Dark
description:
The blindfolded team challenge game!

The ultimate blindfolded trust game! In this team game one player will be blindfolded whilst their team mates guide them to complete activities.

Test your blindfolded skills with 50 challenges to choose from, involving dice, drawing and action.

Prepare yourself for some seriously funny team challenges!

name: Mayor
description:
User summary:
Mayor is a co-operative board game themed on the election of a local mayor. The game works as a simulation of the process in Japan, with players acting the roles in the election headquarters. They decide the different campaign strategies needed in each district of the city, with the aim of their candidate winning the election.

The game is published in Japanese only, but English rules are available for download.

Publisher summary:
地方市長選挙がテーマの全員協力型シミュレーションゲーム。
プレイヤーは選挙対策本部の役員となり、市内の各地区へどのような選挙活動を行うか戦略を練り、市長候補者の当選を目指します。
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Smorgasboard
description:
Smorgasboard is a board game for foodies, friends and family alike. Players take on the guide of aspiring chefs as they work their way around the board in search of gastronomic success.

The object of the game is to be the first team of chefs to graduate from Rick's Culinary Academy by answering questions from the following categories:

4BIDDEN-FRUIT
KITCHEN-KAOS
NUUDLE-DOODLE
TASTO-QUEST

Basically a food and drink based variant of Trivial Pursuit for 2-4 players/teams.

name: El Juego del Come Come
description: Every player has to get as many of their markers to the opposite edge, preferably in the right order, thus achieving the highest points. They must also avoid losing their markers, if one of your markers goes off the sidelines on your left or right, or if your market is "eaten" by other player.

name: Boerderij Spel
description:
A farm isn't a farm without it's animals. Throw the dice, move your pawn and purchase the animals and machines by paying the requested amount. Primary goal of this game is to purchase the animals related to your farm. First one to succeed is the winner of the game.

An educative game of trade and luck

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #16
description:
The Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #16 is composed of 2 expansions:

Hot Tin Roof: Home Turf
Includes 4 Turf tiles and 17 sardine can tiles. The Turf tiles allow the player to claim a patio as their home turf, and whenever another player places a cat on the board from a Home tile on home turf, they must pay that player 1 can.

Road Rally USA: Mud Boggin'
Includes 3 Mud tiles that can be placed on the board during setup. During the game, when a player starts their movement in a space containing a Mud tile, the first card they play will give a movement of 1.

This is available in Game Trade Magazine (Issue 182 - Apr 2015).

name: Open Field Battle
description:
Open Field Battle is a simple wargame portraying generic 17th-century combat; no specific battle is represented.

Each player has a force of pikemen, cavalry, musketeers, and cannons. Each turn a player gets a random number of command points to spend on musketeers and cannons firing and on pikemen and cavalry moving and assaulting.

Combat is deterministic; the result depends on the formation the defender is in and the status of the defender and any neighboring units. E.g., a lone defender or one at the end of a line is disrupted (or eliminated if already disrupted), but one with two undisrupted neighbors merely retreats. The neighboring units may suffer effects as well.

Optional rules allow for different ways of using the command points and the possibility of saving them from turn to turn.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Hold Your Breath!: Bonus Cards
description:
From the publisher:

In Hold Your Breath! each player assumes the role of a pirate treading water in the ocean. These brilliant tacticians have decided to play a game of "Hold Your Breath" to see who is the toughest pirate because, you know, what else are you gooing do in the middle of the ocean facing certain death? The game is played in two rounds. In the first round, each player may dive deeper, providing they have the "Swim" and "Air" cards to do so. Players press their luck each turn since it is the pirate who dives the deepest in round one and resurfaces in round two who is the winner. What about the losers? Who cares, they are losers. But if you really want to know, well, they dove down and ran out of oxygen before they could resurface, so now they are just "resting" underwater until the next game, okay? But we digress... Players can play "Panic", "Shark", and other nasty cards on the other players, slowing their progress. In the second round each player struggles to reach the surface before he runs out of air and therefore decides to take a rest. Most of the pirates may not make it back to the surface, but the one who makes it back alive and dove the deepest is the winner. Be careful, though, because if you dove the deepest in the first round, you will surely have the toughest time getting back to the surface since A) you swam the deepest and B) no one else wants to see you make it back alive. This is a 4 pack bonus card set with manual.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Nautical, Pirates

name: Gross-Abulary
description: A word game in which players compete to earn the most picture cards. Players earn points for taking word tiles and grammatically using them correctly in a sentence or phrase. The player earning the most points in a round gets a chance to answer a trivia question on the back of a picture card won. They may tell a joke in the process. At the end of game play, the player with the most picture cards wins.
categories: Educational, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Bowling Cards
description:
Play Bowling with Cards

There are 156 cards in the deck, consisting of:
Number cards (1 to 9)
Strike/Spare cards
Gutterball cards
Hole cards (that's an 8 )
Joker cards

There are different ways to play the game.
version 1:
Every player gets 21 cards and has to combine them as
good as possible in one serie of Bowling

version 2:
Player starts with 5 cards and then plays 1 of them and discard one card.
Before next turn player draws 2 cards and one of the cards can be the top card from discard pile,
it's not allowed to discard holecards or gutterball cards

name: Unstable Isotope
description:
Unstable Isotope is a micro party game. Each player gets a subset of the cards that represent an unstable isotope that is about to become stable by kicking something out of it.

If you are going to get ejected out of the isotope, you can save yourself by correcting finding a different subatomic particle to eject in someone else's hand.

If you get ejected, you are out until the next round.

Knocking someone out scores you subatomic particles. The first one to collect a whole set wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Korinar Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Q Continuum.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

description: Damage Control Teams are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "Deja Q," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Q Continuum. It is considered a Resource.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Monstrocards
description: Monstrocards is a party card game in which players quickly create their own cards and pit them against other players’ cards in a series of duels. Because you don’t have much time to create your deck, what comes out is often weird, sometimes creepy, and usually hilarious. When two players pit their cards against each other, the players who aren’t dueling vote on which card wins.

name: Monopoly: Glööckler
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Harald Glööckler, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pedal Beach
description:
It's the Maine event! The Pedal Beach bicycling competition is here with trophies provided by Allspeed cycling and snow.

In this two player bicycle race, player "pedal" their bike by alternating between right and left hands in attempt to match goal cards in the center of the table. Try to acquire the most goal cards to earn a trophy at round end.

Players may choose alternate play methods such as taking turns in play,all out race with no turns, or even play in teams with one player per pedal.

Swerve to avoid bears and moose and be sure to celebrate a victory with lobstah! Have fun with this easy to learn card filler, where memory and speed will lead to victory.

name: Red Herring
description:
Can you keep a straight face - even when you're lying? Can you tell the difference between a truth and a blatant bluff?

If you're the world's best blagger, or just a champion cheater, then this is the game for you. thinking on your feet and coming up with creative answers are what counts here - and you'll need to reel off some real-sounding suggestions if you want to win. Players must come up with - and pass off - plausible meanings for words and sayings in 4 different rounds including word definitions; sayings; world customs and moments in history, but only one of them will be genuine. Can you fish out the red herrings and spot which one?

description:
Bring the magic of the movies home with the first board game ever based on the films of Kevin Smith!

The cross-country adventure of "Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back" is now an official, authorized edition of Monopoly, with a game board featuring art and locations from the movie! The game also has new Chance cards, Community Chest cards and game pieces, all set to the same classic Monopoly gameplay! Packaged in a full-color game box with movie artwork.

A Diamond Select Toys release
The first board game ever based on the films of Kevin Smith
Based on the cult favorite film
An official, authorized edition of Monopoly
Game board features art and locations from the movie

name: Reverse Charades: 2015 Tabletop Day Edition
description:
Reverse Charades flips the charade standard of one person giving clues to a large group on its head by splitting the players (six or more) into two teams, then having all but one person on a team work together to get that one person to guess as many words as possible in sixty seconds. Each guessed word is worth one point; each word spoken or mouthed costs that team a point.

After each player has guessed once, the team with the most points wins.

This version was given out during Tabletop Day 2015 and consists of 51 double-sided cards, a rule card, and 2 cards promoting other USAopoly games. (no box)
