name: Mind Masters
description:
A competitive deck-trashing game for 2-5 players by Florian Woo.

Each player plays a famous Mind Master. These people have telepathic abilities, which allow them to read the minds of others and exchange and extract memories from there.

Every year, the greatest of these Mind Masters meet in a battle for sanity. During these tournaments, they try to bring the most precious memories of each opponent into the foreground, so that they can access and delete these thoughts forever. Only the ones who keep these hidden until the end will stay sane.

Mind Masters is a competitive card game, where each player has an identical 40 cards deck at the beginning. Inside these decks, there a five "Precious Memory" cards, which each player has to protect. They will play cards forcing the others to discard or even trash cards, to finally remove all of their "Precious Memories". Therefore, the deck gets thinner and thinner over game play. The last player keeping at least one of his "Precious Memories" wins.

This game was created for the March 2015 24h design contest at BGG (theme: confusion).

name: Coin Tower
description:
Coin Tower is a casual abstract game that can be played for adults and children (>6 years). It's a game that have the spirit of Pong hau k’i or Tic-Tac-Toe; it's a little abstract that can be solved but that you can play with your children, or in a pub with casual gamers, because the original idea was to make it on a coaster. You need a little board game and only ten coins, that forms two towers of five coins each.

Players build two towers, five coins each tower. Each player places, per turn, one tower on an empty space on the board.

The first turn is for the player who placed the first tower on board. Per turn each player moves any tower one or two cells on the same row or column, without changing direction. When a player moves a tower can carry as many coins as he wants to the target cell, but he must leave at least one coin in the origin cell. The target cell must be empty and in his movement the tower cannot jump over other towers or other coins. Every move will create new towers, which can be moved in next turns. A tower consists of at least two coins. A coin on a cell cannot move, but can block the movement of other towers.

The game ends when a player on his turn cannot move a tower. The player who made the last move is the winner of the game.

name: Herzblatt
description:
A German card game played with the 32-card deck composed of the values seven through ace in the four suits. This game is a simplified version of the German game Skat - in that the trumps are fixed (always hearts), but the ranking is still the same:
A-10-K-Q-J-9-8-7.

Depending on how many players you have, you reduce the 32 card deck further.





Players

Cards In Deck

# Dealt to each player



5

32 (7 -> A)

6



4

30 (remove 7♥ & 7♦)

7



3

26 (remove all 7's + 8♥ & 8♦)

8



2

20 (10 -> A)

9




Players take turns after dealing to see if they want to make a go of a play. Goal of making a go at it is to get 66 or more points in the tricks you capture. If you make 66, you get your wager (fixed, say 1 pt). If you make a go and fail to get 66 pts you loose 2x wager (say -2 pts). If you make a go and fail to get more than 33, you loose 4x the wager (say -8 pts). If you make a go and succeed and keep the sum of everyone else to 33 or below, you win 3x the wager (say 3 pts).

The points are: A=11, 10=10, K=4, Q=3, J=2, and 7,8,9 =0.
So there are 120 points on offer, and you need to capture 66 of them. Remember the 10 is better than the king, and there are rules for using trumps and playing trumps and suits - so if you don't think you can make it, pass the option to make a play to the next person. If the question to play goes around the table fully and no one takes it, its a bust and reshuffle ( There is no Skat like option of playing with a crappy hand).

Once cards are dealt there will be 2 cards left over - leave those face down. Whomever makes a play, gets to draw those 2 card into their hand and discard 2 cards, to set aside. Those set-aside cards count in the scoring of the player making a play. So its important what you discard - consider the rules of when suits and trumps need to be played.

First player left of the dealer plays first card (regardless of who decided to make a go of it this hand). You have to play the suit led with, if you have it. If you don't have it, but have hearts, you must trump with a heart (your choice which). If you don't have hearts either, play any card - but you won't get that trick. If hearts is the first card played, you MUST play hearts if you have it and you MUST play a higher heart if you can.

This way, you can see that its possible to force others to play hearts at certain times and get the trump cards out of play, and then still control play and be able to bring home points with less valuable cards like face-cards.

It sounds very complex, but its not nearly as bad as it seems, and a great light version of Skat. Unlike Skat that requires exactly 3 players, this plays with 2-5 players.

name: Memo Tierfamilien
description: A variation of the standard Memory where you need to find Triplets instead of pairs. Each triplets represents an animal family.

name: 梦想之道 (The Way of the Dream)
description:
夢想之道 (The Way of the Dream) is about the journey toward the dream. In the game, each player takes two roles at the same time: the one who tries the best to make their own dreams come true, as well as the key person during the pursuit of other players' dreams. What will happen during the journey depends on other players' choices; some are good, while others might hinder you a bit. Therefore, you can focus on disturbing other players, or concentrating on how to realize your own dream. Or, try to make a win-win situation with wisdom of crowd.

In a player's turn she will draw destiny cards and distribute them among all players as their hand cards. Then each player must give the active player one card from their hands, and the active must use what she has got form her fellow players' "help" to lay the cards onto the game board, paving the way toward her dream. Once a player reached the central goal area, her dream comes true and wins the game.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Ortus: Tactica
description:
Ortus Tactica expands the gaming experience of Ortus, the fast paced 2-player tactical game. The box contains new units to add to your band of warriors, giving a big twist to the game.

Your tactics will have to adapt to what your opponent brings to the table as well.

This expansion also adds Warlord cards, introducing variable player powers. Try and beat your opponent with each of the 6 different Warlords and in every combination.

Ortus Tactica brings new options, challenges and fun to an already exciting board game.

name: Alien Run
description:
Get Ready for Some Cosmic Fun Because Alien Run is Out of This World! Think you have a plan? Think again! Strategic thinking will be challenged around every bend.

What is Alien Run? Alien Run is a fast-paced strategic board game full of bizarre twist and turns. You can either play independent or with allies. During the race each player can be detoured by an opponent. The play of a Trump Card, Mystery Card, or landing on a Wormhole can send you into a galactic U-Turn. The secret to success is strategy. The player with the most orbs wins the game. It may sound easy, but it's not. Your strategic thinking will be challenged around every bend.

Each Player begins the game without Orbs, Trump Cards or Mystery Cards. That's right, empty handed. Players can collect Orbs from either game spaces, other players, Trump Cards, or Mystery Cards. Players have the opportunity to purchase Trump Cards from the bank to add to their arsenal, however there are purchasing rules. The Trump Cards are used for offensive and defensive plays during the game play. The secret to success is strategy, so keep your cards hidden and try to make some allies. Remember, it's not about who finishes first but who finishes with the most Orbs. The enticing bonus structure maybe just what a player needs to finish in the lead and be declared the winner. So get the popcorn ready, four players can finish in forty-five minutes. Game night will never be the same.

I almost forgot....

Don't get distracted by the hidden images in the game board. What a player misses can send them orbiting in the wrong direction. Stay focused and Alien Run victory can be had.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hero Company
description:
A new game by Masao Suganuma, of Machi Koro's fame, based on the eponymous manga by Kazuhiko Shimamoto, which is basically a parody of the "Super Sentai" series, better known in America for its "Power Rangers" version.

In this game, players are would-be heroes working for the Hero Company, which such fancy names as "Choco-Red", "Soft-Yellow" or "Macaron-Navy". Each turn, which represent a week of game time, they try to resolve three different cases of increasing difficulty (ending with a final battle of supposedly epic proportions), in order to get the best grades from the company. Each hero can only try to resolve one of those, though heroes can queue to resolve the same case. Some cases only rewards the player who actually resolved it (ie, beat the threshold to resolve it with the die/dice), and others rewards every player who participate.

To spice up things, each hero has a hand of skill cards to either boost his capacities or mess up his partners' plan.

While it is important to cooperate to overcome the different cases, in the end, there can be only one winner, so this isn't a cooperative game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Hey Bartender!: The Cocktail Themed Party Game
description:
Hey Bartender! is a cocktail-themed party game for 2-4 players. Players move around the game board collecting ingredients, and develop their world-famous cocktails, with the goal of gathering and matching various ingredients to shake their cocktails. Get ready now for the challenge from your family, friends, and lovers.

How to Play Instruction

1) PREPARATION: Place the game board in the center of the playing area Each player receive 1 chip board, and choose one character to represent him/her while traveling around the board .

2) BARTENDER: Select as Bartender a player who will also maintain the supplies and inventory for the bar. A Bartender who plays in the game must keep his/her chip board separate from the bar board.

3) BARBOARD: The bar boards holds all ingredient chips, cocktail cards, shakers, and cocktail chips. The board supplies ingredient chips to players and exchange cock-tail chips to player upon completing every single cocktail. If the Bar runs of out ingredients, the Bartender is allowed to issue ingredients needed by writing on any ordinary paper.

4) THE PLAY: Starting with the Bartender, each player in turn throws the dice. The player with the highest total starts the play: Place your character on the corner marked “OPEN/START”, throw the dice and move your characters in the direction of the arrow the number of spaces indicated by the dice. After you have completed your play, the character turn passes to the left. Two or more characters may rest on the same space at the same time. According to the space your character reaches, you are entitled to obtain the ingredient designated in the space or follow instruction stated in the space such as Chance, Give, Take, or obliged to rest a turn, jump to any space, or to exchange cocktail card, etc.

5) WHO WIN? The first player to complete all their cocktail cards in hand. If time limit of a game play is set, player with the highest combined total scores of ingredient in hand (please refer to score table) will be the winner. Any completed cocktail chip is awarded 10 bonus points.

Play Option 1: The first player to complete all their cocktail cards in hand wins.
Play Option 2: If time limit of a game play is set (average of 25 minutes), player with the highest combined total scores of ingredient in hand wins.

Players must dodge and utilize Bartender's instructions as it may force you to give or take ingredient chips from other players to make this game unpredictable.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Party Game
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TRADITION OF GLORY: A Game of Naval Adventure during the Age of Nelson
description:
INTRODUCTION
The year is 1795 and France is gathering their Forces for their Armies and Navy in a grand attempt to conquer Europe. It is also a time of revolutions, imperialism, piracy and political intrigue. In this game, you start out as a young Officer serving in the British Royal Navy. As you complete missions, you will gain experience, honor and hopefully promotions. In time, you may command a Ship of your own. This game is for fans of the Nautical Fiction Series of Horatio Hornblower, Richard Bolitho and Jack Aubrey.

OBJECTIVE
In TRADITION OF GLORY each player creates a Player Officer starting out in what will, hopefully be, a long and glorious career in the Royal Navy. During, play, Player Officers (POs) will be assigned to Ships and conducting a variety of Missions as they move along the Career Track Game Board. The Career Track consists of Ports, Sea Travel and Ship Duty Assignments. These Assignments will result in a variety of situations and encounters including Naval Battles, Port Assaults, Land Skirmishes, Shore Bombardment as well as a variety of other Missions in which the Player’s Officer must resolve. The outcome of these Encounters and Situations determine whether the Player’s Officer advances along the Career Track. While the Officers conduct Challenges, they might gain or lose Merit Points, which are used to improve their Attribute Ratings and Rank. The Player Officer with the Highest Rank after reaching the Ending Space on the Career Track, is the Winner. If this is tied, then the Officer with the most Merit Points remaining is the Winner. If this is tied then the Officers may conduct a Duel to determine the Winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Monster Buffet
description:
Monster Buffet is a real-time, extremely fast paced, quick party game! Every players play a monster with endless hunger whose only purpose in life is to gorge itself full. Mostly on smaller, much less fortunate little critters! But alas, he is not the only one with empty belly and gaping maw. Other hungry monsters want their share too, and gosh, they are greedy!

Each player grabs the token with one hand and puts it in his monster belly. Building and eating stack of critters, from one up to ten. You can take the lower number, same number or higher number, but never skip one in between! At the end of each round the app counts the points. The stack is worth the number of points equal to "meat" icon collected in it. In each round all players draw a random mutagen card. Each card offers them a task to fulfill to get extra points. Dare to get a run at them to tip the victory in your favor!
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
publishers: Rebel Sp. z o.o., Rombo Games

name: Fantastic Storytelling
description:
Fantastic Storytelling is a new card game which enables players to tell hilarious, unique stories and score points. Fantastic Storytelling is a brand new card game for telling unique, hilarious stories.

Amateur and professional linguists alike can craft crazy, imaginative stories with the aim of making people laugh and scoring points - and it's as easy as laying down a few cards. The premise is simple - the longer your story is, the more points you score.

The game combines my love of writing, comedy and games into one little box, which enables players to create ridiculous, silly, funny and crazy stories. There are so many cards that no two stories will ever be alike! 360 professionally designed and printed cards, along with the instructions on how to play the game.

Anybody can play, but due to some of the combinations that could arise whilst playing, it is recommended that players are 18+. You can play with 2-8 players, or even alone to try and improve your Fantastic Storytelling skills!

name: Beguile: PaWN The Enemy
description:
From the publisher's website:

Aching for a two player game? Have a chess set just collecting dust in the house? Afraid to take on the house champion for fear of embarrassment? Then prepare to parry, charm and back stab your way through this strategically clever spin on chess. Beguile is an exciting add on to any standard chess set that will have you looking at strategy in a seedy and underhanded new light. Beguile is a game for 2 players. A standard chess set is required to play.

Players draw a hand of five cards from a shared deck of fifty cards. On their turn they may play a card from their hand to make a pawn move like a knight, raise a piece from the dead via Necromancy, give your opponent's pawns the plague, or perform many other actions to achieve victory.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval

name: Schweizer Reise
description: Players secretly get 8 cards of destinations. On a map of Switzerland, they move their pawn according to a special dice showing 3 different dots and a question mark. If they roll a dot, they are entitled to move to the next space showing the same dot. Question mark means draw a card and follow the instructions. If you reach a space requested by one of your destination cards, you receive the mentioned number of adventure points. The player who visited first all 8 destinations receives another 5 points. Player with the most points wins.

name: Light Bobs
description:
Light Bobs was the nickname for the British light infantry, first used during the American Wars of Independence, and later commonly applied to the Light Division during the Napoleonic wars.

Light Bobs is meant to cover actions where hundreds, rather than thousands, of soldiers are deployed. Light Bobs is written at battalion level where the player commands four or more units called Companies. Companies are small (4 to 12 figures). This scale is larger than a man-to-man encounter, but below a brigade or multiple battalion engagement.

A basic game is between two leaders called Leaders of Worth with each commanding 4 to 6 Companies. Action is fast and sharp with the different Companies being of mixed arms and varying moral types. This is the scale of small units led by individual officers. To bring out the individuality of the scale and the period personality rules are used from which allow players to watch their Leader of Worth grow as a commander as they go from battle to battle. This system is a sort of paperless campaign.

name: King's Reign: Solitaire Card Game
description:
Similar to Blackie's Maze in style, this is a game where you must adventure out and create farms, forts, jacks, and queens to protect your king, who is the center of it all.
Build farms to supply more men for you to create. Build forts to disrupt your enemy's path. Create jacks for you to combat the enemy with.
The goal is to discover all the possible cards and get the most points. The two ways to win are 1, discover all cards, or 2, not have enough cards left to battle an enemy.
Use a basic card deck without jokers to lay out your yet to discover kingdom, and claim rule to your land.

name: THE IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls: Idol Produce Deck Set "Cinderella Stage"
description:
Based on the anime adaptation of Japanese mobile phone game "THE iDOLM@STER CINDERELLA GIRLS". Player take the role of producer of group of pop idols, your goal is to make them reach stardom.

This is one of deck building game which each player have to have their own deck. There are three set: pink(cute), blue(cool) and orange(passion), which represent character type from original mobile game. You buy a card, play various cards to collect mission and first player to earn 10 victory points win the game.

Let's make these girls successful!!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Prince LanLing in Battle
description:
This game's protagonist is Prince LanLing. His name is Gao ChangGong, an ancient Chinese legendary general of the Northern and Southern Dynasties. According to historical records, Gao ChangGong not only brave and fierce, and the face is very beautiful, like a woman. He worried that he could not intimidate the enemy on the battlefield every time he regarded terror mask over his face.

AD564, Northern Qi's enemy Northern Zhou sent 100,000 troops besieged LuoYang ,Gao Changgong led only 500 cavalrymen and fought through an army of Northern Zhou, which was attacking the city with 50,000 soldiers. He fought bloody way to the gates the city, surprising the defenders. The soldiers of LuoYang didn't recognize him, so he took off his helmet and mask. The soldiers in the city rejoiced at his arrival and were refilled with courage. They opened the gates and joined the battle outside the city. Soon the army of Northern Zhou was defeated.

In order to celebrate the victory, the soldiers composed a famous song and dance "Prince Lanling in Battle” (蘭陵王入陣曲). This song and the dance are long lost in China itself, however, it was introduced into Japan during the Tang Dynasty and is still being performed in some ceremonies today

name: White's Tale
description:
The White’s Tale board game makes players “become” a white-tailed deer and thrive by taking advantage of their environment and avoiding perils unique to nature’s four seasons. The game is fun for kids and benefits retailers, too.

“The white-tailed deer’s keen senses, complicated communication system, and commuter-like daily living habits make it essential that hunters understand the deer’s world,” said Emily Beach, the Archery Trade Association’s manager of education and curriculum development. “In the game, players are white-tailed deer, trying to survive and raise fawns. It sounds tough, but The White’s Tale makes learning child’s play.”

The game was created as part of the ATA’s “Explore Bowhunting” program, which teaches kids of all ages the basic skills of hunting with a bow and arrow. Students in “Explore Bowhunting” play The White’s Tale to learn how animals follow patterns when traveling, eating and mating. Students then use that knowledge to their advantage while hunting.

With this classic-style board game, players learn the natural history of white-tailed deer. Players must collect food and water through all four seasons, and breed successfully by collecting five fawns while avoiding predators, hunters, diseases and other unexpected dangers. It’s recommended for two to six players 8 and older.

Although The White’s Tale doesn’t teach players specific hunting tactics, it educates future hunters.

name: Pluto Presents...Off My Back
description:
A Walt Disney World Game from Parker Brothers.

The object of the game is to help Pluto get rid of his fleas.

Spread out the included playmat of Pluto. Break apart all the flea cards and mix them up. Then spread out the flea cards on Pluto, even on his tail, being sure that each card has a flea showing face up.

On each turn a player spins the spinner and then turns over a number of fleas equal to the number indicated by the spinner. Whenever a flea card is turned over and a new flea is found on the reverse side, that player wins the flea card. Blank flea cards remain on Pluto.

Players continue until all fleas on the board have been turned over or removed. Players count their own fleas and the player having most is the winner

name: Tumo-n
description:
Tumo-n is a game of piling up monster cards. The board starts with the largest monster (size 5, two cards) on the board, and players take turn putting a monster on the pile. You can't put a bigger monster on a smaller monster, though, and little monsters won't be able to hang on to a small ledge. Special actions may also give you an advantage.

As soon as one player is unable to play a monster from their hand, they lose the round. The game is won by the first player to win three rounds.

name: Scott Joplin Melody Dicer: The Music Making Game
description:
Compose ragtime music by rolling two dice, one small, one large. The number on each dice corresponds to a musical card (cards that have a few musical notes on them).

When five sets of two cards are laid out they can be played like sheet music by anyone with a piano, organ, guitar, woodwind, brass, or string instrument. Instruments not included!

Players can then select the best composition among all the songs created.

name: True Story
description:
True Story gets players telling true stories from their lives and teaches storytelling skills in the process.

Gameplay: Each players draws a Theme Card from the deck and tells a true story inspired by that theme. Theme Cards are memory cues to help you think of a story, from your own life, that you feel good about telling, e.g. Unknown Territory: wandering off the map, wild beasts & lands await, words not yet invented. With each round come new theme cards and new stories, plus new story challenges like longer stories, vivid descriptions, suspense, and self-reflection.

Goal: Players earn points telling a series of increasingly complex stories that include specific story elements. At the end of the game, points turn into votes (called Award Points). The player who receives the most Award Points is declared Master Storyteller.

name: Scooby-Doo! Amazing Chase Game
description: Each player gets a Scooby-Doo! eraser mover to use in this exciting race to the finish. The special decoder helps you find the snacks you need to zoom ahead. but watch out for the monsters who will set you back. Special game board spaces can be used with smart phones for augmented reality interaction!

name: 3 and C
description:
User summary:
This is a game that involves elements of addition and subtraction in creating a line of 3 pieces and can easily be learned even by young children. It teaches arithmetic in a fun manner and can be played a number of times in a short time frame.

The player who is able to arrange 3 pieces in a vertical, horizontal, or diagonal line wins the game. However, when there is a draw, the player whose pieces are placed on tiles with the highest total number of dots wins. If this number is the same, the person with more pieces on the 3 colored tiles wins. There is no draw.

The tiles making up the board are randomly shuffled each time the game is played, so the strategy involved is not simple. This makes for a game that is equally enjoyable for adults and children.

Publisher's summary:
小さな子供でも簡単に覚えられる3目並べゲームに算数足し算の要素を入れ
た、短時間で何度でも楽しく遊べて計算力が身に付く算数ゲームです。
縦横斜めに3目並べば勝ちですが、引き分けの時は駒を置いたボードタイルのドット数の合計が多い方が勝ちになります。同点の場合は3枚の色タイルにより多くの駒が載っている方が勝ちになります。引き分けはありません。
毎回ゲームごとにボードのタイルをランダムにシャッフルするので、戦略は単純ではなく子供から大人まで対等に楽しく遊べます。

name: Pig Out!
description: How long will you pig out before you chicken out? Roll pigs to score. Pig Out (keep rolling) as long as you want - but roll too many chickens and lose it all!

name: Hero Dice
description:
Hero Dice is a dice-based competitive role-playing game where every player is vying to become the most famous Hero around. Roll your character race, class and ability, and then set out exploring dungeons, fighting bandits, and showing up other Heroes.

At the start of you the game every player rolls to determine their Race, Class, and Ability. They will play a factor in battles against other players and enemies you encounter, providing advantages and disadvantages. As you roll other dice throughout the game, if you hit one of your 3 main die, it will automatically change to reflect the new die face up - only you can change your character.

During the game you'll be earning Fame and Infamy which can be spent to help you succeed at battles and gaining Companions. Though there's a lot of randomness to be had with dice, it involves a great deal of strategy and provides multiple ways to play and experience the game.

In a quest to become the most famous Hero around, how will you get there? Honor, deception, friendship, treachery...what kind of Hero will you become?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: 5-Across
description: An alternate take on the Connect 4 style of gameplay, 5-Across is a vertical game played with checkers. The board is placed on the stand to hold it vertically and players drop checkers into one of the 7 slots until one player succeeds in getting 5 in a row either vertically, horizontally, or diagonally.

name: Thunder Hamsters and the Temple of Cheese
description:
In Thunder Hamsters and the Temple of Cheese, players take on the role of one of the legendary Thunder Hamsters while they delve into the fabled Temple of Cheese. Players have several paths to choose from and will encounter large wheels of cheese, traps, guards, items of all sorts, and many other wonders.

This game has story-telling at the heart of it. As each encountered item is revealed, the player must make up a story to indicate how to pick up/ward off/handle the situation. Once the story is told, a judge is picked from the other players at the table and the story is ranked on a scale of likelihood. The player then must make a die role to determine the attempt's success or failure for that encounter. Other players may also toss in a coin to challenge the original story and a roll-off ensues.

Rules guide the players in basic mechanics such as movement, but the story-telling aspect opens up the game to nearly limitless possibilities.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Action Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Monopoly: The View from the Shard
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from London's highest viewing platform.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Cornwell Quality Tools
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from, an US company, known for favorite hand tools, power tools, tool storage products, specialty tools...
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Nördlingen, a city in Germany.

name: Nuscheln
description: You say a phrase and the others have to guess what you are saying. Too simple? No, because you have to poke your tongue out or bite on your tongue or ... during talking.

name: Monopoly: Mansons TCLM Limited
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Rotary Club of Mount Isa South West, Australia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wanted: The Outlaws – Fully Loaded Expansion Pack
description:
The Fully Loaded Expansion Pack is a set of new cards and dice that you can add to any COGgs game! It includes three new types of cards and a new set of dice that you can mix in to create even more intrigue and challenge!

The Legends set add notorious outlaws from history; The General Store brings gear and day jobs; and The Newspaper lets you spend your hard-earned loot to get ahead!

The dice in this pack let you change the odds when doing jobs, so you can plan ahead and adjust the risks and rewards to suit your posse's current strengths and weaknesses!
categories: American West, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Monopoly: Vancouver Canucks
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Vancouver Canucks®, an ice hockey club.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Greatest of All Mountains
description:
Greatest of All Mountains is a competitive Mountain building card game for 2-5 players that can be played in 45-90 minutes. The game currently includes nearly 160 cards.

Each player represents a mountain which is vying for the title of Greatest of All Mountains. To achieve this, players must acquire the most victory points in the three phases of the game, using various abilities and events to gain an advantage over the other players.

In hopes of achieving the high honor of being named Greatest of All Mountains, each player must first form the terrain of their mountain. By adding slopes, lakes, cliffs and more to their mountain they craft the foundation of their strategy. Players may also compete to gain the all or nothing "Tallest Mountain" award for additional VP.

Next, players must build facilities on their terrain. This is where strategy becomes very important as the facilities built greatly effect how the next phase will play out. Build the best facilities on the faces of your mountain or choose to build sub-par facilities on your opponent's mountains.

Finally, each player must attract tourists to their mountain. The goal is to get tourists to your mountain's "Safe Zone" where they will be scored at the end of the game. Tourists frequently change hands, so players must employ a variety of strategies and abilities to make sure their tourists are safe from the other players.

name: Chopstick Expert
description:
A 1 ~ 2 player game to practice using chopsticks.

The game comes with
2 pairs of chopsticks
1 small bowl
4 sprues of 6 "beans" in two colors (there are 4 shapes)

The instructions provide two ways to play 1) Compete against an opponent to be the first to put all of your color "beans" to the bowl. 2) Time Attack (solo) - challenge to transfer all of the beans to the bowl

name: Monopoly: Hannover 96
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from FC Schalke 04, a soccer club in Hannover, Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hop la Puce
description:
Hop la Puce is played with several colored discs, that are scattered across the playing area. Also in the playing area are two target rings. Players take turns launching a disc, in Tiddledy Winks fashion, trying to make them land inside a target ring.

Each player has three assignment cards that he tries to fulfill. Each card shows one, two or three discs inside a ring. If a ring contains the right configuration of discs, the assignment has been completed. The first player to complete all three of his assignments wins the game!

name: Dungeons: The Card Game
description:
A dungeon building card game, with a new dungeon every time!

A game where the dungeon is randomly generated for the players including rooms, monsters, loot, and traps. Each time you play the game will be different.

Adding both competitive and cooperative aspects, a group can enter a dungeon together or alone, teaming up on the boss, or stealing each others loot.

With expansions in booster packs you can always get more rooms, items, monsters, and puzzles for your dungeon to make it the way you want. Using our specialized booster system you only get the types of cards you want!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: The Wilds of Mars
description:
A simple little photo safari game built on the Treehouse system.
The object of The Wilds of Mars is to travel to "the grounds" where animals native to the red planet are bound to be and photograph them.

Setup: Each player selects one of the colors from the sets. Two cards are placed face-down next to each other in the middle of the table; these are the homes. Each player places one of their small pyramids on one of the two base camps pointed straight up. In addition, each player gets an initial hand of 6 cards.

Order of Play: Each turn a player takes, in order, the following actions: Draw, Resize, Play, Move.

The game ends when one player has scored at least 7 points of the grounds. That player is the winner.

name: It's a M-Monster!
description:
Two players are in a haunted house with a roaming monster! Each tries to manipulate the monster's path so that their opponent gets caught, allowing them to escape.

The gameplay takes place in two phases. First the players take turns to place 15 room cards in a 4 x 4 layout, with one space. The player and monster cards are placed in the rooms during this phase.

Next, players take turns to rearrange the rooms by sliding one or more cards to fill the space, and then move the monster according to the instructions on its room card. The first player to be caught loses the game while the other player escapes.

name: Giallo
description:
In Giallo, players compete to become the villain of their own classic horror movie.

2-4 players simultaneously choose to either raise the suspense, or murder a victim, striking at just the right moment to generate the most screams from the audience.

Each victim claimed grants new, unique powers, offering chances to disrupt other players and gain the lead, but hidden motives make some victims more valuable than others...

Whoever has accrued the most fear after five scenes becomes the true villain of the movie. The first player to win a trilogy of movies wins the game.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Bartnicy w lesie
description: Bartnicy w lesie (Honey hunters) is a simple educational race game for children explaining and promoting the ancient art of honey hunting (traditional bee keeping in living trees). The educational value is added via random adventure cards the players can draw after landing on an adventure tile. The goal is to reach the forest meadow and collect as much honey as possible.
mechanics: Action Queue, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Goldilocks and the Three Bears
description:
A roll and move game combining a custom die with a spinner, with the players taking the three bears to compete in a race with Goldilocks to reach their house.

From the publisher:
Will the Three Bears race home before Goldilocks?
Race home to stop Goldilocks from eating Baby Bear’s porridge, breaking his chair and sleeping in his bed.


Develop turn taking and communication skills
Develop concentration and interaction skills
Promote number recognition and counting
Link to National Curriculum Maths Key Stage 1

name: Harass Order
description:
Players fulfill orders, and get victory points.
They need resources fulfill an order, but their hand-size is limited.
If a player cannot (or doesn't want to) fulfill an order, he must hand it off to the next player with resources.

name: Eddy, das schwarze Schaf
description:
The little sheep ran away, encountering the wild boar Bruno along the way! They're now scared and want to return quickly to their pasture.

In Eddy, das schwarze Schaf, you use the black sheep Eddy to return these sheep to their pasture before Bruno can make it in.

name: Smiles: A Game of Shells
description: The perfect blend of luck,skill and strategy. Players roll cowrie shells in their attempt to get the shells to land smile side up. You are allowed up to 3 rolls per turn and you can roll any or all of your shells each turn. The strategy increases as scoring points becomes more difficult and penalties and bonuses apply.

name: Vampire Panic
description:
The Vampire Lord has entered the Castle and is slowly infecting everyone to take control. The Lady and her Hero are pure of heart and can resist him for a while, but they have only one night to find him and one chance to kill him when the sun rises.

In Vampire Panic, (which is possibly not the game's final name), all players are dealt a character card, with one player starting as the Vampire Lord. Players trade cards in two rounds of play and may secretly become infected. The vampires will attempt to infect as many humans as they can while concealing their identity, while the surviving humans are trying to identify the location of the Vampire Lord by the end of the night.

Vampire Panic is a light social deduction game that attempts to combine the hidden roles and fast play of Akihisa Okui's One Night Werewolf with the tense infection mechanism of David Ausloos's Panic Station.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Intrepid Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "Balance of Terror" episode Organized Play event.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Kings of Air and Steam: World's Fair
description:
Expanding the world of Kings of Air and Steam, the World's Fair expansion features:

1) New Technologies! The World's Fair has brought new technologies into the world, which will translate into fantastic actions and abilities the players can use during the game. Before the game begins, these technologies and drafted by the players, then unleashed during the game.

2) New Teams/Ships! This brings more variability and more player powers to the already varied world of KoA&S.
mechanics: Action Queue, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tjusarspelet för killar och tjejer: Sune och hans värld
description:
Freely translated from the back of the box:
"Sune and Sophie has taught their friends how to allure somebody and today they have arranged a competition of that art. Everyone wants to be in it. They have written down the names of the students and given them a score based on how easy or difficult it is to allure them. In order to succeed in their competition you have to play your allure cards cleverly, because then you get the chance to allure some of the most advanced girls/boys and than means extra points."

The gameplay is fairly easy and quite creative:
Cards worth different amounts of points are placed on the squares of the board. Your job is to move your piece to the squares that hold the highest points. Because, whatever square you land on, you get the card that is placed there (and its value is added to your score).

The tricky part is the way you move your piece. See, there is no die, so you move by playing your 4 "move cards" in a particular order that you decided before the round started. You don't know the order of the other players' "move cards" until they are actually played, so it's tricky to plan ahead how you should move in order to get the most points.

A game consists of 7 rounds. After that, the player with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Le nouvel empereur
description:
Each game gives you access to seven guilds with high recognition in the world of Bicolline. This game gives you a choice of 160 different cards in order to build your own army. Take the destiny of Bicolline into your hands and start the conquest of this fantasy world.

When a player has no more reputation, the game ends and the player who has the most of it wins. The game is played in multiple rounds and each players turn have 4 phases each. First you refresh used up cards, then you activate your "at the beggining of turn" cards skills if they are in your production or play area, then its battle time! You have to play a card and activate its power. Finally, you finish your turn by activating your "at the end of turn" card skills. Play continue turn base until the end.

name: Bota Abaixo
description:
From the publisher:

Bota Abaixo is your new card game!

Four friends, inebriated by another tedious evening decided to look for the cure for boredom creating this amazing game.

With this game you will finally find a way out of those awkward silences on stuck-up events. Bota Abaixo is the solution to turn the most monotonous of parties into a cascade of good vibe!

Bota Abaixo is the game that can’t miss to liven up your parties!

Based on the most popular drinking games as Ring of Fire or Kings, Bota Abaixo is more than a game, it’s an appealing and singular object which allows you to play, have fun and collect.
PLAY TO THE LAST DROP !!

HOW TO PLAY:

The players get around the cards in circle and the cards are randomly put in the middle face down. Playing clockwise each round a player picks one card which will have one specific rule wich the player make something (usually drinking a swig). At the end of each round the cards are discarded with the exception for the WC and immunity cards which can be kept. The game is played until there are no more cards.

You can play in the Competition mode in which each player can only refill his glass one time and are eliminated as soon as they drink it. The game is when until there is only one winner "standing".

There are various cards as Cascade; Make up one Rule; They Drink; Rime vs Rime...

Note: To play this game the use of alcoholic drinks is NOT mandatory.

Description in Portuguese:

Quatro amigos com jeito para a ilustração, inebriados por mais um serão enfadonho resolveram procurar a cura para o aborrecimento. E foi assim que de lápis na mão e de copo na beiça criaram o Bota Abaixo!

Baseado nos mais populares drinking games como Ring of Fire ou Kings, e ilustrado duma ponta à outra em 56 divertidas cartas, Bota Abaixo é o jogo que não pode faltar para animar as tuas festas!

Com Bota Abaixo vais conseguir quebrar o gelo naqueles convívios chatos onde apenas se trocam olhares macambúzios. É a tua solução para transformar a mais monótona das festas numa cascata de boa disposição!

JOGA ATÉ À ÚLTIMA GOTA!!

name: Privateers! The Golden Decade
description:
Privateers! The Golden Decade is a competitive boardgame for 2 to 5 players that takes the life of 18th Century's piracy on your table. Players will impersonate a pirate sailing the high seas among isles to conquer them all. Pirates will hunt treasures, loot merchants and sell goods to the colonies, avoiding dangerous storms, reefs and shoal-filled waters. They will trade ships for better and bigger ones or improve them with sails, crew and weapons in order to fight each other.

Every pirate starts the game with:

a standard ship card of 100 doubloons value with: movement of six, basic weapons, one crew man to repair the damaged tokens and empty slots where to put markers of canvas or every other markers in the hold;
twenty doubloons;
a command token, that let the pirates do special action during the play;
a load pawn and a ship pawn (to represent the ship on the board);
four pirate coves tokens, to put on the national flags when a pirate has conquered that national city.



Sailing around the modules, every player can freely attack the colonial ships, that are moved by the wind, or the other players, to steal doubloons or equipment tokens. The attack start when two ships are on the same tile. Every contender takes his three combat cards, that match the weapon token on his ship (or the basic weapon) and chose secretly one of them. When both the contenders had chosen their card, they flip them at the same time and they compare the two cards to see the result.

At the end of his own turn, each player has to generate one of the six events spinning the Wind Rose and immediately has to perform the related action: Diplomacy, Kraken, Castaway, Buried Treasure, Storm, Colonial Ship.

Once the game ends the scores are assigned to the players according to the following conditions:
Retained doubloons;
Owned ship;
Retained command tokens;
Owned cities
Equipment tokens, even if damaged
The player who has got the highest score is the winner.

name: Objectif Tobrouk
description:
This game covers the campaign around Tobruk during may - june 1942 at the regiment level.
1 turn equals two days, 1,5cm equals 3km
sold in a ziplock, with 200 colored counters, one map 40cm x 51cm and a rulebook)

name: Scheffeln: Run-expansion
description: 6 additional movement cards: 1 x Evasion, 1 x Nasty exchange, 2 x Backward and 2 x Joker. The rules are described in the rulebook from the base game.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Transportation

name: Méli Mélo Circus
description:
From the publisher:

Play with family and friends and recompose Jef, Walter, George, Colette and Nicolas. When it's your go, throw the dice and step by step put the body parts back together. Head, chest, legs, arms - the first one completing a whole body is the winner!

name: Bun Fight
description:
The Glitterati of Bear Valley Hills are at an awards after-party, someone says the wrong thing, then the cakes start flying! Whoever comes out the other end cleanest is the winner.

Bun Fight is a board game in which players move between tables laden with various cakes to grab and hurl at their rivals.

On their turn, a player has a number of actions enabling them to move to a table, grab a cake, push a cake in someone's face (close combat), or hurl it at someone (ranged). "Sweet Surprise" cards may be played at any time by any player, adding effects or helping players avoid/recover from trouble. Cakes (Just Desserts) cause Splat and Stun, and the player with the fewest Splat when the last cake is grabbed wins. Stun causes a player to miss actions but can be avoided by either dropping a cake or discarding Sweet Surprise cards if preferred.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Kingpins
description:
In Kingpins, you’re running a criminal syndicate in 1920s Temperance Town. The onset of Prohibition means it’s a race to see who will become the best bootlegger in the business! Recruit the right ne’er-do-wells to your side and undercut your rivals at the right moment to ensure that your syndicate comes out on top.

The goal of the game is to be the player with the lowest score after five rounds of play. Cards left in your hand at the end of a round will add to your score. Play smart and leverage your cards’ special abilities if you want to win!

Shuffle the deck and deal five cards to each player.
Place the remaining cards in a face down stack in the center of the playing area. This is the stockpile.Flip the top four cards of the stockpile face up and place them north, south, east,
and west of the stockpile. These are the recruitment stacks.

GAMEPLAY
The game lasts five rounds. In each round, players take turns in clockwise order until the round end is triggered (see ROUND END).

On your turn, you may take any number of the following actions, in any order:

Play a kingpin (12) from your hand to start a new syndicate stack in an empty space on one of the four corner positions around the stockpile (NE, SE, NW, SW).
Play a card from your hand to any stack. The card you play must be the next lowest in rank, but opposite in color (e.g., You can play a red 10 on a black 11).
Move an entire stack onto any other stack. This is only possible if the bottom card of the stack being moved is one rank lower and opposite in color to the top card of another stack (e.g., a stack of R4-B3-R2 can be moved onto a stack of R6-B5). Recruitment stacks can be moved onto syndicate stacks, and vice versa.
Play any card from your hand to one of the original (N, S, E, W) recruitment stacks that has become empty.
Discard a femme fatale card to play a different card from your hand to the bottom of any stack. The card played must be one rank higher than the card currently on the bottom of the stack, and opposite in color.
Play a hideout to any stack. This is only possible if the top card of the stack is a 1 and opposite in color to the hideout.
When you play a card, resolve its special ability (if any) immediately. If the ability cannot be resolved, simply ignore it.


If, after playing a card, you have none left in hand, the round ends. If you have cards left but cannot or do not want to take any more actions, end your turn by drawing a card from the stockpile.

If the stockpile runs out during the round, continue to play as normal but do not draw.

ROUND END
The round will end either (a) when one player manages to get rid of all the cards from their hand or (b) when the stockpile has run out and all players have passed consecutively—whichever comes first.

Score all cards remaining in your hand at the end of the round (taking all special abilities into account). The scoring value of each card is indicated in its bottom right corner. Add your score for the round to your running total.

GAME END
After the fifth round is complete, the game is over. Players should then compare their scores. The player with the lowest total score is the winner—the true kingpin! If there is a tie for lowest total score, the tied player who won the most rounds is the winner.

name: EUROPA à la Carte
description:
The Players travel around in Europe and try to get as much Gourmet Awarts as possible.
The player change their role while the Play from dishwasher to Gourmet and back to porters.
Only some roles allow the player to try to get a Gourmet Award.
The Player who has most awards at the end of the game wins.
The game is dice driven (4 travel dice an 1 Hotel die)

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Advanced Technology Resource
description:
The Advanced Technology Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "Future Tense," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Temporal Cold War. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using this resource, during the Activation Phase, any ship in your fleet may:

1) Disable 1 of it's Tech upgrades to perform any Action on its Action Bar as a free Action. OR

2) Discard 1 of it's already disabled Tech upgrades to perform an Action on its Action Bar as a free Action.

A ship may not perform any other free Actions the round it uses this ability.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Treasure Island
description: Treasure Island is a roll-and-move game where players hunt for pirate treasure. It is included in The Great Pirate Activity Book, published by Kingfisher. There are four starting points, each marked by a ship and leading to a different track. Each player chooses a ship and places his or her starting marker on it. More than one player may choose the same ship. Players take turns rolling the die and moving their marker along the track, following the directions on spaces where they land. Spaces may move players forward or back on the track or cause gain of loss of turns. When a player reaches the pirate treasure on an exact roll, he or she then heads back the starting ship. The first player back to his or her starting ship wins.

name: Animal Merry-Go-Round Motor Skill Game
description: An excellent addition to the My First Play World series from HABA, the ' Animal Merry-Go-Round Motor Skill Game will be both fun and educational for your little one! Each animal has his home. The cheeky friends, however, have a lot of fun with the turning disk and love to change places! Who can return order to the jumble? To do so, little zoo friends need a good touch and some luck at turning the seesaw. Specially designed to foster motor skills and introduce the concept of games with instructions. This set includes fun game ideas to keep little ones entertained for longer. Made in Germany, the board and tiles are sturdy cardboard and the pieces are made of beech wood. The game includes 1 elephant (3.00" tall), 1 lion, 1 zebra, 1 flamingo, 1 monkey, 1 rotatable seesaw, 10 play tiles, 1 game board, set of instructions. Perfect for children ages 2 years and up.

name: Charades Mini Game
description: Cha-rades? Hey, what's that? Charades is a way of describing things without using words and by using only gestures, facial expressions and body movements. The aim of the game is to guess as many of the things acted out during the game as fast as possible. Classic fun for all ages! Includes blank cards so you can act out whatever you like. Portable Version in a tin by HABA!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: New Zealand Holiday
description:
Each player is a tourist visiting beautiful New Zealand. The winner is the first player to stop at all his destinations AND return overseas to the SAME staring place.

The board has a map of New Zealand with real towns and cities are represented as spaces on the board which players move between.

At the start of the game players are randomly dealt destinations cards which they must visit during the course of play.

Movement is done in one of three ways. Rolling the dice, moving one space on the board or, if their pawn is on an N.A.C. Aircentre, by flying to a randomly determined destination on their choice of the North or South island.

If a players lands on another players pawn they may give them one of their already visited destinations and that player must then add that destination to their itinerary to be completed before they can complete the game.

name: Ostfriesen-Pasch
description:
A dice game where each player can roll the dice in a row as long as he can push symbol or number fields upwards. Not operated fields give minus points.

Ostfriesen - reward with Pasch 21 31 or 42. Ostfriesen - risk is to roll three times possibly with doubles 42 minuses. Failing that he gets no minuses but 50 plus points. Failure to achieve the minus points are doubled. Loser is the one who at the agreed end of the game , has the most negative points.

name: Bola
description: Bola has twelve double-sided cards, with each card showing a colored ball on each side. The balls come in eight colors, and each color appears three times. Each turn, one card is flipped to its opposite side, and whoever succeeds in finding three balls of the same color scores a point. Whoever first scores five points wins!

name: Take Out the Trash
description:
In Take Out the Trash, you must decided whether to Trash, Recycle, or Reuse. And, sometimes you find a dead cat or even a dead man. This card game is a fast paced trick taking game where the person who takes out the trash the best wins.

In this trick taking games, players are dealt a hand with which they must bid on the left over cards. The winning bidder declares a trump and the play begins. Players may also attack each other with Do Not Trash cards and the player with the most points on won tricks wins the match.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Snog Marry Shove
description:
The game of impossible choices and hilarious results.

3 famous names; 3 hard choices.

Who to Snog. Who to Marry. Who to Shove.

Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu, Cameron Diaz, Enrique Iglesias, Antonio Banderas, Ricky Martin.

Decisions, decisions!
It's hard enough trying to decide what you'd do, let alone guess what everyone else is thinking!

Let's get a little personal, shall we?
There are hot seat question cards for you to make up your own choices - family, friends, work mates, ex-boyfriends, ex-girlfriends, or, if you're really daring, your fellow players!

Watch out for those Same Sex spaces. There's only ONE agonising decision to make... who to snog?

The winner is the first to get to the finish (and is still talking to their partner!)

—description from the back of the box

name: Jet Fighter
description:
The game of jet fighters air combat in the imaginary battle.

There are 28 different jets (US, USSR, GB, FR, JAP, etc...) each detailed on a separate card with its vital statistics.
It seems quite close to Air War.

This game use simultaneous movement like those used in the SPI games.

Components :

- 8 maps;
- 1 rules manual;
- 2 sheets about missiles;
- 2 sheets of charts and tables;
- 580 counters;
- 1 Simultaneous Movement pad;
- 2 six sided dice

name: State the Picture
description:
Description from the publisher:

State the Picture encourages children (and adults) to learn about the fifty U.S. states through a family-friendly drawing charades game. Players move across the board by correctly guessing the names of states based on their fellow players' corresponding, hand-drawn clues.

name: Polite Murder: Vile Fiends Expansion!
description:
Now you can murder your friends in the skin and guise of famous and foul villains.

Includes:
10 Character Cards.

During game play of Polite Murder, players play action cards from their hand in which they may either do the action on the card or sometimes attempt murder on their fellow players by rolling the die.

The Character cards in this expansion allow the players to either add a +1 to die rolls when they are that character or if a player being attacked has that character, they can discard their card to escape murder.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Voobrazhariy: Stars
description:
Who sang “Love Me Tender”? Who is the author of Faust? What was the name of Frodo’s uncle?
Voobrazhariy: Stars is a new exciting game about guessing celebrities, both real and fictional ones. Each turn a new player must use one minute to describe as many famous personalities as possible by inventing intuitive word associations, recalling historic events or parodying stars. Be creative, resourceful and fast to become the main star of the evening!

Key game features:

New Super game from the series «Voobrazhariy» series – fast-paced word association game!
Now your task is to describe as many famous people and characters as possible.
A cool opportunity to play in two ways: every player for himself or team play.
You can mix Voobrazhariy: Star cards with other versions of the series to get more than 9800 entries!


Russian description:
Какой певец предлагал выпить за любовь? Кто сжёг второй том «Мёртвых душ»? Как звали хозяйку Крыски-Лариски?
«Воображарий: Звёзды» — новая увлекательная игра на загадывание и разгадывание знаменитостей, реально существовавших и вымышленных. Каждый ход выбирается новый ведущий, который должен за одну минуту объяснить другим как можно больше известных личностей, придумывая интуитивные ассоциации, вспоминая исторические события или пародируя звёзд. Будьте креативны, находчивы и расторопны и тогда обязательно станете главной звездой вечера!

Ключевые особенности игры:

Новая супер-игра из серии «Воображарий» - игра в ассоциации на скорость!
Теперь твоя задача угадать как можно больше знаменитых людей и персонажей, существующих или существовавших в реальности, а также вымышленных.
Крутая возможность играть двумя способами: каждый сам за себя или объединиться в команды.
Карты игры «Воображарий.Звезды» можно перемешать с другими версиями серии и получить более 9800 заданий!

name: CardArt
description:
Description from the publisher:

With as few cards as possible, try to portray a concept while everyone else tries to guess what it is. Whoever gets it first by calling it out receives points, as does the player who successfully portrayed it.

In more detail, in CardArt the players can use the cards as they like: laying them flat on the table, keep them in upright position, or any position they think are helpful to get the concept across to the table to the other players. You can even move them on the table and in the air. With the person card Luca, for example, it is easier to portray a racecar driver in his car or a parachuter under a slightly bended card. The only limits are with the imagination of the players...

name: Nimmit
description:
Description from the publisher:

One player turns over all the cards as quickly as he can. At the same time, the other players collect as many complete animals (that consist of three parts each) as they can in the given time.

But since the time pressure is high in Nimmit and the parts of the animals look quite similar, players can easily mess it up.

name: Quiz Chef Vini
description:
This game challenges players with more than 200 trivia questions about wine!
Play the game to get some great advice and achieve the knowledge of a sommelier!

Each question has a "BEEP-ed" word: the players take turns trying to find the missing word.
The first player answering five correct questions wins the game.

Some cards present a different challenge: simultaneous answer, or a greatest prize consisting in stealing a point from another player in addition to the normal prize for the correct answer.

The game presents four different levels of difficulty: at the beginning of the game, the players may choose to play a specific level or a mix of all four.

name: Red Rook Blue Bishop
description:
After countless battles, the King and Queen have grown worried of the strength of their army and thus have issued a decree for their soldiers to train more! Together, a Rook and Bishop practice their combat skills in Red Rook Blue Bishop.

Red Rook Blue Bishop is a micro abstract game that can fit 1 or more players, though 1-4P is recommended as the board is relatively small. The components are minimal, the gameplay is simple, and players may jump in and out at their leisure.

The gameplay takes inspiration from both Ricochet Robots and the movements of a Rook and Bishop in Chess. The goal is to be the first player to reach 3 points, and a point is rewarded every time a player successfully points out a path to the target.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Canada Quest
description:
A traditional style quiz game that features a Canadian theme and optional added elements of risk and wagering.

In the 'basic' game, players earn points by either answering the trivia questions posed by their opponents, or by their own questions being incorrectly answered twice.

In the advanced version, players are allowed to wager on whether opponents will correctly or incorrectly answer the question being asked.

A 3rd 'classroom' variation allows for group play by eliminating all advanced elements and simply posing questions to each team, with incorrect answers allowing the other team to 'steal' the point.

Play continues over as many ~5 minute rounds as players pre-determine, with the player or team with the most points being the victor.

Interestingly, this game was self-published sometime between 1980-1984 (based on question content) and includes no copyright date, publisher, or author information, other than a post-office box in Ottawa. A unique piece of Canadiana.

From the box: A quiz game exclusively for Canadians.
Thousands of Questions. Over 100 Categories.

Encompassing an "all-Canadian" theme, the questions cover a wide variety of topics. From PRIME MINISTERS to LAKES, from HOCKEY to EARLY DAYS, from INVENTIONS to MOVIES, there are 101 topics touching on all aspects of Canadian life. The questions are presented at three levels of difficulty with a corresponding point system. Players will find some questions easy, some "memory-testers", others educational.

Other Features of CANADA QUEST include:
-three variations
-second chance on each question
-time control
-wagering
-classroom use.

For 3-6 players / teams, Ages 12-adult. English.

name: Pot 'O' Gold
description:
Pot 'O' Gold is themed after playing a slot machine, but is a dexterity game where players take turns spinning gold coloured plastic chips onto the game board. On the game board, there are cherries, oranges, plums, bells, and 7's, separated by pots of gold. If the chip lands on a pot, then the chip is added to the "jackpot". If the chip lands on one of the other symbols, players mark off that symbol on their score pad. After marking off any of the symbols for the fifth time, a player wins the current jackpot, and then that symbol will no longer win a jackpot for any player. The game ends when a jackpot is won for each of the five symbols, with the player with the most chips being the winner.

There is a unique game board design in Pot'O'Gold, where the board is actually 5 giant jigsaw pieces. This does not effect game play, is simply an alternative to having a game board that folds for storage.

In the 1990's, Video Lottery Terminals, or VLTs, became legal in the Canadian province of Alberta, and most bars and lounges had them installed. Different games could be played on the VLTs, including a five wheeled slot machine where you won by matching up cherries, oranges, plums, bells and 7s on a line. Pot'O'Gold is themed after the slot machines on those VLTs.
publishers: Genuine Fun Games Corp., Northern Games Co. Ltd.

name: Carbon Copy Politics
description:
A strategy card game about well intended people in bitter competition over exactly how to save the planet from climate change...and how to serve their own special interests while doing so.

Take on the role of a special interest group trying to save the world from a changing climate. However, while all the interest groups want to maximize positive impact, they all have different priorities for how to go about it. Are you advocating clean energy, habitat protection, or island nations that might get flooded? Will you pass laws to create subsidies, institute a carbon tax, or maybe attempt an ambitious geo-engineering project? Every method has its own benefits and drawbacks, and you will need strategic planning and political cunning to lead your organization to success.

Mechanics:
Players attempt to pass bills into law, both to have an impact in general and to further their own special interest's goals. However, all players will need to pursue a mixed strategy to succeed -- your special interest does not dictate your strategy. For example, a player might be rewarded for seeing enough geo-engineer projects succeed, regardless of who plays those cards -- so they might play those cards themselves or negotiate for someone else to play them.

Carbon Copy Politics uses a novel "clock" mechanic to track the progress of activities over time. Players play cards onto the clock, which ticks down each turn. Cards that reach the end of the clock resolve, building variable delays into the play of every card. The delay requires players to plan ahead, allow them to set up combos, and creates opportunities for disruption by opponents. For example, bill cards are typically delayed by 3 turns before they are evaluated, so you might play it one turn, play an action to boost public will-for-change the next turn, play a modifier on it the next turn, and then discard cards as the bill resolves to pay the rest of the cost.

Bill cards are rated by their difficulty (cost) and impact (score). Different types of bills offer different ways to pay the cost. Carbon Tax bills get easier to pass as more taxes are passes, while Cap and Trade bills are easier if several are played at the same time by different players.

name: Ophidian Wars: Hallowed Arenas
description:
Ophidian Wars Hallowed Arenas is a FREE print-to-play Expansion Set for Ophidian Wars Tabletop Game, but this release also features a bonus of two brand new Gladiator cards for Ophidian 2350 CCG/Ophidian 2360 card games. Meaning that above you will find:

9 cards (2 Gladiators + 4 Maneuvers + 3 Arsenal Items), fully compatible with Small Cave Games’ Ophidian Wars and Dark Rooks.
2 cards, fully compatible with Ophidian 2350 CCG and Hack and Slash Games’ Ophidian 2360.

Now you also can get your printed cards, as starting today they are available to buy. And as a bonus, you will get exclusive to the printed version 2 game-counters cards to track your respective "Adrenaline" and "Cheer".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Squish
description:
Squish is a fun, family friendly, dexterity game for 1 to 6 players in which you drop player order cards (also referred to as boot cards) in an attempt to squish bug cards that are on the ground. You try to be the player with 10+ points at the end of a round. The bug cards are thrown into the air at the beginning of the game and fall where they may. After, you are ready to get Squishing! You go in number order according to your player order cards. You drop your player order cards from shoulder height, number side up, in an attempt to completely cover a bug. Bugs range in size and value. The bigger the bug, the more points it is worth. Beware though, because if your player order card lands boot side up someone can cover your number and take one of your squished bugs from you. You squish the bug and your friend steps on your toes and takes it from you. This could turn a win into a loss or a loss into a win. Getting 10 points is easy, keeping them is tough. Some dropping techniques can make it so that your card is boot side down and keeps you safe from anyone's nefarious plans of stepping on your toes.

A variant for younger crowds makes the game a bit easier by the requirement to cover a bug goes from, covering the entire bug, to covering just the head or body.

Squish: The Dexterity Card Game of Bug Squishery is a fun and easy game for kids of all ages and plays in only 30 minutes.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Area 1851: Promo Cards
description:
7 promo cards (from the Kickstarter) offered in Essen 2015 with the main game:

+ 4 feat cards:

- I'm unique
- I've got time
- Just sittin' around
- Loner

+ 3 tinker cards:

- Ancient
- Futuristic
- Modern
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #3: Haunted Oak
description:
The rumors are true! The Crypt King has shown up on the edge of civilization with a legion of undead. On this border, an old Tavern named Haunted Oak has re-lit it's fires. The Elf Champion and his many allies are starting to fill the tavern and getting ready to face this new threat.

In Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #3 , up to four players take turns collecting heroes and sending them out to gain victory points for your tavern. Each player will try to create a powerful combo of heroes to defeat even the toughest locations.

Only one deck is needed for up to four players; extra decks can be used separately by each player or shuffled together for everyone to share. Game Pack #3 can be played separately or with Game Pack #1 and #2. TCG is for 'the card game'
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Mission Silbenrätsel
description: One day, a safe suddenly appears in the castle ruins - but what is the code to open it? Luckily, the four amateur detectives keep on finding cards with pictures on them on their way through the city, which lead them to the code numbers. How is it done? Think of a word that describes the card and break it down into syllables in order to move the figures. Crack the code with a sharp mind and a feel for language!

name: Valgkamp: et spil om Mudder, Magt og Mærkesage
description:
Danish description:
Et spil om Mudder, Magt og Mærkesager

Valgkamp handler om at være den politiker der bedst leder sit parti gennem valgkampen.

Du bruger terninger til at erobre mærkesager, undgå skandaler og ikke mindst sværte de andre politikere til. Og ja, terninger er tilfældige, men det er politik også - selvom du gerne vil køre en velsmurt valgmaskine, kan det sagtens gå galt i sidste ende.

Dagsordener giver point, skandaler trækker ned, men du kan også få point hvis du klarer dit partis hemmelige mål. Den med flest point ender med at vinde og blive statsminister.

Translates to:
Election
A game about mud, power and agendas

Election is all about being the politician who can lead the party best through the campaign.
