You use dice to take possession of agendas, avoid scandals, and to smear other politicians. And yes, dice are random, but so is politics - even if everything is running according to schedule, things can go wrong right at the last minute.

Agendas gives points, scandals deducts points, and you can get bonus points if you acquire your party's secret goal. Whoever gets most points wins the game, and is elected prime minister.

Gameplay:

Each turn the player throws the 6 dice. 1's can never be re-thrown, and are always bad, since three of those will give you a scandal. Three 6's can be used to throw mud at an opponent, which will give them a scandal. Everything in between cen be use to take control of agendas. Agendas require som combination of dice, like three 2's, or two 4's and two 5's, or many other Yatzee like combinations. Agendas give points, and some gives you special abilities. Agendas comes in five different themes, and some political goals is to acquire the most of a certain type, or many different types, or the least scandals or...
categories: Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political, Print & Play

name: Top
description: Each of the 2-4 players control 3 pins carrying replaceable tokens. There are 12 tokens numbered from 1 to 12. The players move their pins on the board horizontally, vertically or diagonally. When 2 pins from 2 different players are located diagonal next to each other their tokens can be exchanged. The game ends when all pins reached their destination. Each player sums up the values of the tokens his pins are holding. The winner is the player which has achieved the highest sum.

name: The Flintstone Kids Game
description:
Yabba Dabba Doo! It's Rock 'n' Rolling Stone Age Fun!

The Flintstone Kids Go To The Bedrock Concert. Includes Board, 4 Die Cut Figures & Stands, 4 Die Cut Skateboards, 2 Deck of 54 Cards (27 Skateboard On & 27 Skateboard Off)

Players move on the board by drawing cards and following the instructions. Players begin with the skateboard off. Players draw from the Skateboard Off cards until they are instructed to put on the skateboard. (Slip the skateboard over the head of the figure to put the skateboard on) Once on the skateboard, they draw from the Skateboard On cards. Winner is the first to reach the Bedrock Concert.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Coban Received
description: A trick-taking card game in which the hand stakes are revealed to only some of the players, and the trump suit is determined as the hand is played out by players bidding to pay out victory points to those who follow suit.
publishers: 篠原遊戯重工 (Shinohara Yugi Juko)

name: Game of Thrones: The Dice Game
description:
Be the first player to claim the Iron Throne at King's Landing by placing the 10 Characters in your house upon your Iron Throne player mat.

Game of Thrones - The Dice Game uses the Pyramid Scheme game system (Copyright 2012 Brandon Freels, Pat. Pending)

name: Spectrobes: Input Cards
description:
Spectrobes Input Cards are hard plastic and are part of a system present in all three Spectrobes games. It used to acquire rare Spectrobes, Custom Parts, Minerals, and weapons.

In Spectrobes, you unlock Card Input from a cube, while in Spectrobes: Beyond the Portals, you unlock it after repairing the escape pod. Player enter the code at the back of the card in the Constellation Card, then links the stars to form the pattern displayed.

Three distinct "sets" were released. Each "set" contained a unique assortment of cards and could only work with the game it was released for/to co-inside with: set 1 with Spectrobes, set 2 with Beyond the Portals, and set 3 with Origins. Each video game came with a random selection of cards from the "set" that worked with that game. If additional cards were wanted you had to buy them direct from Disney (as individual 'packs' in clear wrap). Disney never marketed the cards well or made them available from other retailers. When a new set" was released the previous one was discontinued.

name: Quality Street Monopoly
description:
This is a card game, a variation of the English game Pairs (known as Memo or Memory in Europe) but has unique twists on that type of game. The game was given away in Quality Street boxes of chocolates in 2005.

Object of the game: To finish with property worth more than any other player.

The playing cards are placed at random face down on the table. Each player should also start the game with 7 Quality Street sweets!

Starting with the youngest, the players turn over two cards. If the property on the two cards is identical, the player keeps the cards and turns over two others. When two cards which do not match are revealed, they are turned over face down again, and the player’s turn is over.

Hidden in the playing cards are a number of ‘Community Chest’ and ‘Chance’ cards. If revealed, the player accepts their reward or fine, and if it is the first card turned over, that player still turns over a second card as part of their turn. These cards are removed from the table once revealed.

There is one ‘Go to Jail’ card. If this is revealed that player’s turn is over (even if it is the first card turned), and they must miss their next turn. Unlike the Chance and Community Chest cards, this card stays on the table, so you are wise to remember where it is!

The cards have a value on them (related to real values on a traditional English Monopoly board). So it is not the one with the most cards who wins, it is the one with the highest value of cards that wins.

name: Monster Allegiance
description:
Monster Allegiance is a strategic fast-paced card game which challenges 2-4 players to compete for majority control over a horde of powerful and often unpredictable monsters. Tilt the balance of power in your favor and hold it until the end of the game, and you win! But beware... These are not mindless minions, but proud and dangerous creatures. Defeat an opponent’s monster, and you’ll earn it’s allegiance. But if one falls to your opponent… you’ll lose its respect and it’ll turn against you! As a Monster Commander, you must strategically decide when and where to place each monster, how to capitalize on the elemental strengths and weaknesses of each, and how to turn the tide with powerful item and element cards. Enter the Monster’s arena, but keep your mind sharp…. for if it dulls, your usefulness to the monsters will swiftly end...

-From Kickstarter description

Features:
-Beautiful colorful pixel art monsters.
-Simple but streategic battles- decided by number comparisons on 4 sides.
-Playable with competitive personal decks or a single deck for balanced play
-Unique twist - All monsters brought into play by either player can swap teams.
-Durable card material
-Multiple games to play - new game instructions released regularly.
-Future expansions with guaranteed content - No random boosters required to obtain all cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Memory Yoga
description:
Your Goal: Collect the most pairs of matching Yoga Pose Tiles.

Beginner (Ages 3 and up)
Learn yoga poses as you search for matching pairs. Find the most matching pairs and - YOU WIN!

Advanced (Ages 6 and up)
After you find a matching pair, perform the illustrated yoga pose. Correctly perform the most yoga poses and - YOU WIN!

name: Zombies and Survivors
description:
Rules light skirmish game for 28mm scale zombie survival scenarios, played with miniatures and terrain on the tabletop using 20 sided dice. Suggested game size is 3-5 human survivors verses 36-150 zombies!

From the rulebook introduction:

ZOMBIES & SURVIVORS is the free downloadable fast play ‘fun’ Zombie game from Grekwood Miniatures. This game guide has all the information required to start playing the zombie apocalypse.

name: Brighten The Life
description:
User summary:
ブライトゥンザライフ (Brighten the Life)

DNA damage pouring on the earth. The survival of the fittest. Fierce and merciless battles between living creatures. How will you survive? By breeding, preying upon others, or evolution?

Whether by breeding or preying upon others, living creatures manage to thrive by making the most of their abilities. Furthermore, in the long history of evolution, they've managed to evolve by overcoming the DNA mutation in the ever-changing global environment. We've made a game with a theme of such life.

The future changes every moment according to the surrounding environment. Living creatures must simply choose the best move.

Brighten the Life is the game to make all living creatures shine most brilliantly.

Publisher's summary:
地球に降り注ぐDNA ダメージ。弱肉強食。生き残りを賭けた生き物同士の無慈悲で壮絶な争い。生き残る術は増殖か、捕食か、進化か。
生き物は増殖が得意なもの、捕食が得意なもの、それぞれ自分の持つ能力を最大限に生かすことで繁栄を勝ち得ている。また、長い進化の歴史の中で、生き物は地球環境によるDNA 変異を受けながらも、それを克服することで進化してきた。そんな地球上の生き物の営みをゲームにした。
未来はとりまく環境によって刻々と変化する。いま生き物ができることは、いま最良の行動を選択するのみ。
生き物を最高に輝かせるゲーム「Brighten The Life」
publishers: ワイビーワイゲームズ　(YbY Games)

name: Spacemen Come!
description:
User summary:
スペースメンカム! (Spacemen Come!)

To protect the Earth from the attack of the irrational aliens from outer space, it's vital to detect your own talent and make it bloom!

When you manage to unlock your innate talent and master your way, you'll rock the universe.

Publisher's summary:
常識が通用しない宇宙人の襲撃から地球を守る。頼れるのは自らの才能を見抜くこと、そしてその才能を開花させろ！
才能が開花し、その道を極めたとき、宇宙は震撼する。
publishers: ワイビーワイゲームズ　(YbY Games)

name: Animal Match Puzzle Cards
description: Animal Match Puzzle Cards is a matching game designed to teach reading skill to young children. It consists of a series of cards depicting animals and matching puzzle pieces showing the written names of the animals. The picture cards are placed face-up on the table. The name pieces are stacked face-down. Players take turns choosing a name piece. They must then read the word and correctly match it to its animal picture card. If the puzzle piece fits the card, the player is correct and keeps the pair. If not, the name piece is placed back on the bottom of the pile and the animal card is returned to its place. Play continues until all pairs are claimed, and the player with the most pairs wins.

name: Kerekítő kukucska
description:
This is a very simple, child memory game, which is based on Hungarian nursery rhymes. There are different figures of nursery rhymes on the game tokens.

Contents:

36 tokens
5 big tokens
1 die

In the setup you get 5 tokens and place them on the game field, and then you cover them with 5 big tokens.

If it's your turn you need to roll the die. Then you need to guess which token is under the big token that has the same color as your roll. If you can guess it, you get the token, if you make a mistake you don't get anything.

The game ends when all tokens are given out.

The player with the most tokens is the winner of the game.

name: King's Castle
description:
EQUIPMENT: one 8-sided die; 4 playing pieces of four different colors; and the board, consisting of an oval, three-lane track with a separate, ten-space track in the center. What follows is my reconstruction of the rules.

SET UP: players group their pieces on the 'start' space of the central track. Turns are in alphabetical order of the colors.

GOAL: to get to the opposite side of the central track, the 'finish' space, a mere nine spaces away. An exact throw is not needed.

MOVEMENT: players take turns rolling the d8, moving that many spaces counter-clockwise. Several spaces are connected by arrows-if you land on the end of one, go to its head; if on its head, go to the tail. If you land on another player, that person goes back to 'start.' Landing on the fifth space of the central track also sends one back to 'start.'

name: Escape from Alcatraz
description:
In Escape from Alcatraz four inmates are working together to try and escape from Alcatraz prison and eventually the island. The inmates only have 60 days to accomplish this goal before they are transferred to another prison. To win the game at least three inmates must successfully escape the prison and get off the island without getting caught.

Each day is broken into two phases: morning and afternoon. Inmates will either spend the entire day at a specific location or can visit two separate locations; one in the morning and another in the afternoon. Players control the actions of each of the four inmates during the two phases of the day and determine what actions they will take.

Escape from Alcatraz is 1-4 player Co-op worker placement game where all the players work together to break out of the prison and escape the island. If any one of the players gets caught the game is over. At least three players must escape the prison and island to win the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Hide and Seek Audio: The Friendly Farm
description:
The new Hide and Seek Audio excites the senses for a stimulating game of discovery.

Two ways to play:
Conventional game: The game comes with several boards, each depicting a scene scattered with various different objects. The objects are hidden within the images so that they mingle with the background, making them hard to spot. One of the boards is chosen for the game.

On each turn, a card is turned face up and players try to spot the object as fast as possible. The first one to do so wins the card. The winner is the player who accumulates the most cards.

With the DVD: Be the first (or play as a group) to find the animals and other things that correspond to the 30 sounds on the DVD.

name: ABAE Football
description:
Game published in Brazil in the 70's (probably 1970) by ABAE - Associação Brasileira de Alimentação Escolar (Brazilian Association for Nutrition in School) in order to collect funds for its activities.
It's a football game in which the ball is moved according to the result of a die roll. According to the rules, the match's duration is 10 minutes divided in two 5-minute halves.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Daktari on safari
description:
An old Greek game, probably having as a theme the famous American TV Series Dactari. Your goal is to catch the most wild animals in the jungle.

There is a price list for every animal you catch.
The game involve dice roll to move.

You move through the different tracks on the game board and you catch the animals when you bring the exact number on the dice roll , that will allow you to land on the same spot where the animals are.

But be careful, you may land on a Daktaris spot and then you lose all your animals .

name: The Rocket Race
description:
Four rockets have a race around the planets, but you have to watch your power in order to get as far as possible. But watch out! As soon as the rockets ar in a certain order you hvae to fire the turbo charger. Who will be the first to reach the end of the universe?

The game is a roll and move game where players roll a custom made dice to move their rocket to try and collect comet rocks from various planets. The winner is the person who ends the game with the most comet rocks.

name: Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure
description:
Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure is the ultimate dungeon crawl! It combines true elements of D&D table top roleplaying using ver3.5 Dungeons and Dragons rules with a versatility of a card game dungeon crawl. If you’ve ever played the original computer version of Dungeon Hack and loved the endless possibilities, then this is the game for you. It allows for solo or CO-OP play within a randomly generated multi-level dungeon. Just like in the computer game, you explore a never ending dungeon with monsters, treasure, traps, and glory! It’s you against the dungeon and everyone is out to get you! Dungeon Hack uses actual monsters, traps, treasures and equipment directly from the Dungeon and Dragons universe. Story lines and game play is taken from actual D&D modules! If you’ve wanted to play D&D but couldn’t find the group, well look no further… Dungeon Hack is here! You create actual characters with abilities that you will use during your adventure. All the while you earn experience and fortunes to help level up and grow your character to much stronger and higher levels.

Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure is a solo D&D game on a micro level using 4”x4” tile cards representing dungeon rooms, corridor rooms, corridors and junctions while colored cubes represent your characters and the ever increasing monsters. A multitude of cards depict and define the monsters, treasures, encounters, and obstacles you will face within the dungeon.

Most D&D rules apply, with many of the mundane and complicated rules left out to create a smoother and more stream lined game play.

The goal is to descend each level facing new encounters that will bring you face to face with puzzles, doors, traps, monsters and treasures at every turn. Before every two levels you will have a QUEST card that depicts special requests for the town asking for specific items you can find during your adventures through the levels of the dungeon. If you find or collect all of the items on the QUEST card you receive the stated reward from the town.

Each level of the dungeon you descend will end up providing your character with a level of experience; if you survive to the lowest level of the dungeon, you will have reached the level of hero to be able to challenge the Big Boss!

As you descend deeper into the dungeon you will encounter stronger and more dangerous monsters. When you reach the lowest level you will finally come face to face with the Big Boss of the dungeon which could be a dragon, a demon, etc… basically the challenge of your life!

Survive the dungeon, make it out alive, and you will become the dungeon master! You’re victory score will be based on the level you reach “experience points”, the gold pieces you’ve earned “total gp”, the treasure you’ve accumulated “gp value”, and the monsters you’ve killed “total monsters destroyed”!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: The Band is Even Better
description:
Are you ready to form the best band of the Rock'n'Roll history?

A simple and tactical game settled in the rock music world.

Each player has a secret leader card corresponding to a leader card in the centre of the table. Goal of the game is to obtain the highest fan appreciation (score) with a Band assembled aroud your own leader.

Gameplay uses a variant of draft mechanic. On your turn you keep one card for yourself, play one card to the center on the table and pass the rest. After this draft there is a round of card play (those which you kept earlier). At the end there is a scoring depending on cards played under each leader.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Music

name: Monopoly: Sanrio Game Master Edition
description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to Sanrio Game Master Monopoly. Step into the classic gaming world with this limited edition of Monopoly, as you search for the Ultimate Game Master, Hello Kitty. Along the way, player will have to visit the 7 Game Masters to collect as many Game Zones, toy houses and toy villas as they can. They will be surprised that their fates will be twisted as they roll the dice. The one who has the greatest number of Game Zones, toy houses and toy villas will be honored by the Ultimate Game Master, Hello Kitty, to become one of the Game Masters in this board game. Come take the challenge and win the throne of Game Master.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Shootout
description:
A fun and simple Western themed dice tabletop game, meant for 2 players ages 8 and up, that can be played anytime and anywhere.

Each player starts out with one bullet (red or blue dice) in their chamber. Each dice has a barrel, bullet, BANG. Each roll scores. For instance if Red rolls a barrel and blue rolls a bullet, blue scores as red is "hiding" in the barrel. If both roll bullets, each get a point. Each six rolls equals one round. Winner is the player who wins the most rounds. If both roll BANG, both miss each other and no one scores.

Quick, easy, filler game.

name: Waurie
description: Waurie is a Traditional Games: Mancala game played on the Cayman Islands where it is traditionally played with nickernuts. It is also known as Island Wari. Unusually for a Mancala game the aim of the game is to empty your side of the board rather than win the most seeds. It is played on a board with 2 rows of 6 holes and a storehouse at each end, starting with 4 seeds in each hole. Turns must start on your side of the board, there is no capturing, but seeds are sown in a player's own store. Sowing the last seed in the player's store gives that player another turn. Waurie can easily be played with a Kalah set.

name: Plentiful Food Bounty
description:
In The Democratic Republic of Korea (North Korea), food is plentiful. Bluff your way through this game of taking food supplied by the Supreme Leader, but don't be greedy.

Contents:
2 Bags for sorting your plentiful bounty of food.
30 Food Tokens (Rice, Wheat, Fish, Chicken, Bread, and Vegetables)

The first player secretly takes any number of tokens from one bag and places them in the second bag. He then offers the two bags to any second player of his choice.

This player has three choices:
A) Pick one bag as his own. Then, both players count the number of tokens in their bags. The player with the most tokens (food) in their bag should be ashamed for taking more than they need and the player with the least tokens chooses a token from their bag to give to the shamed player.

If the number of tokens in each bag is equal, all the tokens must be placed in one bag and one token is drawn at random and eliminated from the game. After this is resolved, the bags should be given to another player by the second player.

B) Take both bags, move tokens, and then offer the bags to another player.

C) Take both bags, draw one random token from one bag, and pass the bags to another player.

Play repeats until three types of tokens (food) are depleted or one player accumulates 15 points.

name: Greece (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:some give you the option to climb a mountain:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks but you might pick up an option in the chance cards.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Tasty Battles
description:
The village of Piquant was a very happy place. They had five bountiful farmlands that each produced a different type of food. All of the people had lots of delicious food to eat. But the evil wizard Captious grew jealous and cursed each of the five farmlands. The food grew to a monstrous size and began to attack the village. The people had only a limited supply of cannonballs to defend themselves against the humongous food! Thankfully a giant from the land of Epicure volunteered to guard the village and eat any food that got too close to the village - even though it was food that giants didn't normally eat. The wizard's magic is limited so your challenge is to defend your village until it runs out.

This is a co-op game designed to be played together by a parent and one child. The game contains a single-sheet board, tokens, and a small deck of cards. Players will also need to provide one 6-sided die and about 10 small candies or snacks that the child likes to eat such as M&Ms, Fruit Snacks, or Fish Crackers. The parent should also choose five foods that they would like the child to try eating. I recommend choosing one food from each of the five food groups but any combination of foods will work.

Each section of the board contains a track leading towards the village and is marked by an icon of one of the five food groups. Before the game, assign one of the five foods to each track (markers are provided to help you remember which food is on which track). Each turn, players will draw a card from the deck that will indicate what tracks are attacking the village that turn. Move that marker one space down the track.

The village can defend itself by rolling a die and trying to get a higher number than the advancing token. At any time, the player may use one of their "cannonballs" (candies) to automatically win a battle. If they use a cannonball it is lost forever (the parent gets to eat it).

The giant marker can move along the red line between the "1" spaces. If a giant and a food monster are ever in the same space, the giant may immediately remove that piece by eating it. The child must taste the associated food for this action. The child can push back the food monsters by tasting the associated food.

If any food monster is ever able to enter the village it squishes all the villagers, the game is lost, and the cannonballs are lost (the parent gets to eat them). If the child is able to defend the village until the draw deck is empty, he or she gets to eat all the remaining candy cannonballs as a reward.

This game is inspired by Israeli Independence by Darin A. Leviloff.

This game won 3rd place for Best Co-operative game in the 2015 Children's Game Print and Play Design Contest.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Viaje Retro
description: Viaje Retro is a themed trivia game about entertainment culture of the second half of the 20th century in Argentina and the World. It features different categories like 'Cinema and TV', 'Music' and 'Various'. It also involves whistling, acting or drawing.

1% is a deckbuilding game where not only are you building your deck collecting point and/or useful card while also trying to take over sites that give you powerful abilities. Collecting three of these sites instantly wins the game so players must be aware, battle opponent's crew, and interact more than your usual deckbuilder.
A drafting mechanic while setting up allows you to customize your gang members prior to play so you feel like you have actually customized your crew from actual strategy and choice.

name: Scooby-Doo: Łowcy Duchów gra przygodowa
description:
The players must find the ghosts in the forest, by catching them in headlights of their cars.

The game is played on a five by five grid of tiles. Players taking turns moving their car on the grid, turning their headlights on after each move. This allows them to flip over the tiles in a straight line in front of the car - until they reach a ghost, or the end of the board.

The player that finds the most ghosts wins the game.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Hexlinx
description:
From the publisher:

Hexlinx is an intriguing game of geometric strategy in which players start each turn with 6 tiles, then score points by trading, switching, and connecting them to build a honeycomb grid of interlocked rings. Each ring must include 6 different color tiles. When all the tiles have been drawn and no player can form any more rings, the game is over. Highest score wins.
Uniquely simple yet challenging, this exciting game of logic requires strategic planning (and a little luck) to win. For a variety of gameplay, some optional Rules can be used -- and because there are 2 methods of scoring points (standard and advanced), Hexlinx is FUN for children and adults of all skill levels !

name: DragonHeist
description:
In DragonHeist, 2 to 4 players are gold thieves, taking it in turns to plunder the sleeping dragon's hoard, pushing their luck to grab the most treasure, whilst trying not to wake the dragon!
Once all the coins from the hoard have been stolen, the player with the most treasure wins!

TREASURES!
Players roll 6 'Plunder Dice' to see what treasures they can collect - coins, keys, chests, or magic rings. If they finish their turn with any of these treasures they can claim them from the dragon's hoard. There are 3 magic rings to find that can protect players from dragonfire, silence their noise, or make them invisible!

THE DRAGON FIGHTS BACK!
Some dice rolled affect treasures – the dragon can snatch them back, or they can be made too hot to hold by dragonfire. The dragon's tail or wing send coins flying around his lair, whilst rolling a dragon's eye means the dragon is starting to wake up, so best not roll any noise!

DEFEATING THE DRAGON!
If a player manages to collect all 3 magic rings, and they are brave enough, they can try to defeat the dragon! With all 3 magic rings, they cannot be seen or heard, and are protected from dragonfire! The 'Dragon Die' is rolled to see whether the player can defeat the dragon before all their gold is stolen back

name: BrainBox: Kaatje
description: Brainbox: Kaatje is a version of Brainbox specifically made for the Belgian/Dutch market. Kaatje is a popular television figure for small children. As with all Brainbox games the players are shown a card with a drawning and have to memorize all aspects as later they will be asked a specific question about it.

name: Union
description:
In each opening round of the trick-taking card game Union, players take turns using their voting tokens that are randomly drawn from a bag for starting player, trump, super trump, number of cards discarded, and the value of tricks taken. Once the starting player is determined, that player chooses a partner, then the teams play out the round based on the rules they collectively chose.

In this unique three suited trick taking game, players also have the option of playing -5 point cards out of sequence that will outcome the trick.

Contents:
5 Player Tokens
1 Bag
32 Rule Tokens
5 Starting Rule Tiles
48 Cards in Three Suits (Yellow, Black, and White)
10 Cards that are -5 Points per trick (Red)
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Ockham's Razor Games

name: Star Duel
description:
It is a period of war. The intergalactic empires of Enate and Kurth have grown desperate as scare resources have forced them to aggressively expand across the universe. They use planetary nodes as instruments of war, consuming entire star systems in the blink of an eye. Now the two empires compete for the final goal: Complete domination of the universe.

In Star Duel, you control strategic galactic nodes to gain Energy, Minerals, Population, and Influence, then use those resources to crush your opponent.

GAME OVERVIEW
In Star Duel, players take turns activating, exhausting, and moving their nodes while also attacking the nodes of their opponent. The player who best manages his network of nodes will emerge victorious.

TURN OVERVIEW
At the beginning of each turn, the players choose two of their Node Programming cards, orient them to match their coordinates for a node, and reveal the cards to the other player. The player that programmed the lower number goes first. After the first player completes his actions for the turn, the second player performs his actions and then a new turn begins.

On a player's turn, the player may perform each of the following actions one time and in any order:

Execute Program [target a node, replace a node, or produce energy]
Exhaust node;
Move node.

WINNING THE GAME
A player wins immediately if his opponent is ever reduced to 0 influence or 0 population. Additionally, a player wins if he controls all available nodes at the end of a round.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Kensington-Opoly
description: Build your fortune as you buy, sell and trade properties from the Kensington neighborhood in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Don't worry it's classic Monopoly fun! Take a ride on Huntingdon El Stop, buy a neighborhood store, or buy up All of the stores — it’s your turn to get rich! You’ll take a spin around the board. Roll your dice and move your favorite game piece. Prove your skills as a deal maker. Pass YOUSE, collect $250.00, take a Destiny card or head over to Fate space as you wheel and deal your way to the top. But remember to stay out of The Sweat Box! Bring back those old neighborhood memories.

name: Port Richmondopoly
description: Build your fortune as you buy, sell and trade the properties. It’s like classic Monopoly fun!

name: Slash: There's a Fan Fic for That...
description:
Slash: There's a Fan Fic for That... is an alternate set of rules that provides a new way to use the character cards in Slash: Romance without boundaries or one of the Slash spinoff sets.

Each player selects a character card, then takes a role in a scenario set in a location such as a coffee shop, the old west, or high school. The player must act out scenes from a typical fan fiction while being both the character (e.g., Orphan Black, Commander Shepherd, Veronica Mars) and the role (sheriff, jock, cheerleader).

name: Vagadas
description:
Vagadas is a mancala inspired game of wandering. After setup of the 18 modular land tiles and placement of goods on each tile, players take turns moving the tokens around the board to gain points based on the tokens they are moving and where those tokens end the turn.

Contents:
81 tokens (9 each of cargo, fish, food, gold, love, people, stone, water, and wood.)
1 bag
18 Land Tiles
5 Player tokens

Setup:
Shuffle the 18 land tiles and make a 6 x 3 pattern (You may vary this modular board as long as there are at least 2 rows of tiles). Draw 4 random tokens from the bag and place on each tile, following the rules of each if needed.

Game Play:
Players will take turns going North/South or East/West depending on which side of their player token is face up. Players will take all the tokens on a tile, and moving in the desired direction, place one token on each tile until all the tokens in hand are exhausted. After all tokens are placed, scoring will happen depending on which tile the player ended placing tokens. Play repeats until there are no legal moves and the player with the highest score wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Fantasy, Math, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Tactical Ball
description: Players take turns removing marbles of the same colour from the board. You can take as many marbles of a single colour as you wish but all marbles need to be accessible, meaning they are free and not blocked by other marbles. The player with the most marbles at the end wins.

name: Balancing Cat
description:
1 Cat
18 Balls of thread
4 reels of thread
1 coloured dice

The object of the game is to place the brightly-coloured balls or blocks on the cat without the animal tipping over or one of the balls falling off.
Rolling the dice determines the colour ball which is to be placed on the cat. Each player takes turns throwing the dice, moving in a clockwise direction.
A player that causes a ball to fall during their turn is out of the game. The winner is the player who places the last ball of thread on top of the pile without causing anything to dislodge and fall or who is the last player to remain in the game.

name: Balancing Ark
description:
1 Ark
12 animals (in 6 pairs)
1 dice with symbols

The object of the game is to place the animals on the Ark without the boat tipping over or one of the animals falling off.
A dice with symbols is rolled to determine which animal should be placed on the Ark.
If a player causes pieces to fall off the boat, then the player is out of the match.
The winner is the player who puts the last piece on the Ark without knocking it over

name: The Millionaires' Club
description:
A Game of Capital Gains!

Invest in the Stock Market!
Buy and Sell Real Estate!
Beware!
Money Loves Nobody!
Wallets Grow while Pockets Empty!

The Millionaires' Club is a game for 2-5 Players taking about an hours worth of time to play.

Games are played in Rounds, with Players taking Turns within each Round. A Round starts with every Player collecting a crisp One Million Dollar Bill.

Players then take turns engaging in intriguing business decisions; Competing over ownership of the largest share in various companies, as well as, Buying and Selling Real Estate Properties.

The Millionaires' Club will make you feel like a wealthy entrepreneur in no time!

After every Round, the Starting Player rolls Two 'Market Dice', One Red; One Blue. The Red affects the Stock Market: A Low Roll can Crash a Company, while a High Roll Skyrockets Stock Values. The Blue manipulates the Real Estate Property Market: A High Roll Creates a Bubble of economic prosperity, gaining Players a bonus Cash Pay Out! from the Bank. Reversely, a Low Roll will Burst the Bubble; Forecloseing Properties, costing Players their hard earned money.

Afterwards, the Starting Player shifts Clockwise to the next Player, Starting a new Round.

The Game continues, Round after Round, with Players Conducting Business and Rolling the Dice. The Player with the highest valued Estate at the End of the Game Wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Stock Holding

name: The Divine Wind: A Dexterity Battle of Martial Farts
description: 'The Divine Wind' is a light-weight dexterity game where you play as Samurai, taking to the field of battle to engage in the ancient tradition of He-Gassen, or “fart battling.” You will ride your horse around the battlefield, positioning your posterior to blow away your opponents with your superior flatulence. Using bean buns to increase your strength, sake to increase your duration, and special cards to tip the battle in your favor, you will fight to be the last Samurai standing. Every card that is not used becomes a shield to protect from your opponents. With positioning and a good ole flick of the wrist, you will corner your opponents, pierce their defenses, and blow them down with a divine wind.

name: Rembi
description:
A memory card game by Altenburger und Stralsunder Spielkartenfabrik.

The goal of the game is to get the most points, by remembering where the four identical cards are located.
On a player's turn, he/she turns around four cards. If any of those are identical, he takes those cards. All other cards are turned around again. The turn passes to the next player, and the game progresses.

When there are no more possible sets, each player score their cards:
2 identical cards give 1 point.
3 identical cards give 3 points.
4 identical cards give 4 points.

name: Trafalgar
description:
Throw two dice and you can move your pawns, insert new pawns on the board or move the wheel of waves. If you can reach the six orange fields of your opponent, you have win the game.

You play on the board inside the box. You can move a wheel under the board with holes. If you turn the wheel, holes can be open and your or your opponents brave sailors lost their life in the sea.

name: Gespensterturm Schnupperspiel
description: Gespensterturm Schnupperspiel is a small, promotional copy of The Haunted Clock Tower (Gespensterturm) containing the Clock Tower (with real movable hands) and 15 ghost cards (3 each in 5 colors).

name: Identidad
description:
The board shows the 20 characters in the game. At the start of the game a character card is delivered to each player. The player assumes the character assigned. Question cards are shuffled and delivered to the different players. On each turn, each player uses a question card to find out the character of the opponents. The questions are printed in the cards and must be answered with a yes or no. The players always answer telling the truth, except four special characters (the wizard and the star always lie, the unmarried always says no to all questions, and the president will answer whatever he like).

Once a player consider he knows the identity of all the rest of the players, he identifies them. Each player then put into the answer box if the identification is correct. If the player matches all characters, win the match, if not, the game continues until someone guesses all the characters.

name: Little People Dominos
description:
Dominos with two levels of play, featuring Sonia to help.
Theme is based around animals and vets making them better.

Each player gets 4 dominos to start, the rest are placed in stock. One tile is used from the stock to start the game. Players take it in turns to match the animals building a chain from either end. Once a player has placed all their tiles. Sonia is placed on the last tile and no more tiles are laid.

A Heart token is now placed on any animal with a bandage. Players now roll the die and any heart token they pass over or land on they pick up.

Once all the hearts have been picked up the player with the most wins!

The second level is played using the paw print side (players have to count the number of paws to make a match).
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Little Critter's Just a Mess
description: Be the first to clean up Little Critter's room! Spin the spinner and move around the track in either direction. Land on a toy space, find the matching token in the center of the board, and put it in your toy box. Be the first to put away 6 toys and you win! But beware of the cobwebs and dust bunnies. You can't win if they're in your toy box!

name: The Chief of Police
description:
From the back of the box:

The game "The Chief of Police" has been created by a serving police officer. By playing this game in a family environment everyone will gain a valuable insight into the rights and wrongs of behaviour in everyday life.

Whilst playing you become aware of Crime Prevention, Traffic Laws and Road Safety. You experience the problems faced by Police Officers and the decisions which have to be made by them when on duty.

After starting patrol from the police Station each "Police Officer" will endeavour to be the first to win 10 Commendations and become "The Chief of Police."

It's fun - it's educational -it's a challenge for the whole family.

Can you become "The Chief of Police"

name: FidoMaxi
description: Both players control a "snake", using two rotating disks to guide it. Using the snake, they have to catch metal marbles inside a labyrinth, and carry them back to their base. The player who catches the most marbles wins the game.

name: KiBosh!31
description: KiBosh! is a classic 3-Card game with Explosive Action! Kibosh31 is a new card game based on a classic 3-card game of 31, also known as Scat or Ride The Bus. The object of the game is to build your 3-card hand to a total of 31, or as close as you can, before your opponents do by drawing and discarding from the deck or discard pile. KiBosh! includes Skip and Reverse cards similar to UNO, and a unique KiBosh card, that when played, forces the next player to dicard their entire hand and draw three new cards. Players are eliminated after losing all their chips in round play and the last player wins the pot.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: 1879: Minis Corebook
description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to 1879! The British Empire, passing through an interdimensional portal, has found a new world, the Gruv, chock-full of resources and land to be exploited. In the process, though, they've run headlong into the Samsut, descendants of ancient Babylonians who've been living there for over three thousand years. Now the might of the Empire clashes with the weird science of the Samsut. The Saurids, a reptilian race native to the new world, contest with both empires to retain their ancestral lands. Who will control the Gruv? That's up to your battles to decide! This miniatures game focuses on the military aspects of the period providing the Universal 18 ruleset and basic information about the British and Samsut forces, and a series of Forcebooks detailing the various military forces on Earth and on the Gruv.
categories: Book, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Dinosaur Wars
description:
Fight the elements and each other in a race to become the greatest Bone Hunter in the Badlands!

Based on Dinosaur Fossil hunting in the late 1800's, Dinosaur Wars is a board game for 2 - 4 players with a playing time of around 2 hours.

Object: You are a seasoned bone-hunter on assignment to a renowned museum.

Your mission is to field expeditions into the Badlands to plunder the Dinosaur Digsites there. Landing on a Digsite enables you to pick up or “excavate” Bones Cards.

To maximize your haul of Bones Cards you will need equipment and the services of a sometimes disreputable crew. The more crew and equipment you have the greater your haul of bones cards. The race is then on to get your precious cargo back to your museum where complete sets of bones cards have a points and money value. Money enables you to fund your expeditions and points are recorded on the pad provided. The game continues until there are no more bones cards left to “excavate”. The winner is the player with the most points.

But beware! The attentions of Bone Rustlers and Claim Jumpers, the pitfalls of Calamity Cards and shady dealings at the Bones Bazaar may leave your collection in tatters, trust no-one and have no regard for the ethics of bone digging!
categories: Adventure, Animals, Bluffing, Educational, Exploration, Prehistoric
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: SARA
description:
User summary:

After dinner at a local restaurant, you and your friends find that no one has their wallet. The manager is none too happy about it, and proposes a small competition. The first one to wash enough dishes gets to walk away, while everyone else will be turned over to the police.

On their turn, players must decide whether to 'carry' or 'wash' dishes. If 'carry' is chosen, up to two cards are played face down to the table. 'Wash' simply allow you to add cards to your hand at the end of a round.

After all players have taken a turn, 'carry' cards that have been played are simultaneously revealed. These are then checked against the carry rules and resolved. Finally, player's who chose to 'wash' draw 2 cards.

This continues round after round until a player successfully washes 10 dishes.
publishers: Install Games (インストールゲームズ)

name: Tatort: Das Spiel
description:
Trivia game about the German Tv-Series "Tatort"

Crime Scene - The game is for everyone who can't get enough Crime Scene. But don't be afraid of gaps in your knowledge! With a little luck, even crime scene laypeople can beat the crime scene experts. How it works? Sometimes the players have to answer multiple-choice questions, sometimes they have to guess or answer a question with yes or no. And if you fall behind, bonus cards will help you to get back to the front. It never gets boring here: because everyone is playing at the same time! Would you like a little crime scene?

Includes 336 questions in 6 categories: Classics, Faktencheck, Kuriositäten, Modern Times, Städte, Backstage.

name: Turtles Power Cards: Donatello
description:
Pick a power on your card and compare it with the values on the other players´cards. The players win or lose cards on each round, and the last player with cards left wins the game.
This Deck is specifically dedicated to Donatello even if all the Ninja Turtles Characters are present
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: WWF "Attitude in Review" Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Take your knowledge to the mat with this fascinating trivia game about wrestling! Young people can play with the old "pros"... Everybody wins! - But there is only one champion!

800 World Wrestling Federation Trivia Questions. Go for that World Wrestling Federation Championship belt... Flaunt your knowledge... Display your acting talents... Pin you Opponents! Create your own "Dream Team".

At the end of the tournament - Claim the "Prize" (The best spot in front of the TV?) - Until the next match.

name: Monopoly: Kraków
description:
Version of Monopoly - Kraków Edition.

The game uses all of the rules and values (prices, tax), money and pawns from the standard Monopoly game.

Changes:
- Names of places to buy (properties, utilities) were changes to the know places in Kraków
- Board is lustrated with photos from the city
- Community chest & chance cards have city related flavor texts

Extra:
- The game contains one Top Trumps card - Wawel Royal Castle
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Hishigata Shogi
description:
Hishigata Shogi (Diamond Shaped Shogi) is a large board shogi variant played on a 19x19 board like Maka Dai-Dai Shogi. Each player has 31 pieces of 22 different types placed in a diamond shaped starting configuration. The pieces are a subset of the Maka Dai-Dai set (96 pieces of 50 different types), and move and promote in the same way as in Maka Dai-Dai Shogi. By using no pawns and predominantly the more powerful pieces from Maka Dai-Dai Shogi in a much more confronting starting position (only one rank separates the two players) Hishigata Shogi is a much faster and more dynamic game than Maka Dai-Dai Shogi while preserving the flavor of the old large board shogi variant.

The game was published at the chessvariants.com homepage in 2005.
Se also description of Hishigata Shogi at Wikipedia as part of the Maka Dai-Dai Shogi article.

name: Wiekslag
description:
Wiekslag is a abstract tactical game for two till five players. The goal is to place three pawns in a straight row, a so called wiekslag. If a player makes a wiekslag, he may remove one pawn from his opponent. If played with three or more players there are two variants: making a wiekslag (1) you may remove one pawn from one opponent or (2) you may remove one pawn from all other players. The ultimate goal is to stay as the last player on the board.

The players start turnbased placing pawns on the board. After all pawns are placed, the players may move one pawn to an adjacent spot on their turn. When someone creates a wiekslag he removes one (or more) pawns permanently from the game. It's not allowed to remove pawns from an existing wiekslag.

When a player has only three pawns left, he is allowed to jump with his pawns to any free spot on the board. When a player with three pawns left, loses another pawn, he or she is elliminated from the game. The game ends when there is only one player left on the board.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: Dead Ends
description:
Go here to see the Official Kickstarter Published game: The Abandons.
https://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/249047/abandons

Dead Ends is a solitaire card game where the player shuffles the cards, then places the Entrance card on the top of the deck, and the Exit card on the bottom.

The cards consist of Path Cards - hallways, intersections, and dead ends - Item Cards - which can be used at certain spots in the game - and Choice Cards - where the player needs to make a decision regarding their path.

The goal is to reach the end of the deck without getting lost. The player loses the game by getting "lost", meaning that they have no possible exits from the most recent intersection on their map.

name: Living
description:
Across eight turns, you will live out your life in a city somewhere in the world.

Each turn represents a phase in one’s life:

1. Starting Out
2. Meeting that special someone
3. Settling down with that special someone
4. Kids arrive (by birth, adoption or otherwise)
5. Kids grow up to be teenagers
6. Kids leave home, the nest is empty
7. Getting old
8. Approaching this life’s end

The game is played on a five by five tile 'city' - with 13 fixed tiles (representing CBD, four inner suburbs, four outer suburbs and four corner 'holiday home' locations) and 12 Modifiable (Mod) tiles which represent different landmarks (for example restaurant, art gallery, rubbish dump etc).

Each Mod tile has a scoring value each turn, which can change depending on the turn (phase of life) you are in. For example living near a retirement home scores well in later rounds.

You start the game with a house in an inner suburb. Players draft a hand of 'mod' tiles which allow them to modify the landmarks on the board (for example turn a park into a 'fancy' park, which scores more highly) - they also receive one temporary closure tile (means a tile is not scored for the current round) and one demolition tile (which permanently removes a Mod tile and replaces it with one from the side of the board).

Your objective is to optimise where you live in relation to your particular stage in life, and this is scored at the end of each turn.

Each turn you either:
1. Move house
2. Buy a holiday home (allowing you to place a second home on a corner of the board and then score the adjacent tiles each turn) - you may only perform this action once per game, or
3. Modify a Mod tile

You cannot pass in Living.

Each turn you then score the tiles orthogonally adjacent to your home and your holiday home (if you have one).

At the end of the eighth turn, the highest score wins the game!

name: Eastern Blades
description:
Overview
Eastern Blades is the samurai card dueling game we have all been waiting for. Players will adopt one style of the characters dealt to them at the beginning of the game. Then all players will battle for supremacy using their character to defeat all comers. Game play is designed to depict extremely faced paced sword duels on the battlefield. 2-5 players will take part using only the core game. Games last 10 to 15 minutes. Expansions are planned to begin in early 2017.

Game Play
After selecting their character players get ready for the coming onslaught by selecting stances, choosing an attack or item and finalizing their plan of attack. However, we all know that on the battlefield even the best laid plans do not survive contact with the enemy. Players will simultaneously select their actions and who they will attack each round. Upon being attacked combatants will be able to parry or even redirect the attack just like in a true sword fight. This “ebb and flow” of combat will persist as long as it takes to declare a winner. This is no easy task as every decision will devastate either your enemy or yourself. You will inevitably find yourself asking questions like what stance I need to be in next, should I block or should I hold for a bigger attack, is the opponent faking their threat level, and can I get my attack off before theirs? In any event this high stakes sword fight will have you coming back again and again.

How do we know you will like it?
BC Games focuses on making quality games over a quantity of games. For this game we consulted Marty Katz Shihan, Shichidan (7th Dan in Bushido), founder of Bushido Karate Dojo in an effort to add a large shot of realism to the flow of the game. We even had the maneuvers translated into Japanese (with subtitles) and cross referenced them so some of the maneuvers block and counter others specifically like they do in the real world. You will enjoy this game for its realism and attention to detail regarding the art of Bushido and the way of the warrior. The Samurai put all they had into their training and ability as an honorable but lethal force at the altar of war. Now you can live out your dream of an amazing duel of your own.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Smoleńsk 1812
description:
Smoleńsk 1812 covers battle of Smoleńsk, the first major battle of the French invasion of Russia took place on August 16–18, 1812, between 175,000 men of the Grande Armée under Napoleon Bonaparte and 130,000 Russians under Barclay de Tolly, though only about 50,000 and 60,000 respectively were actually engaged. Napoleon attacked Smolensk occupied by Russian General Bagration's corps and captured two of the suburbs. During the night the Russians evacuated the burning city.

This game is an expansion of Borodino 1812 and was published in the 32 issue of the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine.

name: Dungeon Crawl
description:
Dungeon Crawl is a solitaire RPG card game designed for use with a standard deck of playing cards. It was developed by Marc Case for the 2012 Instructables Toy Contest 2.

Dungeon Crawl uses a standard deck of 52 playing cards with the Jokers removed and a character stat and score chart. Gameplay begins by selecting a Mage or Warrior character class and drawing cards from the deck to determine stats. Mages draw cards for hit points (HP) determining health and mana points (MP) for casting spells. Warriors draw cards for hit points (HP) determining health and shield points (SP) determining defense.

Gameplay progresses through a series of rooms each of which contains a single monster encounter. You begin the room by drawing cards to determine the stats of the monster including hit and damage points. Next you draw for initiative with the higher card determining the order of the battle between the player or monster. The monster and Warrior turns consist of drawing an attack card with the value determining the strength of the attack followed by an opposing evasion card with the color determining its success. The Mage turn consists of either a one point Melee attack with opposing evasion draw or an attack spell with opposing evasion draw. A Mage may cast an attack spell by turning over a mana card during the players turn or a shield spell by casting during the monsters turn. Player and monster alternate turns until one of them is defeated.

You progress to another room by defeating the monster. The defeated monster's HP is added to your cumulative score and all cards played during the round are shuffled back into the deck. Mages may sacrifice 10 score points at any time to regenerate the mana pool. Gameplay ends when you die in combat or choose to leave the dungeon.

name: Chip Shop
description:
Chip Shop Is a game about the computer boom of the 1980s. Players take on the role of the head of a fledgling computer company vying to capture a slice of the new market. You have a decade to make your mark, will it be for longevity, loyalty, units shifted or a balance between them all?

The game consists of ten rounds, with worker placement from money made from products and events. Players may win by scoring on any one of three score tracks, or a combination of the above.

Chip Shop begins in the American 1980s, but expansions are planned to allow for game play in different eras, regions and markets.

Aside from official expansions or 'updates', the tools and processes used to create the game have been open-sourced, allowing the community to create its own additions, or 'patches'.

name: Corked: The party game for the entertaining connoisseur
description:
From the publisher:

A crazy twist on classic charades. Two players must work together to act out separate clues that the crowd must combine to get the correct guess. Every player plays on every turn and no one ever performs alone. 2-person teams change constantly.
This game requires quick thinking and spontaneous creativity. The scoring is every man/woman for himself/herself in the end, but the crowd can influence both the score and the pace of the game. There is constant hilarious action and interaction. It's super easy to learn.

The game comes in a wine tote bag because the makers of the game think wine makes game nights better, and you may want a spot to put your bottle. It also makes for a great gift. This is not a "drinking game", nor does it have "adult content." It just comes in a different type of package than most party games.

name: The Bugs
description:
From the publisher:

The Bugs is a cooperative card game designed for kids that adults will also enjoy. We have created several ways to play that will help the youngest discover the game while learning (3+). Later, they’ll be able to enjoy the game even more by including new cards and more challenging rules.

While they play and cooperate, they will also learn the fundamentals of programming.

The Bugs are small robots living on a little planet. They live in harmony with their environment and they have created an energy network around their planet. Sometimes, some of the robots have problems and they don’t work as expected. These are Buggy robots. They need you to repair them.

You can play up to 4 players in a cooperative mode. You have to catch the Buggy robot (the red one) as a team. For this, you have to create an energy network around it.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Elements
description:
Elements is a simple card game in which players try to collect 15 symbols of one of the three elements (wood, fire or water) using a rock - paper - scissors mechanism.

All players simultaneously select a card from their hand and reveal. If only two different elements show, all cards go to the player showing the highest number of the winning element (fire beats wood, wood beats water and water beats fire).
If there is no winner the cards stay on the table and are added once a player wins a round.

name: Balancing Ladders
description: In the classic fashion of several dexterity games, the colorful ladders must be stacked very carefully in such a way that the resulting tower does not overbalance and tip over.

name: Förfestspelet
description: Förfestspelet is a party game. The players roll the die in turn order. If the players pawn lands on a colored square (white, red or black) they draw a card in that color, the three different kind of cards in categories: "Sex", "Get to know each other" and "missions". The player that draw the card then have to say or do different thing, for example "Play your favorite music" or "show the others a secret SMS". The player that first get his/her pawn to the goal is the winner.

name: Puppy Love
description:
The run is busy with excited dogs running around freely while others are pulling their masters in different directions. But there is a logic behind the frenzy.

In Puppy Love, players move their canines into point scoring positions such as sniffing, licking and another dog's face or marking their territory on the fire hydrant.


Sniffing or being sniffed : 2 points;
Marking your territory on the fire hydrant: 1 point;
Licking another dog's face: 3 points.


The first player to reach 10 points wins!

name: Mustache Dandy
description: In ヒゲダンディ (a.k.a. Mustache Dandy), players need to determine the state of their facial hair in relation to the mustaches and beards of all the other players, but players cannot see the hair on their own face, so they'll need to use cues from others to figure out exactly how dandy they look.

name: Älskling
description: Älskling is a quiz game. The questions are about to get to know another person. On each of the cards there is three questions, eg Would you be willing to get a tattoo? Did you have braces when you were younger? What is the most embarrassing you've bought in a store? This is a social game and there are no "winners" in traditional sense, it is about knowing more about the fellow players.

name: Morphogea: A Modular Hex Map (fan expansion for Power Grid)
description:
Morphogea is a modular map expansion for Power Grid, which provides some 275 quadrillion map configurations — a number which excludes bottlenecks and peninsulas and any configuration with excess cities — via 14 individually configurable map hexes. If the players agree to peninsulas and/or bottlenecks, there are septillions of configurations — nonillions if the players agree to cover unavailable cities as in the base game.

The map hexes are "sliced" into equilateral triangles, so that connections pointing off the edge of the map can be removed by flipping over the edge triangles. Additionally, the connection costs were determined according to the first-edition Funkenschlag rules, based on the terrain the connections traverse.

Because the base game's gameboard is no longer required for the map, this expansion includes an octagonal board to replace the resource market, heptagonal boards to provide distinct city connection tracks for the different player counts, and a hexagonal turn order / auction status track.

Finally, to provide extra variety, the expansion includes a deck of 32 resource cards, which can be used to randomize the starting resource market.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Moral Choice
description:
User summary:

Moral Choice is a philosophical game published in Canada in 1985 by Moral Choice Associates.

In the game 2-6 players move around a spiral track representing their growth from childhood to adulthood to old age by rolling a die. Most of the squares have a large K or M on them in five different colours. There are also special Horseshoe (Opportunity), Lightning Bolt (Crisis), Light Bulb (Bright Idea) and Superdilemma squares.

When they land on K or M square, they must choose a card of the colour they landed on from a box divided into 18 groups. These cards describe moral dilemmas (brief case studies) on one side, with four multiple-choice options and the real solutions for both the K and M philosophies on the other.

These cards are divided into three major categories based on age (Youth, Adult and Senior), each of which is divided into six colour-coded sub-categories based on the type of dilemma one must solve (Business/Professional, Biomedical, Social/Political, Environmental, Personal/Sexual, Superdilemmas).

The K squares ask players to answer a dilemma according to the duty-based ethics of Immanuel Kant. The M squares ask you to solve the same dilemma according to the utilitarian ethics of John Stuart Mill. The game comes with summary cards for Kant and Mill listing their seven key ideas in each case.

Players can use either the easy multiple-choice option, or answer the dilemma in their own words, with the other players voting on how close they came to matching the true solution. In the case of a Superdilemma, no solutions are given, so players propose their own, with others voting to determine whether it’s correct. They can also time the game, giving each player 3-5 minutes to answer a dilemma.

If you get the right answer, they can move forward next turn. If they get it wrong, they move backwards when they roll again. The winner is the first player who gets to the end of the spiral track.

name: Goblin Prügel Party: Schrate & Vampire
description:
Extension: 20 new cards + 1 cover card with rules

Rule changes: You start with 3 out of 6 cards instead of 3 cards randomly distributed.

Variant for experts: Before the game begins, each player gets half of the cards and discards 5 of them. These are out of the play.

name: FantaSticks!
description:
FantaSticks! comes with 15 stunt sticks in each of six colors, a deck of cards with one of eight activities displayed on each card, 16 tokens numbered one through 16, and, for each player (or team), a 4X4 board with spaces numbered one through 16.

At the beginning of each round, a token is flipped face-up, a card is drawn, and all players (or teams) then try to complete the activity shown on the card. Successful players place a marker on the space on their boards that corresponds to the number on the token. The first player to place four in a row wins.

Activities involve the sticks in some way, usually by building structures that don't fall or that are produced from memory or instruction or that others try to guess. A few activities use the sticks differently, e.g., to indicate answers to trivia questions or to prompt Liar's Dice-style guessing.

name: VERBA: Français
description:
VERBA is the new language learning card game developed by The Pericles Group. The concept is incredibly simple -- one player (acting as a judge) draws a random card containing a fill in the blank sentence in the target language and the other players play a card containing a noun from their hand. The player who has played the sentence card then chooses the best card played and that player scores a point. Play continues with that player as the new judge.

All VERBA players benefit from seeing high frequency words, with many repetitions, in a context that fosters authentic learning and comprehensible input. As with all of The Pericles Group's educational games, the play objectives and the learning objectives are one in the same. Players win by making comprehensible sentences, scaffolded by the cards, the images, and the helpful hints included on the sentence cards. We always want to ensure that the learners are seeing correct forms and those forms are continually reinforced by the mechanics.

Core Set: Includes 50 sentence cards and 146 noun cards. Designed for the novice French learner.

name: Quiz Bingo
description:
"The Question and Answer Game that is played like Bingo"

Game play is a lot like regular Bingo, with the exception that a question is asked prior to covering a space on the Bingo card. There are 50 questions included in the game. (Example question: What large city is situated on Lake Michigan? The answer is Chicago, which is represented by the Bingo space "I-20".)

name: Legends of the Colosseum
description: Legends of the Colosseum is a gladiatorial miniature skirmish game for 2-3 players. You will be pit against other players in strategically meaningful combat rather than simply throwing dice at one another. Make a poor defensive decision and you could watch your best fighter be executed for the crowd's amusement; call an opponent's bluff and deal unbelievable damage as punishment!

name: You're Fired: Corporate Zombies
description:
The search for brains has backfired! Employees are dropping like flies and taking their co-workers with them. Beware.

A Corporate Zombie has no ability, and can be played to the break room with no effect. If a Corporate Zombie is fired, it takes two more employees to the Unemployment Line with it.

name: Boomtown Bandits: Sneakiest Bastard Promo Card
description:
Boomtown Bandits, celebrating game copies now lootable from store shelves in Spring of 2016, introduced this new bonus card, "Sneakiest Bastard", and branded shot glass promo. The bonus card provides a mid-game reward, claimed by the first player to win a shootout without a fight and call it. The card is worth $15 (points) at the end of the game.

--
The shot glass has no game effect, although filling it and emptying it repeatedly may alter dice rolling accuracy.

Email events AT breakinggames DOT com with your address to get your copy, while supplies last.

name: Takotsubo!!
description:
User summary
タコツボ (Takotsubo!!), themed on sea creatures, is an abstract game similar to Chess, Checkers and Shogi. You win the game by catching your opponent's Octopus piece or moving your Octopus into the trap pot (Takotsubo). Like checkers, catch your opponent's pieces by jumping over them. Try to come up with a clever tactic to lure and catch your opponent's Octopus.

This game was originally designed with its illustration in 1996 by Kohei Higashi, a former Japanese Chess champion and Shogi journalist, when he was 60. After twenty years, in 2016, it was reissued with the artwork by Maiko Fujita. The re-issue is called タコツボ 復刻版, meaning "Takotsubo!! Reprint".

Publisher's summary
海の生き物たちによる、チェス・チェッカー・将棋に似たアブストラクトゲーム。相手のタコをつかまえるか、自分のタコがタコツボに入れば勝ち。生き物はチェッカーのように飛び越せるときは必ず相手を飛び越してつかまえなくてはいけない。うまくおびきよせて、タコをつかまえるには？
1996年、チェス元日本代表で、将棋記者の東公平が日本に将棋やチェスの楽しさを伝えられるように60歳のときに考案・イラストデザインしたゲーム。20年後の2016年に、ふじたまいこのアートワークでリニューアル出版した。"

name: Full Moon Circus
description:
The circus world is full of glamour, magic, and... intrigue. Who is the best, who is the most talented?

Each player gets pair of performers and must bring both of them performers into the circus tent, avoiding the
wicked magician, so they can perform first.

Player in his turn rolls die and move accordingly avoiding the magician. Sometimes He may choose paths - shorter or longer but with ability to find useful items against magician.

The first player who reaches into the circus tent is the winner
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: New York Bop
description:
New York Bop is small scale skirmish game created by Ghetto Miniatures where you command a gang of local hoodlums looking to make a name for themselves in 1970’s New York.

Suitable for 2 or more players you will each take turns at activating your gang members to perform a number of actions. You will test your brawn against your enemies in a one on one fighting or will your gang up on the weaker enemies to take you on the path to glory.

The gang characters are represented by a detailed range of 28mm gang miniatures that each have a baseball style stats cards. All the gangs and their members have special attributes that will set them apart from their rivals who they want to get the better of.

A standard game of New York Bop is played with 8 gang members on a 3’ x 3’ surface. Games are fast paced and exciting and you can have a number of enjoyable games in one evening between friends.

Gang Warlords take control and can issue command orders to their street soldiers. You can tell your gang member to cause havoc in the streets by vandalising shops, breaking into cars and spray painting your gang logo on enemy turf in the ultimate 'Up Yours'.

Event cards in the rules add an element of unpredictability to the game as you never know when or what cards your rival is going to mess up your plans.

The rules will contain full campaign rules and map, which will allow you to fight over of New York’s Boroughs of Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx. You will start the campaign with a small gang and a number of turfs with the aim to expand your territory to increase your income and gang size.

As you battle through the campaign you will be able to expand your gang and upgrade member’s ranks and weapons with the income from the local shops protection money.

name: Wormhole: The Definitive Question and Answer Game
description:
From box:
Wormhole (n): An imaginary passageway in space and time connecting the history and the present of the universe.
The exciting game of Wormhole lets you travel through the universe in your own space and time. Discover how truly fascinating the world's history is and how it connects to your everyday life.

Players take turns rolling a die and moving around the board answering questions. Six of the eight categories are historic and geographic, divided by continent.

Each player starts the game with 6 discs, one of each colour. When you correctly answer a question on the large space, you discard your disc of that colour. If, however, you answer incorrectly, your turn ends and you pick up all of the discarded discs of that colour.

The first player to discard all of their discs, make it back to "Start" and correctly answer a "Global" (miscellaneous) question wins.

name: Room on the Broom: Memory Card Game
description: Room on the Broom: Memory Card Game is a children's game, a variant of the classic game Memory. The players should collect the most pairs to win but also watch out for the Dragon that can cause a reshuffle. The game contains 54 illustrated jumbo cards featuring the figures from the Room on the Broom children's book.

name: Ninja Dice: Gunpowder Kage Master
description:
What gunpowder ninjas lack in precision, they make up for in destructive force!

Includes a custom kage master die and character card.

Ninja Dice core game and Ninja Dice: Kage Masters expansion needed to play.
categories: Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Die Omama im Apfelbaum
description:
This cooperative game is based on a classic austrian children's book "The grandma in the appletree" by Mira Lobe. In the book Andi is sad, because he doesn't have grandmother. He retreats to the appletree, where he imagines all kind of zany adventures with an equally imaginatory and zany gandmother. Later on he meets his new neighbor Mrs. Fink, an elderly woman without grandkids, so in the end, he has two "grandmothers". In the game the players try to help Andi tell Mrs Fink about his adventures with his grandma and then tell his mother about how he helped Mrs. Fink.

The game is played over 8 to 10 rounds, depending on playercount. Each player has a hand of three cards. In each round, the active player flips an apple token from the tree, revealing either grandma (green) or Mrs Fink (blue). Depending on the colour he tries to fulfil as many of the cards of that colour until a timer runs out. To fulfil a green card the player has to roll a certain combination with four coloured dice as fast as he can. To fulfil a blue card the player has to stack the dice in a certain way. Whenever the active player finishes a card in front of him, the next player in turnorder lays another one out in front of him and the active player continues.

Once the timer has run out the active player has to shut his eyes immediately. On each green card is a word, on each blue card a chore. So the active player either has to tell a story with the words on the green cards or recount the chores he did on the blue cards. He has to do both in order. Each card correctly remembered goes into a scoring pile. Once a mistake was made, the rest of the cards are put away, and the next player becomes active player. After the last turn all the saved cards are counted up, and the group can rate their score based on a scale. The goal is to save as many cards as possible for scoring.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Building, Storytelling

name: Manatech
description:
Manatech is a 1-4 player, cooperative, action-adventure game that features real-time elements, modular levels and dice-assignment.

In a world of destined kings, daring rogues and scheming evils, mages and magic creatures were once hunted to near extinction. Through rebellion, struggle, and fate, the mana-laden were able to overthrow their oppressors and, over time, build a sprawling metropolis. Now, with these past events all but forgotten, their ancient oppressors have risen again in the form of the Iltheria Corporation.
