It's up to your band of rebels and warriors to infiltrate the Iltheria Corporation and foil their plans once again. Manatech is played by moving standees through a series of room tiles and rolling dice to pass challenges. The game is won when your scenario specific objectives are completed. Your objectives will take you all around the corporate tower, and force you to face auto turrets, laser walls, and the corporate security team. This modular, corporate espionage game uses a combination of timed player turns and dice assigning to create tense, strategic gameplay.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Monopoly: Fox Cities
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Fox Cities of Northeastern Wisconsin.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rugby à 2
description:
Rugby à 2 is a card game. Each card can be used in attack (information on the top of the card) or defense (on the bottom of the card). In total, there are 110 cards and 24 different actions.

Each player has a hand of eight cards. The attacker player can play suites of cards in order to score (try or penalty). When the player plays a card in attack the information in the top of this card tells him which card it is possible to play now.

name: All Around the Playground
description: All Around the Playground is a children's game. The player spin a spinner that shows different symbols, like cube, triangle, heart or star. The player then move his/her pawn to the next spot on the board with the matching symbol. First player around the playground on the board and back to the school, that is the finish, is the winner. There is three shortcuts on the board. Includes a game board, 4 game markers with stands and a spinner. Game board measures 16” x 16”.

name: Guilty Blossom
description:
User summary
ギルティブロッサム (Guilty Blossom) is an Uno-like card game, but this is a co-operative game. All players win if any one player gets rid of all cards in their hand. All players lose if the apocalypse number reaches 13, or players take total of four damage.

You may play a card if that card matches its color or number to the top-most card of the discard pile, or draw a card if you cannot or don't want to play. The apocalypse number fluctuates according to the cards played, so sometimes you have to draw a card even when you have an eligible card. But you cannot draw too much, because you take damage if you have more cards than your hand limit. All of you should discuss who will be an attacker who gets rid of cards, and who will be a healer who draws cards and keeps away from apocalypse.

Publisher's summary
協力型のウノです。誰か１人でも手札を出しきれば全員の勝利となります。手札の出し方のルールはウノと同じで、直前に出したカードと色か数字が同じなら出せます。しかしカードを出すたびにダメージが溜まっていきます。時にはダメージを回復すべく、あえてカードを引く必要もあるでしょう。誰をアタッカー（手札を出し切る役）にし、誰をヒーラー（限界まで手札を溜めてダメージを回復させる役）にするのか相談しながらゲームを進めましょう。

name: Sugorokumaru Ninpoutyou TATAMIJIGOKU
description:
User summary
双六丸忍法帖 畳地獄 (Sugorokumaru Ninpoutyou TATAMIJIGOKU) means "NINJA girl in TATAMI INFERNO" in English.

Sugorokumaru Ninpoutyou TATAMIJIGOKU is roll-and-move style board game for two players.

There are 18 cards placed on the table, forming a triangle. Each of these squares represents a tatami, Japanese flooring material made of woven straw, and has two sides: black and white. Players take turns rolling a die and moving their Ninja pawns along the triangle. If the white pawn lands on a black square that is forming a line of three or more black squares, the white player takes damage, and vice versa. The longer the line of cards, the more damage that player takes.

Before a player rolls a die, that player may play one card from their hand to flip a square specified in the card, and may spend one tatami power to play an additional card.

Each player has a Ninja character who can use their special abilities spending tatami power.

The game ends when a player's life is reduced to zero, in which case the survivor wins, or when any player goes around the triangle three times, in which case the player with the most tatami power remaining wins the game.

Publisher's summary
カードをマス目に見立てた二人用対戦双六。
畳の色を連鎖させて呪いで相手のニンジャを殺す。
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Race round Australia
description: Simple roll-and-move race board game played on a map of Australia. Players race from Adelaide to Darwin, with various penalties, bonuses and detours along the route. Line illustrations of animals, birds and Aboriginal artifacts within the map are keyed to a list of their names in the top left corner.

name: Mets Ton Slip !
description:
Pants Up!
Who will be the first to fully dress his or her character from top to bottom?
Pants Up! A cheeky card game for the whole family!

You start off the game with a butt naked character. The goal is to be the first one to dress your character, starting with the pants and then by stacking 5 different types of clothing of the same season.
At the beginning of each turn, players will draw - from the clean laundry pile - clothes cards, joker cards to help them, attack cards to slow down the other players, or event cards to wreak havoc… before discarding one card and putting it on the dirty laundry pile.

The first one dressed all the way from the pants to the hat wins the game!

Contents: 108 cards

name: Colorful Drake
description: Colorful Drake is a tile game with dragons of different colors printed on both sides of each tile. The basic game is a memory game, where a player's turn consists of choosing two tiles from the board, and flipping them up in front of you. If the tiles match, you keep them, if not, you return them to the board without flipping them back over. The game also includes two other rule sets for the same tiles.

name: Postman Pat: Balancing Parcels Action Game
description:
"Help Pat Stack his parcels"

This Postman Pat game is a dexterity and roll and move game. Players roll the dice and move their Jess piece around the track which tells them how many pieces to add or remove from the stack of parcels in Postman Pat's arms. Postman Pat is depicted by a large plastic model that sits in the center of the table. The first player to topple to tower of parcels in Pat's arms loses the game.

name: Market Movements
description:
The expansion takes the form of 20 unique cards, five of which are revealed at the start of the game. The cards, which represent different effects, can be used once only per game, by anyone at the table, as an action.

The cards represent everything from devious sabotage to risky trade-offs. Once revealed, they're akin to a loaded revolver in the middle of the game table: whether you want to use them to level the playing field, or utilise them as a bargaining tool should you think someone is bluffing.

Think somebody escaped with too many juicy profits? Bring them back in with a Bailout. Want to expose someone's workforce? Employ some Hackers. Think someone is too close to Downsizing? Surprise them with some friendly Interns.

Market Movements is a simple addition that gives you so many possibilities for different avenues of game play. Whether you want a grudge match with a rival or a more interesting game with a group of friends, we hope this will add a great deal more playability to the core game.

name: Wö.rteln
description:
The game consists of double-sided letter tiles and a bag. Each turn, the players draw four letters out of the bag and try to form a word. However, a word with four letters counts no points, unless it contains an "exotic" letter (marked with a . after the letter, as in the title of the game). But if you manage to form a very short word, you can keep tiles for use in later rounds. Each letter beyond the fourth in a word counts one additional point.
After a certain number of rounds (depending on the number of players), each used exotic letter and each letter beyond the fourth in word counts a point, each unused letter tile means minus one point. The player with most points wins.

name: Angry Granny
description:
From the publisher:
A broom, rotating slippers, meatloaf explosives and aggressive grannies!
All this is Angry Granny!!!
A game up to six players where you have to drive your grandmother in a fight full of explosives and grandchildren of Alzheimer attacks with purpose of winning the coveted old-age pension!!

Angry Granny is an easy game to learn but more and more challenging as they play! You have to choose very carefully the grandmother to attack because it might hide some surprises ...
in short, this is a game in order to put an end to even the most solid friendships!.
Grandmothers of Angry Granny will change forever!!
There are no more grandmothers of a time!

IN THE BOX:
18 Grandma cards
100 action cards
6 staples scorecard

The goal of the game is to defeat other players reducing their grandmas' score to zero! The last player who survives with his grandma is the winner.

Each turn consists in three phases:

Supplying phase: The turn player take a card from the fighting deck. He reveals it to everyone and then he holds it among his cards.

Main phase: The turn player can play cards of his hand respecting a sequenze of colors in the use of the cards (first yellow, then red and finally purple cards).

End Phase: Every player can place a covered defence card and then he respects the number of three cards in his hand drawing new cards from the fighting deck or discarding redundant cards .
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Kampf dem Zufall
description:
Each player has his own game board and four pawns. The goal of the game is to get all meeples off his board, either by moving them past space 49 or by getting them on the board of another player. Movement is determined by two dice. The player may choose to move two pawns with the result of each die, or one meeple with the added result of both dice. If a meeple gets on a space of it's own color it stays there, but if it gets on the space of another color, it moves to the game board of this color onto the space of the same number and is now controlled by the player of this color. Instead of rolling the dies, he may move a meeple of his own color ten spaces ahead, if it lands on a space of his own color.

The first player to get all pawns off his board, wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Albi Regionální kvízy Praha
description:
From the series of quiz games that tests players' knowledge of different Czech regions.

In this game the players will try their knowledge of Prague in four different categories: History, Culture, Places of Interest and Miscellaneous.

Players roll the die and move around the board, landing on a spot where they will answer a question from a card. If they answer correctly, they get to keep the card. Whoever collects cards from all categories first, is the winner.

name: The Big Apple
description:
The Big Apple is a “building” game for from 2 to 4 players. Players recreate the “history” of New York City, from its earliest years up to modern times, by slowly constructing more and bigger buildings, parks and cultural centers. Each player is looking to amass wealth and political power, all leading to his being elected Mayor of New York.

Players win by earning Victory Points. There are several paths to gaining VP - wealth and political power are the two main roads - and players must choose which of these they will take to win.

The Big Apple requires players to master various types of games all at the same time. The building portion of the game requires players to adapt spatially to the changing environs for in each of the three eras of the game. In addition there is a population management aspect where new immigrants are constantly coming ashore and need to find housing. This leads to a constant friction between the building of housing to hold voters... I mean population versus the creation of lucrative businesses versus the migration of the populace into the boroughs of Brooklyn, Queens & The Bronx. Finally the game is full of dirty political tricks that can set your opposition back and create opportunities for you.

The Big Apple is for 2-4 players and plays in about 45 minutes per player. It is easy to learn but full of nuances that make mastery slightly more difficult.

name: Alligators, Dice & Doors
description:
Alligators, Dice & Doors is similar to Snakes & Ladders in game play, although generally faster. It's made to be a simple dice-rolling game to help familiarize youngsters with larger numbers and simple arithmetic, and the goal is simply to get from Start to Finish across 69 squares between them.

It uses polyhedral dice (4, 6, 8, 10, 12, and 20 sided) and a rolling mechanic for backwards steps - if a player lands on an alligator square, they roll the 6-sided die and move backwards.

The "Doors" in the game refer to portals similar to the ladders in Snakes & Ladders. Under basic rules, these are one-way and treated the same. Alternatively, each door has a number. Upon entering, the player may roll an eight-sided die to determine the output location.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hide & Seek In The Town
description:
From the publisher:
Every evening, Uncle Bob takes the two dachshund siblings, Spot and Louise, for a walk. While playing with her brother in the park Louise s ball rolls away. Louise runs after it, but she is so tiny that she gets lost among the bushes and objects of the park. When she realizes that she can not see Uncle Bob anymore, she starts to look for them right away.

In the meantime Spot also starts searching for Louise. Which doggie will find the other? A strategy game for children who love to play hide and seek.

User summary
Game play:

The goal is to find the opponent's dog (pawn) before it finds you.
Pawns (dogs) moving on a grid of 5 × 5 squares of 7 × 7 squares depending on the selected difficulty level. Each row and each row contains a decorative element: a leaf, a kite, etc.




On your turn, you roll two dice. The pink dice shows how many questions (1 to 3) you can ask.



The questions are of the "Looking to .... what do you see? ".
We can look to the city (north), the park (south), River (west) or the road (east). With luck, the answers may give the exact location. Often uncertainty remains.

You can then move the maximum number of spaces shown on the black die (1, 2, 3, 3, 4 or 4) to try to reach the opponent's piece.

In this game of hide & seek the player who finds the dog of the other player before his dog is found wins!

name: Monopoly $ycling
description: This was an unofficial home-modified version of Monopoly Empire, briefly offered on eBay in 2014. The player tokens were replaced with plastic figurines of cyclists. Gameplay is nearly identical to Monopoly Empire.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Angry Birds Pig Island Smashdown
description:
Description from the publisher:

It’s pig smashing, Red crashing fun with the Angry Birds Pig Island Smashdown from Spin Master Games! Set up the Pigs and their Pig City in 1 of 24 ways and then smash Red into the precarious structure for maximum destruction! Or set up this 30” board to play Pig Bowling or Shuffleboard for hours or fun. It’s Red versus the Pigs in Angry Birds Pig Island Smashdown!

Use the 24 enclosed challenge cards to create the layout of the structures. With 6 blocks, 3 planks, and 3 pigs, there a multitude of challenges await! When built, you have 3 chances to slide an angry Red down the board to crash into the structures, toppling everything above.

name: Gamer Deck 2: Theme
description:
Gamer Deck is a series of card decks that appeal to gamers and game designers. Each deck will be more like a card system than a standard deck of cards. A card system has multiple elements to be used to play and design many games.

Gamer Deck 2 - Theme is like a standard deck of cards because it has 4 suits (A-K). The suits are cards, meeples, hexes and pawns. There is an RGB color scheme to the deck. There are dice images on each card. The cards are numbered 1-52. Each card has a letter and 3 game themes on each of the 3 colors.

name: Creatures of Dark Manor
description:
Players take on the role of an adventurer and explore the manor room by room. They have to avoid the spooky creatures that live inside to discover its secrets.

The game is a memory card based game containing 36 Castle Cards these are split into monsters, doorways, candles, potions, maps and a portcullis. Players shuffle the cards a construct a 6x6 grid by looking at the cards before placing them face down with the first card in the middle of the table. As other cards are placed have to touch the edge of another card. Doorways however are placed face up to begin with and where possible should not be placed next to each other.

The last player to add a card picks the doorway they wish to start on and the remaining doors are turned face down. Players move around the board by moving to the next face down card in a straight line (Up, down, left or right). Face up cards or spaces can be jumped over.

During play if a monster is flipped over and the same monster is also in the row or column then the player gets "scared" and has to take the monster card they landed on. The player then runs to a face up door card that has no current players on it. There are also bonus cards that have special effects when activated.

The game ends when players can no longer move as there are no cards remaining face down. To win players count the scores on the monsters they collected and the lowest score wins. If there is a draw then the last player that had a turn wins.

name: Super Mario World
description:
Players again don the red hat with the iconic "M" to once again foil Bowser and his minions. In this adaptation of the Super Mario World video game for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, players quest through the Mushroom Kingdom. Each player rolls a die and moves his or her player piece. Depending on what space the player lands on it dictates what they do. If they land on a "?" Block they will get coins or, if they are lucky, powerups. If the player lands on an enemy space they must defeat an enemy using items or face losing a turn or coins. Finally, to move from World 1 to World 8 a player will have to successfully complete a mini-game to beat each world. Players collect coins as they journey to World 8 to defeat Bowser. Only with powerups picked up or purchased with their hard earned coins can a player defeat Bowser and rescue Princess Peach. The first player to defeat Bowser is the winner!

In the mini games you have to beat various enemies using die rolls and augmenting them with powerups players purchase at Toad Houses or find along the trail. In two minigames you have to spend coins to toss them onto a slanted board to do damage to enemies or use the star road as a shortcut to other worlds.
categories: Children's Game, Exploration, Video Game Theme

name: ROM contre FATALIS! Conquéte Planetaire
description:
A fold out game from the French comic book magazine STRANGE issue 166

From the publisher (translated):
Who, ROM the benevolent Space Knight, or DOOM the sinister SUPER-VILLAIN, will be able to conquer the planets of the other?

User Summary:
ROM contre FATALIS! Conquéte Planetaire ("Rom Against Doom! Planetary Conquest!") is played on a grid of planets, 16 on each players side and a open strip of three rows of 9 spaces across in between.
Players alternate turns moving one piece either one space in any open direction. Or by jumping over any other piece as long as the landing space is open, as many jumps as can accomplish that way.
The game is won by occupying all of the opponents spaces.

From the publisher:
Qui, de ROM le bienveillant Chevalier de l'Espace, ou de FATALIS le sinistre SUPER-VILAIN, saura conquérir les planètes de l'autre?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Otooreverse
description:
User summary
オトーリバース (OTOOREVERSE) is a card game with a theme of drinking race. In a drinking party in Japan, 'reverse' means "to reverse what you have ingested". It is a mild expression of 'vomit'.

At the beginning of the game, you are assigned a character, who has their own alcohol capacity and beverage preferences. Their favorite beverage's alcohol counts zero, and hated one counts double toward their capacity.

Each turn, you may choose to quaff a beverage (draw a card), and if the total amount of alcohol exceeds your character's capacity, the character 'reverses' and you are out of the round with no victory points. You should stop drinking before your character 'reverses'.

When any character would quaff a beverage (after drawing a card but before resolving it), you may make an 'alhara' (alcohol harassment) to force any character (including yours) to quaff that beverage. You have limited times of 'alhara' attempts.

At the end of round, each non-'reversed' player gains victory points according to beverages their character has quaffed. After several rounds, the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
オトーリバースとは、より多く酒をのんだ人が勝者というゲームです。
ただし酒のアルコール度数が肝臓の強さを超えると「リバース」してしまいます。
厄介なのは、吐いてしまった人間は悪酔いして他人に迷惑をかけること。
あなたはこの最悪の宴で生き残ることができるのか…
publishers: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)

name: Visualise
description: Test your observation and attention to detail. Look at the picture. You have 30 seconds to memorise as much as possible and then be prepares to answer questions about the picture. Each correct answer earns you 1 point. After three rounds of pictures the player with the most points wins!

name: Auction House
description:
In Auction House is a classic auction game. Players take on the role of potential bidders, as they bid over lots based on some of highest value items ever sold in real auctions.

Auction House is simple bidding game made of two decks the auction items and the cash cards. Players all start with the same amount of cash and bid in secret on items.

Once revealed the highest bidder wins. Play continues until all players run out of cash cards to bid. At the end of the game the player with the most items is declared the winner.

name: Le dernier canot du Titanic
description:
You and your fellow players are officers trying to save yourselves and some passengers but there is only one last lifeboat remaining, eventually fighting for life. That last lifeboat has a limited number of places...

Players use their action cubes to determine:

the turn order (it also allows to get courage or money)
the distance their officer walk. Each one has a list of rooms he must go through before he can leave the sinking boat.
the money they want to get (it helps to get objects and passengers)
the courage they want to get (useful in order to move further and guide passengers)
if they want to get an object (useful when fighting)
if they want the buoy (to go through a room that has got the water leak)


-*if they want passengers

Then the water leak moves from one room to another. The buoy comes handy there. If an officer is in that same room, he must go back on his rooms list.

Then actions are taken.

Fights are resolved when several officers are in the same room. Passengers and collected objects are used to calculate the force of each opponent's group.

When each officer arrives at the end of his list, he finally moves into the lifeboat. He takes as many places for his passengers as he can, if remaining.

The game ends when the lifeboat is full.
The winner is the player who could save the most passengers.

name: The Gottman Couples Retreat Board Game
description:
Join your partner on a virtual island couples retreat, where you’re sure to have fun while building a better relationship! Just one round of play will show you why 86% of couples report significant benefits from using the Gottman approach to create stronger, deeper bonds between you and your sweetie.

Designed for couples who want to deepen their relationship and have fun together. Partners take turns rolling the dice and moving their game pieces with the goal of “returning home” from vacation with more closeness and intimacy.

Strengthen your relationship and deepen your connection by playing together in a tropical paradise! The Gottman Couples Retreat Board Game unites the best of our renowned, research-based relationship tools in a playful, accessible format. Balancing thoughtful conversation topics with fun, intimate action items, this "retreat" makes exploring each other's worlds enjoyable and enlightening. Even more, you'll be making deposits in your "Emotional Bank Account" by building on positive moments with each other during gameplay. Whether you're new partners or have been married for decades, the Gottman Couples Retreat Board Game is ideal for an at-home date night....or use it on anniversaries as a "ritual of connection" in your relationship. Also makes a special birthday gift or wedding present!

The game ends when the ship field is reached.
categories: Educational, Humor, Mature / Adult, Medical, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Chicken
description: Chicken is a quick, press-your-luck party game for 4-16 players. Based on hot-rod drag-racing, players race towards the edge of a cliff to see who can get closest without going over. Each round the road cards are placed face down. Players then places their marker where they would like to stop. Road cards are flipped over one at a time, with each road card being worth one or two points and the cliff is worth three. Players earn all points from the beginning to where they stop, unless they go over the cliff and forfeit all points gained for the round. The first player to 30 points wins.

name: Everdark
description:
Description from the publisher:

What is Everdark ?

Everdark is a 2-4 player semi co-operative rotating maze strategy game where teamwork is encouraged but by no means guaranteed. Players are given events to complete that are located around the city board. They have to navigate their way to these locations by moving their character and twisting the rings on the board. Any areas that are not defended succumb to darkness and the maze becomes harder to navigate

It is a mid-level game taking around 60-90 minutes to play. The length of the game can depend on the rule variation used by players. The key reasoning for that is that the use of the timer (whilst recommended) is not compulsory. This, among other rules, allows flexibility among players to play Everdark in a way of their own choosing.
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Lucca
description:
Description from the publisher:

Lucca is an abstract game where you play tiles (houses) in groups (blocks) and stacks (towers) to dominate the board (city). The board size depends on the level you wish to play - the bigger the board, the deeper the game.

You control a block by controlling the tower of the block and you control the tower by having the top house of the tower. On a standard 8x8 board, you win if, at the start of your turn, your tower is the highest and has a height of at least 8 houses. Alternatively you win by defeating other towers and taking at least 4 sets of prisoners.

Take turns to place one of your own tiles in an empty square or any number of tiles of any color beneath already placed tiles to build a tower.

There may only be one tower in a block and its colors must correspond to the colors of the block, i.e. two black tiles in the block allows two black tiles in the tower.
 
When two blocks grow together, an equal amount of tiles is removed from the two towers, leaving only the strongest tower but potentially with a new controlling color.

The challenge of Lucca is to time the tower building and removal so that your own color prevails in the end.

The unique mechanism of Lucca is the four dimensional thinking where not only the block area and the tower height must be taken into account but also the timing of the removal. All this is accomplished in a pure and elegant setting where luck plays no part.

name: Mama Mu och Kråkan
description:
Description from the designer:

Mama Mu is a lively cow who wants to build a treehouse. She asks her friend crow to help her. Crow, as always, is reluctant, but she does. She helps Mama Mu with collecting all the wood needed for the treehouse and a ladder to get in.
Aim of the game is to build your ladder, and when you are done you can let Mama Mu get into her new house.
of course you have to take care, wood can get stolen and the farmer should not catch the cow and the crow do "human" things.
based on a childrens book by Jujja Wieslander and Sven Nordqvist who also were the artists for this game.

name: Maeshowe
description:
According to the Orkneyinga Saga, Earl Rognvald Kali Kolsson broke into the chambered tomb of Maeshowe, on Orkney, in AD1150. In AD1153, Earl Harald Maddadson and a group of his men sheltered there during a snowstom. The sagas tell us that Rognvald found treasure there and that two of Harald’s men went mad. When the Victorians opened the tomb in 1861, they found Runic graffiti demonstrating that both of these episodes were based on real tomb-breaks. This game combines the two events from the 1150's and casts you as Harald and Rognvald.

The game uses a deck of cards, a player board and tokens to simulate your escape from the tomb. The player has a limited number of health and action tokens, which can be removed through normal play or through negative card effects. The player plays cards from hand and these can be positive as well as negative - removing passage tokens (leading to victory) or gaining extra action or health tokens.

name: Down
description:
Down is based off a traditional ladder game played in Korea. You play by following a set of lines from the top of the cards to the bottom, making turns as needed. In Down, the player must try to collect gold coins and avoid red hexagons. Players have a limited number of stars that they can use to control the course they take...they are great for squeezing out those extra coins, but use them too much and you are left at the cards' mercy.

This game uses 9 cards, and can be played with the cards being held in one hand, so you can play it while standing on the train after work, waiting in a queue for a rollercoaster, or even when taking a well-needed 'parent break' (hiding from children in the bathroom).
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Toh'Kaht Expansion Pack
description: The I.K.S. Toh’Kaht is a powerhouse for 28 SP featuring a 5 primary weapon value, 1 agility, 5 hull and 3 shields. The Action Bar contains Evade, Target Lock, Cloak and Sensor Echo Actions. The ability to cloak and sensor echo is what makes the Vor’cha class ship so dangerous. The generic version of the ship loses a shield and a Weapon Upgrade slot for 2 less SP. The I.K.S. Toh’Kaht has a special ability that allows you to take an action to place a Scan Token and an Auxiliary Token beside your ship. Since the I.K.S. Toh’Kaht normally lacks the Scan Action, being able to perform a Scan Action sets this ship apart from other Vor’cha class ships. Kaybok is a level 3 Captain that allows you to re-roll a number of your attack dice equal to the number of Tech and Weapon Upgrades deployed to the defending ship. Kaybok will make sure your attacks find their mark, especially against ships with lots of Tech and Weapon Upgrades. The Elite Talent Upgrade in this blind booster is Covert Mission. As an action, you may disable all of your remaining Shields and target a ship at Range 1-2 that is not Cloaked and has no Active Shields. Discard this card to steal 1 Weapon Upgrade on that ship with a cost of 5 or less.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Monzart
description:
The musicians' pets are upset because their masters always dump them at the corner when they play music together. To please their masters, they decide to form a band and create some nice music, which they think will attract their masters' attention.

However, the pets have only a smidgen of musical knowledge from looking at their masters' practices — five lines, notes, basic beats, etc. — so they find it very difficult to compose music. Therefore they decide to start from the simplest point and use their masters' instruments to make a piece of music. And they name the band following the great musician Mozart as "MONZART"! After all, the pets are animals, so they cannot control their temper properly and sometimes just release their temper for no reason.

During Monzart, players act as one of the pets, trying to use their hand cards to place as many music notes in clef as they can to score points from the notes and the combinations of notes. If you found yourself in a hard position, don't worry! You are a pet and are allowed to release your temper! You could be angry, or you could be upset! Either way, you can use this reason to override your situation!

At the end of the game, whoever has the most points — from the game itself plus the final number of the notes — can attract the masters' attention as the "Best Composing Pet"!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: 21JumpBall
description:
Can you leave 21 or less in two minutes?
Game play begins with rolling of the 3 dice to determine which one of the 1-15 numbered balls will be taken out first. Players put in a chip and each players tray is passed to the right so the individual does not play with their own tray that they set up. The two minute timer begins. Players continuously jump numbered balls creating a pattern as they are jumping and discarding balls that are jumped. The jumps continue until there are no more jumps or until the two minute timer is up. The numbered balls on the playing tray are totaled up. With the goal being to leave 21. If you go over 21, you busted your game play. And if you don't get 21, try getting the next best score: 20, 19, etc.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Math, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Physical Removal, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Sun Bid
description: Sun Bid is an adaptation of Reiner Knizia’s classic game Ra for the Decktet. The auction mechanics come from Ra, but the scoring system is different to Ra.

name: Booze Barons: Lookout Tower Promo
description:
A new location card that was originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Side A: Tail the player seated to the left or the right of the Booze Baron

Side B: Choose another player. That player cannot be tailed this round
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: My First Animal Tower
description: Fisher-Price animal stacking dexterity challenge. Little kids version of Animal Upon Animal. 6 Big chunky animal pieces and 1 large wooden die included in the game. Roll the die until an unstacked animal is shown, try to stack the animal shown . Everyone wins if the stack is complete. Person who knocks over the stack is the loser. For an extra challenge, try stacking the die on top of the animals for a finishing touch!

name: Monopoly: Farewell Boleyn
description:
Introducing an exclusive collection of pieces created to commemorate the 112 years at the Boleyn Ground.
In summer 2016, West Ham United will say goodbye tothe venerable Boleyn Ground, home of the club for over a century.
Situated in Newham Borough's heart in East London, The Boleyn Ground was opened in 1904, when the Hammers were still a Southern League club.
In 1919, the stadium hosted its first Football League match and became a successful Premier League team when the competition arrived in 1993.
Special Edition "Farewell Boleyn" Monopoly.
Gives you the chance to invest in stands and stadiums and trade in landmarks and players!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The County Fair Game
description: The objective of The County Fair Game is to have the most fun at the county fair by spending as much of your money to win prizes, be awarded ribbons, take photos, eat food and experience the fair. Players begin with 85 play dollars to spend at the fair. Before entering the fair, they must first find a parking place (roll to land in spaces around the outer edge of the board.) Upon entering the fair, players roll a die each turn and can choose which space to land on (usually from several options.) The player with the most points from accumulated prizes, and experiences wins.

name: Brain Flip
description:
Give the wrong answer on purpose! In Brain Flip, one player picks a card and the other players try to guess which card it is by asking questions. The twist: every answer given will be the opposite of the truth. Train your brain to do mind bending gymnastics and you will be the winner!

Display a number of cards on the table. Mentally pick one and prepare to answer the players’ questions. The players will try to guess the card you picked by asking questions that have to be answer only by YES or NO. You must always answer the opposite. It looks simple, but it will trick their brains. Don’t get confused! Play smart and find the hidden card! Tally the points to see who is the winner!

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Turtle Power Battle Game
description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Become a Turtle or one of the bad guys and challenge your friends to an exciting duel."

Simple dice-based combat game based on the Nickelodeon cartoon.

Each player starts with ten numbered power cards. On your turn you roll two dice and can take power cards from your opponents equal to the total rolled. In addition, you roll the character die and take a bonus card if it comes up with your character.

When you take a player's last power card, a you roll off with that player in a duel. If you eliminate a player, you take their character card for use in future rounds. The last character standing is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: La conquista de Europa
description:
Back in 1400 Europe had other borders. Hosts in each country are located and begins the conquest. Can you take possession of other countries and make you strong and powerful?

Purpose of the game:
Fulfill the mission contained in Secret Mission card.

Preparation:

Each player chooses the color of his army.
Distribute the 20 territory cards.
Submit a Secret Mission card to each player.
Place the armies spread across territories.


Turn:

Gaining reinforcements.
Choosing a contact territory to attack the enemy with dice.
Removing the destroyed armies and moving the conquerors.



(Game description in Spanish)

Allá por el año 1400 Europa tenía otras fronteras. Se sitúan los ejércitos en cada país y empieza la conquista. ¿Podrás apoderarte de otros países y hacerte fuerte y poderoso?

Finalidad del juego:
Cumplir la misión que figura en la carta de Objetivo.

Preparación:

Elegir cada jugador el color de su ejército.
Repartir las 20 cartas de países.
Entregar una carta de Objetivo en secreto a cada jugador.
Colocar los ejércitos repartidos en los países.


Turno:

Ganar refuerzos.
Escoger un país enemigo en contacto y atacar con los dados.
Retirar los ejércitos destruidos y mover a los conquistadores.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Rage Quitter or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Flip the Table
description: In Rage Quitter, each player competes in a dexterity challenge to see who can collect the most game pieces from the scattered ruins of table. On each players turn, after collecting game pieces, they will flip a table(card) from their deck with two pieces on it and try not fling them off the table. After flipping a table, the player then gets to throw a table(card) to cover up the pieces on the table, so no other player can get to them.

name: Alla ricerca di Dory: Occhio al tentacolo
description:
A board game based on the Disney/Pixar film Finding Dory.
Each player takes a Dory figure and tries to meet his four friends, avoiding the tentacles of the octopus Hank, and go home with them.
The current player spins the spinner and decides to move based on the number or color of the arrow: if the destination square is occupied by another player, the current player moves further.
After the movement, the player flips the coin of the target square and, according to it, he can: meet one of his friends, turn the spinner again, move to a square he likes or rotate Hank tentacles 90 degrees. It is useful to remember what is depicted in the chips, so you better choose whether to move by color or number.
If the spinner lands on octopus Hank, the player rotates 90 degrees clockwise or counterclockwise: if its tentacles hits one or more figures, they come back to the starting square.
The winner is the first to meet all 4 Dory friends and returns to the starting square.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wizards and Unicorns
description:
Wizards and Unicorns is a fast-paced card game about battling unicorns, wizards, unicornwizards, elves, and pegasus set in the city of Unicornopia. You dive into the role of one of them trying to gain control over the Stone of Sigma. In order to achieve this, you try to gather fans among the wizards in town.

In a match of Wizards and Unicorns, you battle with your foes for fan markers by playing showtime cards and hoping to keep them on stage. As the players take their turns, the draw pile will soon run empty. The game ends as soon as a player manages to get a certain number of fans or the draw pile runs empty.

The game consists of roughly 50 uniquely styled and funny cards, each featuring many different effects, offering you the possibility to play the game with many different strategies. The vast options of combining them and the growing intensity as the draw pile shrinks lead to many new and exciting situations.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Bavarian Holiday
description:
There is nothing quite like a Bavarian Holiday of sampling good beer and enjoying the local scenery. In this dice game for 2-5 players, Alt, Pilsner and Weiss beer are represented by different colored dice and are each represented on the score cards. Choose the number and color of dice you wish to roll in the hopes of crossing off the empty spaces on your score sheet. Choose carefully or you will spill too much beer and be cut off or eat too many pretzels and get full. Are you the first to leave the pub, buy flowers and go home or do you push your luck and try to get one of the two really big beers?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Crazy & Horrible Rabbit: Volume One (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
A third-party unofficial humorous expansion pack

Compatible with Cards Against Humanity.

Includes 80 White, 32 Black Cards
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Quizduell: Das Buch
description:
An expansion for Quizduell: Das Spiel.

This book contains more than 500 additional questions and answers from 19 different categories for the base game.

name: Shuffle: Subboteo
description:
Each of the 2 players have their own deck with red or blue backgrounds.
In his turn player try to play cards in a horizontal line in front of him so that the ball matches the positions of the previous cards. Are there 5 cards in line? Now is time to play the goal card and score.
Player who scores more goals is the winner.

name: Next Seven Days
description:
Next Seven Days is a solitaire card game representing the first week of the new world.

With a deck of various events, numbered 1–20, each with a special piece of story and effect, the player must discard some of the cards in order to play the cards they want. Cards must be played in a strict pyramidal form in seven layers, obeying the rules for numbering. The game is played in seven rounds, and if the player manages to create an unbroken line of increasing numbers from round one to seven, the week is complete. Points are awarded for achieving special goals.

name: Let's throw away it all
description: Let's throw away it all is a simplistic card game about throwing away trash. All players have cards numbered 1–7, and secretly decide what to discard. If no one else discards the same number, the player gains points. However, each round there are special numbers worth a lot of points, and other factors that affect the game. Penalties are given to players who discard the same number as another player.

name: Monopoly: Historic San Francisco Edition
description: Monopoly Game Featuring Historic San Francisco
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Jolly & Roger: Cannonball!
description: Jolly & Roger: Cannonball! is a mini-expansion for Jolly & Roger that consists of two cannonball tokens (that you need to cut out) and rules for how to use them in the game.

name: Huscarls: A Game of Conquest in Dark Ages Britain.
description:
INTRODUCTION
Huscarls is a semi-historical game where one to four Players assume the roles of minor Saxon Warlords in Britain during the Dark Ages of around 980-1080 AD. There are many rich pastures, thick forests with deer and boar and rolling hills, all ready for the taking as the riches of Medieval Britain can be yours. All you need is to demonstrate a firm hand and fruitful estates. A strong sword and loyal followers are also required to maintain your lands and ensure the villagers are providing the proper taxes. You must also be able to defend your territories from rival Lords and invading Normans and plundering Vikings.

GAME OBJECTIVE
Players assume the roles of Saxon Warlords in Dark Ages Britain (AD 980-1080) with the goals of expanding and improving their territorial control. Warlords do this by raising Retinues and conquering neighboring territories. Warlords can, also, improve their holdings by building Hamlets, Manors and Castles. A Game consists of up to 10 Campaign Seasons. Players may agree to play fewer or more as desired. The Player, who at the end of any Campaign Season (Spring, Summer or Autumn) controls the greatest Settlement Value from their Hamlets, Manors and Castles, is the Victor.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wissensquiz Langenfeld + Hilden + Monheim
description:
The "Wissensquiz [Cityname]" series contains Trivial Pursuit-style cards with questions and multiple choice answers. The topic of all questions is directly related to the city.

For each player, a card is drawn and the question asked. The player has 30 seconds to choose the correct answer. If the answer is correct, the player keeps the card. The game ends when there are no more cards to draw. Whoever holds the most cards by then wins.

In an alternate game mode, points are scored for each correct answer. The first correct answer scores 1 point and allows the current player to draw another card. If that card is answered correctly, too, 2 points are scored and another card is drawn. That one will yield 3 points for a correct answer, and another card is drawn until the answer is wrong.

name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – AI Human Hybrid Forms
description:
It was a secret project. And utterly failed one.

The assumptions were ok... hmm at least for such morons, with dreams on armies taking over countries, somewhere at the end of the third world. The research and trials took almost 2 years. In the meantime the progress in robotics and nanomaterials completely changed the reality. The genetics and cloning were back. We couldn’t manage to breed a stable hybrid. The mechanic part was either rejected or didn’t accept the orders from the interface.

The whole thing was too big, too heavy, not enough... let’s say... sublime. Yes, you are right, the marketing nowadays is important even for partly illegal military project for government. I really don’t know why the objects weren’t destroyed just after the project was closed. The whole lab was hidden somewhere in the bowels of the tower. Probably it was easier to keep it in secret than to destroy it. Or not... I think it is more likely, that our board was hoping to sell it to someone else anyway... or use it somehow. And they got what they deserved... She has used them! She woke them up, after she destroyed her own security. Probably the drones were not enough for her. She had to have something even more frightening... And the rest... well you know that better than me.

THE TESTIMONIES OF A SECRET INFORMER, ALIAS “SERPIO” DURING THE INVESTIGATION AFTER THE INCIDENT IN NAKAMURA TOWER.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Merkurya: Promo Essen
description: 2 Tower Pieces

name: Army Lists 3000BC - 1250AD
description: Army lists for use with WRG wargames rules, with lists for 48 ancient armies.

name: Es war einmal: Pegasus Promo Story Card
description: A single "Pegasus" story card to expand the base game.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: UFO
description: UFO is a 2-player game from Alga, a game in the Algette series (no.5). One players is red, the other is black, and each players has 1 pawn in their colour and 9 cards. The players need to play cards from there hands with number on them. The number represent the steps the players pawns will move. There as always two numbers on each cards, one red and one black. There are four circles on the board, to get to another circle, the pawns has to land on an square with an arrow. The aim is be the first player to reach the middle of the board.

name: Tower Defense
description:
Tower Defense is a light, asymmetric game where one player defends a castle from the onslaught of soldiers from the other player. The defender needs to stop the hoards of soldiers while the attacker tries to destroy the castle as quickly as possible.

The game comes with a one game card which represents the playing surface. Players are expected to supply their own coins (10 one-cent coins, 10 two-cent coins, and 10 5 cent coins).

Depending on their placement, the coins have multiple purpose. They either: (1) represent the life points of the castle and the soldiers, (2) determine how a soldier enters the board when rolled by the attacker or (3) show how much damage a soldier will suffer when played by the castle defender.

name: Four Land
description:
Jewels, jewels everywhere! You should utilize limited action with intelligence; consider to make maximum advantage. Compete with others, get all jewels, a few of them, or just monopolize one. Think Craftily, act cleverly, and be the master of the jewels!

A game of card placement and land acquisition for 3-6 players. Have the highest bets on land to claim the jewels.

The object of the game is to collect jewels from Land Plates to meet the victory conditions. Jewels are of different types and values. On your turn, take or bet a number card or token, or take and place land cards and jewels. When a round is complete, players will assess their total numbers of their bets on land cards with the winner taking the jewels. The game ends when a player either has 10 points from one type of jewel or 3 points of value from each different jewel type.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management

name: Octonauts Memory
description:
Memory - a worldwide classic with awsome octonauts theme
The exciting search for matching picture pairs guarantees hours of fun for thewholefamily!

For 2-6 players from 3 years of age.
Contents: 48 cards (24 pairs)

name: Klondike Gold
description: Players start out from Skagway with a “stake” of 1000 ounces of gold. They make their way, with many adventures along the road, to Dawson City and the Klondike Region. Along the road they may be caught in a blizzard, or lose their way along the trail, or they may be attacked by snow blindness, wolves, or chance upon various other adventures and hazards of the trail. At Dawson City players may speculate in various concessions, or they may continue on to the Klondike Region and try to make a gold strike. Once the gold strike is made a player must continue on the trail to the Land Claim Office (with adventures good and bad on this trail, too). Once he has successfully registered his claim and made his way back to his mine he searches for Nuggets of great value. When one of the players has earned his second Nugget the Klondike Adventure is over and players tally their gains from all sources. The prospector who has gained the most gold on his trip is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Epic Fights: Kung Fu Masters
description:
A two-player microgame with 18 cards.

Winner of the 2015 18 cards game contest.

Epic Fights: Kung Fu Masters is a confrontational two-player game, with a quick, very light, tactical gameplay. Two kung fu masters battle each other in 9 rounds, using various techniques and building up combos.

name: Ophiusa: A terra dos mil ríos
description:
Description (English):
Ophiusa: The land of a thousand rivers. It is a card game for all ages.
It consists of 54 cards that represent several of the most outstanding events of the society, culture and politics of Galicia. Although you do not need any prior knowledge of history to play.
Ophiusa, besides being an entertaining board game, also develops an important didactic work, which will help the players to organize chronologically their knowledge of history.

The goal is to get more points than the rest of the players. For this, you must form a timeline of events with cards grouped by color in groups of four cards (one for each color). Besides, get extra points with the province cards that serve as a bonus. To form this timeline, each player will add a card in the sense of clockwise.
The cover of the game, shows the logo and the Galician flag.

Description (Galician):
Ophiusa: A terra dos mil ríos. É un xogo de cartas para tódalas idades.
Componse de 54 cartas que representan varios dos acontecementos máis destacados da sociedade, a cultura e a política galega. Aínda que non é preciso ningún tipo de coñecemento previo da historia para poder xogar.
Ophiusa, ademais de ser un entretido xogo de mesa, tamén desenrola unha importante labor didáctica, que axudará os xogadores a organizar cronoloxicamente os seus coñecementos da historia.
O obxectivo do xogo é conseguir máis puntos ca o resto dos xogadores. Para isto, deberase formar unha liña temporal cos acontecementos das cartas agrupándoas por cores en grupos de catro cartas (unha de cada cor). A maiores, conseguiremos puntos extra grazas ás cartas de provincia que servirán de bonus. Para formar dita liña temporal, cada xogador engadirá unha carta no sentido das agullas do reloxo.
A portada do xogo, fusiona o logo coa bandeira de Galiza (a terra dos mil ríos).
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Puzzle, Trivia
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory

name: Gute Nacht
description:
Gute Nacht is a 3D game in which the little princess Enni does not want to go to bed. Time after time, she gets up because she needs something: a glass of water, a bedtime story...

In more detail, this is a small, memory-type game in which storytelling and role-playing can become part of the game. The game — part of HABA's "Sleepy Princess" (Erbsenprinzessin) line — is for the youngest children to slowly ease them into the world of games and help them understand easy-to-grasp rules.

name: Inqvisitor
description:
INQVISITOR is a game where an inquisitor visits the town with the intention to eradicate the blasphemy.
In the game the inquisitor is represented by a die, and rolling the die represents being interrogated by the inquisitor. Depending on the results the player will be freed under suspicion, sent directly to the pyre, found completely innocent, tortured, or given the opportunity to accuse another player.
Apart from the die, each player will have 3 tokens representing his innocence that will be decreasing depending on the results of the interrogatories (the dice rolls), and another 3 tokens representing money to buy the church's indulgence or to betray any other player. The last remaining alive is the winner.
categories: Dice, Humor, Medieval, Party Game, Religious
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Spice Planet
description:
Spice Planet is a card game for three to eight players, playable with two standard decks of playing cards.

"He who controls the Spice controls the Imperium!"

The Galactic Imperium is completely dependent on the addictive Spice produced on only one world, the Spice Planet. From time to time, the Great Houses vie for influence on the planet with both armies and intrigue.

Objective: Be the first faction or alliance to control four cities, or control the most cities before a ceasefire ends the game. Control a city by building a stack of cards that is larger than all opposing card stacks on that city. Obtain more cards by controlling cities, trafficking in the spice harvest, and engaging in reputational intrigue.

Turn Sequence: Repeat this sequence each turn until the game is over.

1. Weather: determine the first player in the turn order by flipping cards from the top of the draw deck to the harvest pile until a player’s suit is drawn; the first player starts the action phase and decides if turn order proceeds clockwise or counter-clockwise. Each time a face card is drawn, alliances may be made or broken.

2. Action: each player in turn order either takes an action or passes; when all players consecutively pass, the phase ends; then, check for military victory.

3. Harvest: player or players tied for the most cards in pile draw 1 for each enemy suit present in pile then take 1 of own cards from pile.

4. Intrigue: reveal the intrigue pile; player or players tied for the least cards in the pile draw 1 for each enemy suit present in pile then take 1 of own cards (if any) from the pile.

5. Income: shuffle and place all discards at the bottom of the draw deck; give each player 1 card, then award 1 card for each controlled city, then award 1 card for each adjacent pair of controlled cities.

Military Victory is declared at end of the Action phase by a single player or an alliance that controls 4 cities. The victors seize control of Spice production, forcing an end to the hostilities, and the game ends immediately.

Ceasefire is declared if the draw deck is depleted. The player who then controls the most cities wins a Political Victory, but a tie is a Stalemate with no victors. Exception: see victory conditions for The Nomads and the Guild.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Negotiation, Novel-based, Political, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fuji-san
description: Score the highest total number of points by capturing pyramids pieces on a Fuji-San board. After strategically placing their pieces, players take turns trying to surround and capture the most valuable pieces on the board. This is done first by a player picking up two pieces off the board; one is discarded, and the other placed back on the board somewhere. Then they remove one "surrounded piece," which is placed into their score pile.

name: South Mountain: September 14th 1862
description:
Description from the publisher:

This is the twenty third battle in our series of the American Civil Wargames in 3D. The Confederate Army have been caught attempting to cross the passes over South Mountain in to Maryland.

Historically the Union came into possession of the Confederate Special Order 191 which showed the disposition of the Confederate Army in the Maryland Campaign. Acting of this information General George B McClellan sent the Union Army to attack them at the passes of South Mountain.

South Mountain is a single day battle that has a time limit of 7 bounds, 13 with extended play option. The Union must capture the six marked objectives. The games design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game within a 1-2 hour period of continuous play. The game gives a flavour of the American Civil War period and a simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in two halves, the South Mountain seven page Battle Rules, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty one page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice. The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you continue this great series of battles with another victory? Play North or South in this the twenty third game of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Soul Puzzler
description:
Soul Puzzler is a 2-player, head to head tile placement game inspired by the puzzle based video games of the 90's to now. Similar enough to another classic, popular game, Soul Puzzler is easily accessible to all players. However, it has layers of depth that will please the more experienced gamer.

During each turn a player may take one of two actions, that of playing a Soul Token or switching an existing Soul Token's Position. Once the Soul Token is placed or a Soul Token is switched, the turn then goes to the next player. When you have 3, 4, or 5 of your Soul Tokens in a Row or Column, you remove them and score points equal to the number of tokens you remove. All Tokens above the removed Soul Tokens fall to the bottom most portion of the board. The first player to reach 15 points wins.

name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – AI Human Hybrid Form 04
description:
The results of physical test highly above estimated parameters. Speed, reflex and basic tactical abilities, all on the upper end of scale. The simulations proved extreme aptitude for infiltration and assassination.

The instability of behavioral interface was observed, confirmed accidents of ignoring the orders despite of active connection. Thorough modification of control protocols is highly recommended...

Notes of senior specialist Jimmie Asturo on the forth prototype of AIHH, written the day before the funds had been withdrawn and project taken on hold.

Box content:

1 metal miniatures
1 ID cards
2 weapon and gear cards
1 plastic bases
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Win or Go Home
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Win or Go Home! is a racing game where you can take a driver and improve him (or her) over the course of a career.

Unlike other racing games, it's the pack of cars that moves around the track.

Win or Go Home can be played with the counters we've provided or with any die cast models you may already have.

Inside you'll find:

A game that can be played solo, cooperatively, or as a head-to-head competition.
A system that lets non-player drivers race against players, and allows the non-player drivers to follow their own strategies while remaining competitive.
A campaign system that, with little bookkeeping, allows you to race a full season.
Playable with die cast vehicles in any scale, or even cardboard counters if you want.

name: Monopoly: Exclusive Resorts
description:
Experience the perfect vacation.

Perhaps your idea of a perfect vacation is relaxing pool side with a forgotten novel, or enjoying the serenity of the setting sun on the vast expanse of the ocean. Maybe you find inspiration on a challenging golf course or rejuvenate by dining with friends in the privacy of your own magnificent residence. Or, possibly it is the deep winter powder in Deer Valley and the fresh air of a summer hike. No matter how you define it, a lifetime of perfect vacations is yours as a member of Exclusive Resorts.

Whether you're on vacation with us, or just daydreaming about your next getaway in one of our destinations, we invite you to enjoy your Exclusive Resorts Member's Edition of the MONOPOLY game. As you'll see, the game tokens represent various aspects of vacation and the board spaces represent our many sought-after destinations. Control the board to own it all in the world of perfect vacations. We hope you enjoy the MONOPOLY game play experience while imagining your next perfect vacation with Exclusive Resorts.

Games Includes : Game Board, Title Deed Cards, Play Money & Banker’s Tray, 16 Destinations Cards, 16 Activities Cards, 32 Residences, 12 Resorts, Rules, 8 Custom Pewter Tokens, 2 Dice
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: You Guessed It!
description:
Description from the publisher:

You Guessed It! is a cooperative version of the classic game 20 Questions. Work together as one team guess a word. One player knows the word and the other players guess it in 20 YES or NO questions or less. Is that it? You ask. YES! You Guessed It! It's that simple.

name: YoliBoli
description:
Yoli Boli is loaded with bouncy craters and hungry space pigs. Count to three, point and guess. You need cunning, memory and skill to win over your space friends in this exciting card game.

The players will be counting to three aloud. By pointing and guessing on cards, the players will win cards. The goal of the game is to gather four Crew Cards of the same kind to win: Captains, Lookouts, Engineers or Spaceships.

Activating Special Cards like Bouncy Craters, Space Yoghurt and FiFi makes the game wacky and fast paced.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory

name: Krawall im Stall
description:
Description from the back of the box:

"There seems to be a lot going on down on the farm. The farmer accidentally left the barn door open and now the animals are all loose. With great difficulty he's managed to catch them all but now the barn is in uproar. Can you help sort the animals?

An exciting memory game with lots of animals that can also be played with as a farm set once the game is over.

Players mix up the 32 wooden animals (4 each of 8 different animals) and place them into the 8 barns. Players then take turns trying to find pairs of the animals, until all of the animals are matched. The player who found the most pairs wins.

name: Gawi Bawi Bo!
description:
Gawi Bawi Bo is a strategy game for 2 players ages 8+

For ages 8+
30 min play time

You move and capture tiles following the Rock, Paper, Scissors rules.

Setup
Place board between the players

Shuffle the 36 tiles face down

Tiles are placed on empty spaces of the board

In turn, flip over and place a tile on an empty space, starting with the outer edge spaces. Then work your way towards the center leaving the center space empty.

You are now ready to play

Stacking Order
A Rock tile can be stacked onto a Scissor tile

A Scissor tile can be stacked onto a Paper tile

A Paper tile can be stacked onto a Rock tile

Play
Players share tiles

Play Rock, Paper, Scissors to determine the starting player

Turns then alternate

On a turn,

Move a tile from 1-3 spaces in any of the 6 directions, not over empty spaces or the center of the board. Then following the Stacking Order end the move on top of another tile capturing it.

Both tiles are removed from the board, they will be used at endgame scoring

Groups
Adjacent tiles are considered a group, a single tile with no adjacencies is also considered a group.

If a group is split into 2 groups that are divided by empty spaces, the smaller group is removed from the board.

If a group is split into 2 or 3 equal size groups, remove the group/groups that did not have the captured tile.

These tiles are not used in scoring.

When no more moves can be made the game ends

Scoring
Total your tiles using the numbers on the face of the tiles

Runs of two or more tiles only count as the lowest value in the run, like (23,24,25,26)

Subtract any (-1) tiles you may have from your total

Objective
The player with the lowest score wins!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Iron Infantry
description:
1 versus 1 tactical combat game played on an 8x8 to 12x12 square grid game board. Each side has 6 military units, plus a Fortress to defend, and a Cannon Turret to defend the Fortress.

Set up your units on your edge of the board, then let the battle begin. Each player's turn is made up of 2 actions: Move, Attack, Heal an injured unit, or Repair and disabled vehicle.

Attacks are resolved by comparing Attack Strength + dice roll to Defense Strength + dice roll. Defending units may be destroyed, disabled, or sustain no damage.

A player wins the game by destroying their opponent's Fortress or all of their opponent's army.

Iron Infantry was an entry in the 2015 Mint Tin PnP design Contest.

Iron Infantry is a mini game based on the steam punk inspired game "Iron & Brass".

All that's needed to play is the 8 units per player, 2D3 (1,1,2,2,3,3) dice per player and a checker or chess board, or any other 8x8 to 12x12 square grid board.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Monopoly: University of Kansas
description:
Description from the publisher:

Monopoly, the legendary game of risk taking, deal making, and owning it all, and the University of Kansas, the celebrated university of academics, research, Olympic track stars and national basketball championships, team up to create a classic board game for Jayhawk fans everywhere. Take a spin around the board to find the best loved athletes, coaches, buildings and scenes of one of America's great universities. And be prepared to pay big bucks if you land on James Naismith or Phos Allen the inventor of basketball and one of the most beloved coaches in college basketball history.

Grab your friends and family, put on your Jayhawk sweatshirt and enter the halls of KU for the game of your life. The Lied Center, Gale Sayers, Allen Fieldhouse, Wilt Chamberlain or 22 other KU properties can all be yours. Whether a student, alumnus or fan, can you resist the chance to buy KU's finest?

GAME INCLUDES: Game Board Property Cards Play Money and Banker's Tray 2 Dice 10 Game Tokens Chance Cards Community Chest Cards Package of Dormitories Package of Houses
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tireli'Cochon
description:
Smash the piggy bank (Tireli'Cochon) and pick the treasure!

Spin the arrow and discover the action to be done: insert a coin in Tireli'Cochon, pull its tail or try to break it by beating it down with a hammer on its helmet! When the piggy bank explodes, run after the coins and try to pick up a maximum!

Casse la tirelire et récupère le trésor !

Tourne la flèche et découvre l’action à accomplir : glisse une pièce dans Tireli’Cochon, tire lui la queue ou essaye de le casser en tapant sur son casque ! Quand ta tirelire explose, cours après les pièces et essaye d’en ramasser un maximum !
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: WhatchamaCALLit
description:
Description from the publisher:

A new concept in word games with the great advantage of involving all the players in the fun of the game all of the time. The game can be played by the whole family & by any number of players. The game centers around the planners or plans. These are the 'Crosswords' made up by all the players before the play actually begins. These planners are filled out by each player in crossword fashion on a particular theme or subject e.g. Film Stars, The Sea, Sport etc & the rest of the players have to find the words in these plans - the player with the most points being the winner. A game concept that can grow & even use tiles from other word games !
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Eliksir
description:
On the periphery of the hidden forest, not far from the cave of the fallen dragon, every thirty-three years an ancient tournament is held. For centuries the druids and their apprentices come to this magic forest to harvest all the best ingredients for their elixir.

Back in the old days, in order to prevent recipe from falling into the wrong hands, the first druids have made the key with words through which to come up with the right ingredients. During the tournament, with the key droids utter keywords, but faithful apprentices have to understand those keywords and reveal where the ingredients are hidden.

Now you also have the opportunity to enter this magical world and try your luck in an ancient tournament, decipher keywords, find the ingredients, help your druid!

In Eliksir, two teams compete to see who can make their elixir faster by finding all ingredients. Druids give one-word clues that can point to multiple words on the board. Their teammates try to guess their own words while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team. And everyone wants to avoid the deadly black ingredient.

Can you find help your druid find all your ingredients before the other team, find out in Eliksir.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Litterarum
description:
Litterarum is a compact word game inspired by Tim Fowers' Paperback and Shh of Chris Handy.

Players try to score as many points as possible by building the most valuable words from available letters that are changing every round.
Letters are drawn from every players' hand and played simultaneously. Then a player on the left of the one holding the "inspiratione" card must create the most valuable word from letters in play, being followed by player on his left. Letters in a word may repeat freely.

Instead of standard letter cards players can play wild letters that can be used instead any other letter that is not currently in play. However, every wild letter card can be used in a word only once and does not score a point.

Every standard letter is worth a point. A player with the most valuable word (in case of deuce a player with the least amount of wild letters used in a word or a player whose word value was not beaten) becomes a winner of the round.

If a player doesn't want to score in a round, he may choose two other actions: getting an inspiration and passing. Inspiration can change owner only once per round, passing can be played anytime.

The winner of the round adds one card from draw pile among letters in play and then takes two of them back to his hand. After that, a player on his left hand picks one letter and so on until all the letters are taken. Then a new round begins.

When the winner of the round draws a "+1 littera" card, he puts it above the vowels card. From now, players repeat letter-picking phase for every such card in play, playing more letters, giving them more possibilities.

Game ends when the draw pile is empty. Players play one last round, winner gets the vowels card and then every player counts the amount of cards in hand.

A player with the most cards is a winner. If more players have equal amount of cards, a player with more wild letter cards in hand wins. In case of deuce a finalist sitting (clockwise) nearest to the player with inspiration card (or a player with an inspiration card himself) wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: GeoQuest
description:
Geocaching is a high-tech adventure game enjoyed world-wide by players equipped with GPS receivers. Players find containers called geocaches, hidden by other players. The geocaches are often located in interesting places that you might not otherwise discover.

GeoQuest is a board game based on geocaching, for 2 to 6 players. The object of the game is to be the first player to reach 25 points, or find all of the caches on the board. You gain points by finding caches or from Event cards.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Pirate Plunder
description:
It's about building your own pirate ship. You can build cards, or steal them from other players.

Everyone has a hand of cards that they choose to play one card from simultaneously. The cards are different parts of a ship e.g. sail, cannon, hull, etc. Or they can steal other players' cards they have played. The cards are all worth different amounts of gold.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Game of Trolls
description:
Description from the publisher:

Game of Trolls is a card game centered around trolling and testing the limits of your friendships. Players take turns attempting to attack one another, forcing them to either defend or draw a mountain of cards. The game's unique event cards get the entire group involved. It's an awesome family game and an epic party game that'll ensure you'll have fun at the expense of others.

The longer the round, the more dynamic the game becomes as Gold cards stack on additional rules, keeping everyone constantly on their toes. The first player to discard all their cards becomes the King of Trolls, acquiring game-changing perks for the next round. The loser also gets powers too because let’s face it, it sucks to suck.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: EOD Expansion
description:
