Another mole is introduced in the expansion. As a member of terrorist organization, he/she can share the information of terrorist organization and has chances to make bombs.

The objectives of both forces remain the same with EOD BASIC: Police Force shall defuse all 3 bombs, while if any one of bombs explodes (assume moles are not suicide bombers), the terrorist force will be the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Traponium
description:
Using tiles showing the powers of two (or three in more complex levels), players move orthogonally across a randomly constructed board of numbers from one corner to the other. This is done by constructing equations producing the number to which they wish to move before drawing replacement tiles from the bag to replenish their stock.

A modular board, an optional dice determining the number of spaces a player may move, and the choice of exponent, allow for a variety of levels of difficulty. All levels will develop mathematical ability and forward planning.

name: Naval Engagement
description:
This 1870 title is a simple but very early game from McLoughlin Brothers, printed on a single sheet of paper. It shows an image of a coastal battery of 10 guns in the foreground exchanging fire with a fleet of 10 ships.

Each of the ships and guns is numbered from 3 to 12. Players take turns rolling 2D6, with snake-eyes a miss and any other number eliminating the ship or gun of that number. The first player to succeed in eliminating all of the opposing guns or ships wins.

While most of the ships are still three-masted sailing vessels, the fleet includes one Monitor-style ironclad and what looks like a two-masted steamship.

name: Word Has It!
description:
Description from the publisher:

It’s a race at great speed… the tallest word is what you need! Turn over the category card, spin the spinner and scramble to build the tallest word using the three sided counters, whilst the electronic timer is getting faster and faster……time is up, discover which Word Has It!

Players race against the clock to build the tallest/longest word from a series of tiles scattered on the table.

name: Free Mars
description:
Description from the publisher:

From the colonies of Mars to the orbital stations of Earth and to the outposts on Jupiter, the cry is heard, Free Mars! is a science fiction wargame of revolt across the Solar System in the late 21st century.

Earth’s colonies are rising up against an oppressive Terran Federation. The system is based on SPI’s Battlefleet Mars, but with additional forces and units representing several types of spaceships, ground units and special forces.

Special weapons include artificial intelligence missiles, cybernetic attacks and enhancement of human warriors via nano-technology. Cards representing the various military-political-economic groups that are maneuvering for power are included. The map shows the Solar System out to Jupiter, with displays for each planet. Two maps, two counter sheets, two card decks.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Le quiz de comment
description:
Le quiz de comment (The How? quiz) is an educational trivia game aimed for kids.
Each player starts with 7 cards in 7 different categories. The goal of the game is to get rid of the cards a quickly as possible and score most points.

One by one the players play out a card with either a solo or group question. The solo question has to be answered by the player. If right he scores a point, otherwise he draws a new card of the same category.
All players can try to answer the group question simultaneously. The quickest scores two points. If a person gives a wrong answer he draws a new card.

The game ends when a player has no cards left. The one with most points wins the game.
publishers: Larousse, Manteau/ WPG uitgevers België, Ploegsma

name: Farkle Around
description: Flip over your first card to show what dice combination you are trying to match. Each card has two identical dice combinations, one for burgundy dice and one for ivory dice. Roll your set of dice, then set aside those that match the card and continue rolling the rest. But if none of them match what is needed, you "Farkle" and play passes to the next player. When someone matches the card, they earn the points on the card. The game continues with new cards until someone reaches 10,000 points.

name: Sly Knight Robbery: Detective Team Pig & Pig
description:
User summary
A small expansion for Sly Knight Robbery introduces a pair of pigs to help the Sly Knights recover stolen items. Each player gets a card with two pigs, to use as a neutral no.2 played on stolen item cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: Monopoly: Longhorn Edition
description:
Description from the publisher:

Monopoly, the legendary game of risk taking, deal making, and owning it all, and The University of Texas at Austin, the celebrated university of academics, research, and national championships, team up to create a classic board game for Longhorm fans everywhere. Take a spin around the board to find the best loved athletes, coaches, buildings and scenes of one of America's great universities. And be prepared to pay big bucks if you land on the Tower or Littlefield Fountain-the University's most recognized building and beloved spot on campus don't come cheap!

Grab your friends and family put on your Longhorn sweatshirt and enter the halls of UT at Austin for the game of your life. The Texas Union, Show Band of the Southwest, Darrell Royal, Littlefield Home or 99 other Longhom properties can all be yours. Whether a student, alumnus or fan, can you resist the chance to buy Texas' finest?

GAME INCLUDES: Game Board Property Cards. Play Money and Bankers Tray. 2 Dice 10 Game Tokens. Chance Cards Community Chest Cards Package of Houses. Package of Dormitories
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Gloom: Bookmark of Death
description:
The playable bookmark "Bookmark of Death" was part of the "Gloom: Digital Edition" kickstarter project.

Description from the kickstarter: Sour friendships and turn the tables with the playable bookmark, usable in a game of physical Gloom.

Bookmark Text:
Front:
During your turn, you may perform wither of the following actions as a free play.
Take one Untimely death card from the discard pile and add it to your hand.
Or...
Discard any number of Untimely Death cards from your hand.

Back:
After using the Bookmark of Death, pass it to the player on your left. Each player may only use the Bookmark of Death once per game.
At the end of the game, it is returned to its original owner.

name: Pokemon Rummy Card Game
description: As a Pokemon themed version of rummy, the object of the game is to be the first player to earn 100 points by making matches and runs. The game features round pokeball-backed cards that are numbered and suited like traditional cards and can be used for other card games. It comes with rules for a Pokemon variant of Rummy in which runs are created with different evolution stages of Pokemon characters, aces are wild cards, and jokers allow you to take a card from another player's hand. These four joker cards feature characters from the first season of the Pokemon TV series: Ash, Misty, Brock, and Team Rocket and the represented Pokemon are all from the Kanto region: Bulbasaur, Ivysaur, Venusaur, Charmander, Charmeleon, Charizard, Squirtle, Wartortle, Blastoise, Pidgey, Pidgeotto, Pidgeot, Pikachu, Raichu, Ekans, Arbok, Clefairy, Clefable, Jigglypuff, Wigglytuff, Meowth, Persian, Koffing, and Weezing.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Gem Duel
description:
Description from the publisher:

Gem Duel is one of the card game to duel with your opponent, using variety beautiful cards of sealed creatures into GEM.
These creatures are from myths around of the world.
You and your opponent summon each 3 creatures one by one, sort each summoned creatures , and battle at the same time.
You win by direct attack to your opponent after destroying all of his shields.

Note : You can destroy the shields and attack directly in same color creature’s battle only.

name: Munkki
description:
In this game you travel between the different municipalities in the Central Uusimaa region of Finland (poorly defined, but roughly the area immediately north of Helsinki and it's immediate environs) by rolling a d6. You cruise around the municipalities and do tasks which are given to you by cards. Tasks may include, for example, moving to a certain town on the map. After the first player has visited four out of the six municipalities in the game, and defined one of the six as an end goal destination, the first player to get there wins the game.

(The name Munkki translates roughly as Donut in this context, but instead of driving in small circles to leave skidmarks, in the local slang it refers more to cruising ie. driving some popular short repetitive route, such as driving around the block. Often in the company of other such drivers - a pastime that has always been popular among the youth of this region.)
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: EndQuotes
description:
A party game for literate degenerates. Mash up epic quotes!

EndQuotes lets you mash up hundreds of unforgettable lines from movies, tv, songs, books, and more! It consists of two decks of cards: one with quotes with their endings missing, and one with those endings. Each round, the active player draws a quote card, then the other players each secretly choose an ending card in their hand to end that quote with and plays it face-down on the table. The active player then reveals these cards and chooses the ending card that, in his opinion, is the best ending for the quote. The winning player gets the quote card.

Once a player has won a pre-determined number of quote cards, that player wins.

name: Rampunctious
description:
Description from the publisher:

Rampunctious is a party game about making terrible puns and word play. The game starts by the players making puns out of their own names. Whoever has the best pun becomes the Pundit. The Pundit has a hand of 5 Topic cards, they draw a Scenario card from the deck and read it aloud to start the round. Each Scenario shows a unique fictitious situation. The Pundit then plays a Topic of their choice from their hand and the players must make as many puns as possible by combining. At the end of a round the Pundit awards the Scenario card as a point to whoever made the best, worst or most puns. The game ends when a player reaches 10 points.
At any point in a game, if a player makes a pun that causes everyone to cringe they can be awarded a Cringe card as a reward. Depending on how you're playing these may count as a point.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: FINISHIT
description:
Description from the publsiher:

FINISHIT is a table top game that's fun for almost everyone. It's recommended for ages 13 and up. The object is to win five points (cards) by being the best or worst at completing short phrases. In this game players get points for being awesome or terrible. The Judge decrees who are the best and worst Scribes in each round, while a Bomber, a Scribe who modifies others’ responses, hopes to gain the advantage and win the round.

FINISHIT is like Cards Against Humanity and Balderdash had a baby, a very funny baby.

It has lots of player interaction, like eruptions of laughter, suspicion, accusations, and clever jabs. It's full of surprises, like when grandma and little johnny both win, or when your shitty answer suddenly turns out to epically awesome. FINISHIT is flexible too, so you can play with the family, or the guys at the hunt camp, or at the sweet sixteen party. And the artwork and branding is great... it says shit right on the box!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Zircles
description:
Everything comes together when players strategically place pieces onto the magnetic board. Create the most circles to score points while sabotaging your opponents' scoring opportunities. With single player and multi-player options, the fun is endless with Zircles!

Contents: 48 pieces, 32 scoring markers, magnetic travel case with board, and instructions

- Easy-to-learn puzzle game where players strategically place pieces on to the board to score points
- Each piece must be placed adjacent to pieces of a different color - make your move to score or to sabotage your opponents
- Magnetic puzzle pieces to keep them from shifting around the board
- Great reply value with solo play for high scoring
- For 2 - 4 players ages 10 and up, with average game time of 30 minutes per game

name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Assault Squad – "Heavies"
description: The Spetsnaz have arrived in the Middle-East! Deployed alongside any SSU force, the Spetsnaz Assault Squads provide intelligence and are able to communicate efficiently with fire support units should they encounter any threat. These are even sneakier and deadlier Spetsnaz than the rest!
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Kidnap Machine
description:
User summary
Kidnap Machine is a print-and-play solitaire boardgame. There is a variant Version called Obscura (see below).

You woke up in a dark room, and you feel the presence of something horrible. You must get out of the room using your wisdom and luck.

To play the game, you need a die, two pawns, a pencil, and a printed square-grid play sheet.

You may move two squares in a turn, but must end your turn after you try to enter a new square, in which case you roll a die. You cannot move if the result is less than the movement difficulty designated on the original square. Otherwise, you move to the new square and roll a die to determine the movement difficulty for that square.

Then the monster moves. Basically it moves along the predetermined route, but while you are within the area of its sight, it approaches you.

You win the game if you reach the goal square without being captured by the monster.

The PnP files are on the designer's website (see Weblinks). This includes a second Version on the game called 'Obscura'.

Obscura
Suddenly, the lights went out.
The darkness came one step closer.

"Obscura" is an improved version that allows you to play "Kidnap Machine" without using a pencil by using working tiles.
Enjoy a difficult escape from the labyrinth now clothed in deeper darkness.

Publisher's summary
Kidnap Machineは、Print and Playの一人用ボードゲームです。
あなたは暗闇の空間で目を覚ましました。あなたを捕らえようとする、何か恐ろしいものの気配をすぐそこに感じます。
運と知恵を頼りに、この恐ろしい状況を脱しましょう。

プレイシート以外に用意するものは、サイコロと駒と鉛筆です。
あなたは、決められたスタート地点から出口まで、隣り合うマスへ駒を移動させていきます。
未知のマスに移動するときはサイコロを振り、今いるマスの脱出難易度を超えれば移動に成功します。
その際、移動先のマスの脱出難易度もサイコロで決定します。
すでに難易度がわかっているマス同士の間の移動であれば、１ターンに２回、自由に行なえます。
あなたの移動が済む度に、ボード上で化物が動きます。
彼らは基本的に決められたルートに沿って移動しますが、あなたを視界に捉えると追跡をはじめます。
彼らに捕まってしまったらゲームオーバーです！

Obscura
すぐそこで、明かりが消えた。
暗闇が、また一歩近づいた。

"Obscura"は、タイルを工作することで"Kidnap Machine"を鉛筆を使わずに遊べるようにした改良版です。
より深い暗闇に閉ざされた迷宮での、困難な脱出劇をお楽しみください。
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Shop Hop
description: Players in Shop Hop need to visit the eight stores and buy something faster than anyone else, but to move they need to spin the dial to see which of the six colored paths they can move on each turn. Some stores are closed when you first approach them, but if you can enter through the key symbol — or wave a little money at them — then they'll open for business.

name: Ollinkalli
description:
Description from the designer (Translated):
An abstract board game of both luck and strategy. Compete to get your pieces out of the board before the other players do.

Ollinkalli has a unique piece movement mechanic. When you move your own pieces, it's likely you'll be moving your opponents' too. You should be attentive and see if your moves benefit yourself or somebody else too. Be careful, maybe you are helping them to win before you do.

Description from the designer (Spanish):
Es un juego de mesa, de azar y estrategia, con un diseño y una mecánica de juego totalmente original. El objetivo es sacar todas tu piezas del tablero antes que los demas jugadores.

Ollinkalli destaca por la manera particular en que se mueven sus piezas. Cuando tu muevas tus piezas, es muy probable que muevas piezas de tus oponentes al mismo tiempo. Deberás fijarte muy bien si tus movimientos te ayudan solo a ti o también a alguien más.
Ten cuidado, si te distraes, quizás hasta los ayudes a ganar el juego antes que tú!

name: Bushido: Wamu
description: Another worm to emerge from the perilous, relentless training of the Kaze Kage Zoku, Wamu is a swift and nimble novice assassin. Like her fellow novice Wamu is able to employ the teachings of her mentors to great effect. A competent warrior and a promising student of the ways of the ninja.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Madoka
description: In times of war the Prefecture of Ryu is able to call upon those loyal to their Takashi Lords, swelling the ranks of the serving ashigaru with Goshi. Madoka wields his long axe in the name of Ryu, hacking down foe with sweeping blows; his courage in battle is soon restored in the presence of a trusted commander.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: NDAK Observer Squad – "Desert Eagles"
description: The Afrikakorps is finally back to where it belongs! Nothing as efficient as a good artillery barrage to keep the enemy on its toes... Thanks to these observers, regimental and division artillery pieces can deliver the most powerful punch to crush the enemies of the Axis.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Bushido: Isamu
description:
A veteran of the Dragon wars, tales of his courage at the battle of Hendai are still told today in the streets of Tsumaga. He had led the life of a fisherman after the first war until the call from Ryu came, summoning all goshi back to service in this new time of strife. From an early age Isamu exuded an air of authority and a calm head in the heat of the moment. It came as no surprise that he was raised to the rank of Gunso quickly during his first term of service to the Takashi clan, a position he quickly settled into. His experience and presence imbuing his soldiers with a confidence and courage to fight on and turn the tide of battle for the Dragon clan.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: Leutnant Sammt, Luftwaffe – "Rolf Samt"
description:
Elite officer of the Fallschirmjäger Korps of the Luftwaffe, Lieutenant Rolf Sammt has seen action since Operation Mercury, the invasion of Crete in 1941. Since then he has fought almost everywhere, mostly in the Luftwaffe Field Divisions on the Eastern Front. With the reactivation of large paratroopers formations and airborne operations, he has been recalled to full Fallschirmjäger duty, where his invaluable experience is passed along to younger generations of Axis jump troops.

This miniature come with his own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dicecapades! 2nd Edition Expansion Pack: Video Games
description:
Description from the publisher:

Dicecapades! 2nd Edition is the same great game as the original version but now with more cards! Think you can stack dice on your face? Will you dominate in arm wrestling? How about obscure facts? With a mixture of dice games, physical challenges, artistic creations, and trivia questions that will exercise both sides of your brain, you'll see why DICEcapades isn’t just the luck of the dice - it’s the smarts of the roller!

Need more cards? No problem, get the DICEcapades Expansion Packs. Each expansion pack comes with 45 new cars to boost your Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

Expansion pack 3 is video games themed and includes 45 more cards for Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Party Game, Trivia

name: SanremoN
description:
SanremoN is a collectible card game. The deck consists of 40 downloadable cards. It celebrates 67 years of events and characters of Sanremo's Festival, setting them in a fantasy universe.

(The Sanremo Music Festival, or "Festival della canzone italiana di Sanremo", is a popular Italian song contest and awards ceremony. It is held annually in the city of Sanremo, Liguria, Italy.)

PURPOSE OF THE GAME: Being able to bring your opponent's life points to 0

HOW TO PLAY

It is played exclusively in two (1 Vs 1) and with a single deck of cards. The two players (Challenger A and Challenger B), after having shuffled the deck, draw 5 cards each.

The remaining cards remain available to Challengers who at the end of each round of play will draw one or more cards, depending on how many will they play, so you always have 5 cards. Each Challenger has 5000 Life Points to start.

In the first round, the Challenger A plays his first card, chosen among the 5 in their possession. The Challenger A is in the process attack, then the ATK (Attack) points of the card played will be those to be taken into account. The Opponent B, vice versa, is located in defense phase, and then play one of 5 cards in his hands, considering the DEF (Defense) points associated with it. If the ATK points of the opponent A will exceed DEF points of the opponent B, the Challenger to win the turn and the difference between ATK of A and B will be the DEF points to be subtracted to the Opponent's Life Points B. If the ATK points are equal to or lower than DEF points opponent, no Life Point will be subtracted from the Challenger B.

At the end of the round, played cards are collected in a new deck (the discard pile), and the two Challengers will fish from the draw pile as many cards as they were played before moving in round next. He will fish for the first Challenger will play in the Attack phase (in our case, it is for the Challenger B).

This continues round after round, until the the deck runs out. Then all the cards collected in the discard pile will be reshuffled and put back into play. Repeat for 5 times at most.

The winner will be the one who will manage to bring the Life Points of the opponent to 0, or the one who at the end of the 5th phase of the game has higher Life Points.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Music, Print & Play

name: Monopoly Junior: Eloise's Rawther Exciting Globetrotting Adventure
description:
Description from the back of the box:

Join Eloise, Weenie, and Skipperdee on a globetrotting adventure around the world. You'll visit Eloise's favorite cities - Paris, Moscow, and of course New York, and learn lots of interesting facts about landmarks and famous places.

Along the way you can buy famous properties, put up penthouses and of course say "Charge It Please" when someone comes to visit.

The player who collects the most money at the end of the trip wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dai Senka
description:
Japanese children's 'wargame'. 1-4 players move from their starting spaces (2 as submarines, 2 as bombers) by die rolls, directed through a network of spaces by the number they roll, scoring points for the enemy ships they land on and 'sink'. With luck, one player can reach the victory space in the minimum of 5 moves.

The spaces in descending order are:
Victory:
大戦果 Dai Senka / Big Battlefield
60 points:
レキシントン USS Lexington (scuttled 8/5/1942, Battle of the Coral Sea)
プリンスオブウェールズ HMS Prince of Wales (sunk 10/12/1941, off Malaya)
25 points:
甲巡 heavy cruiser
甲巡エクゼター HMS Exeter (sunk 27/2/1942, Battle of Java Sea)
甲巡 heavy cruiser
15 points:
乙巡 light cruiser
乙巡トロンプ型 HNLMS Tromp (severely damaged, 19-20/2/1942, Battle of Bandung Strait)
乙巡デロイテル HNLMS De Ruyter (sunk 27/2/1942, Battle of Java Sea)
乙巡ジャバ型 HNLMS Java (sunk 27/2/1942, Battle of Java Sea)
15 points:
特巡 merchant raider
乙巡 light cruiser
輸送船 transport ship

name: Pokémon TCG: Platinum Expansion
description:
The TCG set is based on the changes between Pokémon Diamond and Pearl and Platinum, including Giratina in both its Altered Forme and its Origin Forme, as well as introducing Shaymin to the Trading Card Game. It also features Team Galactic's Pokémon and various Trainer cards based on them. Platinum also introduces two new mechanics to the Trading Card Game. The first new mechanic is a new type of Pokémon known as Pokémon SP. The second new mechanic to be introduced is the Lost Zone. The Lost Zone is essentially a second discard pile: however, it is not located in the play area. Hence, cards that are moved to the Lost Zone cannot be retrieved by cards which specify the recovery of cards from the discard pile.

Platinum features 130 new cards. Theme Decks feature a full 60 Pokemon card deck with special holographic foil card , metallic coin, and damage counters.

Platinum roughly corresponds to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Galactic's Conquest.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: The Pokémon Company International, Wizards of the Coast

name: Bushido: Takashi, Ancestor Spirit
description:
Those that follow the way of Michi will often spend hours in meditation, waiting for a sign from their ancestors of the correct path they should follow or the right choice to make. In times of peril the ancestor spirits have been known to manifest in physical form. Their presence guiding the hands, minds and blades of the living, gifting them their infinite insight and knowledge gathered from their timeless vigil and granting them the courage to stay on the path. Of course this comes at a great price to the spirit for once you have left the heavens you may never return…

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Goshi
description:
From Ugo to Eddo, the loyal servants of the Takashi can be called upon to bolster the ranks of the Dragon’s armies. Their knowledge of the terrain invaluable in giving the Prefecture an added advantage in battle.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Joker-Poker-Toc
description:
To win the game, you will have to make 3 sequences of 5 cases (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) on the board game.
To do so, you will have 5 cards in hands who will allow you to chose a case on the board.
The used card is discarded and a new one is picked from the pile. The next player do the same and so on...

The rules booklet explain 3 other fun variation games for all tastes.


Pour gagner vous devez bâtir 3 séquences de 5 cases (horizontale, verticale ou diagonale) sur le tableau.
Pour y parvenir, vous aurez 5 cartes en mains qui vous serviront à choisir, à tour de rôle, une des case du tableau.
La carte utilisée est remplacée par une nouvelle carte, le joueur suivant fait de même et ainsi de suite.

Contient également les instructions pour 3 variante de jeux captivantes et pour tous les goûts.

name: Rainbow
description:
THE WINNER IS THE ONE WHO REACHES FIRST THE RAINBOW! THE GAME OF COLOURS

Wooden game. Rainbow is a wooden educational game based on colours and chance. The age is not important: children and grownups playing together have the same opportunities to win.
COMPONENTS 3 dices, 1 scorekeeper, 2 pawns made of maple wood deriving from eco-friendly forests

INSTRUCTIONS:

Pick the one who throws the dices first, who moves the green pawns and who the light blue one. Both pawns start from the 0 position behind the start. The dices are thrown in turn. To score a point you have to throw one of the winning combinations.
The one who scores first 5 points and reaches the rainbow with its pawn wins.

WINNING COMBINATIONS:
3 of the same color
2 of the same color and joker
3 jokers
1 color and 2 jokers

name: Battle of the Dnieper. 1943
description:
After the Battle of Kursk began a large-scale offensive of the Soviet Army. On leaving in 1943 to the Dnieper the Soviet command had decided immediate crossing it. This option does not have any time to the Germans to strengthen the left bank of the river and turning it into an impregnable "East Wall". Due to the haste of the operation craft sorely lacking, so the main forces crossed the Dnieper on improvised means: fishing boats, makeshift rafts of logs, barrels, tree trunks and planks. The entire burden and forcing the first battles on the left bank fell to infantry units. About heavy fights indicates the following fact - for the crossing of the Dnieper in 2438 soldiers were awarded the title Hero of the Soviet Union, which is more than the total amount awarded for the entire previous history of the awards. This title was awarded to not only the commanders of battalions and regiments, but also up to the distinguished junior officers (NCOs). Such mass awarding a single operation was the only one in the history of war. In memory of all the fallen Soviet soldiers dedicated to this game. We remember.
 
The game is designed for two players - one led by the Red Army, the other - Wehrmacht troops entrenched on the banks of the Dnieper. Soviet Player has 6 turns not only to cross the river and take a foothold, but also to keep it to the end of the game.

The game has simple rules and takes 30-60 minutes. Released in the PPP format in the second issue of the magazine Stratagema (Стратагема)
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: The Third Law
description:
Take on the role of an elite Machinist and drive your Wreckers in full metal, robot on robot combat! In The Third Law you are one with the machine, riding the grid, dealing and receiving life-threatening feedback as you strive to cripple your opponents' mind. Control the Nodes or annihilate their Wreckers; either way only one Machinist will walk away with the prize.

With a dynamically shifting battlefield and an unparalleled level of immersion, The Third Law marks a new peak in skirmish level, miniatures wargames. Constant interaction between players anchors a fluid combat system; subroutines are assigned and executed in devastating assaults. Unleash your custom code as lethal programs drive your Wreckers onward in a brutal frenzy of destruction.

There are 4 initial factions in The Third Law, each with their own back-story, motivations, look and play style. With in-faction options for Machinists, Wreckers and upgrades, each Array selected will be unique to you and the strategy you determine.

The Third Law is a skirmish level, sci-fi miniatures wargame where players take on the role of a 'Machinist'; selecting and controlling their Wrecker Arrays to do battle against rival factions in a dark, near future world.

Starting with your choice of Machinist, you will select, upgrade and control a small team of robotic combatants (Wreckers) in tabletop combat. Your ultimate goal is to inflict enough feedback damage to the opposing Machinist (while minimising the feedback you endure) to ensure that it is them and not you that is removed from the battleground in a comatose state.

You can inflict feedback in a myriad of ways but most commonly damage to a Machinist is done through the temporary loss of a Wrecker, through The Grid itself (by controlling the strategically significant 'Nodes') or through direct Machinist attacks. Depending on the faction you chose, you will discover a wide range of options and specialisms that can help you emerge victorious.

With its innovative 'subroutine' resource allocation system, The Third Law is an unparalled tactical challenge for even veteran gamers. Your choice of Machinist, Wreckers and upgrades will determine the type and quantity of resources available to you in battle. With each Wrecker making a contribution to the global subroutine pool you begin defining your strategy as you select your Array.

Futher strategic depth is delivered through an ever changing battlefield; as Nodes change hands new fronts open up and astute Machinists can take advantage of the ebb and flow of power across The Grid to inflict further punishment on their opponent. It may not be enough simply to dominate by weight of metal, often victory is seized by those who can best control the currents of energy and create crippling waves of feedback. By using your Wreckers to secure and hold Nodes deep in enemy territory you can ensure the safety of your neural pathways while inflicting untold damage on the mental capacity of your foe.

Finally, as the controlling Machinist you are able to bring your own range of special abilities to bear on the outcome of the battle. With each Machinist equipped with their own custom code you can take advantage of more efficient programmes to drive your Wreckers. Depending on your class you may find yourself able to support your Wreckers with more effective subroutines or cripple your enemies with devastating viral strikes. Whoever you chose to play as, you can create a bespoke package of abilities that reflect your playstyle and tactical preferences.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkeo Obskura
description:
Description from the publisher:
Imagine a world where all of your deepest fears have come to life, a place where monsters, terrifying creatures and deviant criminals threaten your very existence and that of the entire planet.
You and your friends are the only ones that can stop these terrible plans... Will you succeed or will you die trying?

In Arkeo Obskura a handful of heroes (from the Modern or Victorian eras or even from the early 1900s) face incredible adventures populated by zombies, witches, mummies, ghosts, the forgotten, aliens...
The game system is easy to lean and intuitive and you don’t need a Master.
You can play solitaire or with friends in cooperative or competitive mode.
You will see your characters grow, buying new characteristics and equipment from one game to the next.

Arkeo Obskura is the first release in the Survival Hees series and presents a skirmish-level Horror setting that covers forgotten cults, urban legends, ancient mythological creatures and fantastic archetypes that are the backdrop for the adventures that our Heroes will face to save themselves and to save humanity!
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: A game of two halves
description:
A game of two halves is a two players game you are the coach of a soccer team and try to won the match. Choose formation of your team (442,433,451,...), roll one dice for each player in a row. The best in midfield win an attack. If you win an attack you've the right to shoot. Substitute,penalty, red cards, star player are included.
It is easy to add chrome for example use real team with real player and give them modifiers ( do not use the star player rule)
Basically it is a multiple dice game but it incorporates a lot of basic soccer concepts and tactics so for all you footy fans out there this is a great way for a head-to-head challenge, or even a tournament with a few friends.

name: Hut ab
description:
This game can be played in 4 different ways.

1.The players have to get their 2 figures to the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. If a figure reaches or overtakes an opponent figure, this figure loses it's hat and can't move until the player rolls a 6. At the marked spaces the figures of the same color advance to an inner circle. The colored spaces between circles are safe spaces. The figures may stop there, even if they rolled more than is required to reach that space.

2. The players have to build their figures by rolling a die for the parts they need to assemble their figures.

3. This is a combination of game 1 and 2. The players have to assemble their figures before they may enter the boardgame.

4. The game is played as a pachisi variant with 2 meeples per player.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Safari-Dual
description:
Publisher's summary
Safari-Dual is a kind of Chess game, using three kinds of pieces; Lion, Elephant and Giraffe. The board and pieces are made of ceramic.

The Lion is the King and the Elephants and Giraffes are the Pawns. The winner is the first to capture the opponent's Lion, or to move their own Lion onto the opponent’s Lion's base area.

Pieces have dual natures; one is their shape and the other is their species.

Players move their own pieces and try to sandwich any of the opponent's piece or pieces. If the player's pieces making the sandwich are of the same species, this is a capture and the captured animals are removed from the board. A Lion can sandwich and capture any opponent’s pieces, using their own Elephant or Giraffe piece as the other end of the sandwich.

But the dual nature of the pieces gives the game more complexity.

For example, a player's own Elephant piece will sandwich and capture the opponent's Giraffes and Lion by using the opponent's Elephant. The same specie will work together! Likewise, the opposing Giraffes will work together to capture the opponent's Elephants and Lion. Only the two Lions will not work together.

This dual system is a unique and very interesting system first invented by the designer Mitsuo Yamamoto in 2008, and the game was first produced in 2011, a small and a large edition. A new edition is being produced in 2017 for a Kickstarter campaign.

name: Nine Beasts and Crusaders in Moosingal
description:
Publisher's summary
Nine Beasts and Crusaders in Moosingal (Moosingal no 9 Hiki no Maju to Tennku no Kishidan) is a Japanese card game set in a mythical land, a place where the Makai and the local world meet Moosingal.

There, nine animals were gathered as an Order, to recapture humans who won't grow old. But to protect the area from monsters, the Sky Knight appears in various places.

When the Order joined the Moosingal, they heard a horrible legend. "Do not hunt the Dragon of the Five Heads, the Dragon of the Five Heads will attack as a zombie."

In the battle, the cursed soldiers become monsters, and attack as zombies. Even while in the mercy of the humans turned demonic beasts, the Order must defeat them with the help of angelic humanity.

Jealousy and desire are the most horrible monsters swirling inside humans.

Nine Beasts and Crusaders in Moosingal is a trick-taking card-game in which players must co-operate to help defeat the monsters, but also try to compete for the highest final score. The cards have an Art Nouveau design to them.

name: Whoo Hop?
description:
You and your friends can help Little Red Riding Hood get to her Grandmother's house before the Wolf. Remember which pine tree he is hiding behind in the forest and choose the right pine tree to move forward. The Huntsman, foxes and imps will help you along the way.

A kids' cooperative game roll-n-move without rolling the dice (you pick a card that represents an action) with a classic theme, featuring a memory element.

How to play:

The first player must take a card from the market, turn it and show to others. They must then perform the action indicated on the card. The following player will do the same and so on. Game ends as soon as tree reach the grandmother, once there all you need to do it flip them over and see who is hiding at the bottom:

If the Hunter and Little Red Riding Hood get ahead of the Wolf, then the whole team won and they beat the game!

However, if the first one that came to the grandmother is the gray Wolf, then if the next one who makes it to the grandmother is the Hunter, and not the Little Red Riding Hood then the team can still win as the Hunter can beat the grey wolf.

Different Levels of difficulty
Easy level: During preparation of the game Little Red Riding Hood is necessary to remove the card "Cheeky Fox" from the marked cards.

Intermediate: Before the game, mix all the trees.

Difficult level: During preparation of the Little Red Riding Hood Whoo hop game is necessary to remove the card "Curious Gnome" from the marked cards. Before the game, mix all the trees.

Cards with the characters pictures:
Little Red Riding Hood: You need to make one move forward with the tree, beneath which the Little Red Riding Hood hides.

Hunter: you need to make one move forward with the tree, beneath which the Hunter hides.

Wolf: you need to make one move forward with the tree, beneath which the gray Wolf hides.

Action cards:
All forward: you need to make one move forward with all the tree's.

Curious Gnome: you need to choose one tree and find out who is hiding under it.

Cheeky Fox: you need to swap any of two tree's around so that they stand in each others place.

name: Form Line of Battle: Naval Wargames Rules for the Age of Sail 1650 to 1820
description:
Description from the designer:

These rules enable you to take on the role of Hornblower RN, John Paul Jones or even Horatio Nelson. They are prepared in such a way that you can take command of a squadron of Ships of the Line, or on larger games with many players you may be given command of but one vessel. We would recommend that each player should have up to 3 vessels under his command. Experienced players could probably handle more once they have got an understanding of the game system. The basic rules are quick to learn, and there are a host of optional extras to give the feel for the period.

The basic rules are designed for games set around the turn of the 18th to 19th Century, however they are equally able to be used for the Dutch Wars of the 17th Century, and there are rules covering this.

The game sequence is managed using a card system, which randomizes when, and whose, command and action phases happen. There are advanced and more detailed rules for actions using frigates and smaller vessels.

9 Scenarios and 25 typical ship classes are provided to get you into the game, as well as an easy to follow system to create your own ships based on historical research.

• recommended scale 1/600 to 1/2400
• complexity: 6/10
• level of detail: 6/10
• avg game length 2 hours
• dice required: D6
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Um el Tuweisat
description:
Also known as "The Little Goat Game".

This is considered the children's version of Um El Bagara, and it originated in Africa, in the area now known as the Sudan.

The board is a 2x3 mancala board, and 3 stones are placed in each of the six playing wells. Players take turns moving stones by picking up all the stones in a well then dropping a stone in each well until they run out, moving either clockwise or counter-clockwise depending on the position of the well. A well with only a single stone cannot be moved.

After your move, starting with the well you last placed a stone into, any wells that have exactly two stones may be placed in your scoring well. If there is a well that you cannot score (it has a number of stone other than two and cannot be your well), then any that come after it in sequence may not be scored either.

The game ends when neither player can make a legal move. Any stones left on a players side of the board are added to those in his scoring well. Whoever has the most stones is the winner.

name: Malachai Stout's Family Reunion
description: Malachai Stout’s Family Reunion is intended to be played around a table by eight people (but extra players can be added as investigators). Each of the players will be assigned a character and given a character sheet that explains who or what their character is, what information their character knows, and how their character should respond to events that occur during the game. In this particular Murder-Mystery Mini, the guests will be playing the roles of the largely dysfunctional members of the Stout family, who have gathered at their ancestral home for a family reunion, hosted by the elderly Malachai Stout.
categories: Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Wer kann rechnen?
description:
Six games to learn maths.

Game 1 (find the right amount): Find the card with the right amount of lines on it given a number.

Game 2 (amount matching game): Race to put the same number of tokens next to your card as there are lines on the card (or as the number shown if you use the number side).

Game 3 (sorting task): Sort the numbers from 1 to 10 (or to 20).

Game 4 (dominoes with amounts and numbers): play dominoes with cards that have a number on one end and an amount of lines (or pictures) on the other end.

Game 5 (calculation problems): Cover a board of calculation problems with the solution number cards.

Game 6 (calculation bingo): As above but the solution cards are called out as with bingo, the player who first finds a matching problem on their board gets the card.

name: Impulse: All Your Base
description:
In Impulse: All Your Base, an expansion for Impulse that can be played with or without the Brake for Launch expansion, players build bases with communal special powers to further their cause in their local areas of space. In addition to the public impulse track, a parallel public layout track indicates the current shifting powers of bases for all players. Players leverage layout cards to perform cards of like type on the board on a corner of which they have built a base.

All Your Base is an area-control add-on for players who wish to focus more on developing their pocket of space to match a strategy. At least one base must be built to score any points at all. More bases multiply points scored, and more points are required for victory. Bases can be destroyed easily by enemy cruisers should they approach close enough, or if uncontested nearby, captured for a devastating impact on the previous player.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Capturing Cage
description:
User summary
Capturing Cage is a game of tag, scientists versus an out-of-control android (similar to games like Scotland Yard or Pyramid of Pengqueen).

The scientist players secretly move, and mark the position on their player sheet. Then the android player moves the pawn, and asks the scientists "Gotcha?".

The scientists must respond such as "I'm caught", or "Near you", or "You passed me". Using this response, the android must deduce their position and hunt them down.

Victory condition for the scientists are to shut down predetermined number of servers to deactivate the android. Victory for the android is to capture all scientists, or claim a predetermined amount of energy, or to stay alive for 12 rounds.

Some other special actions exist for both scientists and android. The publisher says it is a short but deep game of tag.

The artwork for the game is by the publisher and design group Decoct Design.

Publisher's summary

科学者と暴走したアンドロイドの鬼ごっこです。

科学者側プレイヤーはプレイヤーシートに移動先の番号を記入します。

アンドロイド側プレイヤーはコマを移動させ科学者たちに問いかけます。

「捕まったかい？」

これに対し科学者たちは「捕まった」「近くにいる」「通り過ぎたよ」など返答をします。

このヒントをもとにアンドロイドは科学者たちを追い詰めていきます。

科学者側の勝利条件はアンドロイドを止めるためサーバーを規定数停止させること。
アンドロイド側の勝利条件は科学者を全員捕まえる、規定数のエネルギーを溜める、１２ラウンドを生き抜くの３つです。

他にも科学者、アンドロイドともに特殊アクションもあり、短時間で濃密な鬼ごっこを楽しめるゲームとなってます。
categories: Deduction, Party Game, Real-time, Science Fiction

name: The Joust
description:
Description from the designer:

The Joust is a 2-player card game that uses a standard deck of cards along with the two jokers. You will also need pencil and paper or 4d6 [2- white, 1-red and 1-blue] used to track knight advantage and number of lances broken.

The design is component ready since it needs only a deck of cards and I will post the rules later today.

The Joust is played where two knights ride horses in a list with armor and lance trying to knock the other knight off his horse.

A win will be either unhorsing your opponent "which is an automatic win or breaking three lances.

As you ride down the list you will try to gain an advantage while also trying to center your lance on your opponents shield on impact.

You will use 8 cards to create the initial list. The jokers will represent each knight, and 9 cards [from each player] will represent each players shield.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Three Cheers for Master: Santa Claws
description:
4 promo unique cards for Three Cheers for Master.

These cards was released for Christmas. It's four times the same except the funny text which is different on each card.

name: The Tears of Sango (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
Tears of Sango is a science fiction story set 100 years in our future using the T.I.M.E. Stories base game system. A global catastrophe is about to befall the Earth. Can TIME agents from even farther in the future save humanity (and themselves) from annihilation?

The scenario is played in two phases (two decks). Players must complete Phase 1 before continuing with Phase 2. Rules are provided to utilize two, three, or four players (receptacles), with eight receptacle cards to choose from. The Mission to save Earth is in your hands.

This is a downloadable print-and-play scenario for T.I.M.E. Stories (English language). The file is formatted for double-sided printing with 180 playable cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Science Fiction

name: Leader Foot
description:
Realistic football (soccer) simulation using magnetic board and pawns.
3 difficulty levels give a gameplay from a simple family game to real pedagogic and professional simulation.

With the first level of difficulty, each player gets a maximum of 5 actions per turn and must choose between attack, defense, shooting attempt, shooting, shooting defense and goalkeeper.

A special dice thrown give the result of each action and let the players know if it result with a goal or not after the succeded actions were simulated moving the pawns and the ball directely on the board.

The second and third levels of difficulty add more specifics and complex rules to the first ones by introducing real professional and international rules as corner, free-kick, offside, penalty and throw in.

Each player get 1 minute for its turn and the game can be set for 1 ou 2 45 minutes half times.

As a real soccer match, the best goal scored player is the winner.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Silver Creek Shootout
description:
Place your Posse Cards in front of your draw pile with the cowboy facing the opposite player.
Pull 3 randomly drawn cards from you number cards. Next roll the die to match the cards. If the card and die match, move that number card up to the hit area, reminding you that you have secured one shot. If you match 2 cards with one roll, you receive the Jam Card. (For one turn you only have 2 cards to roll to match.)

If at any time one player is ever 2 cards ahead, the opposing player "feels desperate" and takes the Quick Draw Card and goes twice for one turn. If no cards are matched, then replace any card of your choice with a randomly drawn card from the draw pile. When ever 4 cards have hit, then one Posse Card is turned so that the Grave is facing the opposite player.

name: Wolfe Tone Rebellion: Irish Rebellion of 1798
description:
In 1796 the charismatic Irish rebel, Wolfe Tone, convinced the Revolutionary government of France and one of its finest generals, Lazare Hoche, that Ireland was poised for rebellion. Ireland would rise, he insisted, if France would only lend its support. That year, a force of 14,000 Frenchmen on 43 ships evaded the British fleet and sailed into Bantry Bay, Cork County, Ireland where rough weather forced them to abandon their operation and return to France.

Two years and three audiences with Napoleon later, Tone tried again. Three waves of French landings were planned to coordinate with a general rising of the United Irishmen (Protestant and Catholic alike) all across the island. Unfortunately, word leaked and key leaders were arrested in Dublin, triggering an early rising, quickly and brutally put down by a combination of professional troops, recently raised fencibles, local militia and orange order yeomen. The rebellion staggered on through September but only in County Wexford and later in County Mayo with minimal French support, did the rebellion meet with any success.

As for the French, the first wave of 1100 men under the able command of Jean Humbert, stormed ashore in County Mayo in August, 1798. A smaller force landed in Donegal in September under the command of Napper Tandy. Humbert enjoyed a few successes but soon surrendered to the overwhelming force Lord Cornwallis brought to bear. Soon after, Tandy abandoned the Emerald Isle when he realized he could no longer be of service to Humbert. A month later and further North off the coast of Donegal, a second wave of 3000 men under Jean Hardy and Wolfe Tone himself met with disaster. Hardy’s fleet ran afoul of the British fleet and Tone was captured. Imprisoned and condemned to hang, Tone committed suicide. The third and largest wave of French soldiers never sailed.

Without determined French support the Irish rebellion of 1798 stood little chance of success. Historically it was a bloody great uncoordinated fiasco made worse by the early demise of Tone’s benefactor, General Hoche to consumption. History might have been different if the stars had aligned, if those key Irish leaders had not been captured and their plans revealed, if the rebels had received a sizeable number of French and British arms, if Hoche had survived. If a second and even a third wave of French regulars had landed, and if those French regulars had landed while the rebellion was still vibrant, then – then, as WOLFE TONE’S RISING reveals, England would have had a serious problem.

WOLFE TONE’S RISING puts the aforementioned what-ifs into play. A short game of seven turns pits English regulars and loyalist militia against the Irish rebels and their French allies. Here, the French play a shell game with the British attempting to land troops in Ireland not once but three times. Here, unknown morale plays a vital role to the outcome of every battle. Here, Local leaders are not cookie cut-outs but individuals who enjoy unique abilities in battle. And here, each battle is assisted by a battle board utilizing fresh mechanics that make each battle a mini-game unto itself. A note on the leaders used: British and French leaders are key historical leaders, whereas Irish rebel leaders are largely representational. Anonymous loyalist leaders represent a mixture of militia and yeomen. Loyalist hierarchy was either nonexistent or too confusing to identify specific names.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Alchenemy
description:
You are an alchemist for "The Kingdom". In order to keep your job and become the Royal Alchemist you must make the most "Coin" for the Treasury. Starting with only Air, Earth, Fire, and Water as ingredients, play Formula cards from your hand to make valuable Materials. These Materials are worth Coin towards winning, but can also be used as ingredients for Formulas that steal, transform, destroy or regenerate cards.
Alchenemy combines elements of resource management (cards that count towards winning can be discarded to perform actions), “take that!” (inevitably, someone breaks out the Aqua Regia and dissolves something you were really attached to), and a novel mechanic that gives players some control over when the game ends: you choose whether to draw from a common, limitless deck of basic resources or a limited, personal deck of more powerful cards – with the catch that the game ends when any personal stack is exhausted. Two, three, or four people may play and it should take first time players about an hour to finish.

name: Humanity Hates Hillary, Too: Expansion Two
description:
Humanity Hates Hillary, Too: Expansion Two is an unofficial expansion pack to other Party Games including Cards Against Humanity.

Includes 110 cards (80 White Cards, 30 Black Cards).
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political

name: Stadt Land Spielt Limitierte Sonderdrucke 2013
description:
A single punch board containing expansions for 4 different games - Elfenland, Zooloretto, Belfort, and Stone Age.

Expansions are:
Elfenland: Back to the Roads
Zooloretto: Tapir
Belfort: Guild Promo Pack #1
Stone Age: Casino

It was released for the Stadt Land Spielt event that took place on September 2013 throughout Germany.
publishers: ABACUSSPIELE, AMIGO, Hans im Glück, Pegasus Spiele

name: ¿Los ves?
description:
This is a visual perception game.

There are always two equal drawings ... But only two!
Each card has 8 items and one and only one is repeated in another card. Can you find it?

¿Los ves? ("Do you see them?") is a set of multiple and very entertaining games of concentration and visual perception both for children and adults.

Description (Spanish):

Siempre hay dos iguales... Pero solo dos! Cada carta tiene 8 elementos, y uno y solo uno, está repetido en otra carta ¿puedes encontrarlo?

¿Los Ves? es un set de múltiples y muy entretenidos juegos de concentración y percepción visual para grandes y chicos.

Juegos de percepción visual

name: The Smash Hits Game
description:
"Could you become the richest, swankiest, most successful pop star in the world? Release records! Have hits! make pots of cash!

First you have to get a music record out and battle your way to the top of the hit parade against the other players. But keep your wits about you, because you'll have to use your skill and judgement to determine when to cash in on your chart success before you tumble down pop's dastardly dumper!"

Players move around the board collecting pieces to create their records. There are four pieces to every record A,B,C and D. A and B make the song name and C and D make up the first line of the single. You have to then make up, oh and also, sing the next line for your single to make it into the charts.

Whilst moving around the board you can steal, pass and lose un-used pieces of the record. But once it's created and in the charts you start to move up the charts and cash in on the popularity. Game play moves clockwise around the board and spaces and action/question cards indicate what the players must do to move play along. create the most successful records and collect money at the right time (preferably before the records slumps) to win!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Negotiation, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Journey of Existence
description:
Journey of Existence is a three to five player card game in which players journey through a world filled with dreamy art. Each choice a player makes affects them as the game proceeds.

Key Features of the Game:

Friendly Player Interaction: Journey of Existence is a bit friendlier than most games of its type as there are no discarding or stealing mechanics. It isn't free from all chaos however as its main mechanics of sharing and passing valuable cards around can be just as scary. Strategic players will usually win the game by planning out what cards to pass and which to keep once the inevitable passing happens.

High Replay-ability: Journey of Existence is a game that has so many combinations of card plays that every game experience is unique. The core game mechanics, victory point combination possibilities, and card passing theme ensure that every game is different from the last.

Journey Goals: The game revolves around the theme of Journeying through your Existence by picking up Life Traits important to your style of play. Depending on the type of Journey you decide to have and how it relates to the other players will decide the outcome of the game.

Life Actions: In Journey of Existence your time is limited. Each turn provides 4 Life Actions which can be used to do a variety of things. To do well you will need to balance your plays and keep a close eye on what other players have done in their Journeys so that you can win the Journey Goal Cards at the end.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Burn & Loot: Wrath of the Northmen
description:
Wrath of the Northmen is the first supplement for Burn & Loot, the historical miniatures wargaming rule system for Medieval Era.

In this book you will find a brief history of the Viking, a comprehensive map showing all the Viking's raid, the rules you need to field your new Armies, plus new Scenarios and rules for a Campaign in the Viking period. The Army Lists you will find in this supplement have been extensively tested, so you and your opponent can deploy forces that are as balanced as possible.

This book also includes new Traits and Reactions wich, along with your skill as a player, let you relive the battles of the Dark Ages - especially those involving Vikings. This book covers the early medieval period in western and northern Europe (a period roughly from 650AD until 1070AD).

To play this supplement you will need a copy of the Burn & Loot wargame rules.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Eligor Larington – Golden Templar Costume
description: An new Unique Ability with alternative art for Eligor Larington from BattleCON: Devastation of Indines.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Hikaru Sorayama – Defender of Justice Costume
description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Hikaru Sorayama from BattleCON: War of Indines.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Hikaru Sorayama – World Warrior Costume
description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Hikaru Sorayama from BattleCON: War of Indines.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Luc Von Gott – Leader of the Four Heroes Costume
description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Luc Von Gott from BattleCON: War of Indines.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Cadenza – Space Invader Costume
description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Cadenza from BattleCON: War of Indines.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Discover Moscow
description:
Everyone is moving on the Moscow subway map. In the beginning every player receives 3 cards with photos of Moscow tourist sights. The goal of the game is to visit your 3 sights and return to the starting point. To win the game you need to do it first. Main difficulty is to recall what subway station is the closest to sight. On the back of the sight card there are 3 hints which can be earned during the game.

In order to move players need to answer quiz question about Moscow and make stakes on the right answer. Every turn player can make secretly a stake or not to bid. After all bids were made variants of answers are revealed - participating players choose their answers. Those who answered correctly can make a move (no bid - 1 station, otherwise - according to the number on their bid). Those whose answer were wrong lose their appropriate bid tokens. Those tokens can be replenished on the specified areas of the map. For 2 moving points player can instead receive a hint about one of their sights. For each sight there are 2 hints, for the 3rd hint player receives exact location of the sight. Also there are cards with random events which are revealed at different locations.

name: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
description:
A Skirmish Board and Card Game for 2 Players set on 26 October 1881 in Tombstone, Arizona.

An 8x8 square grid chessboard is use to represent Fremont Street in the town of Tombstone.

One player is the Earps. The other player is the Cowboys. The aim of the game is to kill 3 opposing gunmen.

There are 2 Decks:
1. The Action Deck
2. The Wound Deck

Each player sets up his men on his back 4 rows, up to one man per row, with none of the men touching or sharing a column or on the farthest left or right columns.
Each player starts with a hand of 5 cards.

Players take turns.
Each turn has 3 Phases:
1. Draw Phase
- The hand is filled to 5 Action cards.
- For each of a player's men killed, 1 less card is drawn.
2. Move Phase
- A layer plays "move" cards to move his men.
- Each man may move only once per turn.
- The man must be moved the exact number of spaces written on the card.
3. Shoot Phase
- A player may play a card to have a man shoot.
- Each man may shoot a max of once per turn.
- The shot is fired at an exact range as written on the card.
The Shot will automatically “Hit” unless the opponent plays a defence card to negate it.
- If a shot is not negated 1 wound card is drawn from the Wound Deck and its effects applied to the target (e.g. killed, wounded, not wounded)

A player wins when he has killed three of his opponent's gunmen.

name: House of Habsburg
description:
A card game for 3-6 players in which each player represents a branch of the Royal Habsburg Dynasty. Players try to make and steal the most and best holdings.

Players share a common deck. There are 5 types of Cards:
Person Cards
Holding Cards
Claim Cards
Succession Cards
Disaster Cards

To start each player is dealt 3 cards.

Players take turns with each turn consisting of 4 Phases:
1. Draw Phase
- Draw 1 card from the deck and put it in your hand.
2. Meld Phase
- You may make 1 or more melds. A meld consists of exactly 3 cards from your hand: 1 person card, 1 holding card, and 1 claim card. (If the top card of the discard pile is a holding card, you may use that instead of a Holding card from your hand.)
- Every time you make a meld, gain 1 Victory Tokens equal to the value of the Person card.
3. Event Phase
- You may play (discard) 1 succession card or 1 disaster card or 1 Claim card or 1 Person card.
- If you play a Succession, steal a target meld with a claim value equal to or less than the value of the Succession card.
- If you play a Disaster, discard a target meld with a Person card equal to or less than the value of the Disaster card.
- If you play a Person card, draw 2 cards from the deck.
- If you play a Claim card, steal 1 random card from target players hand.
4. End Phase
- Max hand size is 5 cards. Discard excess cards.

Each Melded Holding card is worth from 1 to 5 Victory Points.
Each Victory Token is worth 1 VP.

The game ends when there are no cards left in the deck and no player has any cards left in their hand that they can or will play. The player with the most Victory Tokens and Victory Points worth of melded Holding cards they control at the end of the game wins.

name: Olika
description:
Olika is a trick-taking game designed for three players (with variants for two and four). Each hand, players secretly select bid cards that show how many game points they stand to win or lose, and whether they're aiming to get the most card points, the fewest or somewhere in-between. After each player has dealt once, the bid values increase so the stakes get higher. The player with the highest score at the end of three rounds is the winner.

The game can be played with a specially-suited deck or with a modified French deck.

name: Indus Valley
description:
A card game for 2-7 players.

Each player represents a city of the Bronze Age Indus Valley Civilization (IVC), also known as the Harappan Culture. The IVC flourished (in present day Pakistan) 3300 - 1300 BCE.

The game is conducted over 10 turns. Each turn represents 200 years.

Players share a common deck. Each card has the trait of one or more scoring categories of seven different types:
1. Farming
2. Animals
3. Materials
4. Products
5. Trade
6. Building
7. Culture

Each turn has 4 Phases:
1. Draw Phase
- Each player draws 3 cards OR fills their hand to 7 cards.
2. Trade Phase
- Players may trade Cards and Points with each other. Trades do not have to be equal.
3. Meld Phase
- Each player may make 1 or more melds in this phase. A meld must consist of 3 or more cards in the same category. A meld scores points in that category equal to the square of the number of cards in the meld.
4. End Phase
- Max hand size is 5. Discard excess cards.

At the end of the game each player looks at his 7 point categories. A player's final score is equal to his score in his lowest scoring category. The player with the highest final score wins.

name: Nine Homeworlds
description:
Nine Homeworlds is a 9-Card Nanogame, in which the players assume the role of norse clan leaders who want to collect as much glory as possible before the end of the worlds approaches. Dice rolling and tactical movement are just as important as wise calculation of the enemies' possibilities to gather as much glory as possible before the game ends.

Players roll a die and choose whether they want to move one of their heroes to another world or quest a world they are currently at. By moving into better positions, players try to gain maximum points from questing.

name: Nugget
description:
Nugget is a card game about building the best poker hand.

Played over multiple rounds. Each round, the deck is shuffled and each player is dealt one card. The rest of the cards are placed in the middle of the table in a face down stack. On a turn, a player draws either the top card from the deck or a card from the center (if any). When they draw a card from the deck, they may keep it or they may discard it to the center of the table. If they discard it, they must draw another card from the deck, which they must keep. This occurs until everyone has seven cards in hand. From those seven cards, each player builds their best five-card poker hand and is awarded points based on the strength of that poker hand. Whoever has the most points after multiple rounds wins.

Nugget is in the same family as Sacramento and Bonanza.

Played with a standard deck of cards, published in Reiner Knizia's book Blazing Aces!: A Fistful of Family Card Games.

name: Jump Wars
description:
A Space Empire Game for 3-5+ players using simultaneous movement per written orders.

Play is conducted on a 10x10 grid populated at random with counters (30 x void, 20 x star field, 10 x cluster, 20 x black hole, 20 x nebula). The counters indicate the resources to be gain at that location or restrictions/advantages conveyed by that location.

Each player gets a set of counters of a unique colour, plus one unique counter that designates their homeworld. Players share a common set of resource tokens and a common deck comprising two types of card – basic technologies (of which there are 12 with each player starting at level 1 in each) and special technologies (which do not have levels – players either have them or they don’t).

Each turn has 8 Phases. Within a phase, the start player goes first and play proceeds clockwise.

1. Draw Phase.
- Each player draws 2 cards from the Tech Deck.

2. Trade Phase
- Players may trade/gift Tech cards and resource tokens, as well as make promises and alliances.
- The player with the highest trade level may steal a random card from any target opponents hand.
- The player with the highest diplomacy level may declare one target player as an ally. The Ally may not jump fleets onto the diplomat’s currently occupied spaces.

3. Tech Phase
- Each player discards one Tech Card from their Hand and increases their level in that tech by one. Alternatively, a player may discard one Special Tech Card from their hand and gain that special ability.
- Any player then may discard 2 cards of the same type to increase their level in that tech by one.

4. Mine Phase
- Each player gains Resource Tokens (RT) for star fields, clusters and homeworlds occupied, and for Tech cards discarded. The RT gained is modified by the manufacturing level of the player.

5. Build Phase
- Players may buy fleets. A fleet costs 4 plus your attack and defence levels minus your miniaturization level. All fleets start stacked on your homeworld.

6. Jump Phase
- All movement is simultaneous. All players must write movement (jump) orders which are revealed at the same time. An order moves 1 fleet or a stack of fleets you control from one space to another space. Players must include the start and finish coordinates as well as the number of Fleets jumping in the Jump Order. Jump distance and fleet size is dictated by jump level and logistics level

7. Fight Phase
- If 2 or more opposing fleets occupy the same space, there will be combat until only one side remains. Attack order is determined by Initiative level and the damage delivered is based on fleet size, attack level and defence level of the opposing fleet.

8. Final Phase
- Max hand size is 3 + the player’s research level. All players discard excess cards.

Victory is achieved by occupying all opponents’ Homeworlds at the end of the turn.

name: Are You An ALiEN?
description:
‘Are You An ALiEN?’is a tactical question and answer card game, but don’t panic, it’s NOT a trivia quiz.

The earth is being invaded by ALiENs!
Not in a ‘Zap! Bang! Crash!’ way, but slowly and silently…
Unknown to most they are secretly replacing us with exact copies of the people we know.

NOW ANYONE COULD BE AN ALiEN!

Fortunately, it has become apparent that the copies take time to fully assimilate our thoughts and memories.
Following extensive background research and testimonies from family, friends and acquaintances the authorities have compiled a set of questions with verified responses designed to expose the galactic imposters.

Mr Doombar, Mrs Mayhem, Lord Uppercrust, Professor Banana, Lady Toff, Mrs Ditch, Doctor Butt, Harry, Otto, Norma and many others are all under suspicion.
Everyone will be asked one critical question - failure to respond with the established answer will reveal the ALiEN within!

‘Are You An ALiEN?’ is a card game for 2-6 players.
The deck is made up of 180 cards. On each turn players have a simple choice;- draw a number of cards from the deck or select a card belonging to another player and ask them a question.
As a human Subject suspected of being an ALiEN you must try to answer your question correctly.
However, you will also assume the role of an interrogation Agent with the 'ALiEN Imposter Detection Unit'.
In all, the cards feature over 300 different types of question and answer, after a quick look you will have to remember all the information on your drawn card(s) before placing them face-down in front of you. The more details you can remember the greater the chance of answering your question correctly.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Role Playing

name: Legends of Rome
description:
A card game for 2-6 Players themed around the History of Rome from its earliest Origins to the Fall of the West. Each player in turn takes control of the History of Rome.

There are 6 decks representing 6 consecutive ages, each played in turn:
1. Early Rome
2. Early Republic
3. Middle Republic
4. Late Republic
5. Empire
6. Decline
Cards are of 11 different types: Leader, Threat, Conquest, Politics, Culture, Build, Religion, Disaster, Defect, Origin and Battle.

Players share common sets of Gold Coins, Ambition Tokens, Legion Markers, Fate Tokens, Faction Tokens, Threat Markers, Victory Tokens and Power Tokens.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 19 Phases:

- Destiny Phase. Gain 1 Fate Token.
- Fate Phase. Flip over the top 2 cards from the current deck and place them face-up in their respective available card piles. If a card is an action card, place it in your hand.
- Ambition Phase. Gain 2 ambition tokens.
- Taxes Phase. Gain 1D6 gold plus 1 gold per conquest card you control.
- Disaster Phase. If there is a major disaster card available cause a target player to roll 3 times on the disaster table. If there is a Defect card available cause a target player to roll once on the disaster table.
- Leader Phase. If a Leader card is available you may take it for 1 Fate token.
- Senate Phase. Discard a Politics card to gain one of a range of benefits.

- Legion Phase. Pay 1 gold per Legion you control. You may raise extra Legions for 4 Gold each.
- Threat Phase. If there is a card in the Threat pile roll 1D6 and resolve.
- Conquest Phase. If there are no cards in the Threat pile and there are one or more cards in the Conquest pile you may go conquering by paying 1 ambition token and 1 gold coin to attack one target conquest card in the conquest pile.
- Politics Phase. If there are any Politics cards available, you may take all of them for 1 fate token.
- Power Phase. If you have a Leader that is not already in power, you may have him attempt to seize power by spending 3 ambition tokens and rolling 1D6 against a table and resolving.
- Build Phase. If there are any Build cards available, you may purchase them for 1 ambition token and 4 gold each. Immediately gain 5VP.
- Religion Phase. If there are any Religion cards available, you may buy them for 1 gold each. Immediately gain 2 VP for each.
- Culture Phase. If there are any Culture or Origin cards available, you may buy them for 1 fate token each. Immediately gain 1 VP for each Culture card and 3 VP for each Origin card.
- Games Phase. Spend 1 gold to roll on the games table and gain corresponding benefits.
- Scoring Phase. Any player who has a Leader with a Power Token gets 1 VP and 1 Gold. The Player with the most Religion cards gets 1 VP.
- Corruption Phase. Discard Gold, Ambition, Legions, Fate and action cards down to their maximum permissible levels.
- End Phase. Roll 1D6 for each of your Leaders. On a roll of 6 a Leader is discarded.

An Age Ends when a turn starts and there are no cards left in the deck. All Leader and Origin cards controlled by players are discarded. All Available cards are discarded.
Each player scores 1 VP for each Build card they control. The Player with the most Culture cards gets 10 VP. The Player with the least Culture cards loses 5 VP.
Break out the deck for the next Age.

The game ends after the 6th Deck is used up.
