We hope you'll have as much fun playing fortune & Folly as we do!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Phillip Island
description: Roll-and-move board game designed by The Phillip Island Tourism Board to promote Phillip Island in Victoria Australia. The goal of the games is to be the first to travel around the island.

name: Beard Wars: The Card Game
description:
Beard Wars is a game played with 2 or 4 players.
The object of Beard Wars is to collect as many of your opponents Beard Cards before the deck runs out. Some of the cards contain abilities to help you carry out this objective. Read them carefully.

Setup:
Each player has their own deck. There will be a draw pile, discard pile, and trophy pile.

Draw Pile: This is your main deck of cards. At the beginning of each turn, you draw until you have 7 cards in your hand.

Discard Pile: This is where your used cards go. Including Instant Plays and your own used Beard Cards.

Trophy Pile: When you win a card from your opponent, place it here so you can count them up at the end.

—description from the designer

name: Oklahoma Sixer
description:
6ラホマミキサー (Oklahoma Sixer) is a card game in which players are shamans who, at a festival held on one day each year, summon elemental spirits for a dance.

Each player chooses one of two actions each turn: play (from a hand of cards) a dance partner to his or her lead spirit, or play a card to one of two rows at the center of the table.

If the two rightmost cards in either card row in the center add up to six and are capped with a zero, players swap dance partners. This sometimes eliminates players' lead spirits as combinations of some elements (such as fire and water) are volatile. If either row has a total of six cards, a scoring occurs. The player with the highest combination of lead spirit and dance partner chooses all cards of one color from the row that caused the scoring. The player with the second highest combination follows, and so on. Cards taken from the row are set aside to score at the end of the game.

The game ends at some point after the stock deck runs out of cards for a second time. Players then score the cards that they have collected over the course of the game. Each card is worth one point, but bonuses are awarded according to the number of score cards of the same rank that each player has. The player with the most points wins.
publishers: 大気圏内ゲームズ (Taikikennai Games)

name: Charades: Kid Edition
description: Contains 50 double-sided cards and an instruction sheet to play Charades with kids.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: Bunny Farm
description:
Left from Albuquerque, past the Toad Empire, and far past McGregor's farm lies the small, fertile, and (mostly) peaceful land of Bunnitopia, which is home to the four great bunny families: Ice Cream, Chocolate, Macaroon, and Biscuit.

Harvesting carrots is serious business in Bunny Farm, and the four families are willing to do whatever it takes to build the largest and most successful farm in the land. Build factories, expand your farm, sabotage crops, or even manipulate the markets in your favor. However, you'd better build some fences before the dreaded GIANT BUNNY comes and eats ALL your crops. Spring is almost here. Better get harvesting soon!

Bunny business is brutal!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Party Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle
description:
The game was patented in 1908. "It is listed in the Gamages Christmas Bazaar Catalogue of 1913, where it is priced at 2s 6d and described as an 'exciting war game, played by 2 or 4 persons by pieces representing Generals, Cavalry, Guns, Infantry and Ammunition, on a battlefield". (from C. G. Lewin, Wargames and Their History).

Battle is played on a regular 8x8 chess board. Pieces that are square tiles with symbols, letters, and digits on to describe the type, movement and attack patterns of each. When played with four players, the pieces on each side is divided between two players so that one commands the eight infantry units and the other player commands the remaining eight units.

name: ¡Adivina!
description:
Get ready for laughing afternoons where your family and friends will take on the most ridiculous identities and try to describe, interpret or draw them so that others can guess.
Players form groups. A player starts by choosing an easy or difficult card. He then draws a card from each different deck available, A, B and C showing it only to his teammate. Those cards have different identities in order 1, 2 and 3. The other team, without knowing and seeing the cards has to choose 3 numbers between 1 and 3, which will be the sequence of the identities that the previous team must try to describe.
You then have to describe those identities to your teammate. If he correctly guess an easy identity he scores 1 points, and if he guess a difficult one he will score 3 points.
The team who scores more points wins.

name: Roll and Cover
description:
An educational game to help students practice addition and subtraction math facts.

Choose one of the three boards available boards, each with slightly different rules.

In the basic form of the game, players each start the game with 10 cubes. On your turn, you roll the dice, sum them, and find that space. If the space is blank, put one of your cubes there. If it has one cube of another color, bump that cube -- replace it with your cube and return the bumped cube to its owner. If it has 2 cubes (of any color), miss your turn. If it has one cube of your color, put a second there and 'lock' the space -- it is now safe from being bumped. The first player to get rid of all their cubes wins.

On other boards, players roll 2 dice and take the difference or roll 3 dice and take the sum of all 3.

The game can be played with more than 2 players if each starts with fewer cubes (3 players use 7 each, 4 players us 5 each).

This game has been made freely available online as a print-and-play.

The game can be played in a less aggressive fashion by giving each player their own board. On your turn, roll and cover the appropriate space. The first player to cover a specified number of spaces wins. In that form the game is called "Roll and Cover" instead of "Bump".
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Math, Print & Play

name: Pictionary Junior: Play it With Clay
description:
This edition combines the fun of charades with modeling clay.

The object is to guess a word from the sculpture made by your teammates. Every time a word is correctly guessed, that teams advances on the board. The first team to the finish space wins.

The top card is turned over and both teams sculptors look at the word on the card. The timer is turned over and both teams begin sculpting and guessing at the same time. The first team to correctly guess spins the spinner and advances to the color indicated

If no teams gets it in the alloted time, a new card is drawn and the process is repeated.

The first team to the finish space wins.

name: Word for Word
description:
From the box:
Word for Word is an addictive family game which combines questions on synonyms, rhyming words, definitions and Pot Luck! Its great fun, exciting and educational.

Word for Word is a MUST for crossword enthusiasts, word game lovers and anyone from school children to adults wanting to develop a more varied, powerful and impressive vocabulary.

name: Dog Rallye: Active Kids
description:
Let’s get rolling! The rolling toy moves quickly across the floor, and colorful treats fly out from both sides. Now you players need to be quick! Pretend to be a dog and chase the rolling toy. The first player to collect the right dog treats will win the Dog Rally!
An active movement game.

How to play:

All players call out "woof, woof, woof" together. On the third bark the oldest player pushes the rolling toy forcefully forwards.
Now everyone follows the rolling toy on all fours at the same time, hunting for and collecting treats that fall out of the rolling toy on the left and right.
Now take the treats you collected and sort them into the matching colored holes in your lawn section on the board.
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Batte Bugs: Samurai
description:
Description of the game:
As a player receives equal and opposing army of insects, consisting of 6 groups - each with its own characteristics.
Behind the screens, with the help of special tablets, players give orders to their armies or units, which are then executed simultaneously.Orders are actions by putting some counters on tablets, where you select a specific unit, as well as the direction and distance of its movement.

The basis of the game: stealth tactics with simultaneous progress on the playing field.

The goal - to implement a first one of the following purposes:
-The destruction of the enemy General;
-The destruction of the entire enemy army, except the General;
-The accumulation of 8 points of influence for the retention of the Central field of the cell.

1 box duel
2 boxes - up to 4 players!

name: Komet!
description: This is a simple mini game of tactical air combat in Europe, 1944.

name: Alltagswahn Autobahn
description:
You're on the Autobahn and want to go as fast as possible, but it's packed and the trucks are performing their usual "Elefantenrennen".* Finally there is an extra lane, allowing you to overtake one vehicle after another — only to be photographed in a speed trap...

In Alltagswahn Autobahn, you are the best driver when you pass more cars on the Autobahn than any other driver.


Literally "Elephant Race", this lovely German expression describes the temporary freeway blockage caused by one truck passing another with only a small difference in speed.


(The game comes with an German rule, but a english rule is as download available. No text on the cards.)
mechanics: Race, Simulation, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Tanks+
description: This is an enhanced edition of Tanks. Original Tanks covers WWII Eastern Front only, but Tanks+ is added units and scenarios of Western Front.
publishers: Banner Of War, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Book of Mormon: Big Dig
description:
The Scriptures are full of treasures and artifacts, and now it's your job to find them! Set out on the ultimate archaeological hunt across twenty Book of Mormon locations, from Zarahemla to the Hill Cumorah- and more!

Roll the dice and choose which direction you'll head- or pick up the pace by flying across the board with one of five handy Helicopter Tiles.. Once you've landed, take your Artifact Card in hand and start digging! Finding the tile that matches the card in your hand will earn you an artifact- but try not to get stuck in the wilderness! First player to find three artifacts wins! (from the back of the box)

name: Oil and Gas
description:
A card game for 2-4+ players themed on the Oil Industry.

Players share a common deck containing cards of 7 types: Explore, Oil, Transport, Refinery, Gasoline, Product, and Event.

Players share a common pool of 7 types of tokens: Profit, Explore, Oil, Transport, Refinery, Gasoline, and Product Tokens. Players start with 10 Profit Tokens.

Each turn has 10 phases:

1. Company Phase
- All players draw 3 cards. Max hand size is 10 cards. Discard excess cards. Players may pay 1 Profit Token to draw an extra card. (Max 2 extra cards per turn)

2. Market Phase
- Players may trade cards and tokens.

3. Event Phase
- Players roll high on 1D6. Highest goes first playing 1 event or passing, then proceed clockwise. A player may play (discard) an Event card to activate its special effect. Multiple Event cards can be played each player. The phase ends when all players pass.

4. Explore Phase
- Discard 3 Explore Cards to roll 1D6. Dependant on roll a player will gain 0, 1 or 2 Explore tokens.

5. Drill Phase
- Discard 4 Oil Cards to roll 1D6. Dependant on roll a player will gain 0, 1 or 2 Oil tokens.

6. Transport Phase
- Discard 4 Transport cards to gain 1 Transport Token.

7. Refining Phase
- Discard 3 Refinery cards to get 1 Refinery Token.

8. Gasoline Phase
- Discard 4 Gasoline cards to get 1 Gasoline Token.

9. Production Phase
- Discard 3 Product cards to get 1 Product Token.

10. Profit Phase
You may make 1 or more melds. A meld requires 1 Explore Card or Token, 1 Oil Card or Token, 1 Transport Card or Token, 1 Refinery Card or Token, 1 or more Gasoline Cards or Tokens, 0 to 1 or more Product Cards or Tokens. Gain 1 Profit Token per card you play in the Meld. All meld cards and tokens are then discarded. After making a meld, immediately draw 2 cards.

The winner is the first player to get 25 Profit Tokens.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: City University London
description:
Based on one of the UK's leading academic institutions, City University London.

Identical as any other monopoly game but themed based around this university
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Political World
description:
Politics is our life.

My vote, my voice, my beliefs determine my daily life and decide my life. When you make the right choice, the world moves in the right direction. The more I have more interest, the more transparent the politics. If we want a world where common sense is common, we must respect the importance of politics. And a small board game, Political World, that moves such a politicized book into a real sense of humor can make it easier and more fun for people to come into politics.

Basic rules
Polytical World is basically a marble type game that moves on a dice and can be played from a minimum of two to four (recommended). All players start as members of parliament. The board includes a total of 24 arcades including starting lines and TV discussions, including districts that reflect real politics.

20% approval ratings in 5% increments will be substituted for currency and can be obtained using event cards and power cards. The approval rate certificate is held by the NEC, which replaces the bank, and when the NEC declines, it begins to take over and take away from other players. If you are in prison and lose your approval rate, you will be eliminated.
The event card is the core of the game. It is a 72-card that combines the political and social issues of Korea with satire and humor. There is a variety of events and humor, including the approval rate certificate, loss, and imprisonment. The latest issue is updated every year for each edition.

When the presidential election comes back every 12 months during the contest, the person with the highest approval rating is the president. The president has powerful power and gets the rest of the rest of the players.
The victory condition is to win the president three times in succession, to become the president, to purge the remaining players, or to become the president and have a 100% approval rating.
It may be strange at first, but once the game is started, you can find yourself embroidering a chopper to become a president and defeat another player. This is because, unlike the conventional possessive games, the three-dimensional and extraordinary feelings of power and dominance can be felt.
The game continues until one last winner is left. There are a number of factors, including the rules outlined above, the remorse of the conscience, and the privilege of the president. Please feel it directly at the Polytical World 2016 edition.

name: Master Thief: Cursed Items Exhibition
description:
This is the first expansion for Master Thief and was available as an add-on to the base game during the Kickstarter campaign.

The Cursed Item Expansion consists of 18 cards. It is comprised of cursed items that offer an opposite effect to the charmed bonuses found in the core game. This pack brings a level of danger and difficulty to more advanced players. Curses harm your gameplay, but if you are skillful enough to take on the challenge, you can escape with these highly valuable items!
—description from the publisher

Card breakdown:
9 Action cards [6 Action, 2 Reaction, 1 Utility]
8 Museum cards [6 Cursed (foil), 2 Security]
1 Calling card
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Five Seals of Magic: Circle VII – Circle of Curses
description:
New spell circles available as add-ons to give you even more options for playing Five Seals.

Circle VII: Circle of Curses
2 - Confuse
3 - Hazard
4 - Damage
5 - Banish
6 - Whirlwind
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Jadran
description:
First World War naval action in the Adriatic consisted mainly of Austro-Hungarian bombardments of Italy′s eastern coast, and wider-ranging German and Austro-Hungarian submarine incursions into the sea and the Mediterranean.
Allied forces mainly limited themselves to blockading the Central Powers' navies in the Adriatic, which was successful in regards to surface units, but failed for the U-boats, which found safe harbors and easy passage into and out of the area for the whole of the war. Considered a relatively secondary part of the naval warfare of World War I, it nonetheless tied down significant forces.
This is an area game simulating the Great War in the Adriatic Sea (1915-1918) between Italian and Austro-Hungarian Fleets. The game comes with the last issue of NoTurkeys! web-zine.
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Sporks
description:
Think fast before you pass! Dig into the fast-passing card game of Sporks. Choose which food to collect and race to get as many as you can, but stay sharp as you also need the right spork to win. The wild spork gives you the edge, but will you be quick enough to grab it?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wat een file!
description:
Stau-Mau Mau is a family game from the 'Haba Reisspeile' collection.

This game is similar to Uno. You get to a number of different car tokens in different colors. On the central gameboard you need to put down your tokens and get rid of all of them. You can put a vehicle after a vehicle of the same color or the same shape. As you lay out your pieces you create a big traffic jam across the board. Some cars have no special function others make the next player to skip a turn, give the player an extra turn or makes the next player take more tokens.

The goal of the game is to get rid of all your tokens, when you have one token left, you need to shout something or you need to take a new token from the reserve.

The game is played totally on magnetic surfaces which is nice. The players get their magnetic tokens on parking lot cards in their hands to keep them secret. The board is laid out in the tin lid thus making it magnetic itself. This makes it perfect to play everywhere.

There are 32 car tokens, 3 parking lots and one main board in the box.

name: ダイスキングチェス (Dice King Chess)
description:
User summary
Dice King Chess (ダイスキングチェス) (Daisu Kingu Chesu) is a Japanese two-player game. Using the same components, you can also play Dice Maze (サイコロ迷路) (Saikoro Meiro).

Dice King Chess is an intellectual game that combines a dice puzzle game with mini Chess and Halma. The game is played on a Chess board, with a set of dice instead of pawns, and a poppel for the King. A player may move one of their dice pieces according to the number showing on the top face of the die. As the player moves the die, it is rotated in the direction moved - move one space left, the die rotates leftward - move one space forward, the die turns one side forward. In this way, the number showing is changed when the die ends its movement, and this new number dictates where it might move to next.

Dice pieces are captured by being landed upon. The first player to either take their opponent’s King or have their own King move to the top corner wins the game.

Once you get familiar with the game, you can add extra rules, such as “a player can only remove an opponent’s die if both dice have matching numbers".

Publisher's summary
ダイスキングチェスは「サイコロパズル」と「ミニチェス」と「ハルマ」が混ざったようなイメージの頭脳ゲームです。
サイコロは上になっている目の数だけマス目に合わせて転がり、先に相手の王を取るか自分の王が上の角に到達したら勝ちです。
ゲームに慣れてきたら、「同じ目にならないと相手のサイコロを取れない」などの追加ルールを加えたり、別ゲームの「ダイスメイズ」をプレーできます。

name: Tegn og Spill med Øistein
description: Memory game that teaches you to draw exciting figures. Each figure is drawn in four stages, and you have to draw the four cards corresponding to each figure in the right order. (User summary)

name: Shuffle Despicable Me
description:
Be a Despicable super villain and take over the world! You'll need to bid with banana cards to collect Minions to help you in your quest. Watch out for Gru's weapons and collect shields to protect you and your Minions. Double, triple and even quadruple the fun on the Shuffle website

-You'll need to bid with banana cards to collect Minions to help you in your quest
-Card game version of Universal Studios Despicable Me
-Player with the most Minions is the winning super villain!
-Free App included

Each player has 7 banana cards for bidding (from 1 to 7).
In turn:
-one player reveals cards
-all players secretly choose 1 banana card
-all players reaveal their bid cards
-from highest to lowest card players choose 1 Minion card to collect
-if 2 or more players play the same bid cards all players must hit banana button card and in the order of hitting choose Minion cards
Game ends when Minion deck runs out. At the end each type of Minion goes to the player with most of them.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Qurious Space family card game
description: This is an educational game which deals with space and space exploration. Much of the photography used is credited to NASA. The game goes in a small square tin and uses square cards. Some of the cards have symbols on one side and a single trivia question and picture on the other side. Others have four questions one one side and responses on the back. Three modes of play involve trivia, symbol matching, and spinning cards to choose questions or activities.

name: ¿Quién soy? Electrónico
description:
Who am I? for adult players, new rules and with an electronic device ("palabrómetro" or "wordmeter").
You fix the electronic device around your forehead and push it. A name of a famous person will appear on it, but you can not see it. Then ask the other players yes-or-no questions to determine, "Who am I?"
You have a limited time, but if you guess corectly, push it again to play with another name, until the time is over.
Ask the right questions and combine them in just the right way, who gets more points will be the winner.






































Muy grande y con trompa ¿QUIÉN SOY?
Nunca fue tan divertido tener tantas cosas en la cabeza.
Más grande que una moto, más ruidoso que un camión. Me asustan las hormigas y tengo un gran trompón ¿Quién soy? Es tu turno, tienes 90 segundos ¿acertarás esta vez?
Llega el “palabrómetro”, un generador electrónico de palabras que debes colocarte sobre la frente, él indicará a tus compañeros de partida qué personaje, película, animal o canción eres y mediante pistas tendrás que adivinarlo en un tiempo record.
Formad dos o hasta cuatro equipos, apretad el palabrómetro e intenta adivinar quién eres entre las más de 2000 palabras que presenta el juego: actores, personajes históricos, políticos… puedes ser cualquiera, ¡descúbrelo con las pistas que te dé tu equipo!

name: Chessaga
description:
CHESSaga is a fantasy/chess game where players take their chess pieces on story-driven journeys across custom game-maps!

The hero player controls 3 chess pieces -- a knight, a bishop, and a rook. On each map, they face 1 or more enemy pieces, controlled by the villain player. An losses the hero incurs are permanent. On the first 6 maps, the goal is to rescue the captured pawn(s) then escape the board via a specified exit square. On those boards, the pawns are stationary objects. Defeating the enemy piece(s) is not necessary. On the final board, the pawns activate and join the hero to help them capture the enemy king. If the hero players makes it through all 7 boards and capture the enemy king, they win. Otherwise, the villain wins.

With more than 2 players, players split control of the hero pieces. The rulebook also provides loose guidelines for playing solo and controlling both sides fairly.

The gameboards and rules are all contained in a thin comic-book sized booklet that opens up to different pages for different missions.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: The Zombie, The Princess & The Kid Next Door
description:
It's the game that features a surprising mix of characters, amazingly simple rules and the right touch of cleverness.

Each player starts with 3 tiles. On every turn place one of your tiles on any open space on the board. But look carefully so you don't place a tile that will help your opponents score as you try to get three in a row - vertically, horizontally or diagonally.

When you're successful, collect a token. On some especially good moves you can get 2 or 3 tokens.
At the end of the game when the board is full of zombies, princesses and that kid next door, the player with the most tokens wins.

name: Malifaux: Doppleganger
description:
Doppleganger is an expansion unit for Malifaux. He belongs to the Neverborn faction.

Overview
The Doppelganger can be almost anything you need it to be. Doppelganger can (0) Mimic any action on a Non-leader models stat card or Upgrade as long as it doesn't list a model by name. It can be either an enemy or friendly model's action and there is no resisting if you want something from your enemy. Doppelganger can't declare Triggers with these actions but you can still make it a huge advantage, should you fail something important (Example: a Lure from a Beckoner, you basically get 2 more chances to that with the Doppelganger, if you get the right Trigger to Mimic (Tomes) you get to do the action 3 times).

The Doppelganger also brings more than that to your crew, with Ill Omens you get the possibility to cheat the Initiative flip before you or your opponent use Soulstones. This can be huge as usually in every game comes a time when it's crucial to win the initiative.

If that's not enough the Doppelganger also has the Ability Don't Mind Me which allows it to make Interact actions while Engaged, which in the right Scheme Pool can be a great advantage.

All this for a very reasonable price of 7 Soulstones becomes a bargain and should be considered in many Neverborn lists.
Mobility

Doppelganger has a very respectable Walk of 6, which makes Doppelganger highly mobile to get where needed.
Offense

While not having a very good offense with Fists (Ml5 and damage track 1/1/2) the Doppelganger can become furious in Offense with Mimic as you can copy the stats of the highest Ml beasts in the game. Should you get charged by a Ml oriented model and survive, you just Mimic the opposing model's offense and hit it back with its own damage track or Mimic another model within 8".
Resilience

The Doppelganger has an average Defense of 5 and quite good wounds of 8. The main thing in its Resilience comes from Manipulative 14 which forces the opponent to pass a WP 14 Duel to target the Doppelganger. The good thing about Manipulative is that as long as you haven't activated the Doppelganger your opponent must make the duel with every action as you don't gain Immunity to it as you do with Horror Duels. This can deter a few models from targeting the Doppelganger.

Also, with (0) Blend In (Ca8 mask / TN: 15 mask) you can further up the resilience of the Doppelganger, with a 7 of any suit you get to choose from the following Conditions:

Chameleon: Sh Actions taken against this model receive a minus flip.
A Familiar Face: Ml actions taken against this model receive a minus flip

Playing Against the Doppelganger

Best time to go after the Doppelganger is after it has activated as there is no Manipulative to protect it and in a turn it has used (0) Mimic as then it can't cast (0) Blend In. After that it's quite easy to take down with a big hitter with only Df 5 and 8 Wounds.

name: Aether Revolt Planeswalker-Deck-Set
description: "The Kaladesh Inventors' Fair, a celebration of innovation and ingenuity, was a ruse. A revolt takes place on Kaladesh. The renegades have seized control of large portions of Ghirapur. Led by Pia Nalaar and aligned with aether-pirates, essence-drainers and weaponsmiths, they seek to overthrow the authority of the Consulate. The Consulate responds with increased security and surveillance, the seizure of unregistered inventions, the monitoring of aether distribution, and the enforcement of a city-wide curfew. The Gatewatch and Ajani Goldmane support the renegades, while searching for the nefarious planeswalker Tezzeret." Look for all new mechanics in Aether Revolt like 'Improvise' that enables you to pay a generic mana cost with the help of your artifacts, also look for new cycles and themes to continue exploring the world of Kaladesh. Aether Revolt products are available in the following configurations, make sure to check the Title and Description of each listing to determine which item or items are included in the listing.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Box Quiz: Øl
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Beer'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about beers. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Box Quiz: Ost
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Cheese'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about cheese. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Box Quiz: Chokolade
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Chocolate'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about chocolate. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: GRAFFITI GAMMON
description:
User summary
グラギャモン (GuraGyamon) GRAFFITI GAMMON is a new Japanese game design based on Backgammon. The game designer also credits the work of 古代エジプト人とその後継者たち 'Kodai Ejiputo-jin to sono koukeisya tachi', which means 'the ancient Egyptians and their successors'.

Packaged in a tube, to resemble hard liquor, the game board is a cloth, making the game very portable. According to the publisher, the game has various attractive features:

Based on the concept of Graffiti x Backgammon, we have arranged the traditional gammon-board wildly, incorporating some beginner-friendly designs.

Sexy and attractive, angel and demon characters!
Cool shot glass, shiny jewel parts. Hello Instagram!
Variant rules with additional cards!
Compact package! Foldable fabric game board!
Beginner friendly design with initial setup marks, and distance to the goal (pips)!


The game includes seven action cards allow simple changes to the gameplay such as re-rolls, using your opponents last roll, fixing one of their dice and so on. The action cards each represent hard drink, whisky, rum, tequila, and the special effects are written in Japanese and in English.

Publisher's summary
GRAFFITI（らくがき）×BACKGAMMON（バックギャモン）をコンセプトに 、伝統的な図案が中心のゲームボードを大胆にアレンジしながら、 初心者にもわかりやすい工夫をプラスしたゲームです。
・SEXYな天使と悪魔のキャラクターが魅力！
・ショットグラスや輝く宝石パーツを採用したインスタ映えするデザイン！
・特殊カードを使ったオリジナルルールも追加！！
・コンパクトなパッケージ！ 折りたためる布製ゲーム盤！
・初心者にもわかりやすい初期配置表示、ゴールまでの距離がわかる《ピップ》表示つき！
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: おぼえなサイコロ (OboenaSAIKORO)
description:
Designer's summary
In おぼえなサイコロ (OboenaSAIKORO), you will try to find as many animals as you can, and be the fastest to do so.

But beware! Don’t look for the wrong animal in the wrong place!

And don’t let your opponents be faster than you. Surprisingly, at the end of the game, the player with the most Victory Points will be the winning Pet Café owner.

This game was produced for release at the Tokyo Game Market in December 2017. The game is self-published under the design team label of らなとパパ (Lana & Papa). The game is published with Japanese rules in the box, and French and English rules online.

「おぼえなサイコロ」は、一度見たら裏向きに並べてしまうカードの中から、サイコロの出目に合ったカードを、誰よりも早く思い出して取ることを目指します。ルールは簡単。お子様と一緒に、６人まで遊べる１５分ぐらいのファミリーゲームです。
categories: Animals, Card Game, Memory, Party Game

name: Card in the Hat
description:
A game where two teams of players throw playing cards into a hat. Players each have 8 cards and take it in turns to throw these into the hat, scoring one point for their team every success.
When all players are out of cards they collect them and then take it in turns to throw their cards two at the time, then four at a time then finally all 8 at once.
The team with the highest score wins.

name: Guns in the Pacific
description:
Base game includes support for two to five; Japanese and Indonesian Imperial players versus American, Australian, and British Allied players. Plan your advances across thirteen sea zones to control twenty pivotal bases in the Pacific Theater of World War II. Win conflicts to gain more materiel. Battleships, carriers, and heavy cruisers represented.

Choose whether to respond to each conflict depending on the stakes, until forces get too close. Adjust your task force before battle with intelligence and supplement more ships using oil. Cruisers allow early disengagement and protection from submarines; battleships are best if the battle occurs at night; carriers are best in daylight.

Each ship card is unique with different amounts of armor, ammunition, anti-aircraft guns, command capability, damage control, engine speed, and fuel consumption. Hits to ships knock out individual features depending on hit location.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: クエストREクエスト (Quest Re quest)
description:
User summary
クエストREクエスト (Quest Re quest) is a Japanese card game based upon the common RPG dungeon scene, but here, the players are the village folk! Y'know, those "Welcom' to the town of so-and-so" or "A potion? That's some golds" talking NPC folks.

Since there is a dungeon nearby this town, you see many adventurers stepping by this town, every day. One day, one villager said "I bet that Warrior will survive and get back.", followed by another saying "I don't think so, but I'd bet that Sorcerer will." In a small village with little amusements, this gambling quickly became the most popular game in town.

You are one of the villagers, betting on adventurers, which of them would come back alive. Of course you want to win, so don't forget to set traps to other adventurers!

One of the adventurers died? No worries, the town has a church and a Bishop with Resurrection skills. Problem solved!
Complaints? No way! Well, dead man tell no tales after all. And, no one wants to end up being ashes, by complaining to the church. Or do you?

March on to the dungeon!

Publisher's summary
舞台はダンジョン、プレイヤーは村人！
ダンジョンに挑む冒険者の誰が生き残るかに賭け、
他のプレイヤーの賭けている冒険者には罠の道を案内する。

相手は冒険者なのでたとえ倒れても大丈夫、教会完備です。
もちろん苦情も来たこともありません。
死人に口なしともいいますが、教会たてつくと灰にされかねません。
そうして今日もラットレースが開幕します！

さぁ、ゆきゆきて、ダンジョン！
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game
publishers: しらたまゲームズ (Shiratama Games)

name: Het Sliep Uit Spel
description: A children's deduction game in the Mastermind tradition. The goal is to correctly guess the colour and type of three hidden fruits. A player's guesses are limited by a hangman-like monkey puzzle. Less accurate guesses use up more turns.

Nightfall Theme Deck

Jolteon Pack
Rayquaza Pack
Skarmory Pack

name: Pokémon TCG: Pokémon Card VS Expansion
description:
User Summary

Pokémon Card VS - ポケモンカード★VS is a Japanese-language expansion; it has no corresponding English-language expansion.

The expansion includes 151 cards.

The VS expansion was distributed in a non-conventional manner. While the cards were still packaged in foil packs, each of these packs contained 30 cards instead of the traditional 10 cards. This was also the first time the term 'half deck' was officially used and became a recognized method of gameplay. There were three random half decks released: Grass & Lightning - 草 雷ハーフデッキ, Water & Fire - 水炎ハーフデッキ, and Fighting & Psychic - 闘超ハーフデッキ. Each half deck contained a random assortment of set type Pokémon (i.e. one could only get a Fire-type Pokémon in the Water & Fire half deck). Colorless-type Pokémon and Trainer cards could be found in all half decks.

The 30 cards in each booster pack consisted of: 11 energy cards, 11 character cards, 6 trainer cards (2 of which were TMs), 1 holo character card, and 1 holo special energy card.

Wizards of the Coast officially stated that they had no plans to release the VS set, primarily because they had competitive play in mind. Some cards from this expansion were still released in English in the Tyranitar Half Deck; however, these cards were produced by MEDIAFACTORY and received a limited release to competitors of the 2001 Tropical Mega Battle. Despite this statement, Pokémon USA localized the Generation IV equivalent, Pokémon SP when they debuted in the Platinum expansion.

-- summary obtained from: https://leonhartopedia.fandom.com/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_VS_(TCG)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cartel
description:
In Cartel, you are a head of one of the biggest drug cartels that want to enrich themselves in the quickest and easiest possible way, that why you will plot against other cartels and try to steal their money or simply destroy it while trying to laundry your own cash. Sometimes you will invest your money in some buildings that will generate you some goods or produce you clean money. Player who will get the most clean cash at the end of the game will be named the greatest drug lord in the world.

Cartel is a small game for 2-4 players with multi use cards in which you will be fighting other players while building your own drug empire. During the game players will be facing different phases in which they will be bribing some contacts to enter restricted areas, using multi use action cards in few possible ways like: using it for its action, taking them as the goods or connecting them to own empire as buildings that will help us during the game.

There are few interesting mechanics in the game like area control; card management; small engine-building that works very well and with the smart design of multi use cards each and every game is an unique experience.

So do you have what it takes to take the whole drug cartel and show everyone who is the fierce force to be reckoned with?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Vero o Falso?
description:
A fun game for the whole family full of unusual anecdotes. Are you ready to play? An exciting challenge awaits you!

The game proceed with a series of questions and challenges on the general culture, sports, arts, comics, movie etc.

The player that will answer the most correct questions will win the game.

name: Community Card Poker
description:
Community card poker refers to any game of poker that uses community cards (also called "shared cards" or "window cards"), which are cards dealt face up in the center of the table and shared by all players. In these games, each player is dealt privately an incomplete hand ("hole cards"), which are then combined with the community cards to make a complete hand. The set of community cards is called the "board", and may be dealt in a simple line or arranged in a special pattern. Rules of each game determine how they may be combined with each player's private hand. The most popular community card game today is Texas hold 'em, originating sometime in the 1920s.

Also known as "flop poker", community card poker is a variation of stud poker. Players are dealt an incomplete hand of face-down cards, and then a number of face-up community cards are dealt to the center of the table, each of which can be used by one or more of the players to make a 5-card hand. Texas hold 'em and Omaha are two well-known variants of the community card family.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Mapominoes: USA
description:
Its like dominoes but with maps, as you build a map of the United States, by connecting states that share a common border. Stay one step ahead of your opponents, as you race to be the first player to play all your county cards on the table and win the game.

Take a boat through the Pacific Ocean to Alaska or Hawaii, or block Maine be controlling New Hampshire

name: BrainBox: Predators
description:
Beware! Some of the deadliest creatures on the planet are lurking inside this BrainBox. From the grey wolf to the great white shark, this brilliant BrainBox features the fiercest and most fearsome members of the animal kingdom. Do you dare to open the box?
The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
publishers: Albi, Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft., MindWare, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Crocodile Rock
description:
The game is a race between different animals (interesting selection of "runners": frog, snake, turtle and snail). The winner is the first to reach the end of the track: the Crocodile Rock!
The peculiarity of the game is that each player on her turn throw three six-sided dice: two are regular ones numbered from 1 to 6 but the third one displays only "+" or "-" as a result.
The players need to accordingly add or subtract the two numbers to determine how far they advance. A very good exercise for kids to learn basic math operations!
Some spaces on the board features a fixed number: in this case you only roll the +/- die and move forward or backward of that number of spaces. Other ones show only odd or even number: roll 1 die and advance only if you obtain an odd or even result, respectively.
The track also features a closed loop with a single specific space allowing access to the final section. There's also a few shortcuts, nicely depicted as jumping on a crocodile back or on logs.

name: Send Me Up
description:
Inspired on the one hit wonder song Spirit in the Sky by Norman Greenbaum.


Send Me Up is a cooperative "trick fixing" game meant to simulate giving a eulogy. Players use a deck of playing cards and a die to cooperatively "fix" a trick to produce a specific value.

The game is played over multiple tricks, with each trick having a different target number. If the players can collectively fix six tricks over the course of the game, they have given a touching eulogy and sent the spirit happily to the sky, thus winning the game.


Send Me Up is the postcard game from Button Shy's December 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Teaser: A Game for Guides
description:
Teaser is

star: 44 brightly coloured games-cards on four Guiding Topics - History, International, Badges and General Knowledge
star: 6 exciting games - some using boards, some run-around -- to test your memory and ingenuity
star: fun at meetings and with friends
star: a great way to learn all about Guiding


—description from the publisher

This card game from the 1980s contains trivia about The Girl Guide Movement in the United Kingdom.

name: Sword for Hire: A Solo Dice Game
description:
Solitaire dice game of fantasy combat. It only requires pen, paper, and 3 regular dice. The player controls a fantasy hero who is attemtping to defeat mighty villains and monsters.

Each Hero turn the player chooses to roll and reroll dice. The result of the dice forms a temporary pool of damage points. Certain combos grant special abilities, like double damage or parry.
When the player chooses the Strike action, the total from the temporary damage pool is applied to one of the enemies. The Hero's turn is then over.

If the player rolls a 1 for any reason, the attack is a miss, and there is no effect. The turn was wasted.

Next, the enemies attack - each in different ways depending on the scenario.

The player wins by defeating all monsters, and loses if the hero is killed.

—description from the publisher

name: Chiffre
description:
Inspector Wolf is under pressure: Only if he can decipher the darn secret word will he be able to understand the entire message from the Mafia boss Volpone. Time is short since Volpone could also intercept the inspector's latest message to his informant — and if the mafioso is the first to crack Wolf's password, the inspector's informant would be in extreme danger.

Who will be the first to figure out his opponent's secret word in Chiffree? Time is running out!

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Data
description:
This card is the competitive prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Chronological Chaos."

Unique Federation Crew (5 SP)
As an action, you may discard Data and target an opposing ship within range 2. You then roll an attack die to determine the effect.

Crit: Discard a card of your choice on the target ship.
Battle Stations: Discard the Captain of the target ship.
Hit: Discard a crew on the target ship.
Blank: Nothing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm III – Rise of the Primarch
description:
Rise of the Primarch is the third book in the Gathering Storm series. This 136-page hardback introduces the Triumvirate of the Primarch and draws the threads of the thrilling story of the Gathering Storm together in dramatic fashion.

Rise of the Primarch is packed with new rules content for Warhammer 40,000:

Datasheets for the Triumvirate of the Primarch.
Warlord Traits, Relics, Tactical Objectives and a Detachment for Ultramarines forces.
Formations allowing you to field The Fallen, the Grey Knights’ Bulwark of Purity, the Victrix Guard of the Ultramarines and the Triumvirate of the Primarch.
Daemonic Adversaries – special rules allowing you to field Grey Knights against enemies that are not necessarily Daemonic in nature.
5 Echoes of War missions – key battles from Rise of the Primarch. 3 Cataclysm of War missions. Special objectives to be used when fielding Cypher and the Fallen.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Bitcoin: The Board Game
description:
Theme: Bitcoin/Cryptocurrency

Game-play: Each player has a token (game piece) and "wallet." The wallet is used to keep track of the players cash, bitcoin, and possibly bitcoin cash (if it gets forked into the game). Each player travels around the bitcoin playing board while trying to deal with positive news, negative news, and board spaces that lead to both positive and negative outcomes.

Object of Game: Travel around the Bitcoin Logo board and be the first player to amass a wallet size of $200,000 in fiat currency (US Dollars or one of 6 other currencies Euro, British Pound, Euro, Yen, Swiss Franc, Canadian Dollar, and Australian Dollar).

The ideal number of players is 3-4. There are 3 roles in the game. The main drivers of the game are: your decisions on buying, selling, and hodling bitcoin(bitcoin term for holding) and news cards that can dramatically affect the price of bitcoin both up and down.

The game is designed for ages 12+. Although the real bitcoin has many complex characteristics, Bitcoin The Board Game only focuses on the elements that a teenager can understand and grasp. The game is meant to be enjoyed with friends and family in a casual setting.

If you're like me, the 2017 holidays (US Thanksgiving and Christmas) were spent talking about bitcoin. This year, play the game! It will be available in time for the 2018 holidays.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Schlaraffen Affen
description:
Many juicy fruits await on the trees in Schlaraffen Affen, especially the coconuts on the palm tree in the middle of the game board. To reach the coconuts, the monkeys must move from fruit to fruit through the forest, possibly stealing from one another as well. Travel on the back of another monkey, and you'll move even faster.

Who can first collect a coconut of their own color from the palm tree and win the game?

name: Speed Farkel
description: Speed Farkel is a fast, six-player version of the popular game, Pocket Farkel, in that the scoring combinations are the same. However, all players start with zero score and all players roll every turn at the same time. Players scramble to try to roll a minimum score that has been determined by rolling the 12-sided "IGNITION" die. The scorekeeper records and adds all scores after every round. The first player to get over 10,000 points is the winner.

name: Color-In Kingdom
description:
Color-In Kingdoms is a Roll-and-Write game designed for Gen Can't 2017 where players are the lead architects trying to build a beautiful Province for the Royal Family, but, being hampered by the whims of that same family.

Each of the 4 Royal Family Dice represents the construction desire of that family member, the 1 Royal Duties Dice represents pressing duties family members must attend to, so removes them from the pool for that turn.

Victory Points (VP) will be awarded at the end of the game based on the scoring as outlined on the Construction sheet.

name: The Earthworm (fan expansion for Hive)
description: The Earthworm moves 3 spaces under the hive and swaps the position with the target bug
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Game on!
description:
Game on! is a game released by Identity Games international as part of the Holland Casino Christmas bonus. It was given to all employees and special relations in the year of 2011.

The game combines trivia questions containing information on all sorts of subjects like sports, movies, history and many others, with a gambling mechanic in which players can bet on whether the other player gets the question right or not.

The game can be played in either teams or every player for themselves. On a players turn they spin the wheel selecting one of four categories: multiple choice, open question, versus question, or co-op question. They are rewarded with chips depending on whether they answered the question right.

During the game inactive players can place bets, using their own accumulated chips, on whether the active player gets the question right or wrong (in the multiple choice and the open question categories) or which of the players (in the versus and co-op categories) gets the right answer. All bets are collected and payed out by the bank which one player will represent. The first player(s) to collect 50 chips is declared the winner.

name: Trouv'tout!
description: Each turn in Trouv'tout!, players reveal an illustration as well as a card that depicts a shape or color. Whoever first finds this shape or color in the illustration claims the card as a prize, and whoever collects five cards first wins.

name: Kung Fu Party: Nicolas Promo Card
description:
Promo card for the game Kung fu party with a boss called Nicolas.

The text on the card says "Prima di attaccarlo puoi scartare tutti gli attacchi per pescarne altrettanti".

This promo is included in Io Gioco italian magazine.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Ghost Hunter: Spirits
description:
In Ghost Hunter: Spirits players take on the roles of a party of supernatural explorers from the Infernal Club. They compete against each other to battle and ultimately capture ghosts and other denizens of the paranormal world.

Overview Ghost Hunter: Spirits is a card game for 2-6 players that should last for 10 – 30 minutes. It is a standalone game but it is also one of a series of compatible Ghost Hunter decks. You may take cards from any of these decks and shuffle them together to create new and interesting versions of the game.

name: Sheep Hustler
description:
A colourful, competitive, set-collection card game for all the family.

The objective of Sheep Hustler is to create a Pen of Sheep.
A winning Pen must consist of four Sheep cards and two fence cards. Players are dealt four cards into their hand and two cards face down. It's the combination of these six cards that produces a Pen. The four Sheep cards must be of a certain combination to win.
The first person to create a matching Pen wins the round.
Players can draw from a deck, use a sheep dog or trade cards to create a winning pen.

—description from the publisher

name: Kontinentu Medības
description:
The game of information throughout the world. 1260 questions and answers, divided into five categories.
Questions are made so it is possible to find out correct answer even you do not know it exactly right.
There are also chance once per game use one of each (total 3) different bonus card.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dodgeball
description:
Game #4 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 120 cards of Single and Double Dodgeballs, Single and Double Dodges and a Dodgeball Pile. After drawing a card, the player may throw the Dodgeball(s) at another player; place a Dodge in front of them to protect them; destroy a Dodgeball Pile; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once a player has been “hit” by 10 Dodgeballs, they are out. The last player standing is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Team Play variants.

—description from the publisher

name: Water Fight
description:
Game #6 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 120 cards of Single and Double Water Balloons, Squirt Guns, Water Hose, Kiddie Pool and Treehouses. After drawing a card, the player may throw the Water Balloon(s) at another player or use the Squirtguns; place a Kiddie Pool or Treehouse in front of them to protect them; use a hose to get rid of a Kiddie Pool or Treehouse; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once a player has been “hit” by 10 Water Balloons or Squirt Guns, they are out. The last player standing is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Strategic Play variants.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Travel

name: Omega Jump
description: Omega Jump is a deck-building race game. Create videogame-inspired platform levels and play your cards to advance! Move, jump, fight while trying to survive the hazards of the level (and your opponents)! Collect coins and purchase items to build up your hand for the next sprint, but don’t take too long: only the first to the finish line will grab victory. A frantic race to the end goal, full of trickery and chaotic fun.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Monopoly: FC Augsburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from FC Augsburg, a soccer club in Bavaria, Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: 1. FSV Mainz 05
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from 1. FSV Mainz 05, a soccer club in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

description:

Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Dutch local community Westland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Vlieland
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Dutch island Vlieland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Invasion Busters
description:
The invaders are coming! Hordes of nasty pests are threatening to invade your country. They can sneak in on container ships or even in the baggage of air passengers. Once here, they will secretly grow and spread, damaging your crops and wilderness areas.

Fortunately you and your biosecurity team have the skills to stop them in their tracks! Intercept them before they arrive, or find them quickly and eradicate. Can you bust every invasion?

The Invasion Busters board depicts a simplified version of a real biosecurity system (based on that of New Zealand). A deck of cards represents invasive species which may arrive, grow and spread. Players co-operate to allocate dice to different biosecurity activities, then roll the dice to see if their actions have been successful. At the end of the game points are gained for the species successfully excluded or eradicated, and points are lost for any species which have become established. Players compare their score to a scale printed in the rulebook to see how well they did.

Invasion Busters was developed specifically for use in the classroom, to help teach concepts of invasion, biosecurity and population dynamics to 8-12 year olds, but has also been enjoyed by their teachers and other grown up invasion busters.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: UNO: Despicable Me
description:
Hold onto your overalls! Join Gru and his family, includes his Minions in the Despicable Me UNO!

Play the Mutated Minion card make things a little wild.

And don't forget to yell "UNO!" before you play your last card!

The game is pretty much identical to traditional UNO except there are two special Evil Minion rule cards and two customizable wild cards. Watch for the Evil Minion wild card; draw that card and call out a color. The next player must keep drawing until that color card turns up.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Age of Empires: Expandable Card Game – Nautical Expansion
description: Age of Empires: Nautical is the only published expansion for the Age of Empires II ECG. Journeyman Press printed the expansion on April the 16th in 2001. The expansion comes with 160 cards and introduces the four (4) new civilizations - Franks, Japanese, Saracens, and Vikings; additionally, included are "Water Rules" and new scenarios.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Swindled
description:
Swindled is a family party card game for ages 8+. The game features over 40 different playable cards created loads of mini-games. Build your hand by drawing from the deck, stealing cards from others' hands, and playing games to win more cards. If you can't build your own hand, try to sabotage others by placing car bombs, giving someone a disease, or starting a bar fight.

The base game plays two to eight players, with the ability to add expansions packs to play up to 12 players.

—description from the publisher

name: UPRISE
description:
Uprise is a tower-building game that plays Solo, Co-Op, or Competitively.

You're a member of a new secret society.

Complete all missions to overthrow the ruling elite.

Each mission card comes with its own set of supplies. If playing Solo or Co-Op, share the inventory among all the members in your group. If playing competitively, each member attempts to climb the ranks on their own so each of them needs the inventory indicated.

CONTENTS & GENERAL FUNCTIONS

1. MISSION CARDS
The goal of the mission is stated on the Mission Card. Complete all the missions so that your secret society can grow.

Types of missions:

a) Score-Based Missions: reach a certain number of points before running out of 'Stache Cards.

b) Architect Missions: replicate a certain design before running out of 'Stache Cards.

c) Checklist Missions: complete the requirements on a checklist before running out of 'Stache Cards.

2. TOP HAT CARDS
Disguised with a Top Hat, you can infiltrate a new country by revealing what is known as a Top Hat Card.
Top Hat Cards are divided into 9 squares (1 flag and 8 location squares). While you cannot place anything on a flag square, you are considered to have set up a bureau on the flag square the moment you gain access to that country. For this reason, flag squares will count toward completing Secret Agendas.

3. 'STACHE CARDS
Disguised with a 'Stache, you are able to set up bureaus across the world. Each 'Stache Card contains a location where you can potentially set up 1 bureau. To set up a bureau, you must discard the 'Stache Card and place your bureau on the proper tile.

If you cannot or choose not to use a 'Stache Card to set up a bureau, hide the card in your Vault. Rest assure you'll be able to use it later to make investments.

4. YOUR VAULT
This is where ALL 'Stache Cards not used to place a bureau must go at the end of a round. On any later turn, you will be able to use the $ VALUE to make investments. A list of investments is found on the back of the Vault.

5. BUREAUS
These unmarked buildings are setup locations so that your secret society may operate in that country. Be careful when setting your bureau. Should it lead to exposure due to lack of stability, you'll lose this bureau and likely others as well.

6. SECRET AGENDAS
To accelerate your mission, try to complete Secret Agendas. Secret Agendas are patterns you'll want to achieve within any given country. These patterns are determined by the placement of the flag, the placement of bureaus, as well as the placement of decoys.

Generally there is more than one way to complete a Secret Agenda and you can reveal all your options by rotating the card.

Once you complete a Secret Agenda, you may choose to cover up your presence in that country and move onto the next. You can do this free of charge as long as the Secret Agenda has been achieved.

The Cover Up consist of adding a new Top Hat Card ON TOP the components required to complete the Secret Agenda. As long as you successfully manage to do this, you will also Cover Up your completed Secret Agenda Card with a new Secret Agenda Card.

7. TOP HATS
A Top Hat is an opportunity to enter a new country without completing a Secret Agenda. You can gain a Top Hat by purchasing it from the 'Stache Cards in your Vault or you can also gain one by placing a Bureau on a tile with a Top Hat SYMBOL.

When using a Top Hat, you can either
a) cover up component(s) from an already existing tower and climb UP.
b) start a new branch by adding a new Top Hat Card on the ground floor.

8. DECOYS
Decoys can be placed on the tile of your choice (except on a flag) without needing to play a 'Stache Card.

You can gain a Decoy by purchasing it from the 'Stache Cards in your Vault or you can also gain one by placing a Bureau on a tile with a SUITCASE SYMBOL.

Decoys count as a yellow square in terms of your Secret Agendas. They can also be used to provide stability in a country.

9. BRIDGES
Bridges, when required, merge together separate branches within your organization. The need for bridges is determine by your chosen Mission Card.

There are no fees for placing a bridge(s). However, for a merger to be completed, you will need to cover the bridge(s) with a new Top Hat Card. Do this by using a Top Hat.

10. CRISIS CARDS
These cards are for competitive play only. They enable you to run an interference in another member's plans.

Crisis Cards are purchased.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: LPR – La Palette Rouge
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Since its creation in 1992 LPR has become Europe's No. 2 pallet pooling operator exclusively dedicated to the fast-moving consumer goods sector, handling more than 40 million pallet movements a year.

With subsidiaries in 7 countries (France, Spain, Portugal, Benelux, United Kingdom, Germany and Italy), LPR offers an end-to-end delivery and collection service throughout Western Europe. It has a network of some eighty depots and collects pallets from 20,000 drop-off points across Europe.

LPR offers a fully outsourced solution with high-quality pallets that are entirely compatible with automated production and picking systems. The LPR product range includes all types of pallet used by manufacturers of fast-moving consumer goods and by major retailers.

LPR has a team of experienced professionals, ready to provide tailor-made responses for individual customers, with solutions that are simple, innovative and flexible.

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Flint / Barrow
LIGHT BLUE
LPR Benelux / LPR Germany / Lpr Italy
PINK
West Hallam / Temple Patrick / Avonmouth
ORANGE
Leeming Bar / Folkstone / Mossend
RED
LPR Portugal / LPR Spain / LPR France
YELLOW
Chorley / Wrexham / Kegworth
GREEN
Dublin / Clonmel / Longford
DARK BLUE
Redditch / Toulouse
STATIONS
Northfleet / Stretton / Trafford Park / Burton Latimer
UTILITIES
Timber / Nails
TAXES
One Way Trip Fee / ISPM 15 Charge

This version is very special for two reasons:

1. It is the first "square box" edition that has been created by anyone else apart from Hasbro. (The square box (called the "Number 9") makes a much better version than the rectangle, for corporate gifts. It was always a no go but now companies can now have their own version of this – thanks to LPR.)

2. LPR commissioned their own playing pieces; a lorry and a pallet! (This is the first time a company has done this in the UK.)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Flick A' Round: Zombie Road
description:
A small band of desperate survivors lies on the brink of annihilation. In Flick A’ Round: Zombie Road, Players flick their wooden playing pieces around the table in search of supplies needed to build a safe camp. Find all six of the supply cards needed to complete the camp and get back inside safely.

Work together, but keep your distance. Because in this game, any one of the players could have been bitten on their search for supplies. Once revealed, the zombie player immediately begins his new goal of stopping the survivors from winning by turning them all into zombies before they can complete the camp and get back safely.

name: Textile
description: Textile is a competitive tile-laying game for two players. Each player is assigned either black or white color, and each tile has a black and white pattern. Legal tile placement requires that edges of the new tile that touch previously-played tiles must match the same color. A player color will score points when an enclosed shape of that color is created, regardless of which player placed the tile. After each player has placed 15 tiles, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Monopoly: Officeworks
description:
GET ON THE GO! Live the life of a high-flying trader in the fast-paced world of real estate.

Get ready to play the game of your life as MONOPOLY, the world's favourite in board game, teams up with Officeworks in this unique limited collector's edition.

Officeworks’ history dates back more than 15 years to1994 when the first store opened in the Melbourne suburb of Richmond. Today, Officeworks is Australia's largest office products and solutions retailer and supplier with operations across the country employing over 6000 Team Members.

Whether you're male or female, eight or eighty, the Officeworks MONOPOLY limited edition a must have! It's your chance to build your own network and make MONOPOLY millions by wheeling and dealing amid the fun and excitement of Officeworks.

Do you have what it takes to win the game?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Centrepeg
description:
An abstract strategy game on a board with three concentric circles; these include eight evenly spaced holes per circle forming spokes, plus a central hole. Each player has twelve pegs which are placed in the holes at the start of the game, leaving the central hole clear. The pegs begin on opposite sides of the board. To move, a peg is placed in a vacant hole.

The aim is to take all the opponent's pegs. To take a peg, there must be an empty hole on the opposite side of it, so it can be jumped, and multiple jumps can be made.

The game was deisnged for blind and visually impaited players. The pegs are different shapes as well as colours, and the circles are cut into the board. The rules are in English and Braille.

name: Hedbanz Electronic
description:
Electronic version of Hedbanz Charades. Score points by guessing the card on your headband with the help of your teammates as they give clues based on one of three randomly selected modes each round; You can ask "yes" or "no" questions (or from a small selection of provided questions), listen to your teammates describe what's on the card or watch them act it out.

Game play continues until both teams have performed all three game modes.

name: Geoscope
description:
A fun and educational geography game of Ontario!

Geoscope is the original geography series of games* that offer a visual representation of our world. The games are exciting to play and fun to learn on the gameboard maps.

In series* 007/009, Ontario, the players get to know the province through the race along the path from the southernmost region to the northernmost area using "Place" cards, which tell you about the city you've landed on and advance you forwards, and "Chance" cards, which contain trivia about the Ontario and the board itself. Get the answer to a Chance card wrong, and you'll move backwards to the closest safe space on the board.

The winner of the game is the first player to reach Polar Bear Provincial Park at Winisk.

* While the publisher description indicates an intent to release a series of games, it appears that the Ontario game was the only release.

name: Mendelius
description:
Mendelius is a card game for which one or more Mendelius decks are needed (a deck for every two players). The goal is to be the first player to make different combinations of cards, or crossings. Mendelius is an educational game that presents the genetic basis of the Mendelian inheritance.

A game of Mendelius is played in seven rounds. In each round you have to perform several predetermined crossingss whose difficulty increases as the game progresses, as in other card games such as Gin Rummy. The winner of the round discounts 10 points, while the other players are assigned a score corresponding to the sum of the value of the cards that have been left in their hands at the end of the round. The winner is the player with the lowest score at the end of the game.

name: Just 1 More Cat
description:
This is a cat-themed card game with a lot of luck and a lot of directed spite. It has two decks -- one with action effects and one with cat photos, each with a cute description and a point value. Players draw and use actions to collect cats worth the most points.

From the back of the box:

Just 1 More Cat is an all ages card and dice game where the champion of the game adopts the most cast. Players adopt cats from the cat herd, then trade, steal, and adopt more (you guessed it) cats.

Watch out for cat fights and Catmaggedon.

name: Basketball Duel
description:
Basketball Duel is a fast card game for 1/2/4 players that simulates a basketball game. Players attack and defend in turns and following basketball possession rules. It is an action/reaction game, with bluffing, hand management and luck.

Cards are divided in two parts, an attack action and a defensive action. The basic layer of the game is using colors, each attack has a color and defensive cards cancel one or more colors. But there is much more to it, you are able to move to different positions, some cards have effects when or when not canceled. Most basketball elements are simulated too: rebounds, fast breaks, interceptions, fouls, bad shots, dunks, blocks...

Each round feels different with all the possible combinations and players have few important decisions to take in each turn that can change completely the result of each round.

Basketball Duel thread for contest

—description from the designer

name: Flights of Fancy
description:
Players draft dice in an attempt to create the ultimate beer flight. Dice represent beer color, primary flavor, and glassware. Each player has a flight paddle with dice slots for four beers. Drafted dice are placed in the appropriate slots. Grab as many victory coasters as you can along the way.

—description from the designer

name: Star-Hammer
description:
Star-Hammer is a set of miniatures rules based on the "Star Wars" movies, using alterations to the Warhammer Ancient Battles rules, so you will need a copy to play them.

The rules are a tactical level game over the vastness of space. It is a game of movement and not about getting your Squadrons facing the right direction (so no need to turn or wheel). The Shooting Phase been removed and all combat takes place in the Hand to Hand Phase, because Fighters only can shoot at each other and cannot fire over the great distance of space. Full Army Lists included, which includes; X-Wings, Tie Fighters, and the Millennium Falcon, Also statics for ships from the new movies (The Forces Awakens)

The author designed the rules to use his collection of “Hot Wheels Star Wars Starships” toys, through any Star Wars miniatures could be used.

—description from the publisher

(Star-Hammer is not based on, or associated with the video game Star Hammer)

name: Boat Survival
description:
You are a daring adventurer who has decided to head out on a dangerous voyage across the seven seas in search of treasure, islands, and fame!

Crossing oceans in a rowboat is difficult, and you will face hunger, sickness, and a plethora of unhappy dice rolls, but you will go on with no fear! It is a board game, after all.

After setting the amount of turns in the game, you start. Each turn is divided into three phases, Fate, Action, and Stats, in which you see if you lose items or gain items decide your course of action, and then see if you’re starving to death. If you loose all your health, you lose, but if you complete all the turns, you win!

The ideal game for the lonely, poor and speedy gamer!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Nautical, Print & Play, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Forests (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The Forests expansion is a mammoth 150-tile expansion and may be added to a game of Carcassonne independently of the others. All the other expansions in the series require the Forests expansion to be played with. The series were developed by Scott and Novelty.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Looper
description:
Looper is played on a toroidal board represented by a square grid. Only orthogonally adjacent cells count as adjacent. (Thus, there are no diagonal connections.)

On each turn, a player places 1,2 or 3 black stones on any vacant intersection. Alternatively, on his/her turn a player may announce "take", after which the opponent continues with white and the taker with black, alternately playing single stones onto empty intersections.

Black wins by making a global loop. White wins by preventing this. A global loop is a string of connected stones that circles the torus (either horizontally, vertically, or both horizontally and vertically) and connects back to itself.

A full guide to rules and tactics is here: https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/178192/looper-rules-and-t...

—description from the designer

name: KR 16
description:
