A simple set of generic SF miniatures combat rules freely available from CP Models. Should easily handle modern-day combat too, actually. An optional background set on the planet Kometenmelodie is provided.

Written for 6mm figures, but should be easily adapted for other scales if measurements are scaled up appropriately. For example, could be used for 15mm figures if all measurements in cm are taken as inches instead.

Players alternate activating squads or vehicles, using dice to see if their troops successfully execute orders and to resolve combat. Troops are very simply defined by their quality (determining how responsive they are to orders and their accuracy), their armour rating (determining how likely they are to survive being hit), and what weapons they're carrying (determining range and rate of fire). A few extra rules exist to handle special weapons and vehicles: most notably, most antipersonnel weapons can't harm armoured vehicles at all.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly: TripAdvisor
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
TripAdvisor enables travelers to plan and have the perfect trip. TripAdvisor offers advice from travelers and a wide variety of travel choices and planning features with seamless links to booking tools. TripAdvisor branded sites make up the largest travel community in the world, with more than 20 million unique monthly visitors and over 150 million reviews and opinions covering more than 4 million accommodations, restaurants and attractions. The sites operate in 40 countries worldwide.
TripAdvisor includes TripAdvisor for Business, a dedicated division that provides the tourism industry access to millions of monthly TripAdvisor Visitors.
This limited edition Monopoly board is a gift from the UK Social Team to the TAMG staff of the UK and Ireland as a thank you for their hard work and continued commitment to the company during 2014.

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Rio de Janeiro / Buenos Aries
LIGHT BLUE
Marrakech / Cape Town / Cairo
PINK
Stockholm / Helsinki / St Petersburg
ORANGE
Bangkok / Singapore / Kuala Lumpur (spelling mistake on board ‘Kuala lumpar’)
RED
Paris / Berlin / Prague
YELLOW
New York / Chicago / San Fransisco
GREEN
Seoul / Hong Kong / Tokyo
DARK BLUE
Sydney / London
STATIONS
Swimming Pool / Gymnasium / Business Centre / Concierge
UTILITIES
Spa / Restaurant
TAXES
Staff Uniforms / Last Minute Cancellation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: All Things Zombie: Casino Carnage
description:
I Want a Casino!

It's after the Zombie Apocalypse and players want to find and control a small Casino. Your goal is to clear it out and make a fortune. In the way are zombies, gangs, and other players who have the same idea.

Casino Carnage is a board game using cards, dice, and minis. Designed to be played solo or cooperatively against the game, or competitively head to head, no two games will ever play exactly alike.

With our tried and true Origins Award winning Reaction System you're always in the game, every turn. Easy to learn, but difficult to master, Casino Carnage can be played as a one off game or part of a larger campaign telling a Story, YOUR Story.

"How many zombies did you kill?"
"I don't know. It's not that kind of zombie game."

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Plezant Gezelschap "Het spel"
description:
Small roll and move game. Players have to roll and move as fast as possible to the end point, A bit like game of goose. In that process they have to complete a bunch of riddels.

The game is published as a promotion for their La Chouffe beer.
Published by Belgian brewery D'achouffe.

name: Chicken Out!
description:
Count your chickens and out-fox your friends!

Chicken Out! is the egg-citing, feather ruffling card game for 2-6 players.

Presented in a bright and quirky tuck box, Chicken Out! encourages players to take it in turns to play the cards from their hand with the aim of reaching 21.

Each player in turn plays the top card of their pile, adding the value to the previous player's total and announces the new count. If a Chicken card with a black number is played, the number must be added to the running total. If a Chicken card with a red number is played and it brings the total to higher than 21, players can subtract the value from the previous total to avoid them going bust.

But watch out! Hidden among the flock are 10 cheeky foxes that will either help or hinder each player's chances of winning. The first player to run out of cards rules the roost and wins the game!

name: The Dragon's Favour
description:
In the great Empire of the Dragon, seats of power are awarded based entirely on merit, inspired by the divine hand of the Dragon Clan, which never makes mistakes.

How one determines merit, that’s the trick, though: In the Empire of the Dragon, there are delegations from each clan that come together, argue, discuss, negotiate and deal over days to divine who, exactly, will be the clan that chooses the next magistrate to fill this seat.

And you lead one of those delegations, seeking to win the seat for your clan.

The Dragon’s Favour is a player-versus-player voting/hidden information game for two to seven players. Each round, players meet and gather and nominate political allies and rivals to try and curry the favour of the court, in the hopes of claiming a Magistrate’s seat on the Imperial Isle. It is a time for cunning and intrigue, courtly consideration and deals.

—description from the publisher

name: Ricedice
description: Shake the dice to make Umeboshi rice, sprinkle black sesame seeds on it, and reach out for side dishes! The more that you acquire and the more desirable your side dishes in Ricedice, the more you will be the champion of lunchtime!

name: Pawn Command 2
description:
Abstract duel that is very much in line of classic games like Chess and Checkers because of its patterned movement, capturing and 5x8 squared board, but also shares similarity with newer ones like Onitama because of the way that different movement patterns can be applied to pawns. However, it has few of its own mechanics and twists that make it distinctively different. It is language independent and has fairly strong fantasy battle theme for pure abstract game.

—description from the designer

name: Bushido: Kosuke
description:
Kosuke hails from the mainland of the Empire. He fights with all four limbs, strength and skill are indistinguishable between arms and legs, hands and feet. He comes in aid of his fellow monks of the Ro-Kan and the prowess he shows on the battlefield will be well received by those he fights alongside. However his presence has caused disquiet amongst the Masters of the Ro-Kan. What message does Kosuke’s presence herald?

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: War of the Rings
description:
User summary:

War of the Rings is a Diplomacy variant written by Jeff Key and published in Chimaera (Issue 13 - Mar 1976). The basic game follows the 1971 rules, but with numerous exceptions. The rules were accompanied by a custom color map.

The game supports six players and the named nations are Mordor, Rohan, Gondor, The Men of the North, The Elves, and The Dwarves. Although fleets and sea travel are de-emphasized, the map presents five sea areas. The initial setup does not contain fleets and fleets cannot be built. However the buildable unit "bunchaboats" is functionally somewhat similar. The land area is divided into an exceptional number of provinces, many of which have an indicated "terrain" that limits which types of unit may enter (for example, only Goblins, Ents, and Dwarves may enter mountain terrain). There are thirteen neutral supply centers at the start of play, including The Shire. The initial land setup heavily favors Mordor which starts with eight provinces; The Dwarves starts with two provinces; all other groups start with three provinces. This forces most, or all, of the players to align against Mordor. The initial units include special "double strength" and "triple strength" armies. During play, only normal strength armies can be created.

There is an additional special piece, The Ring, that begins in The Shire region. No player owns The Ring but any player can move The Ring with any army unit that moves from the area that holds it. Alternately, some units may "put on" The Ring which then becomes inseparable, conferring some significant benefits (including invisibility - the unit receives orders as usual, but they are not made public unless the unit engages in combat). If the unit "wearing" The Ring is destroyed The Ring remains in the province.

There are three separate victory conditions: (1) a player may move The Ring to Barad-Dur, destroying it; (2) the Mordor "triple strength" army (AKA Sauron) is eliminated; (3) the Mordor "triple strength" army and The Ring end a turn in the same province. In the case of (1) or (2), Mordor loses and the relative strengths of the remaining players are compared to determine a winner. In the case of (3), Mordor wins.

The rules also present several modifications to the standard rules, primarily regarding the "double strength" and "triple strength" armies. Too, four turns per year are played. Intended for postal play, the game supports traditional table play without alteration.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Quest of Thane Tostig
description:
An early set of fantasy miniature tabletop wargame rules which were released in 1977 with an associated set of miniatures. The booklet itself is a 12-page A5 book, typeset with illustrations in black and white with colored card covers

As play progresses certain events are triggered. Combat is resolved through d10 rolls, and uses hit point locations to determine damage, while magic uses a point system and carries a chance of misfiring.

A scenario was defined within the rules. The hero player was required to raid through woodland and into a small pre-mapped dungeon area with a team of seven miniatures. Meanwhile the evil player had to use his army of eighty orc-like "Sprites" to defend against the heroes incursion.

From the Rulebook: We have devised these rules for use with the Thane Tostig range of fantasy figures designed and produced by Barry Minot, who also drew the illustrations.

They are intended to give an easy to play, fast moving, fantasy action game, which though ideal for the younger wargamer, will provide a basis on which older wargamers and fantasy fanatics can build, adding as many further complications as their fertile minds may devise.

name: Kongens Fald
description:
Kongens Fald (The Fall of the King) is an exciting and strategic board game about building your kingdom, abducting pretty princesses, recruiting soldiers and conquering a neighbouring realm.
The fate of your realm is decided by random events, throws of dice and not the least your own tactic and strategic skills.

—description from the box (translated)

name: Remember When ...: FLASHBACKS Expansion
description: This expansion to the family party game "Remember When..." DOUBLES the number of word cards in the game! Contains 384 additional word cards in all 8 colors. With this expansion plus the base game (which is required to play), players will own every card from the free online version at Board Game Arena.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Voting

name: Geologists (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description: This time you have to go to 1976 A.T. in a town called Raduzhny that placed in the Soviet Union. The Consortium has attracted an unusual spectrum of radiation, probably humanity has found a new type of Anomaly. Your team will collect data on this find and as usually protect people and the space-time from its impact.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Scissor Fight
description:
An abstract shape matching and spatial reasoning game for anyone who can be trusted with scissors.
Players take turns cutting out shapes from scrap paper and fitting them into existing shapes without going over the lines. Points are scored by fitting into existing shapes while covering over your opponents shapes. Points are lost by going over the edges and being covered over. First player to 10 points wins.

name: Disney Cars Racing and Action Game
description:
Disney Pixar Cars Racing and Action Game
- Fast paced racing game and action game
- Includes four buildable cars to play the racing game
- Travel Size
- Suitable for ages 4+ and 2 or more players

2 in 1 game:
Racing game - it's a tileplacemnet game
Acion game - like UNO

Content:
- 4x 3D cars
- 50 cards
- rules
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: The Great Pyramid Game
description:
The Great Pyramid Game is an epic test of mental agility with a high degree of competitive tension. Play it seriously or for fun - with 4 players or 1. Mums and Dads test your powers of observation against the kids!

Unfold your pyramid into a beautiful three-dimensional structure on which you can play three exciting pyramid games for 2 or 4 players, plus a mind blowing solo version.

The Great Pyramid Game will stretch your speed of recognition to the limit in a race against another player. A game of EPIC proportions.

—description from the publisher

name: Kings of War: Clash of Kings – 2018 Edition
description:
Inside this book you will find the concluding narrative to our epic Kings of War summer campaign that ran last year as well as the altered map of Mantica! Most exciting for players though will be all the new and changed units, spells and artifacts which we have concocted along with the Rules Committee to help put a whole new spin on armies and the way the game is played.

So sharpen your swords, polish that armor and let’s march to war!

Conclusion to the Edge of the Abyss campaign – see the new map, which was changed by YOUR games and read what’s happened to the theaters of war detailed in the course of the campaign

New units – the majority of factions will receive brand new units or Living Legends, such as a legendary Rock Thrower for the Goblins and a mythical Fire Elemental for the Salamanders/Forces of Nature

New formations – after launching a handful of formations in the Edge of the Abyss campaign, the Rules Committee has now added extra formations for the remaining armies

New and updated spells!

Updated unit stats – plenty of units have been tweaked in Clash of Kings to ensure the game stays as competitive as possible

New and updated scenarios

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Police Precinct: Game Boy Geek Promo Card
description:
Originally contained in Police Precinct: Crooked Lawyers and then offered in the BGG Store in April 2018

Text says:
The GBG was paid off by a gang to create falsified evidence which supports allegations of excessive force!

After the next successful arrest attempt:
1. Immediately place all arrested punks on arresting officer's vehicle, then later..
2. Drop off the punks at the bank for a pay-off
3. After the pay-off, during future turn(s), pick up the punks from the bank, then drop them off at the station to sign paperwork (and return them to the general supply)
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Ruby Monsters
description:
Ruby Monsters is a "sister work" to Diamonsters, using the same art with some rules changes. Like the other game it uses a "butting" mechanic similar to Hol's der Geier.

Players have a hand consisting of monster cards numbered 1-5. Each turn a card is drawn from the treasure deck, which can be a ruby card (with 1, 2, or 3 rubies) or a skull card. Everyone picks a monster from their hand and reveals it at the same time. If two players put out the same number those cards are removed, and then the highest card wins, except 1 beats 5. The winner removes the monster they used from their hand and the losers get their monsters back.

There are three ways to win: get a total of five rubies, get two skulls, or get four treasure cards of any kind.

—user summary

name: Vaca Muerta
description:
In Vaca Muerta, the players take the role of energy companies which must decide where to invest. The workers are represented by dice and can be used to work in the field, build factories, convince the media, etc. Different generation systems (nuclear, hydroelectrical, coal, etc.) produce different amounts of money, corruption, and environmental damage.
The game includes a double point system, one for money and the other for corruption. At the end of the game, the player with the most corruption is out, and the winner is who has more money.

name: Legio VI Julia Augusta
description:
Legio VI Julia Augusta is a set of miniatures wargames rules aimed to allow large battles of Roman Late Republican and Early Imperial periods (100 BC to AD 250) to be resolved relatively quickly. It's meant for 6mm figures but could easily be adapted to larger (or smaller!) figures.

The rules are derived from the same designer's Comitatus set of Dark Ages rules, but slimmed down to allow larger battles to be fought in less time. Troops are classed a relatively small number of troop types with minimal differentiation based on equipment; the focus is on troop quality and, especially, generals' limited means of controlling their forces.

The rules are freely available from the designer's webpage, along with sister sets covering adjoining periods:

Legio VI Macedonia, for 400 BC to 100 BC
Legio VI Constantiniani, for AD 250 to AD 600
Legio VI Diadochi, for Alexander and the Successors

name: Close Fire & European Order: The Field of Battle – 1700-1720
description:
Miniatures battle game for the 1700-1720 period in Europe (so principally the War of the Spanish Succession and the Great Northern War). The rules are based on those for Andy Callan's Loose Files and American Scramble, a AWI set.

The game aims to capture the transitional nature of early 18C warfare, one foot in the "pike & shot" era, one in the "horse and musket" period. Individual battalions and squadrons are represented, but the practical units of manoeuvre are brigades or even groups of brigades, allowing large battles to be fought in a timely manner.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Vor langer, langer Zeit...
description:
Subtitled "Mit Spaß und Fantasie durchs Moor", this is a game published as part of the Expo 2000 campaign "Das Tote Moor soll leben" ("The Dead Moor Is To Live Again") to promote restoration of the Dead Moor area near Hannover, a historic peat stripping site. In addition to the rules of the game, the rulebook contains information on the biotopes, wildlife, history, archaeology and folklore of the moor, although the game itself is not of an overtly educational nature. Max Moorfrosch, the project mascot, also makes an appearance as a joker tile in the game.

The game is set in medieval times and is played on a board of hexagonal spaces representing the moor. Village tiles are placed on the perimeter, and a peat-mining tile is placed in the middle. By placing log road tiles, players race to connect their two villages with a causeway passing through the peat-mining site, and the first player or team to complete this connection wins the game.

Before each turn, a card is turned over to reveal the advice of the village elders, which may involve missing a turn due to bad weather, being restricted to playing a certain type of tile that turn due to a mishap, getting a double placement due to good weather, or some such. Obstacle tiles are also encountered on the board face down, and mostly have to simply be built around, although some when approached and turned up may also offer an opportunity to place a bridge directly across, or require expenditure of special resources (like an offering for the sacrificial site and using torch-lit roads to keep away the ghosts), or even provide the magical power of the Golden Helm to ward off hazards.

The game contains rules for one, two or four players; in the latter case, two players make up a team with partially shared resources, each joining up their village with the peat tile instead of working from one village to the other. There are also suggestions for any number of players to cooperate as one team or compete as two.

name: Chronoflight
description:
Perception of time is a difficult skill that takes many months to fully develop in children.


What is a half-hour?
Is five minutes a lot?
Why is the hour split into 60 minutes?


All of these questions require understanding and the habit of correlating clock-hand movements with flow of day and night. The new game from The Brainy Band will help children to determine the time on the clock-face, to figure out the relation between “hours” and “minutes,” and to learn the notions of time and duration of activities.

By performing different fun tasks, the players will move around the game board designed in the form of a clock-face. The players’ objective is to do as much as possible in the course of the game, while preventing others from completing their activities and moving forward.

—description from the publisher

name: dittoit!
description: Each team receives a deck with an agreed-upon number of cards. A team member draws a card that contains a category and a number of clues related to the category. The card is handed unseen to the other team, and a player from that team reads the category and the clues, one at a time. The clues re-write sayings, titles, events, objects, etc. using synonyms. The team whose member drew the card tries to figure out the original wording of all the clues within 30 seconds. If the team succeeds, the card is discarded. The first team to run out of cards wins.

name: Cerberus Deck-Building Game: Cryptozoic 2016 Volunteer Promo Card
description:
A normal card to add to any Cerberus game. These cards were printed in extremely limited supply and given to the volunteers that helped demo Cryptozoic's games during the 2016 season of conventions. There is a male & female version of this card, same effect.

A single card, that gains more power when more volunteers play.

2016 CZE Volunteer
Hero

+ 2 power for each CZE Volunteer you play or have played this turn (including this card).
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: La Bonne Pêche
description:
La Bonne Pêche is about a fishing season. The players have to fish in three zones of different profitability with respect to quotas and sell their catches when back on land.
The game ends when a player has sold fishes from all three zones. Other players have to pay penalties based on how far away from land they are. Wealthiest player wins the game.

name: A Rock and a Hard Place: The Battle of Fort Benghaisa, 1942
description:
Had the Germans and Italians gone ahead with Operation Herkules, the invasion of Malta, a key position they would have needed to take was Fort Benghaisa. That fort guarded the second island’s second largest port on the eastern end of Malta (Marsaxlokk Bay). A Rock and a Hard Place details the planned German airborne assault to take the fort.

—description from the publisher

name: Zoo Party
description:
Object: Be the last person with the Zoo-Party-Winner card at the end of the game.

Play: One player is chosen to deal. The dealer shuffles the cards and deals out the deck, one card at a time. Players hold their cards in their hands. Each player separates the cards into pairs and places each set of pairs face up on the table. The player to the left of the dealer begins. They mix the remaining cards in their hand behind their back and then holds them face down to the player on their left. The Player on the left draws one card. If that card "pairs" with one of the remaining cards in their hand they may lay down the pair, then the player shuffles their remaining cards in hand behind their back and presents them face down to the player on their left. Play continues in the same way until only the Zoo-Party-Card remains. The Player with the Zoo-Party-Winner card left in hand is the winner. Players May bluff in an attempt to make other players draw a card other than the Zoo-Party-Winner card.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game

name: 迷いの森 (The Lost Woods)
description:
迷いの森 (The Lost Woods) is a co-operative game from Japan. One to four players work together to try to keep Little Red Riding Hood safe from the Wolf, and get her to her grandmother's house. If the players can do this in under eight minutes, they win. If they run out of time, or connect LRRH to the Wolf by the paths, they lose.

Gameplay is similar to the Ravensburger game Labyrinth. A series of square cards are laid out, six between LRRH and Grandma's cottage. Two more rows of six are laid above and also below, making a grid of 30 squares. Some of the cards show a wolf, all of the cards have paths, turning and branching.

On their turn, a player takes one of the four remaining path cards, and inserts it into the grid from the edge of one of the four sides. This pushes all the path cards along, until the final one becomes open, and this goes into the player's hand for next turn. Players cannot insert a card on the line where LRRH or the cottage are sitting.

After moving the grid, players check to see if LRRH has a clear path to a Wolf, and then a clear path to the cottage. If she is connected to a wolf, they lose. If she is connected to the cottage but not a wolf, they win. If they cannot get LRRH to the cottage before 8 minutes are up, they lose.

Players can make the game harder by restricting the time available, or limiting the actual game turns, to 16 turns suggests the designer.

The game was released at the Tokyo Game Market in May 2018 and early buyers were rewarded with a special set of stickers.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: La Conquista
description:
The aim of the game is the conquest of areas where the players have to place the three types of buildings in their possession: chalets, factories, malls.
The player who first manages to place all his constructions or, if the playing area is complete, the one that has placed the largest number of constructions wins.

name: Storm Dragons
description:
Storm Dragons is a competitive game for 2-4 players (2-6 if you use two decks). It plays in about 30 minutes. The game starts by drafting dragons and storms for your army (beginners can just deal the cards). The game is played over a series of battle rounds. In a battle, you take turns in clockwise order. On your turn you can add a dragon to your dragon flight, add a storm to your storm front, challenge, or pass. Both dragon and storm cards have instant effects when played. Some cards have ongoing effects if the they are the top card in your dragon flight or storm front respectively.

Each round is played either during the day or the night, as selected by the player who starts the round, but some dragon cards allow the player to change from day to night or vice versa. Most cards have different combat strengths during day versus night and many cards have different abilities in the day or night, so control of the battle may switch back and forth. Play continues until all but one player has yielded. The last player in the battle round wins all of the cards played in the round and places them in their victory pile.

The object of the game is to have the most dragon cards in your victory pile at the end of the game.

-description from designer

name: Balap Kuliner
description:
Balap Kuliner tells about the local and foreign tourists who meet at culinary festivals in the city of Semarang. They have to find the fastest way to the store that sells the food. Not to mention they will face the heat of the weather and the crowded traffic jam in the downtown. Not only that, they also need to wait for the shuttle bus on the right timing to get them home and bring the delicious culinary safely. Balap Kuliner is suitably played for 2-4 players, with age of 10 years old. With the grid movement and card mechanics, this game is easy to play and only take 15-20 minutes for each game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Pokémon Scratchees: Tower of Terror
description:
Pokémon psychic guessing game, with psychic, ghost, poison, grass, and normal Pokémon. "Gotta scratch 'em all!"

In this scratch off game, two players scratch off a square in the pyramid, revealing Pokémon, Team Rocket, treasures, etc. Depending on the revealed icon, players get to scratch off other sections of the card. However collects the most Pokémon (points) wins the game.

name: Anxiety
description:
You are a person suffering from Anxiety. Try to survive and thrive while enduring breathing difficulties, sleeplessness, and intense worry and dread.

Each turn, you will first draw a card which will show what kinds of Anxiety effects will punish you. These effects place cards on one of three tracks above the gameboard. Then you will use the healing effects on your cards to mitigate these Anxiety effects.

If any of the tracks above the gameboard has three cards and you need to play another card to that track, you instead raise the Panic Level one space. If it ever reaches 20, you lose the game. You win the game if you run through the entire deck before your Panic Level reaches 20.

This is a solitaire card game that takes 15-30 minutes to play. 2-5 player cooperative rules are available.

name: Tiananmen Square: The Unknown Protester
description:
The game recreates the events of June 5, 1989. Players take the role of either the Chinese Government controlling a column of Type 59 main battle tanks advancing along Chang’an Avenue in Beijing, or a lone Chinese student holding two shopping bags.

The game last ten turns. If the tanks get past the Protester the Government player wins. If the Government has not won by the end of the tenth turn, the Protester player wins.

The players should consider switching sides and playing again. Regardless of the outcome players are encouraged to discuss the historical significance of the event.

This game made in the USA - Definitely not printed in China.

“Tiananmen Square” is a product of Feb30 Games, a game design group (not a publisher) made up of Ref Tom Green and David Helber.

This constitutes the Print-n-Play version. Feb30 Games hereby gives you permission to print a FREE single copy of the 3-up image. Keep one copy of the game for yourself and distribute the other two copies to friends. We hope to offer a deluxe boxed version of the game someday.

Note: If after reading the rules you are confused how the Government player might win, see "Government victory" in the Forums (strategy) section below on this page. It contains Spoilers.

Languages (rules translations so far):
Catalan
Dutch
English (original)
French
Italian
Russian
Spanish
Kudos to the BGG users who volunteered to add a translation. See them as comments in the BGG Forums section on this page below.

—description from the designer

name: NanoTec
description:
Nanodaption of HeroTec.


Description by the designer:

Based on HeroTec by Duane Kolar, as part of the November 2017 WGKS.

Test out your new superhero devices and assemble a set of four. Move around the workshop, spinning the action grid to access new movement options and block your rival from them, use the movements to maneuver your pieces around the lab, and activate some of the powers to Spin, Leap, Dash and Shove your way to a complete set of devices before your rival.

This comes with 2 cards and rules. Cut out the 10 tokens from one of the cards, or use your own.

name: Dueling Dinos
description:
Duel your dinos and show the other cave clans who is the strongest!

Dueling Dinos is a card game in which the object is to outsmart your opponent and gather rewards. Each player drafts a pack of dinosaurs (dinos), wagers precious stones (tokens), and then watches as their dinos take on their opponents dinos in head to head duels.

Each player is dealt a hand of three cards which are arranged in a line face down. These cards are their pack of dinos. Players take turns successively replacing these cards from the deck or discard pile until one player is satisfied with their pack and knocks. The aim is to make a pack that can win the most head to head duels.

When you think you have the best chance of winning the round you can use your turn to knock instead of drawing to replace one of your cards. This causes the play to end after each of the other players has taken one more turn.

The game is played across five rounds and the player with the most stones at the end of those five rounds is the winner. If, at the start of a round, a player can not ante three coins the game is over and that player has lost. Alternately, before the game begins, players may agree upon a set time limit or number of rounds for the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Trick-taking

name: Dinamic-Goal Binaca
description:
3 custom dice for this simple and old Push-Your-Luck soccer game.

Red and blue dice are for the 2 teams, white dice is for shooting on goal.

The language of this game is italian, roll the wooden dice and try to win the football match.

name: Sailor's War in the Pacific
description: Sailor's War in the Pacific is a strategic level wargame of the Pacific War from the viewpoint of the shipping industry. Japanese player classifies transport ships into three divisions and uses them: A) ships for army's logistics, B) ships for navy's logistics and C) ships for transportation of natural resources from Southeast Asia to the mainland of Japan. Allied player aims to destroy these ships. If there is no resource in the mainland of Japan at the end of final turn, Allied player wins. Otherwise, Japanese player wins.

name: Legio VI Macedonica
description:
Legio VI Macedonica is a set of miniatures wargames rules aimed to allow large battles of Roman Middle Republican period (400-100 BC) to be resolved relatively quickly. It's meant for 6mm figures but could easily be adapted to larger (or smaller!) figures.

The rules are derived from the same designer's Comitatus set of Dark Ages rules, but slimmed down to allow larger battles to be fought in less time. Troops are classed a relatively small number of troop types with minimal differentiation based on equipment; the focus is on troop quality and, especially, generals' limited means of controlling their forces.

The rules are freely available from the designer's webpage, along with sister sets covering adjoining periods:

Legio VI Julia Augusta, for 100 BC to AD 250
Legio VI Constantiniani, for AD 250 to AD 600
Legio VI Diadochi, for Alexander and the Successors

name: Legio VI Diadochi
description:
Legio VI Diadochi is a set of miniatures wargames rules aimed to allow large battles of Alexander the Great and the Successors to be resolved relatively quickly. It's meant for 6mm figures but could easily be adapted to larger (or smaller!) figures.

The rules are derived from the same designer's Comitatus set of Dark Ages rules, but slimmed down to allow larger battles to be fought in less time. Troops are classed a relatively small number of troop types with minimal differentiation based on equipment; the focus is on troop quality and, especially, generals' limited means of controlling their forces.

The rules are freely available from the designer's webpage, along with sister sets focusing on the Romans:

Legio VI Julia Augusta, for 100 BC to AD 250
Legio VI Macedonica, for 400-100 BC
Legio VI Constantiniani, for AD 250-600

name: アスキノウ (Asukinou)
description:
Play cards in sequence of the days of a week, the first player to get rid of their hand wins.
There are two types of cards, one has a date printed on both sides of the card, and the other has only one date printed.
Players can predict their opponents hand with double printed cards, enabling them to block them from playing those cards.

name: どうぶつトレカ (Animal Trading Card)
description:
どうぶつトレカ (Animal Trading Card) is a two player card game with light easy rules. The players are battling each other using decks of cards with animals. One player has daytime animals, the other has nocturnal animals (some animals are both). Each player has seven stars. The first to take the seventh star off their opponent is the winner (you can vary this to make the game shorter).

The game is deliberately designed to be easy for new gamers to play a trading-card style game (like Magic: the Gathering) by learning deck-building. The theme, artwork and gameplay make this an easy introduction into deck building and combative style TCGs. But there is no actual trading involved. The game includes all the cards you need.

Each player's deck has various animals, from large and strong to small and weak. Each animal needs food and players collect enough food to be able to send the animal of their choice into combat on the player mat. Animals have values for strength and heart, the animal with stronger or equal values defeats the other. But food is consumed as they attack, and if the player exhausts their food supply, they lose.
-user summary

The publisher says "Easy to play! Easy to start!". They say the game is for children and adults who would not normally try a TCG-style game like this. The simple illustrations and easy rules make it a good introduction. The game has 80 cards, 2 play sheets and 1 instruction sheet in Japanese. There is some Japanese text on the cards.

name: Zombie Doctor: The Classic Horror Expansion Pack
description:
The Zombie Doctor world is officially growing with The Classic Horror Expansion Pack.

These are four iconic characters which can be mixed with the original characters from the base Zombie Doctor game, or played with as a standalone game. Pain or Gain Cards from the base Zombie Doctor game will be needed and not supplied with the expansion pack.

The characters are:


Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
The Mummy
The Invisible Man
Dracula


The characters' design are inspired by the old films and classic novels. They're incredibly suitable for the game's mechanics as they turn from one thing into another! Perfect for fans of the classics or a great addition to your horror games.

—description from the publisher

name: Myth Creation
description:
In Myth creation, You become gods in Korean mythology and create new myths. Be the best god.
This is a simple and fun trick-taking game.
Take two cards and compare them.
The player who has / had a larger number of cards wins.
If two numbers are the same, you can beat two different cards.
If each player hold a pair of cards, the higher number wins.
The winning player must perform an action on a large number of cards.
The larger number of cards, the larger the penalty.
The smaller number of cards, the greater the advantage.
No one can predict who will win until the end of the game.
Enjoy the fast, simple and fun trick-taking game Myth Creation.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Mythology, Party Game

name: Stroop: Wild
description:
Stroop: Wild consists of a set of four promotional cards that can be added to the Stroop base game.

In Round One: You may play a wild card if the previous card names the color, size, pattern, number, or direction of the wild card. Every card is then eligible to be played on the wild card.

In Round Two: You may play a wild card at any time. The next card played must name the color, size, pattern, number, or direction of the wild card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: We the Meeples
description:
In We the Meeples, three to five players will pick and argue about the laws that are to implemented in the newly formed country of Boardgamelandia. Each player will have a political alliance with one of nine political parties and try to score points based on the laws the players pass throughout the game. The player at the end of the game with the strongest political party becomes the first President of the country.

After dealing out cards, players will draw another card on their turn, choose between the two cards for what laws they want to pass, and arguing will commence. The twist for Boardgamelandia's new Constitution though states that every bill must pass. It is up to the players to determine which part of the bill will go through through every political means possible

In this tiny 18 card game, players will constantly have to defend their political beliefs in 18 different categories on cards that are usable in four different ways. But, if you see the laws are not going your way, you may decide to change political parties mid way through the game. Will you represent The Mind of the Republic with dignity, will you argue for the Agricolarians and their ways of life, or are you a member of the Secret Fascists and plotting world domination.

-description from designer

name: AC-Goose Story
description:
On a distant island, geese live in different villages. One day, they decide to cross the river and go on an adventure to the mysterious world. As only six boats can be used, each villages tries hard to let more of their geese embark. Meanwhile, the naughty wildcats and weasels are to hinder everyone...

Game Set Up: Place the boat card and black dice in the center of the playing area; Each player chooses a color and takes their respective game cards, dice, and player screen of their own colors; Each player places the player screen in front of them.

Game Play: There will be 6 turns in a game.
1. Each player rolls a dice and places it on the boat card. The summation of the number on dice represent the number of boat seats in this round;

2. Each player chooses 2 cards in their hands, then places the card face-down in front of themselves in same time. When all players are ready, everyone reveals their chosen cards by turning them face-up;

3. Executing the action of the function cards.

4. According to the number printed at upper-right corner of the cards, arrange the goose cards and luggage cards in ascending order near the boat card. The smallest number of card can embark first, followed by the others accordingly until the boat full loaded;

5. Each players moves their goose card (which get onto the boat) and AC-Goose Man Card (which successfully got rid of the weasels) to their own scoring zone, trashes the remaining goose cards and used function cards to the trash pile;

6.Start the next turn.

Game End: When you have played 6 turns, the game is over. Each player calculates their adventure points; each goose in the scoring zone valued 1 adventure point and each AC-Goose Man in the scoring zone valued 3 adventure points.

The Winner: The player with the most adventure points is the winner. If two or more players tie, the winner will be the player with the most AC-Goose Man cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Nanofictionary Blanks
description:
Nanofictionary is a storytelling game in three rounds. The first round involves the construction of the stories, in which players race to collect the four plot elements of setting, characters, problem, and resolution. In the next round, the players tell their stories. After that, the players vote on which were the best stories, with additional votes being added by judges on the sidelines.

Nanofictionary Blanks is an expansion pack for this game that consists of twelve blank cards and a marker. Now you can put your works into the game to inspire the creativity of others.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Tercer Tiempo
description:
Es un juego de cartas, al estilo construye tu mazo, en donde cada equipo tiene por objetivo ganar un partido, para eso debe ir mejorando su mazo de juego entre cartas de habilidades y cartas estratégicas que le permitirán alterar distintas situaciones que se pueden dar.Cada equipo deberá ir eligiendo que cartas jugar de una mano de 6 cartas, hay algunas cartas que son habilidades que sirven para avanzar de forma directa sobre el terreno de juego y otras que son cartas tácticas que proporcionan una oportunidad de realizar combinaciones con las cartas de habilidad o bien modificar el juego del rival.
Luego de que el marcador llegue al resultado pre pactado por los equipos, la próxima jugada que detenga el partido, da por concluido el encuentro. Quien haya obtenido más puntos será el ganador!

English description
It is a card game, style build your deck, where each team aims to win a game, so you must improve your game deck between skill cards and strategic cards that allow you to alter different situations that can occur.
Each team must choose which cards to play from a 6-card hand, there are some cards that are skills that are used to advance directly on the pitch and others that are tactical cards that provide an opportunity to make combinations with the cards of skill or modify the opponent's game
The game ends after a team reaches the score marked on the scoreboard and the game stops.

name: Mismemory
description:
Easy memory game originally designed for the Piecepack. It can also be played with other materials, such as standard playing cards.

24 tiles of cards, bearing the numbers 1 to 6 in 4 suits, are displayed on the table in a well-defined matrix. In each turn, a player uncover two of them - if they match suit, the player can secretly choose one of them and keep it (unless they already have a tile/card with the same number). The other tile will be placed on any free position in the matrix. The first player to have 6 tiles/cards, each with one number, wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: StratoYager
description:
Stratoyager is inspired by many SF universes, but if we were to point out the most important ones, those would be Wing Commander, Star Lancer, Battlestar Galactica, Space Above and Beyond, Babylon 5, Starship Troopers and, last but not least, Aliens.

We tried to recreate space flight „physics” known from Wing Commander game and Battlestar Galactica TV show, where fighters in space don’t act as WWII planes over Pacific, but can actually perform maneuvers available in space, like moving sideways, spinning, or fly on reverse thrust.

Movement is based on vector principle, and we tried our best to make it as easy to grasp as possible, to deliver maximum fun with minimum bookkeeping. We are fully aware that those rules are anywhere near actual physics, but we think it is the best compromise between gaming experience and feel of in-universe reality. You will judge it on your own.

Goal of the game is to disable and destroy opponent's Yager forces, but may vary with different missions. Game is played using miniatures, counters, cards and dice. Each craft has a specific maneuver and offensive capability. Turn is divided into
1. Initiative,
2. Maneuver Action,
3. Hull Stress,
4. Combat Actions,
5. Combat Resolution,
6. Damage,
7. Locked Missile Damage.

—description from the publisher

name: Naval Warfare, 1862-1918 Panzer Digest Naval War Special A Battlegame Book
description:
Battleship Captain is a simulation game depicting ship vs ship combat in the era of the battleship. The game covers warships produced in the pre-dreadnought (1890-1906), dreadnought (1906-1919), and World War II (1920-1945) eras, providing gamers the chance to replay a virtually unlimited number of historical or hypothetical scenarios occurring during the six decade "golden age" of the battleship.

90-page book containing 3 naval wargames, plus gaming articles. Games are Monitor vs Merrimack 1862, Tsushima 1905, and Great War NavTac 1914. 2018.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: FMK: Twists Of Fate
description:
F Thor? Marry Gandhi? Kill Hitler? What if he can grant magic wishes? The choices are tough but silly in this hilarious card game.

It's the FMK you know and love—but now with silly, cute, gross, and side-splitting twists!


Draw 4 Character cards.
Add 4 random Twist cards.
Decide who to Frog, who to Marry, and who to Kill.


Now to find out who your true friends are! It’s up to the other players to vote for the choices they think you made.

THEY get points when their vote is correct. YOU score each time your choices go unchallenged. All the fun is in justifying your terrible choices.

—description from the publisher

name: Reflec
description:
PiecePack game for 2-4 players. Played on a 8x8 square grid board created by the back of PiecePack tiles. Each player has one laser (pawn), six mirrors (coins), a power storage (die), and a power gain (four tiles: ace, two, three, and four). On their turn, players gain power some of which may be stored for use in future turns. Players use power to move, turn or switch mirrors or to move or fire their laser. Players aim to shoot opponents' lasers thereby eliminating them from the game. Last man standing wins.

From PiecePack Wiki:
Reflec is an abstract pure strategy game with the Piecepack, where players must outplan each other to create intricate layouts of "mirrors" to direct laser beam's to each other's lasers. Who will be the last one standing?

name: Sip It
description:
Get ready to shake up your next game night with Sip It!

All you need is a couple of fun friends and some frosty beverages to play. Players take turns drawing cards, trying to keep the good ones while avoiding the bad! Cards include tasks ranging from ridiculous antics to mild public embarrassment. If a task is too sour for your taste, you need to take a sip or lose "Easy Peasy Lemon Squeezy" points! The player with the most points at the end of the game wins. It's straight-up fun with a few dashes of laughter blended in to make the best night ever! (Paper umbrellas not included.)

—description from the publisher

name: Moonsun
description:
Have you ever heard of a game that uses a unique card ? There it is ! A game with a tarot card with the moon on one face and the sun on the other. The trick is that depending on the side or the position of the card you have different powers.

In this game, you try to establish the balance between Day and Night by making 2 crosses of each color. Players take turns an on his turn, a player must follow these steps in order:

Draw a card from the deck.
Play a card horizontally or vertically on the side of your choice (Sun or Moon).
Use one of the cards you have in front of you.
Flip the card you have just used.


The first player who succeeds in making to monochromatic crosses wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Art Pieces
description:
In each round you will reveal 3 idea cards. Every person must draw an image including those 3 ideas (for example book+accident+zombie).
After 90 seconds everyone stops and the drawings are shown.
An award card is revealed. This card has a criteria to evaluate the drawings: most unique, misunderstood, simple, awesome, boring, etc.
Then the players choose which one did the best picture according to an award criteria and that player gets an award card.
The game ends when all awards are granted. The player with more awards wins.

As you can see it’s not important who draws better, but who meets the criteria in a better way.

It also has a variant in which you must reveal a commission card which adds an extra complexity (example: comic strip, put a title to your work, etc).

It also has a solitary mode.

—user summary
mechanics: Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Judge, Voting

name: Monopoly: Mecklenburg-Vorpommern
description: Classic Monopoly in a Mecklenburg - Vorpommern edition.

name: Schnecken Checken
description:
Tonight it’s again all about hitting on girls - of course with the best chat-up lines in the world. Who can come up with the best Quote?

—description from the publisher

name: Elefantastico
description:
Balance on the circus elephant! In this exciting stacking game, players use finger tip control to try and place small sticks onto the elephant’s back.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: One to 9
description: Play cards at the right time to grab stars in One to 9. Try not to let other players grab stars first by completing rows ahead of you. The first player to collect three stars wins!

name: Don't Count Your Chickens!
description: 12 eggs are placed on a plastic straw base in a circle with the smaller end pointed to the center. Each player takes turns grabbing an egg while attempting to avoid unbalancing the chicken and awakening her. The last player to not awaken the chicken is the winner.

name: Desfases
description:
In this game, players use their die as a timer; this timer is fed by coins, whose values indicate the amount of turns it will take to trigger a score. Scoring depends on the facing of the tiles around the pawns on the board – which is constantly changing, since the tiles rotate on each turn unless they are pinned by the pawns. This way, dice and tiles are constantly moving in and out of phase with each other.

The game will be won by the player with the highest score after all the timers have stopped and there are no more coins left to feed them.

name: Canal du Midi
description:
The game takes place in 1667, after an edict signed by Louis XIV launched the construction of a canal to connect the Atlantic Ocean to the Mediterranean Sea. Pierre-Paul Riquet is tasked with coordinating this gigantic building project but he needs your help.

In the shoes of one of his engineers, you mission is to build as many sections of the Canal as you can, using available resources the best way possible. Players compete to measure the manpower necessary for each section and earn recognition from Pierre-Paul Riquet. But sudden reinforcements could change the game!

When the Canal du Midi is finished, the player with the most recognition points for the sections they helped build has won the game.

—description from the back of the box

Canal du Midi is a quick game played over 9 rounds in about 15 minutes. Players have 9 worker cards, representing varying amounts of manpower. Three of these cards are taken up into their hand, three are open on the table in front of them, and the remaining three form their draw deck. They also get 2 coins.

Each turn, a single section of the canal is revealed that is to be build this turn, and players bid a secret amount of manpower to help complete the section by playing one of the cards from their hand. If the total amount of manpower is enough to complete the section (i.e. beats the target set by the card), the player(s) who bid the most receive recognition points. However, before the section is awarded, all players get the opportunity to spend one of their coins to call up reinforcements. After players have decided whether or not to do so, each player spending a coin may draw a random card from the discard pile, and add the manpower on the card to their bid.

At the end of a turn, players draw a new card to bring their hand size back to 3 (if possible). They can draw either the top card of their drawing deck (blind), or one of the 3 open cards (which will get replaced by the top card of the deck). Play continues until all 9 sections have been built (or at least started, if the manpower fell short), and players have played all of their cards. Whoever has the most recognition points is the winner.

name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – Officer Guttierez
description:
Raid 44 Police Team Officer.

Box content:
1 metal miniatures
1 ID cards
2 weapon and gear cards
1 plastic bases
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Port
description:
Port is a simple game you can play with a Pairs deck after (or during) a long sea voyage.

The rules were first published with the Pairs Pirates deck, but they are also published in the Pairs Companion as well.

The game utilizes the Pairs game system and is designed with the Pirates deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.

Port is played in rounds, keeping score after each round. The first player to score 21 points wins.

name: Strip Tease
description:
A trick taking card game with 53 cards (four suits (Theater', Court, Prudie and Strip Tease) of 13 and one joker) in two variants:
Variant 1 A game of CHANCE for four players and
Variant 2 A game of SKILL for 3-5 players.

In the first variation you play a game of Prosecution (represented by the Court suit) and Defence (represented by the Theatre suit). Each player is dealt 10 cards of the 40 cards that does not include the red Strip Tease suit (which are divided into two face up stacks as "points": 12-7 in one and 1-6 in another one - 13 face down), and the dealer declares if he wants to Defend or Prosecute based on his dealt hand, the other players do the same in turn - until there are two on either side.
The Defenders will try to get the Strip Tease act, by getting their stack moved from 7 to 12 thus revealing the 13th Strip Tease card, the Prosecutors try to avoid the strip tease show to be made by moving their cards on the Theatre's stack to make the stripper more dressed.

The game is then played in partnerships over three to four rounds (Trails) where you play in suits. However Defence can always play a Theatre (Green) card as a trump and Prosecutes can always play a Court (Black) card as trump card. If you can not follow suit you can either play a trump suit (to Object) or play a Prudie (Blue) card.
Highest card wins the trick and places their top Strip Tease card on the other team's pile.

The second variant of the game is played without the Joker, but depending on players can also be wither Paul Pry and Constable cards.
Here you try to avoid taking tricks containing the Theatre Manager (Three months prison), Procecuter (two months prison) or any Strip Tease card (one months prison). The one with least imprisonment is the winner.

No stripping is a part of this game.

—user summary

Scintillating
Topical
Rib-tickling
Prresistible
Thenomenal
-
Thrilling
Ecstatic
Artistic
Surprising
Entertaining
The name describes the game

—description from the back of box

name: Micro Fleet: World War I – British Jutland Fleet
description: New counters and tables to add the British Jutland Fleet to Micro Fleet: World War I
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Micro Fleet: World War I – German Jutland Fleet
description: New counters and tables to add the German Jutland Fleet to Micro Fleet: World War I.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Dino Dice
description: Dice game for very young children. Helps with Early Years addition and subtraction. Players roll three dice (two numbered 0-5, the other marked with addition or subtraction symbols). They work out the sum and the player with the highest score 'wins' a Dino figure. The first player to win three Dino wins the game.

name: Von Noten und Toten
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: About music and death

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

name: Trading Races
description:
A party game for Black culture. Can you Out-Black folks?

Gameplay:
To start the game, each player draws 5 cards. One randomly chosen player begins and plays a card. Everyone else selects a card from their hand that reflects a higher level of blackness and places their card down.

Each player then defends their card selection in relationship to the other players card. As a group, players must come to a consensus on which card is blacker.

Whoever played the winning card keeps the hand and wins the book. The winning player starts the next hand and everyone draws back up to 5 cards.

The player with the most books wins the game.

from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Boxitale: Elite Explorers
description:
An innovative tabletop game that uses a smartphone/ tablet to stream an animated series taking place in a galactic universe.

The game present challenges to the players, the challenges are solved using craft that is placed on the board game

Craft game!

the game is build of episodes and the players win by completing an episode

Captain Kadara has a secret mission of investigating the existence of an unknown space station found on an asteroid near Venus. He assembles a team that includes: Lumi, an “I can fix all” technician, a professor and the kids (in the game, they are called guardians).
Together, they discover the truth about the space station and they need to face the upcoming challenges that come with this new knowledge.
The kids use various crafted technics and a lot of imagination and creativity to solve the challenges and save “El Animal.”
categories: Children's Game, Novel-based, Space Exploration, Video Game Theme

name: Drinking Quest 3: Nectar of the Gods
description:
Drinking Quest 3: Nectar of the Gods is the final entry in the original Drinking Quest trilogy. Chuglox returns and teams up with 3 Gods taking on the biggest monsters and most uncomfortable saving throw situations yet! While still existing in the "DQniverse" this is a complete stand alone game and not an expansion pack.

Drinking Quest 3: Nectar of the Gods features these four quests:

Hilevel Forest: Now that you're super powerful and are questing with 3 Gods, you're not going to start with weak low level goblins. These are the toughest goblins yet, they work out all the time and know how buff they are. It's dangerous to go alone, drink this.

Hordor - Land of the Hoarding Dragons: One does not simply walk into Hordor... because there are a lot of useless objects blocking the way. Nobody told these dragons that they should be hoarding valuable treasure instead of this useless junk. Oh is that a yard sale?

Bosses Clubhouse: What luck! All of the toughest bosses hanging out in one place! It's time to save the DQniverse from a Beer-Holder, An Overly Attached Cyclops and Trent, the Bro Hive Mind.

Absolute Power is Awesome: This quest is interesting because you've just killed all of the serious threats to the DQniverse. You've already won. How will the heroes live out their days? Will they use their power responsibly or will you find creative ways to torment the wait staff because you're bored? The series does have an ending and the card is in this quest. Too bad you won't remember it the next morning.

name: Railways of Antarctica
description: A 9" x 12" map of Antarctica, created by the EGG staff, for use with the ICE trains included in the Railways of Nippon Kickstarter. A contest was held to select the best rules, and the winning rule set was published on the Railways of Nippon Kickstarter page.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Dawns & Departures: A Campaign System for Sharp Practice
description:
In search of adventures for your Sharp Practice characters? If so you have just found them with Dawns & Departures, the campaign handbook for Sharp Practice, providing endless campaign options with our easy to manage and fun to play Narrative Campaign system.

79 pages in length, Dawns & Departures provides everything you need to generate your campaign world, find out what your mission is and then get cracking on some fabulous adventures. Make valuable friends, gain influence at court and a reputation as a fighting man. Battle sworn enemies across a whole world and seek your fortune as you make your name in the black powder era.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Wurstquartett (sausage quartette)
description:
In this game is all about the sausage!
The card game consists of 32 playing cards. The category with the highest value wins. There are the following categories: fat content, porcine percentage, diameter, price / 100 grams, shelf life, calories.

The object of the game is to collect matching groups of sausages by winning cards from your opponent in classical quartet showdowns.

Wurstquartett ("Sausage Quartets") is a variant of a Quartett game, with a touch of Top Trumps. The aim is to collect four cards of one city -- one Quartett.

The player with three Quartetts wins.

name: Monopoly: Traditional Japanese Art & Crafts Edition
description:
Created by Nakagawa Masashichi Shoten, this truly brilliant Monopoly Traditional Japanese Arts & Crafts Edition is a must for board game enthusiasts and fans of Japanese crafts. This is the universally popular Monopoly game, only with pieces and a board adapted to Japan. So you get deer, the maneki-neko (beckoning cat) and daruma instead of the usual tokens of a hat, iron and boot. Rather than the standard community chest and chance cards, you have Zipangu and Future cards.

Learn about traditional Japan while playing the classic game. The locations on the board are businesses, shops and studios dealing in crafts, such as ceramics, paper and more. Complete with bilingual (English and Japanese) cards, the board is also beautifully decorated.

Limited edition of 5,000

Bilingual cards (English and Japanese)
Instructions: Japanese (but regular Monopoly rules and bilingual cards)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Spin the Web
description:
The game consists of a web printed on a turntable, 20 wood "insects" in four colors, a black wood spider, 30 spider cards, a wood die, and a wood dice cup.

There are two games described in the rules.

The basic game has players trying to move their pieces (insects) from starting positions around the web to the other side, always moving along a line of the web. An insect will move either one, two, three, or four spaces (nodes) according to a die roll. The first player to get all five insects across the board into opposite spaces is the winner. Sometimes a spider comes up on the die; when this happens, the player draws a card and rotates the web according to the card's instructions. Therefore the players face a changing board as they try to get across the web.

The advanced game is more interesting: one player takes the role of spider in a contest between a single spider and up to four other players. The players still try to get their insects across the board, and the board will still rotate now and then. A player wins when just three insects make it to the opposite side. The spider can jump around the outside of the board, or can also generate a web rotation, always looking to get close enough to the insects to devour one. The spider has to capture three insects of the same color to win.

The die is six-sided with opposite faces: 1-spider, 2-spider, 3-4. There are 10 cards which indicate a spin of 1 space, 10 with a spin of 2 spaces, and 10 with a spin of 3 spaces. Half the cards indicate a clockwise direction, and half indicate a counter-clockwise direction (distributed evenly amongst the spin amounts).

name: Professor 3Stein
description:
Professor 3Stein is a calculation and strategy game with several game variants for 2-4 people from 5, 6, 8 or 10 years, with a playing time of 15-20 minutes.

The game promotes logical thinking and the calculating ability of children and adults in a playful way. In a maze of one hundred fields, the players use dice to calculate mathematical results with them to move forward. Depending on the game concept chosen, this includes different operations (thus different levels of difficulty).

—description from the publisher

name: Brook City: Waybright & Salinas Promo Card
description:
A promo card made for the Man vs Meeple Kickstarter project 2018.

An ally/rival card.

Ally-Remote:
Exhaust: Waybright & Salinas suffer 1 stress, then you may encounter a target in your crime area as if you were near it.

Rival-Remote:
Each cop at BCPD is considered near this target while there is at least 1 progress on a suspect.

Activate: Each cop must either discard 2 hunches or suffer 1 stress.

Bust: Each cop gains 2 hunches and discards 1 stress.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Steps of the Prophet
description:
In the first half of The Steps of the Prophet, two players use a standard 52 card pack to lovingly build a nation state, progressively adding more details about its hierarchy, industries and values. In the second half of the game, they tear it apart.

The Steps of the Prophet is a game about creation and destruction, cooperation and belligerence, identity and cultural assimilation.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Fantasy, Political, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Amerika: Strategic Markers
description:
These marker rules will help you incorporate additional rules into your AMERIKA game. Feel free to pick and choose which ones to use so long as all players agree. These can help balance the game when players of differing skill levels play against each other, as well as adding new dimensions and strategy for advanced players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Shark Bait
description:
A touch-and-feel game where players take turns rolling the die and racing to "feed" their bait pieces to the hungry shark. The first player to run out of pieces wins.

Includes zippered plush shark, 16 sturdy bait pieces, die, and instructions for two ways to play.

name: Pythago Master Edition
description:
This is an expansion deck for Pythago. It is is a small deck of 36 thick cards showing new shapes for playing Pythago. The pack contains nothing else, no rules or variants, only 36 new cards.

'—user summary

name: Amerika: ICBM – Amerika Rockets
description:
The Missile program known as the “Aggregate Project”, was the German attempt to develop free flying Inter Continental Missiles (ICBM) capable of devastating cities or large concentrated forces through use of high explosive warhead delivery, and later, in the series, a small nuclear warhead. These missiles were to be based in planned occupied Greenland and captured locations in the Caribbean and South America should the United States be invaded, or, in later parts of the series launched from across the ocean itself from the homeland; a true Intercontinental Ballistic Missile.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Amerika: Grossflugzeugkreuzer – Great Aircraft Cruiser
description:
The following rules will help you incorporate these new units into your “AMERIKA” game. Feel free to pick and choose which ones to use so long as all players agree. These can help balance the game when players of differing skill levels play against each other, or add new dimensions and strategy for advanced players.

Very few aircraft carrier designs in Imperial Japan or The Third Reich had the capability to launch and recover jet powered aircraft. Any carriers that were unable to do so were relegated to defending the fleets of the Axis navies late in the war. The Japanese had their immense Taiho Kai class carriers, and the Germans developed a fleet of their technologically advanced Grossflugzeugkreuzers. Both nations had their vessels ready for action prior to the imminent invasion of Amerika.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Amerika: Taiho Kai – Great Phoenix of the Ocean
description:
The following rules will help you incorporate these new units into your “AMERIKA” game. Feel free to pick and choose which ones to use so long as all players agree. These can help balance the game when players of differing skill levels play against each other, or add new dimensions and strategy for advanced players.

Very few aircraft carrier designs in Imperial Japan or The Third Reich had the capability to launch and recover jet powered aircraft. Any carriers that were unable to do so were relegated to defending the fleets of the Axis navies late in the war. The Japanese had their immense Taiho Kai class carriers, and the Germans developed a fleet of their technologically advanced Grossflugzeugkreuzers. Both nations had their vessels ready for action prior to the imminent invasion of Amerika.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Amerika: Defcon 1 – Atomic Defense in Amerika
description:
The following rules will help you incorporate these new units into your AMERIKA game. Feel free to pick and choose which ones to use so long as all players agree. These can help balance the game when players of differing skill levels play against each other, or add new dimensions and strategy for advanced players.

The Axis were aware for some time that the Allies had heavily invested in making atomic energy work as a weapon in hopes of delivering a crippling blow and ending the war. Keeping the Allies from developing this technology into a full-fledged long-range weapon is what Amerika is all about! This expansion set allows the Allies to use whatever nuclear technology they can muster to help defend them while they attempt to finish their work in the wake of an invasion.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Luminous Ages
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.




Luminous Ages: Dragon Dreams is a versatile living card game. Where the goal is to Summon a Dream God (normally a dragon). To do this you have to slowly build up energy while protecting your armies and lands and attacking your opponents.

It comes as four premade decks however players are also welcome to mix cards and create their own personalised decks. The premade decks are designed to be powerful but balanced, giving no true advantage to personalised decks but instead focusing on skill.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy

name: Länder der Welt
description: On the world tour that awaits in Länder der Welt, players need to identify different countries by their flag, the capital, or their geographic location. Players can call for help from hints and joker cards, but the fewer hints a player needs, the faster they orbit the world!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lords of Maleryth
description:
"The decline of the great Malerythian Empire began with the sudden and mysterious death of the Emperor. The eight houses of the nobility plummeted into a ruthless cold war in an effort to claim the throne. You control one of these houses and must use everyone at your disposal (including covert agents, military geniuses, scientists, traders, diplomats and administrators) to ensure that the next in line is allied with your house."

Lords of Maleryth is a fast-flowing deck management game set in an interstellar empire. Using a deck building mechanic, players must defend their own deck whilst attempting to remove cards from their opponents decks, control fleet movements on a central board, and develop rule-breaking technology.

The majority of cards represent different characters in the Empire with different skills and abilities. Each card is numbered sequentially.Once the central supply deck is depleted the game ends, and the player with the lowest numbered card in play in front of them wins.

Unique player communication rules add to the pressure, meaning that players indulging in thinking time give their opponents opportunity to scheme against them, whereas players who think fast limit their opponents opportunities.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Take That

name: Race around the World
description:
From the back of the box:

In this game, you'll visit one country after another, to tour marked cities and end the voyage in the starting city. Each Race has to be finished within limited time. Sometimes, an exciting adventure emerges, for exampe, a treasure hunt. Marked Cities are to visit, treasures to collect and bring to another city.

Sounds easy? Some rules are to obey:

- on each map, all places must be visited in a closed circle
- the direction of the next move is marked by an arrow
- each city may only be visited once
- there a special fields on the map to change direction

Contents:
1 game board
24 maps
1 transparent foil
1 erasable marker
1 eraser
publishers: Dr. Wood Challenge Centre, HCM Kinzel

name: Landpower: GAAT
description:
Landpower: GAAT (the Georgia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Turkey scenario) is a wargame designed by LTC Patrick Schoof at the U.S. Army Command and General Staff College and used for instruction in academic year 2018.

Landpower is designed to drive both sides to plan and conduct sequential operations in a large scale combat environment. Many parts of shaping and combat are intentionally abstracted to allow the intended training audience to focus on appropriate decisions at the division echelon as a division commander and staff. The mechanics of the game are intentionally minimized above and below the echelon of decision. A well-planned operation with its events synchronized usually works most of the time. A poorly planned large scale operation will likely result in failure. Friction is intentionally built in! Landpower was designed to meet educational learning objectives while still being able to stand alone as a wargame. Because of this, most of the instructions ask the reader to treat the conduct of it as an exercise. In the classroom, Landpower is not about the game, but rather the discussion the wargame elicits.
