The exercise is conducted over a series of days. Each day is broken down into four, six-hour turns. During the turns each side will have opportunities to conduct operations to achieve their side’s objectives.

The scenario in Landpower is conducted mostly in Azerbaijan based on the GAAT (Georgia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Turkey) terrain. Each hex is roughly 6.5km across. The terrain has been abstracted for the division echelon of decision with consideration given to possible second order effects of a particular feature’s inclusion or exclusion from the exercise. For example, the terrain at 39°56'42.3"N 48°21'00.4"E was treated as urban, and the northwest-southeast road was omitted because it would not change operations, though the bridge was retained.

—description from the designer

name: Train
description:
The players undertake certain actions to build a railtrack from space S to space Z, while connecting 4 cities in between. The Players draw Action cards. If a player completes an action keeps the card. The game ends when all action cards have been played. The player with the most action cards wins the game.

Additionally to laying tracks (round yellow tokens), the players have to develop the 4 cities by building houses, delivering resources and building bridges over the river.

The materials are transported with one cube, that functions as a helicopter (H), a truck (L) or a ship (S), depending which symbol shows on top. All players use the same cube. If a player can't complete his action in one turn, the next player may use his collected materials as he takes control of the cube. The transport capacity of the cube and it's ability to move over the terrain depends on which vehicle the cube represents at the time. Movement of the cube is like a queen at Chess. Each player has 3 movements per turn. Before each movement the player may change direction and/or the mode of transport.

The tracks are stored at the factory at the middle of the game board. The resources (blue square tokens) are placed on the 3 terrain markers with the neutral side up. They have to be transported to the factory, where they get stored their symbol side up (house, resources, bridge). From three they have to be transported to the 4 cities according to the actions appointed by the action cards.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Dead 'til Dawn: Dead Arm of the Law
description:
Dead Arm of the Law is a 50-card expansion set that comes in its own tuck box.

Comes with 6 more Character cards, 16 more Event cards, and 16 more Equipment cards as well as 12 Setting cards - a type of card not available in the regular core set!

Setting cards are drawn at the start of the game and establish your game's storyline while introducing new rules, making each game played even more unique!

The expansion characters introduced include the Sheriff, Escaped Convict, Thief, CIA Agent, Scavenger, and Gambler.

name: Outlaws In A Strange Land
description:
Assume the role of a demon outlawed from hell, now finding refuge and a life of adventure in the mortal realm of the American Wild West. Set out to unravel a web of ancient lies and conspiracies as you’re hunted down by the forces of darkness.

Battle a variety of supernatural foes, solve mysteries and encounter memorable characters as you explore a truly weird west in the American Frontier.


Outlaws In A Strange Land is a narrative-driven solo/co-op adventure RPG card game for 1-4 players and requires the use of a companion app.

Play through a variety of narrative stories and adventures, crafting your playstyle as you advance your character, unlock new skills, acquire hordes of loot and collect memorable companions that aid you.

Experience truly innovative combat using your hand-crafted character in an expressive condition and environment system meant to keep each fight fresh and fun against a variety of unique foes.

—
categories: Adventure, American West, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Il gioco dell'orso
description: An ancient abstract board game from Italy, the Valle Cervo. It's an asymetrical hunting game. Three hounds hunt a bear, moving from point to point on a special board. The bear needs to escape getting cornered for 40 moves.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Meeple Steeple
description:
The King has ordered the construction of a new steeple! Can your team of builders meet the task? Use smart play and nerves of steel to construct the King’s steeple as efficiently as possible. Hazards abound and if the steeple collapses during construction or if there are insufficient workers to complete the job you will have failed your King!

Meeple Steeple is a cooperative stacking game played over a number of turns. A game represents an attempt to complete the construction of the steeple by playing through all 5 levels (decks) and successfully placing the steeple piece on top of the structure without it collapsing. Players fail to win if the steeple collapses or if the shared worker pool runs out before playing the steeple piece. You must exercise efficient use of your workers while also using smart play and steady hands to succeed!

-description from designer

name: I-GR Making 2
description:
An idol-themed quirky trick-taking game by Kuro, where the card backs reveal the card's colours.

Cards are dealt, and each round, leader chooses one card from the lineup card from the deck is drawn, and plays a card of a different colour. Then, all other players must play a card of a different colour. Players who can't, discard a card face down.

The lineup card decides whether highest number, lowest number, closest to lineup card, or closest to current round number wins.
The winner is the first to pick cards among the played cards, where he must pick cards that share "star" value. Then the next player gets to pick and so on.

Players then form "groups" out of their gained cards, where each group can only contain one of each colour. The bigger the group, and the higher star values they have, the more points.

User summary

name: Newlandia
description:
From the back of the box: Newlandia is a quick and fun game where you build up an island and compete with other players.

Game Play: Each turn you can either play a card in your play area or discard one card on the top of a corresponding discard pile. To place cards in your play area, all cards must be placed by ascending order, and cannot be repeated. You may only put cards with the same color in the same column. Then you draw the top card from the center pile or a discard pile.

Each column's card values will be totaled. The totals will be added together to form the final score. If a column has no number cards, that column has a score of 0. If a column has number cards, add up the numbers, then subtract 20. After scoring, the player with the highest score wins the game.

name: Grand Manoeuvre Napoleonic Wargames Rules: Solo Module
description:
The Solo Module is designed to slowly reveal an automated plan of battle for the non-player side. The rules determine the command decisions of enemy, non-player generals. They may also be used to automate the decisions of subordinate commanders in one to one game play; adding to uncertainty and unpredictability in “normal” games.

The first three sections of the module will generate the non-player’s dispositions, orders and battle arrays if the game has been generated by a campaign, or if it is a fictitious battle. Alternatively, if you wish to re-fight a particular battle, you can keep the historical dispositions and go straight to section two and then section three and possibly change the “shape” and events of the battle by varying the non-players` corps orders and consequently also their battle arrays.

The non-player will react in response to your grand-tactical movements or to changes in tactical situation. There is also a section which relates to the delegation of orders applying to minor objectives. Section eight, “Tactical Systems, Dispositions and Divisional Battle Arrays” is reproduced here from Grand Manoeuvre Miniatures Wargames Rules to provide solo players with more useful information on battle arrays, methods and unit formations used by various nations throughout the Napoleonic period.

Section nine is optional and allows for chance events that may occur in and around the battlefield area that may affect player’s and non-player’s decisions.

The module has 106 pages. The text is spaciously laid out and the rules mechanisms are very simple.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: You've Got Geeky Problems
description:
You've got GEEKY problems is an expansion to You've got problems that will give you all kinds of new geeky perks and problems. Would you rather have your body controlled by a button masher, or be stuck in The Upside Down? These choices won’t be easy, but at least you’ll suffer while being able to say “I GET THIS REFERENCE!”

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Fantasy
description:
Are you not brave enough to mention you-know-who, and do you also participate in the game of thrones? Do you make a "skill check" before you behead the dragon, and do you dream about vampires at new moon? Here is the quiz for everyone that knows the way to Mordor.

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tholos
description:
GREECE circa 800 BCE - 400 CE

Greece is covered in darkness. Do you remember the days of light? In your quest to save the city of Sparta, you hear rumors of a powerful oracle at the temple of Apollo in Delphi.

A skillful memory game for young and not so young, with Medusa’s and a dangerous dragon.

Can you remember where matching tiles are hidden on the 8 x 8 square board? Enhance your memory with the power of the oracles matches? Beware! Each time the dragon is found and not matched, it turns the board around, steals your matches and may even win the game.

There is also a TIME SLIDING ALTERNATIVE PLAY.

There are myths and rumors that Pythia mastered the mysterious art of time sliding. She drank the foaming waters that spurted from a chasm in the earth to start her slide through time and banish the darkness. Time sliding is when you experience the same events in a loop over and over again. When you die you slide back in time and start again. The loop can only be broken after success in some great challenge. Otherwise you are doomed to slide for eternity! The secret is to set yourself up for success in the next loop by what you do and remember in the loops before. Many do not believe time sliding exists and that it is possible to successfully escape the slide. Are you bold enough to find out yourself?

Play alone or with as many others as you like. The length of play is timed. Each turn you fail, you replace the tiles so it is easier to remember
the matches. The unmatched tiles and all the tiles you have just collected are placed back onto any open square, before turning them over. Then you start another turn.

There is also a WORLD WIDE EXPANSION.

Pythia was renowned all over the world. Nothing was completely hidden from her sight. Your spatial conception is challenged in this fun experience of your favorite places.

Choose a play area, which may be a room, park, or wherever you want to play. All of the tiles are placed face down, in plain sight, scattered within the defined area of play. Tiles may be on the ground or different objects such as plants may be used to make it interesting to search for the tiles.

Time sliding and the world wide expansion can be played together for a unique experience.

THOLOS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

name: Pfannkuchenparty
description: There's something going on! Petzi and his friends Pelle, Pingu and Seebär are racing. Even pancakes fly through the air. With your catapults you throw the pancakes across the boat. You meet the given targets skillfully, you are allowed to advance your character. And since Petzi and his friends also need jam for a successful pancake party, jam jars have to be found in between. If you are lucky enough to reveal most of the glasses, you can also draw with your figure.

name: Super Genius: Compound Words
description:
Match compound words three different ways: word to image, image to image equation, and image equation to word.

There is always one -- and only one -- match between any two cards.

name: Super Genius: First Words
description: This reading matching game focuses on closed syllable and short vowel words and helps prepare early readers for more complicated language skills to come. There is always a match between any two cards. Find the pair between a word and its image, two images or two words.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Bug Catch
description:
Bug Catch is software educational game for finding a bug that does not correspond to Such Stone(Dice). In a sense of tension, players need to catch bugs by using fast information processing and quick power.

—description from the publisher

name: 엉망진창 로보샵
description:
Robo-shop Chaos is software educational game that thinks strategically whether to make it faster than the other's robot or make it more perfect.

The games process of confirming the opponent's robot helps to develop sequential concepts and information gathering ability.

—description from the publisher

name: Christmas Tree: Essen Special Cards
description:
Christmas Tree: Essen Special Cards is a mini-expansion for Christmas Tree that consists of two extra objective cards.

Usable: With the normal and advanced game.
Objective: 6 points for each formation containing 3 ornaments: 2 glass ornaments with the same color and shape on both sides of a gingerbread/wrapped candy.
Setup: Shuffle the 2 Special cards into the deck.

During the game: At the beginning of the round, after the ornament cards are dealt, if you have a Special card in your hand, put it face up into the middle of the table and draw a new ornament card from the remaining deck. After you have chosen your objective cards as usual, place them from the Special card(s) separately (in the advanced game, after the objectives went around.).

The Special cards are objective cards, but not in a standard way. During the evaluation of the objectives at the end of the round, you can choose one (or two) Special card(s) from the table (if there is any), instead of one (or two) original objective card(s). You will evaluate the chosen Special card(s), instead of the chosen original card(s) (but the other players still can use the original objectives).

This way you will score the same number of objectives as usual, but you will have the option to choose a Special objective card - which maybe better fits your christmas tree - instead of one of the original objectives.

name: Nothing Personal: Justino "The Player" Gotlibi Promo Card
description:
A special Gangster card from Just Got Played‘s Promo card giveaway.

“When Justino is drawn and placed, immediately swap him with the Capo (influence tokens remain on the Capo).”
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: 勇者アーキテクト 2B (Brave Architect 2B)
description:
Publisher's summary
勇者アーキテクト 2B (Brave Architect 2B) (Yuusha Architect 2B) is a follow-up to the original game 勇者アーキテクト (Brave Architect). Brave Architect 2B is a separate stand-alone game and cannot be mixed with the original. But it can be mixed with the matching game 勇者アーキテクト 2R (Brave Architect 2R). Both games Brave Architect 2B and 2R share the same rules but their contents are different.

Brave Architect 2B is a cooperative role-playing game to create characters (through LCG and mini-deck-building systems) and fight the dragon. The game title in Japanese is closer to 'Architect of the Brave'.

This is a co-operative card game to create characters for each TRPG player, in the world of sword and magic and fights against mighty enemies. Create your characters by selecting from 8 types of tribes, 10 types of weapons, 3 types of combat styles for each weapon, 10 types of sub weapons, and 24 types of skills.

Shuffle the cards of the selected category into decks use them to battle on the map. Play the game with various patterns, with up to 4 types of maps, 4 types of enemies × 10 attributes. Use your decks and various skills effectively and work together to defeat the mighty enemies.

勇者ーキテクト2B・2Rはキャラメイク（LCG・ミニデッキ構築）＆協力討伐系RPカードゲームです。

剣と魔法の世界を舞台に、TRPGプレイヤーごとにキャラクターを作成し、強大な敵を討伐する協力型カードゲームです。
キャラクター（種族）８種類、武器１０種類と武器ごとに戦闘スタイル３種類、サブウェポン１０種類、スキル２４種類から好きな組み合わせを選んでキャラメイクします。
選んだカテゴリーごとのカードでデッキを作成し、それを使ってマップ上で戦闘を繰り広げます。
マップは最大４種類、敵も４種類×１０属性とパターンは多彩です。
デッキと各種スキルを使いこなし、強力して強大な敵を倒しましょう。

2B・2Rは同じルールで内容物が異なっています。単独でも遊べて、混ぜて遊ぶこともできます。
前作の勇者アーキテクトと混ぜて遊ぶことはできません。
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: 勇者アーキテクト 2R (Brave Architect 2R)
description:
Publisher's summary
勇者アーキテクト 2R (Brave Architect 2R) (Yuusha Architect 2R) is a follow-up to the original game 勇者アーキテクト (Brave Architect). Brave Architect 2R is a separate stand-alone game and cannot be mixed with the original. But it can be mixed with the matching game 勇者アーキテクト 2B (Brave Architect 2B). Both games Brave Architect 2B and 2R share the same rules but their contents are different.

Brave Architect 2R is a cooperative role-playing game to create characters (through LCG and mini-deck-building systems) and fight the dragon. The game title in Japanese is closer to 'Architect of the Brave'.

This is a co-operative card game to create characters for each TRPG player, in the world of sword and magic and fights against mighty enemies. Create your characters by selecting from 8 types of tribes, 10 types of weapons, 3 types of combat styles for each weapon, 10 types of sub weapons, and 24 types of skills.

Shuffle the cards of the selected category into decks use them to battle on the map. Play the game with various patterns, with up to 4 types of maps, 4 types of enemies × 10 attributes. Use your decks and various skills effectively and work together to defeat the mighty enemies.

勇者ーキテクト2B・2Rはキャラメイク（LCG・ミニデッキ構築）＆協力討伐系RPカードゲームです。

剣と魔法の世界を舞台に、TRPGプレイヤーごとにキャラクターを作成し、強大な敵を討伐する協力型カードゲームです。
キャラクター（種族）８種類、武器１０種類と武器ごとに戦闘スタイル３種類、サブウェポン１０種類、スキル２４種類から好きな組み合わせを選んでキャラメイクします。
選んだカテゴリーごとのカードでデッキを作成し、それを使ってマップ上で戦闘を繰り広げます。
マップは最大４種類、敵も４種類×１０属性とパターンは多彩です。
デッキと各種スキルを使いこなし、強力して強大な敵を倒しましょう。

2B・2Rは同じルールで内容物が異なっています。単独でも遊べて、混ぜて遊ぶこともできます。
前作の勇者アーキテクトと混ぜて遊ぶことはできません。
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Shard Slingers
description:
Shard Slingers is a fast-paced, push your luck, card and dice game about a handful of sorcerers competing to cast the biggest and best spells they can, in order to amaze an arena of spectators.
Players use 8-sided elemental dice, called Shards, to match up to similar elemental requirement icons on the spell cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Crichers!
description:
Crichers! is a fun and frenetic card game in which you will use these cheeky creatures to defeat your opponents.

You will invade the enemy villages (each player’s draw piles) using the Troop cards (numbered ones) and you will also give orders to attack, defend or manipulate these villages changing the course of the game while using the Action cards (fist icon).

The damage Crichers inflict to the villages lead to the attacked opponent having to draw a card from the barracks (deck of cards).

The goal of the game is to end up with no cards in your hands and to make the opponents fill up theirs and also to earn the maximum number of points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That

name: リターン・トゥ・サバンナ (Return to Savannah)
description:
リターン・トゥ・サバンナ (Return to Savannah) (Ritaan tu Sabanna) is a Japanese game about wildlife in Africa.

Surviving on the Savannah is harsh. Once defeated in a battle over territory, animals are forced out of the Savannah. But they are still watching for an opportunity to return to the Savannah.

Return to Savannah is a tile placement game with a theme of great emigration of animals. In this game, players try to score points by placing animal tiles effectively.

Players take turns placing an animal tile on a 4x4 square grid board. You must place an animal adjacent to another animal of the same type if any, expanding territory for that animal. If a type of animals are surrounded by other animals, they are forced to make a great emigration and removed from the board. At that moment the two leading players score points in the following manner.

There are two leader tokens for each type of animals. These tokens move to certain players each time a tile of that type is placed. When that type of animals is removed, the token holders score points equal to the number of tiles removed or twice that number.

The game ends when a certain number of migrations are made, and the highest scorer wins the game.

—user summary

サバンナでの生存競争は苛酷です。縄張り争いに負けた動物の群れはサバンナから追い出されてしまうのです。しかし、追い出された動物たちもサバンナに復帰する日を虎視眈々と狙っているのです。
このゲームでは、動物タイルをサバンナボードに効果的に配置してポイントを獲得していきます。
動物たちは種類ごとに群れを形成します。そして、動物タイルを配置した結果、ある動物の群れが囲まれたら、大移動が発生します。
大移動する動物のボス・タイルを保持しているプレイヤーは、その動物の群れの動物タイルの枚数およびそのボス・タイルの数値に応じたポイントを獲得します。
ゲーム終了時に、スコアマーカーが一番進んでいるプレイヤーの勝ちとなります。

—publisher's summary

name: Tower Beast Slayers
description:
In a land full of darkness, the cruel Dragon rules over all. With its evil army doing its bidding, the Dragon causes nothing but pain and suffering to the people. The Dragon has built up its vast army over the decade, ruling over the land as it sits atop its colossal tower. The people know nothing but fear and dread. That is until 4 Guardians of the realm were mysteriously sent: a valiant Knight, a cunning Archer, a great Mage, and a wise Cleric. No one knows for sure who sent them or where they came from, but together they are the only hope to slay the Dragon. Will they be enough?

Ready to save the world?

Defeat Monsters to level up and your Guardian allies have enough Magic and Health to defeat the dreaded Dragon. When the Dragon is defeated, the game is won!

Players win by saving the kingdom by defeating the evil dragon at the top of the tower before the Dragon's forces destroy the characters.
Each turn the players use spells like fireballs, pinning arrows, healing or taunting, or attack monsters with their abilities until they are defeated and the next monster emerge. Players control their guardians and dictate what magic to use, who to attack, and customization of their skill trees

name: Zombie Tsunami: Promo card 1
description: At the end of the game (after the the 3rd rounds), players take from their horde the number of Zombies they want (including 0). Everyone reveals his hand at the same time and plays it. All Zombies dices revealing a Zombie side die. Then count the surviving Zombies, the player whit the most wins 3 Zombies, the next player 2 and the third 1. Gather these Zombies with those you have not played, redo the total count and determine the winner.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Party Game, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: ミッキー&フレンズ 5ファイブリンクス (Mickey & Friends 5 Links)
description:
User summary
ミッキー&フレンズ 5ファイブリンクス (Mickey & Friends 5 Links) is a Japanese card game for children using the famous Disney characters. The deck shows the animated friends with some cards having more than one character. There is a bank of Mickey coins (including two secret gold coins worth more). Players start with one coin, and the first to get up to five coins wins.

The deck is shuffled and players are dealt three cards each. Some cards are placed face up to start the tableau. On your turn, you draw a card from the deck (no hand limit) and then you must try to add a card to a set on the table. You can play up to three cards, but each must be a different friend.

If you add the five friend to a set, you draw a coin from the pool. If you cannot play this turn, you pay a coin to the previous player (or from the pool if you have none).

プレイヤーは自分の番がきたらカードを1枚引きます。
ミッキー＆フレンズの5キャラクターのカードを1枚以上場に出していきます。
最後の5キャラクター目を場に出した人がミッキーコインを獲得します。
このコインを誰よりも早く5枚集めたプレイヤーが勝ちとなります。
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Muse: Game Boy Geek Season 6 Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
Originally available from the Game Boy Geek Season 6 Kickstarter.

Two new masterpiece cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Oktet
description:
Oktet is a card game in which each player competes in the most riotous way to make a set of eight identical cards and shout "OKTET" out loud.

In the game, players may trade their starting cards once per round and must give a card to other players and bluff each other with "wild cards" to achieve victory.

name: Starting Lines
description:
A hilarious drawing game designed by a psychologist to foster creativity.

Research shows that childhood creativity is on the decline and we should all be concerned. This game is designed to foster creativity through an old-school tabletop game that’s simple, fun and expands your mind. While the decline in childhood creativity was the impetus for designing the game, it is extremely fun with or without kids and promotes creativity in all. To spice things up a bit for adult game nights, there is also an optional Adults Only Expansion pack.

Each round of Starting Lines provides a creative prompt (a category) and a constraint (the starting line). What happens next is creativity. Everyone gets the same simple Starting Line, but inevitably takes it in a completely different directions. You will be surprised by what kids see in a Starting Line and be brought to tears laughing at what your weird friends find. A judge reviews all players drawings and select the one they like the most. That player collects the category card from that round. Play continues until you decide to stop. The player with the most category cards at the end is declared the winner, and of course deemed the most creative.

The game play can be as quick as 15 minutes or can go on for hours. The game is great for large parties. While the game includes enough markers for 6 players, with more markers you can play with as many friends as you can find.

—description from the publisher

name: Gold Seeker
description:
A rare greek board game from the mid 60's. It was released from ΕΡ.ΚΑ.Π. toy company. A simple roll the dice (roulette) and move board game for 2 players. The winner is the player who arrives first at the top of the mountain with the exact number of steps and finds the treasure.

There is a surprise for the winner. When he arrives at the end, he put a screw at a hole and the treasure shines!! There is a small electrical circuit under the board.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Ankra the Colossus: Necron Commander Set
description:
The towering Necron Overlord known as Ankra the Colossus never forgives a slight, and as he possesses a body of immortal metal, has had time enough to repay nearly every insult dealt against him. His current vendetta is against the T’au of Omis Prion, who have foolishly interrupted his search for the laboratories of the Triumvirate of the Crimson Sceptre. Ankra has resolved to settle this matter in person, telling himself it will be more efficient that way – though in truth, it is just as likely he wishes to feel the splash of hot blood upon his metal body once more.

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Necron kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Overlord miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:


An Overlord: this multipart plastic kit is used to represent Ankra the Colossus – or the Commander of any Necron kill team you wish. Posed with the kind of triumphant attitude you can only really get from millennia of slaughter, he wields a voidscythe and resurrection orb.
A datacard for Ankra the Colossus, featuring its characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
A card featuring Ankra the Colossus’ skill tree – Overlord specialisms which can only be used by that character
6 Necron Commander Tactics Cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens.


—description from the publisher

name: 18 Card Sushi
description:
18 Bite-size games 1-4 players. Every game is different and each takes 5-10 minutes. Draw, draft, match, pass, count, memorize, toss, bluff, place, score and discard your way to victory.

- 18 Cute sushi-themed cards
- 3 suits of 6 cards: salmon, tuna & cucumber
- 18 different games with something for everyone
- Slim deck is perfect for travel
- Easy to learn
- 1-4 player
- 5-10 min
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Trick-taking

name: Running Home
description:
You are the lone survivor of a failed interplanetary settlement attempt. Scavenge what you can to provide food, shelter and the fuel you’ll need to get off this planet and head to the next one...

Running Home is a card based, deep space survival game for one player. Each planet has its own difficulties, so use the resources you find wisely. Avoid storms, hostile aliens and wandering indigenous animals while finding shelter, gathering food, and locating elements to use as fuel to escape the planet. There are a few planets between you and your home world, so reserve your strength to ensure you survive the journey home!

Choose the number of planet cards you must survive (set difficulty level, more planets means you’re less likely to survive!) Draw that many Path Cards and place them face up in order drawn.

Shuffle Scavenge Deck. Draw three and flip (as you would in a game of solitaire) then interact with the card showing. Take food, fuel, or shelter from the new pile to add to your inventory, hoping not to reveal animals, aliens, or storms!

Animals, Aliens, and Storms will take Health Points (HP) away. You start with 20 HP and can avoid losing HP by sacrificing:
Food to distract Animals
Fuel to distract Aliens
Shelter to hide from Storms

If enough food and fuel have been found to leave the planet, clear remaining inventory and move on to the next one. Leave the last planet successfully and win!

name: Augen Auf!
description:
One player is the quiz master and shows one of the contained 24 scenes for one minute to the other players. Afterwards the quiz master takes the picture away and poses questions of rising difficulty to the players.
They answer in secret whether the answer is "Wrong" or "Right". Depending on the difficulty of the question, the players who are right gain 1 - 3 points for their answer.
After all questions are answered, all players gain points on the main board, depending on how many points they achieved in the played scene.
Whoever first reaches the final square on the main board, wins.

—user summary

name: Monopoly: Chester Cathedral
description:
A brand new Monopoly set, special edition of popular property trading game, Monopoly!

The Chester Cathedral edition is something very special, as it comes with six bespoke game tokens exclusive to the Cathedral – including a jolly monk (The Benedictine History), A goose (St Werburgh's famous Legend), Chester Cathedral tower, A pilgrim shell, The 'Elephant & Castle' carving, A Church mouse!

The game is designed so that you get a feel of exploring the Cathedral on a tour around the board. You can buy the game in the Cathedral Gift Shop itself or on their online shop.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Murder à la carte: Death in Venice
description:
It's September 1946 and - following a wartime break - the Venice Film Festival is once again being staged, attracting the biggest stars of world cinema to Northern Italy, and bringing a touch of glamour back to this most romantic of European cities.

Romeo Beechini, the young head of an old wealthy Venetian family, has invited a mixed group to dinner. Unfortunately one of his house-guests, Leonardo di Capulet, the bright new hope of Hollywood, has just been found dead in his bath. When it turns out he didn't die of natural causes, only one conclusion can be drawn: one or more of the guests has killed him.

—description from the publisher

name: Chaos in China: First Expansion
description: This small expansion add more scenarios for the base game.
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: The Censored Game
description:
The Censored Game is an adult party game that "censors" how teams of players act, draw and speak clues. It combines elements of Charades, Pictionary and Taboo but takes things a staircase of steps further by adding layers of difficulty and nonsense. With countless combinations of CHALLENGE and CENSORED cards, there’s always something new. Can be played in teams or cooperatively and there are three different ways to play! Uncensored Play required players to act, speak and draw the "non-clean" meaning referred to in each Challenge Card. Self-Censored is where players agree on which Censored Cards they will use and remove the rest from the deck before playing. Cooperative Play has all players on one team working towards winning seven Challenge Cards in a row without failing once!

—description from the publisher

name: Axecution
description:
"An Axtrordinary Action Game that's not for the squeemish."

This is a dexterity, point-collection game for two players where each player must time their action to remove bones from a coffin while avoiding two swinging pendulums. The swinging pendulums drive a mechanism that drops a coffin lid acting as a timer for the game. Bones retrieved score you points whereas getting hit by the axe incurs a penalty. Score the most points before the lid closes on the coffin.

name: Murder Mystery Flexi Party: Murder in the Roaring '20s
description:
Gray Catsby has invited his most talented and wealthy friends to a charity gala event at his countryside residence, Catsby Hall. But before any dancing and donations begin, Catsby’s fiancée, Ginger Whiskers, is found dead in the dumbwaiter! Join the flappers and dappers to find out who finished her off!

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Flexi Party: Murder at the Manor
description:
You're invited to Heathcliff Manor, where Lord Heathcliff is hosting a dinner party in honour of his new bride. All the usual suspects are here - the cook, the professor, the butler - as well as some unusual ones. But before anyone can toast his happiness, Lord Heathcliff is killed with the candlestick in the pool room. Host your own party to find out who snuffed out his candle.

—description from the publisher
publishers: D'Avekki Studios Ltd, Hachette Boardgames USA

name: Magnificent Flying Machines: Siobhán O'Hara
description:
A new pilot.

May use as a luck token 3 times during the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Escape the Marshlands
description:
It's a card game in which you battle other players using Zombies, Werewolves, and Vampires to be the last survivor and escape!

Players take turns either drawing a card from the deck or attacking another player. Drawing a card can get you useful items to Empower your attack, or help you Repel an attack. You may also gain more Monsters to use in battle. But watch out! There's cards that will Condemn your Monsters too, and you'll have to discard part of your Monster horde. You may also find extra Protection to fortify your army, or a rogue Thief to help you plunder cards from an opponent. Battles are decided with a roll of the dice - more torches on your roll means you defeated those Monsters! When all the cards in the draw pile are gone, then begins Armageddon. You MUST attack on your turn during Armageddon, until there is only one player left alive. He is the one who Escapes the Marshlands! Will it be you?

—description from the designer

name: The Cave
description:
Free game published in the April 2018 (GTM #218) issue of Game Trade Magazine.

The game utilizes the Series: Pairs Game System (Cheapass Games) game system and is designed with the Deadfall Deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.

Background: Welcome to The Cave, a mysterious dungeon filled with dangerous monsters! In ‘The Cave,” you will play cards from your hand into the dungeon, trying to defeat the monsters and bring home their treasure.

Equipment: A Pairs deck and a way to keep score.

To Begin: Shuffle the deck and deal a hand of cards to each player. The number of cards in the starting hand varies with the number of players, as follows:

Players: 2 3 4 5 6
Cards: 7 6 5 5 4

Next, deal the “Cave,” a collection of five cards face up in the center of the table. Play will start on the dealer’s left and proceed clockwise.

On Your Turn: You will play one card from your hand into the Cave. This card will capture one or more cards from the Cave, as follows:

If there are lower cards in the cave, your card captures the card(s) of the value that is closest beneath it. For example, if the
board is 4-7-7-8-9, and you play an 8, you will capture both 7s.

If no cards in the Cave are lower than your card, you capture all cards of the highest rank (even if that rank matches your card).
For example, if the Cave is 4-5-7-9-10, and you play a
4 (or lower), you will capture the 10.

The card you played goes into the Cave. Set aside your captured cards, to be scored at the end of the round.

Refilling the Cave: If the Cave has fewer than five cards, refill it from the deck. If the deck is ever empty, the Cave does not refill, but play continues.

Scoring the Round: Play until everyone has emptied their hand. Then score the game as follows:

For each rank, the player who captured the most cards of that rank scores one point for each. Players with fewer cards in that rank do not score.

For example, if someone captured three 10s, and no one else had more 10s, then that player would get 3 points. If two or more players are tied for the most cards, they each score full points.

Record your score after each round, and play one round for each player, passing the deal to the left. Then the player with the highest total score wins the game.

name: Tutti in fattoria
description:
Tutti in fattoria is a cooperative and memory game, in which the players have to bring the puppies back to the farm before the wolf arrives.

The box contains 4 environments of the farm with 12 shaped and detachable puppies, 12 hiding places (bush, fence and bale of hay), 1 die, 1 wolf and 1 path.

To become familiar with the game materials, children can combine the 4 environments in a single scenario and try to insert the puppies in the right place, next to their mothers, as in a puzzle.

At the beginning of the game, the players remove the 12 puppies and put them under the 12 hiding places: the aim of the game is to bring the puppies back into their respective environments.

The current player rolls a die and discovers a hiding place. If there is a puppy inside, he puts it in the respective environment, next to his mother. If the die shows the wolf, it advances on the path.

The game has 3 modes that require progressively more memory. For example, in the simplest mode the hiding place remains uncovered, while in the advanced rules the hiding places are covered.

-description from designer

name: Bunkaban!
description:
Bunkaban! is a game where players act as reporters aiming for victory in the tengu's newspaper convention. In order to achieve this goal, players travel around Gensokyo looking for material to publish in articles, delivering them back to the residence of the tengu before their rivals.

Potential material for each article is found across the map of Gensokyo, and players must race their way to the scene in question. Player actions, including movement, are performed by rolling a single die, and comparing that result to the corresponding action card on the indicator board. At the start of each turn, players must replace any action card on the board with one from their hand. In this way, players can use their strategy to modify probabilities to their favor at the right moment.

When a player has collected all the articles on the board, if they can return to the residence of the tengu, they become the winners and the stars of the Gensokyo newspaper convention.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Town Tour
description:
Go on a town tour with this fun-filled game...and learn all about the places in your community!

Travel around the town, cross off all of the errands on your "Things to Do" list and return home to win.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hafid's Grand Bazaar: The Lamp Promo Pack
description:
This promo pack adds 5 Lamp cards to add into the Draw deck.

Contents:
5 Lamp Cards
1 Instruction Card
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: Green Box of Games: Cross the Beams
description:
Green Box of Games: Cross the Beams is a promo expansion for the Green Box of Games. It features rules for a cooperative game in the spirit of Ghostbusters as well as a tall white (Marshmallow Man) and a small black meeple (ghost).

It has been available in the context of the Green Box of Games: Meeple Mini Expansion.

name: Mountebank
description:
You've got a list of heists that will cement your name as the greatest con artist of all time, but so does every other con in this town. Put together schemes and execute them to claim money and fame, but don't forget the basics: don't pass up a golden opportunity, keep an ace up your sleeve, and tie up your loose ends.

In this breezy set collection card game, players draft cards to put together their schemes, then meld them to run various cons, trying to put together high scoring melds as well as cash in on shifting opportunities for more points.

—description from the designer

name: Tip Disc Spinner
description:
Dexterity based set collection game where the goal is to be the first to get a set of three discs of matching colours.
Each turn you spin a spinner and usually use a fork to remove a disc of the selected colour off from the central spinner. If you dislodge the tip disc you are out of the game. The game is now over and the person with the most discs of the same colour is the winner.

—user summary

name: Sjöslaget
description:
Sjöslaget is a fun and exiting naval war game for two players or two teams. Each side has a harbor and five ships. The side which first sail one of its ships into the enemy harbor has won the game. But the road offers challenges: Fire from cannons of enemy ships. Melee combat. Fire from long range cannons on the harbors - not to speak of changing wind conditions.

—description from the box (translated)

name: Chesquerque
description:
A chess variant played on a quadruple Alquerque board (9×9, similar to Dablo Aasele). Each player has 18 pieces — the usual chess pieces plus a ninth pawn and an archbishop, which moves as a combined bishop and knight.

The moves of the pieces are slightly adapted for the Alquerque grid: bishops and other diagonal-moving pieces can only move along grid lines; and knights are treated as moving two steps (one orthogonal, one diagonal) along grid lines and, like Chinese chess knights, cannot jump over an intervening piece.

As in chess, the object is to checkmate the opponent's king.

—user summary

name: Saca la Lengua
description:
Saca la Lengua / Treu la Llengua ("Stick out your tongue") is a game on the oral microbiome created together with the Center for Genome Regulation (CRG, Barcelona) for its citizen science project "Saca la Lengua". The game idea was designed in cocreation sessions with scientists, journalists, teachers, and various citizens. Then it was developed by the authors in collaboration with the science communication team in the CRG.

Saca la Lengua / Treu la Llengua is a cooperative game in which players represent members of the general population with certain characteristics of their microbiome (represented in game by 8 genera of bacteria, whose population is represented by the value of 8 dice). The goal is to keep the oral microbiome of the players as close as possible as the ideal equilibrium values (obtained in real life thanks to the research project).

During 5 rounds, the players do the following actions:
a) Each player with 2 or more genera in equilibrium draws an action card, with which he/she can improve the microbiome of other players.
b) Each player draws a "Life is tough" card and applies its effects on himself. Then a common "Life is tough" card is drawn and it must be applied to one of the players (cooperatively chosen).

Some cards add some additional "infection" dice or "severe condition" markers. When the players exceed a certain threshold of infection dice or severe condition markers, they lose the game. Otherwise, if they reach the end of the 5th round, they won and calculate points to know the degree of equilibrium of their oral microbiota.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Medical, Print & Play

name: Spank the Yeti: Geek Pack
description: Official expansion to Spank the Yeti. Includes 100 cards featuring favorite geeky references plus ten blank cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: ニワトリかラマか (Chicken or Llama)
description:
ニワトリかラマか (Chicken or Llama) is a game using currency bills. The front side shows one design, but the rear shows either a chicken or a llama.

Generally in a card game, if the card gets scratched, the game is going to collapse, but this game is different. By creasing the bills, you communicate to your partner. However, if the opponents finds out the meaning of your secret crease, the strategy is a failure. Let's make a clever crease that deceives the opponent’s eyes and transmits info to your partner.

Additionally, don't forget that creases accumulate as the game progresses!

The game is played in partnerships. Each pair of players secretly agree between themselves what marks they will use. One player draws five bills, and marks them to indicate which animal is the minority. The bills are laid out with the animals hidden. The opposing team places chips to show which bills are chickens or llamas. If they get it correct, they score points. If they get it wrong, the first team scores points. The game continues until one side scores the winning margin.

「信じられない！ この発見は世界を変えてしまう」
南アメリカの古代遺跡で消息を絶った考古学者が最後に打った電報は世界を激震させた。各国は早速、諜報員らを派遣。アンデスにある小さな酒場は諜報員たちの集う場所となった。彼らは考古学者が遺した謎を分析し本国に報告しなければならない。しかしこの狭い酒場では敵国の諜報員も肩を並べて座っている。情報はどんな方法を使っても漏れてしまうように思われた。苦慮の末、古典的な情報伝達法を用いることにした。村で使用される奇妙な紙幣を利用した二進伝達法、コード名『ニワトリかラマか』である。

あなたは諜報員となり、酒場にいる味方の諜報員と情報を交換します。現地の紙幣を巧みに使い情報を交換してください。酒場には敵国の諜報員もいます。情報が漏れないよう細心の注意を払う必要があります。成功を祈ります…。

name: Monopoly: CASS Business School
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Centrally located in London between the old financial city and the thriving hub of Tech City, Cass delivers innovative, relevant and forward-looking education, consultancy and research to the business to community.
This special edition game celebrates our strong links to the City of London, our dedication to excellence and our passion for business education.
We constantly seek new ways to serve our students and the global business community, and like a player of this game, we never stand still: we are alert, dynamic and creative.
Cass Business School is at the top of its academic game, so join the fun with our special edition Monopoly!

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Thomson Reuters / Bloomberg
LIGHT BLUE
Library / Careers Service / Alumni Relations
PINK
Citysport / Students' Union / Student Clubs & Societies
ORANGE
Faculty Of Actuarial, Science & Insurance / Faculty Of Management / Faculty Of Finance
RED
??? / 200 Aldersgate / Bunhill Row
YELLOW
London Stock Exchange / 30 St Mary Axe (The Gherkin) / Bank Of England
GREEN
Tech City / Dubai Financial Centre / City Of London
DARK BLUE
Centre For Entrepreneurship / Research Centres
STATIONS
Liverpool Street / Barbican / Moorgate / Old Street
UTILITIES
Travel / ???
TAXES
Textbooks / Tuition Fees
COMMUNITY CHEST / CHANCE
Community Chest / Chance
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Trivial Pursuit Junior: Third Edition
description:
From the Simpsons and the Addams Family, to Beantown and Bosnia...

From John Hancock and Davy Crockett, to Rapunzel and Smokey the Bear...

Here's the third edition of TRIVIAL PURSUIT JUNIOR, the special TRIVIAL PURSUIT game just for kids, with updated questions plus new questions based on what today's kids know.

This Junior version has the same game play and all the fun and challenge of the adult editions, with questions in these kid-friendly categories: Every Day, Fun, Science, Stories & Songs, Nature, and Games.

—description from the publisher

name: WarpShips
description:
A Components: Looney Pyramid Games spaceship maneuvering game.

You will need 36 Looney Pyramids - 3 trios each of 4 colors (Red, Green, Blue, Yellow), a Pyramid Die, and a Starship Captain tin (or similar circular object, like a coaster or a CD).

Colonial ships move by distorting space-time and reappearing at the outer edge of a warp field. After they move, they fire energy beams that teleport other differently-colored ships far across the galaxy. Your mission: harness these warp energy beams to transport a diverse collection of ships, and be the first to form a complete colony!

You and your opponents move ships around the play area via the “warp” using the Starship Captain tin lid to measure distance and direction of travel. After a ship warps, it fires its teleportation beam at another target ship. You roll the pyramid die to find out if the beam successfully teleports the target ship out of the play area and into your own colony.
The goal is to be the first to teleport a combination of ships into your colony: The first player to colonize either two monochrome trios of ships or two ships of every color, wins the game!

—description from the designer

name: Fire! Fire! Scouts to the Rescue!
description:
The game entitled "Fire! Fire! Scouts to the Rescue" is a replica of a rare vintage 1920s board game of the same name.
—user summary

Fire trucks and engines have always caught the imagination of children all over the world. Excitement mounts as the siren is heard coming closer and then the fire engine rushes by. This lovely board game is based on another era when the fire trucks and engines moved at a more sedate pace! Things have changed since the 1920s and 30s but this game is still great fun for all the family.
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: In the Heart of Africa: Army Lists
description:
In The Heart Of Africa Army Lists is a collection of army lists for the period of exploration and imperial conquest in tropical Africa outlined in the rulebook In the Heart of Africa. Chronologically this corresponds roughly to the second half of the 19th century, while geographically it covers the region between the Zambezi River in the south, and the edge of the Sahara Desert in the north – the classic “Darkest Africa” of the explorers. A list of the armies within:

• Part One: The East Africans
•Masai
•Nandi, Kikuyu, Chaga, & Nyaturu
•Kamba
•Baganda
•Banyoro
•Bahima
•Ngoni
•HeHe
•Northern Herdsmen
•Ruga Ruga
•Kavirondo

• Part Two: The Central Africans
•Azande
•Jungle Cannibals
•Pygmies
•Congo Archers
•Southern Congo Kingdoms
•Elephant Hunters
•Bena Riamba
•Ovambo

•Generic Villagers

•Arabs and Swahilis
•Zanzibari Regular Army
•Turkish Slavers
•Bornu & Adamawa

•Naval Landing Party (1875 - 1899)
•French Colonial (1883 - 1899)

•Belgian Colonial (1886 - 1899)
•British Colonial (1888 - 1899)
publishers: Brigade Games, HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company), Rattrap Productions LLC, Sinister Laboratories LLC

name: Historia Lublina
description:
A timeline-like game about one of the Polish cities - Lublin. Players organize cards with historical events that took place in or around the city in chronological order. They can also use one of four special powers that influence played or unplayed cards.

—user summary

name: Ryuuki no Toga
description:
竜姫の咎 (Ryuuki no Toga, "The Sin of the Dragon Princess") is a push-your luck engine building game. There are only five days left before the final battle - can you defeat the enemy and become a legendary hero?

Long ago the Dragon Princess broke a taboo and had a child with a human. The "Sin" was a target for all the monsters in the world, and to defend her child the Dragon Princes descended into the Abyss. After an unimaginably long time, the Abyss transformed the Dragon Princess into a monster, and she's coming to reclaim her child and destroy the world in the bargain. You have just five days to defeat her.

Each round has three phases: card acquisition, playing units, and deciding whether to challenge the monster. A number of cards equal to the numbers of players is dealt face-up, and everyone reveals which one they want at the same time. If there are any conflicts, the start player for the round decides how to resolve that, and it doesn't have to be fair. Next you play units that add to your battle strength. Some units can be played for free, but advanced units will require spending mana of right color from weaker units. Finally you decide if you're ready to challenge the monster. You only get to do this once, so you want to wait until you're strong enough, but not so long someone else beats the monster first.

—user summary

name: Matschbirne
description:
Matschbirne is a game where the players have to use their full body to prove your drawing skills. Each of you can play on its own or you can create teams. One of the players takes a card and has to draw the term written on it. You are not allowed to use your hands for it - aggravated circumstances.

The one drawing applies the headband with the pencil attached to it. Now you have to draw with skilful head movements. This is of course harder than expected - and will lead to lots of laughter!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Smelly Wellies
description:
A fun and simple matching game for children aged 2-6. Turn over welly cards to find matching pairs of wellies for your monsters. The first player to fill their board wins!

There are two ways to play this colourful game, for both younger and more advanced players. This means children of all ages can play and enjoy the game together, either as a simple pairs matching or more complex memory game. The patterned welly cards can also be used to encourage children to identify the objects they can see on them.

Featuring an array of colourful character illustrations, the quirky monsters are bound to get children giggling!
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Christmas Trivia
description:
Christmas-themed trivia card game. Covers topics including:

Carols
Christmas songs
Holiday films and festivities
Santa lore
Christmas traditions

name: メモリス (MEMORIS)
description:
User summary
メモリス (MEMORIS) is a memory game which uses tiles with patterns depicted on both sides. Three games can be played with MEMORIS.

MEMORIS
You remember positions of patterns, and flip tiles correctly.

MEMORIS RUMMY
You complete a certain set of tiles before everyone else does.

MEMORIS SECRET
You deduce what tile your opponent has.

メモリスは、裏表にマークが描かれたタイルを使った記憶力ゲームです。
「メモリス」
マークの位置を覚えて正しくめくるゲーム。
「メモリス・ラミー」
相手より先にタイルを揃えるゲーム。
「メモリス・シークレット」
相手の持っているタイルを当てるゲーム。
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Game System, Memory
publishers: Chronos (株式会社クロノス), Gentosha Education

name: マサラマジック (Masala Magic)
description:
'マサラマジック (Masala Magic) is a Japanese game in which you compete with the other players to create a hand using incense with the scents of various spices.

By correctly identifying by smell the incense chosen by the other players you are able to interfere with their combinations. Creating a stronger combination than your opponents' gains you a point, and three points wins the game.

The game uses very thematic components such as a wooden incense case and metal shades. The components are hidden away in the case in a secret compartment.

--user summary

スパイスの香りがするインセンス（線香）で役をつくり、プレイヤー同士で競い合うゲームです。
ほかのプレイヤーのインセンスをかいでスパイスの種類を当て、役作りを邪魔することができます。
ほかのプレイヤーよりも強い役で勝ち、3ポイント獲得したらゲームの勝者になります。
木製インセンスケースや金属製シェードなど、とってもエスニックなコンポーネントです。

--description from publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection
publishers: natriumlamp games (ナトリウムランプゲームス)

name: Battle Valor Fantasy: A Game of 15mm Fantasy Warfare
description: A 200+ page rulebook packed full of everything you need to play this 15mm Fantasy Scale Mass Combat Tabletop Game. It also includes complete descriptions of all 33 Races that can be found in the World of Legian, as well as a complete Bestiary of every available unit for all 33 Armies.

name: Solorius
description:
User summary''
Solorius (ソロリウス) is a game from South Korea.

Will you overcome the temptation of love and remain single for the rest of your life, becoming the brightest star in Solorius?
publishers: Beagle Games (비글게임즈 스튜디오), Mandoo Games, Piece Craft

name: アリスアセンブル (Alice Assemble)
description:
User summary
アリスアセンブル (Arisu Asemburu) Alice Assemble is a Japanese game.

In the game of Alice Assemble, players are machinists who build an automaton doll by co-ordinating several gears.

At the beginning of each round, a number of cards, which depicts gears, are revealed on the table. Each turn, you place the card, which you have previously taken, in front of you. Then you take a card from the table.

At end of the game, players score victory points depending on patterns of gears they coordinated. You score big points by making a larger chunk of connected gears.

If you took a card with a smaller number in your previous turn, you take your turn earlier. On the other hand, a card with a larger number has more gears than the smaller one in general.

You should consider your opponents' intentions when you take your card, and make full use of the card when you build your doll.

Publisher's summary
『アリスアセンブル』は、機械の街の工匠となり、歯車を組み合わせて自動人形の少女を組み上げるゲームです。

プレイヤーは、場に公開される歯車の書かれたカードを獲得し、手元に並べていきます。
手元のカードの列は、ゲーム終了時、そこに書かれた歯車のパターンに応じて得点となります。
より大きな歯車の塊を作り、組み上げた人形により優れた機能を与えることで、高い得点を得ることができます。

手番で取得したカードに振られた番号が若ければ、次のラウンドでより早く手番が回ってきます。
そして、歯車の多いカードには大きな番号が振られる傾向にあります。
ほかのプレイヤーの動向を見据えてカードを獲得し、それを巧みに組み上げることが勝利の鍵となります！

name: QBO2
description: Build your way through the board in QBO2 and take care to wipe your tracks. Special tiles support you to play offensively and defensively.

name: Warhammer Armies (Fifth Edition): Vampire Counts
description:
Warhammer Armies: Vampire Counts is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Vampire Counts faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Speedy Towers
description:
Speedy Towers is a light, fun, tower-stacking dexterity game for the piecepack.

Players create towers by stacking tiles and coins on top of each other in real time. Build your tiles and coins the fastest to win.

—description from the designer

name: Transformers Prime
description:
This is a DotA(Defense of the Ancients)/LoL(League of Legends) like boardgame which be sold only in China. In the game, players are divided into two teams to compete with each other. They can move on the hexagonal grids, play cards and use their Transformer heroes' unique powers to win an advantage over their opponents. And complete the mission to win the game.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rolling Orchards
description:
Welcome to Rolling Orchards, a 2-player game of growing apples and pumpkins at your personal orchard. Turn them to pies and cider to accumulate more points than your opponent. Make the most out of your resources as the season could be over before you know it.

Rolling Orchards utilizes a dice placement mechanic where players select dice from a pool and place them in turn on action spaces. The number and color of the die determine the benefit gained from that space.

Third Place finisher in the Roll and Write Global Jam 2018!

—description from the designer

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Ogre Kingdoms
description:
Warhammer: Ogre Kingdoms is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Ogre Kingdoms faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bloedstollend Spel
description:
A card game about haemophilia that allows the player to experience what it means to live with this inherited genetic disorder that impairs the body's ability to make blood clots, a process needed to stop bleeding.

This playing game can be played solo or with multiple players. Goal of the game is to score as many points as possible by doing all sorts of activities. More risky activities increase the risk of hemorrhages, which need to be avoided as much as possible.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Galaxies Action
description:
A pinball with a theme of space fight.

The winner is the player who can score the most points with the six white balls. The UFO's at the top of the board, give extra points if you hit them and get them off the ground!

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Helmut Wulf – Star Player
description:
Helmut Wulf, a hitherto unremarkable Lineman for the Bruendar Grimjacks, once volunteered to try out a risky new piece of equipment at his coach’s request. He picked up a chainsaw for the first time and a lifelong bond was forged. It is quite likely that since that day he’s never gone more than five minutes without at least one chainsaw in his hands – certainly, he’s never been seen in public without one.

In 2483 it is the height of the chainsaw craze and Helmut Wulf has risen to prominence as a master of his craft. In a memorable match against the now-disbanded Bogstaff Beardlings, he broke a strong cage formation single-handedly by leaping into the middle and spinning around wildly. How he survived (especially considering how very slippery it suddenly gets) is a mystery, but there’s no doubt that the man’s got style.

Helmut Wulf is a Star Player who can be included in the following teams: Amazon, Chaos Renegades, Human, Lizardmen, Norse, Vampire. His unique brand of carnage and mayhem means that your opponent will be running scared from the first kickoff, and the revving of his chainsaw will haunt their nightmares for nights to come.

This is a complete, multipart resin kit which contains one Helmut Wulf. He is supplied with a 32mm Blood Bowl base, and his rules can be found in the Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports

name: Kar-kas-onn
description:
This is a fan-version of Carcassonne based in space. It replaces cities with habitats, roads with wormholes, and monastries with planets. The River becomes a Nebula and defines two different types of habitats.
It uses double-sided tiles that have to be drawn from a bag. This makes possible the introduction of tiles that trigger special actions.

—description from the designer
